420432.name: Association of Certified Fraud Examiners at Virginia Tech
420432.summary: The Virginia Tech ACFE Chapter empowers students to explore fraud prevention and forensic accounting through networking, professional development, and ethical leadership opportunities.
420432.description_html:
The Virginia Tech Student Chapter of the Association of Certified Fraud Examiners (ACFE) is a professional organization dedicated to educating and empowering students interested in fraud prevention, detection, and investigation. As an extension of the global ACFE network, the chapter provides a platform for students to connect classroom knowledge with real-world applications in forensic accounting, auditing, compliance, and risk management.

The chapter’s mission is to promote ethical leadership, professional development, and academic excellence among students pursuing careers in fraud examination and related fields. Through guest lectures from industry professionals, networking events, case study discussions, and skill-building workshops, members gain valuable insight into the tools and techniques used to combat financial crimes.

In addition to fostering connections with Certified Fraud Examiners and other professionals, the organization encourages members to pursue the CFE credential and to uphold the highest standards of integrity and accountability. By engaging with the ACFE community, students develop the knowledge, experience, and ethical foundation necessary to become future leaders in protecting organizations and society from fraud and financial misconduct.

420433.name: 180 Degrees Consulting at Virginia Tech
420433.summary: Empowering students to drive social impact by using their skills and knowledge to serve nonprofits and community organizations through high-quality, equity-focused consulting.

362524.name: 3304 Sports
362524.summary: 3304 Sports is the multimedia home for online sports journalism at Virginia Tech. We give students who are interested in broadcasting, writing or podcasting about sports the opportunity to get real-world experience covering VT Athletics.
362524.description_html: 3304 Sports is the multimedia home for online sports journalism at Virginia Tech. We give students who are interested in broadcasting, writing or podcasting about sports the opportunity to get real-world experience covering VT Athletics. Our organization allows students to cover all sports at Virginia Tech as beat-writers, play-by-play broadcasters, podcasters, studio hosts, reporters and more to give you experience that you can use to enter the industry after graduation.

186976.name: 3D Printed Aircraft at Virginia Tech
186976.summary: Our organization's goal is to design and manufacture a small unmanned aircraft capable of competing in UTA's design competition. This aircraft will be completely manufactured using 3D printers, save the electronics.
186976.description_html: 3D Printed Aircraft at Virginia Tech was created so to design and manufacture small unmanned aircraft with the intention of competing in design competitions. We are currently composed of 22 Aerospace Engineering students and are attending our annual competition in July. If you are interested in joining our team, reach out to our president via email.

344879.name: 4-H Collegiate Club
344879.summary: Through Collegiate 4-H, Virginia Tech students practice leadership, community building, and service. 4-H promotes civic engagement, agriculture, healthy living, and STEAM by providing activities and leadership opportunities.
344879.description_html: 4-H is delivered by Cooperative Extension and is the largest youth development organization in the US. 4-H Collegiate Club at Virginia Tech strives to foster an environment that promotes service, leadership and professional development, and community. It is the club's mission to provide resources as well as community to those interested in service, as well as careers with Cooperative Extension and youth development. The club organizes community service events, hosts speakers with backgrounds in Cooperative Extension, and provides activities that allow students to feel seen and heard during their time here at Virginia Tech.

160369.name: Academic Advising Initiatives
160369.summary: Our team is tasked with providing support, new ideas, and professional development opportunities for the advising community at-large.
160369.description_html: Our team is tasked with providing support, new ideas, and professional development opportunities for the advising community at-large. Each individual on the team helps support academic advising at Virginia Tech, whether it is through advising technology, such as Navigate, working to bridge the gap between Virginia Community Colleges and VT to assist our transfer students, or increasing professional development opportunities for advisors.

69154.name: Academic Competition Organization
69154.summary: We are an organization dedicated to competing in intercollegiate quiz bowl competitions, hosting high school competitions, and fostering the southwest Virginia quizbowl community through outreach.
69154.description_html:
The Academic Competition Organization at Virginia Tech (ACOVT) is an academic team that participates in intercollegiate Quizbowl competitions and hosts high school and collegiate competitions. Along with our competition season, ACOVT strives to make Quizbowl more accessible at both the high school and collegiate level and to have fun!

What is Quizbowl?
Quizbowl, Scholastic Bowl, ACE, etc. is a team-based academic competition. We like to explain it as "team-orientated" Jeopardy (we also use buzzer systems similar to Jeopardy). If you enjoy trivia, it is definitely for you! 

Practice Schedule
ACO practices every Monday and Thursday from 5:00 - 8:00 PM. For Fall 2025, most practices will be in Squires 145. Members will be emailed a reminder with the location of practice the day of. Practice is not mandatory and is open to the public! If you can only make part of that time, we recommend that you come in for however long you can and hear some questions.

What does the team do?
The main activity ACO members participate in is attending competitions. We generally compete at 6-8 tournaments ranging from collegiate novice to national and world level competitions. These tournaments are all paid for by the club, and transportation and hotels are also covered by the club.  Along with tournaments, we host high school and college tournaments, which ACO members staff. To help build Quizbowl within the local area, ACO sends staffers to nearby local tournaments and help run practices and matches for Montgomery County and nearby colleges.

How do I join?
Come to practice or contact us! There are no auditions or tryouts. We take any Virginia Tech students (including graduate students). In order to be added to the email list that includes sign-ups for competitions and practice locations, you must  attend a practice. This helps us keep the roster number an accurate representative of our active members.
 
Please come and join us!

303405.name: Accessible Technologies
303405.summary: At Accessible Technologies, we work to ensure that students, employees, and the general public with disabilities have appropriate technologies needed to access programs and services of the university.
303405.description_html:
Thank you for your interest in the AT Student Club! Please find more information about our accessibility campaigns and free software resources for students on our Accessible Technologies Website (Student Software Resources).

We are in the process of starting a student club focusing on Accessibility and Assistive Technologies. The primary goal of the club is to form a platform to connect students interested in working to tackle digital and physical accessibility projects, innovate solutions, ideate, celebrate efforts, learn relevant skills, and form a proactive environment to further accessibility at Virginia Tech. 

We invite you to join, the club and be a part of this initiative! If interested, Please fill this AT Student Club Interest Form and tell us more about your ideas to get involved. We plan to reach out to interested students and communicate through a Google Group after you sign-up here. If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to us at atservices@vt.edu.

We look forward to hearing back from you and working together in the true spirit of Ut Prosim! Let us make Virginia Tech more accessible to everyone!Hope you have a great semester ahead!

69296.name: Accounting Society at Virginia Tech
69296.summary: The Accounting Society at Virginia Tech is a professional student organization that aims to connect students to prospective employers.
69296.description_html:
The Accounting Society is a student-run organization that strives to develop the future career skills of Pamplin students by helping them build a professional network, providing a forum for leading, cultivating awareness of the accounting profession, and offering leadership opportunities.

If you are interested, please DM us on instagram! @vtaccountingsociety

115344.name: Actuarial Science Club at Virginia Tech
115344.summary: The goal of this club is to bring together students with an interest in Actuarial Science to provide peer support and an exchange of ideas.
115344.description_html: The Actuarial Science Club helps students pursue a career in actuarial science through studying for exams, exploring career paths, and establishing connections with current actuarial professionals. Feel free to reach out about joining, all students are welcome.

79805.name: AdvanceVT
79805.summary: AdvanceVT assists Virginia Tech in preparing, recruiting, and retaining high quality and diverse faculty. Programs target graduate students preparing for faculty careers, faculty and administrators.
79805.description_html: The mission of AdvanceVT is to assist Virginia Tech in preparing, recruiting, and retaining high quality and diverse faculty. To accomplish this mission, our programs are designed to facilitate success in scholarship, teaching, engagement and administration for a wide range of audiences. These programs target graduate students preparing for faculty careers, new faculty just starting out, senior faculty preparing for leadership roles, search committees, department heads, and senior administrators. AdvanceVT began in 2003 with a grant from the National Science Foundation to promote and enhance the careers of women in academic science and engineering through institutional transformation. Grant funding continued until August 2010. High impact initiatives continue with support from university partners, and have been expanded to include faculty in all disciplines.

69012.name: Adventist Christian Fellowship
69012.summary: We offer weekly Bible studies, provide transportation to church, and support people in growing their faith in God.
69012.description_html: We are a faith-based campus organization dedicated to helping students grow in their relationship with God. We host weekly Bible studies in a warm, home-cooked, and personal environment where faith can be nurtured and deepened. Our focus includes teaching Bible prophecy and equipping students with the tools to study the Bible for themselves. We offer rides to church every week and build community through fun events like hiking, bowling, snow tubing, cookouts, and more. Whether you're exploring faith for the first time or looking to grow deeper, you're welcome here!

83418.name: Afghan Student Union
83418.summary: Bringing the Afghan community together at Virginia Tech by appreciating and promoting Afghan culture.
83418.description_html: The Afghan Student Union at Virginia Tech promotes awareness and understanding of Afghan culture. This is accomplished through social events, dinners, cultural celebrations, seminars, and other events. We want  to bring the Afghan-American community together at Virginia Tech and make them feel more at home.

225092.name: African Graduate Students' Organization at Virginia Tech
225092.summary: We support incoming African students to ease integration and foster community with current students, acting as a bridge between alumni who have returned to Africa and the larger VT community who are interested in service or career opportunities in Africa
225092.description_html:
African Graduate Students' Organization at Virginia Tech (AGSO-VT) provides a bridge connecting current VT graduate students with incoming students from the African continent, thereby easing the process of new students integrating into the VT community. AGSO-VT also offers a supportive community to existing graduate students, while also providing a platform and a purposeful community for alumni and community members who are interested in careers and service opportunities in Africa

 

AGSO-VT also provides a purposeful community to facilitate the need of giving back to communities in the United States and maintaining ties to the alumni who have returned to their countries of origin and raise awareness of cultural and contemporary issues in Africa. Aside from meeting and sharing experiences as a community, AGSO-VT is committed to the outreach to incoming students and alumni. The members of AGSO-VT are students, parents, and alumni from Africa and those interested in serving in Africa.

68835.name: African Students Association
68835.summary: We, the African Students Association at Virginia Tech, aim to educate and bring awareness to African issues, while building community and providing a safe haven for the diaspora. We take pride in sharing the diverse culture of Africa with our community!
68835.description_html: The African Students Association - Virginia Tech Chapter is a non-exclusive, cultural, social, and educational body geared towards serving the community and promoting unity and cultural awareness between all who find interest in Africa and its diaspora.

413611.name: Afro-Latinx Student Organization at Virginia Tech
413611.summary: The Afro-Latinx Student Organization (ALSO) at Virginia Tech is a student-led community created to affirm, empower, and celebrate students who identify at the intersection of Black and Latinx heritage.
413611.description_html: The Afro Latinx Student Organization (ALSO) is a vibrant and inclusive community celebrating the rich cultures, identities, and experiences of Afro Latinx students at Virginia Tech. Whether you're Afro Latinx, an ally, or just curious to learn and connect there's a place for you here! From culture nights and discussions to music, food, and fun events, ALSO is where culture meets community. Come vibe with us!

420434.name: Agricultural Communicators of Tomorrow
420434.summary: The Agricultural Communicators of Tomorrow (ACT) empowers collegiate students to excel in agricultural communications by providing professional development, hands-on experience, and networking opportunities.
420434.description_html: The Agricultural Communicators of Tomorrow (ACT) empowers collegiate students to excel in agricultural communications by providing professional development, hands-on experience, and networking opportunities. We connect academia, industry, and the public to prepare the next class of agricultural communicators.

141089.name: Agricultural, Leadership, and Community Education Graduate Student Council
141089.summary: The organization has been created to connect the professional development, outreach efforts, and social engagement of Agricultural, Leadership, and Community Education graduate students by offering a network of emotional, financial, and social support.
141089.description_html:
As graduate students must balance the independence and stresses of being an adult with the frustrations and worries involved in pursuing a degree, the purpose of the organization is to:

  1. Communicate needs of graduate students in the Department Agricultural, Leadership and Community Education both internal and external to Virginia Tech.
  2. Serve as an open forum for graduate students to discuss current topics related to the Department Agricultural, Leadership and Community Education and agricultural industry.
  3. Assist in the professional development of graduate students in the Department Agricultural, Leadership and Community Education, which include but are not limited to research development, communication, and evaluation.
  4. Serve as a resource for the Department Agricultural, Leadership and Community Education in recruitment and other outreach efforts.

403386.name: Agroforestry Club at Virginia Tech
403386.summary: The Agroforestry Club at Virginia Tech is a community sharing and practicing agroforestry to protect the environment and build rural economies.
403386.description_html: The Agroforestry Club at Virginia Tech is a community that grows and shares knowledge on agroforestry practices. We hope to provide folks with the opportunity for hands-on experiences, networking with professionals, and developing relationships centered around the natural world.

403395.name: AILERON At Virginia Tech
403395.summary: AILERON offers students a dynamic environment to explore and apply principles of aircraft mechanics through hands-on projects and collaborative designs.
403395.description_html: AILERON offers students a dynamic environment to explore and apply principles of aircraft mechanics through hands-on projects and collaborative designs. Members gain practical experience with aircraft systems, maintenance, and repair techniques, while also working on innovative projects such as model aircraft design, engine rebuilding, and aerodynamics testing. In addition to technical skills, the club emphasizes personal growth by offering talks within the community and helping members gain experience with public speaking and communication.  Open to all skill levels, the club fosters teamwork and technical growth, providing opportunities to connect with industry professionals and prepare for careers in aviation and engineering. PLEASE DO NOT REQUEST MEMBERSHIP. ALL NEW MEMBERS MUST GO THROUGH OUR RECRUITMENT PROCESS. THANK YOU!

69303.name: Airsoft Club at Virginia Tech
69303.summary: Students participating in the sport of Airsoft with a focus on working together as a team and military simulation. We use discord as our primary source of communication: https://discord.gg/dX6U8T6zYX
69303.description_html: The Airsoft Club at Virginia Tech (ACVT) is a community based airsoft club bringing together students of all backgrounds to participate in pickup games and military simulation events alike. We welcome all skill levels and can provide assistance to new players with our loaner system free of charge (field fee is separate and not controlled by ACVT). We use discord as our only source of communication: https://discord.gg/dX6U8T6zYX feel free to join and ask questions!

67235.name: Alliance for Social, Political, Ethical and Cultural Thought Student Association
67235.summary: Student association associated with the ASPECT Ph.D. and Masters certificate programs.
67235.description_html: The ASPECT Student Association serves as a collective forum for members of the ASPECT Ph.D. program focusing on issues that span the social sciences and humanities. The ASA carries out events that are relevant to ASPECT students’ experiences, research, and teaching as a way to foster connections across cohorts. The ASA also co-sponsors events on campus that bring interdisciplinary issues to the university community.

123485.name: ALPFA Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
123485.summary: We work to empower and develop students as leaders of character in every sector of the global economy.
123485.description_html: ALPFA is a non-exclusive business organization within the Pamplin College of Business that seeks to connect students with the business community and foster valuable professional relationships with recruiters and current employees from many companies. We strive to promote diversity in the workforce and provide students with valuable connections, knowledge, and skills that will prove indispensable in their future career paths.

68005.name: Alpha Chi Omega
68005.summary: Alpha Chi Omega is a Panhellenic social sorority at Virginia Tech. At Alpha Chi Omega, we strive towards our main values of wisdom, devotion and achievement. We participate in many social and philanthropic initiatives.
68005.description_html: Welcome to Alpha Chi Omega at Virginia Tech! The sisters of the Epsilon Tau chapter of Alpha Chi Omega are an embodiment of real strong women with extraordinary achievements, hopes, and dreams. Alpha Chi Omega prides itself in enriching the lives of its members through lifetime opportunities for friendship, leadership, learning, and service and through our values of wisdom, devotion and achievement. Please contact us if you have any questions and follow our Instagram!

70340.name: Alpha Chi Sigma - National Co-Ed Professional Chemistry Fraternity
70340.summary: The Alpha Chi Sigma Professional Chemistry Fraternity at Virginia Tech is a national, co-ed fraternity dedicated to the advancement of Chemistry, both as a science and as a profession.
70340.description_html:
The purpose of Alpha Chi Sigma is reflected in the three objects of the Fraternity, which express the true ideals of all its members.

 

1. To bind its members with a tie of true and lasting friendship.

 

2. To strive for the advancement of Chemistry both as a science and as a profession.

 

3. To aid its members by every honorable means in the attainment in their ambitions as chemists throughout their mortal lives.

 

There is no organization quite comparable to a professional fraternity. Socially, it presents members with the opportunity of meeting those interested in their work. Fraternal bonds are ever so much stronger than professional ones, but there are no bonds as strong as those created through combined fraternal and professional interests. Members of Alpha Chi Sigma, many of whom are leaders in the industrial and scientific world, all share common fraternal ideals. Purely professional organizations such as the American Chemical Society and the American Institute of Chemical Engineers have their place, and Alpha Chi Sigma constantly encourages its members to become active in these organizations. Social fraternities also offer much to the student, but only a professional fraternity—and Alpha Chi Sigma is the only national professional chemistry fraternity in the United States--can provide the college student and the professional in chemistry and related fields with the interests and bonds of a fraternity.

All chapter-sanctioned events for the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters will be held in accordance with both university and state public health guidelines.

We perform rush events at the beginning of both the Fall and Spring semesters. These events introduce prospective members to the organization, and what would be required of them as a pledge of Alpha Chi Sigma. The pledging process will last about 2 months and will consist of pledge bonding activities, education about the fraternity, and participation in Alpha Chi Sigma's professional and philanthropic activities. 

Undergraduate pledges are no longer required to achieve a minimum amount of credit hours in the Chemical sciences and are only requested to have a passion for Chemistry. Our most common majors are Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Biochemistry, and Biology, but Biological Systems Engineering, Environmental Science and some Agribusiness, Animal and Poultry Science, Crop and Soil Environmental Science, Dairy Science, Food Science and Technology, Human Nutrition, Foods and Exercise and Wood Science majors can also join, as well as anyone with a Chemistry minor. See the documents page for a full list of required options for these majors. We cannot pledge first semester freshmen or graduating seniors. 

Graduate students, faculty members, and members of the community may pledge if in a field where chemistry predominates. Pledging requirements are much less time-intensive for professional pledges. There are currently 13 graduate student and 15 faculty member brothers, and there is a Southwest Virginia Professional Group.

67857.name: Alpha Delta Pi
67857.summary: The Eta Pi chapter of Alpha Delta Pi was founded at Virginia Tech in 1990. Alpha Delta Pi is a member of the National Panhellenic Conference with Executive Office located in Atlanta, GA.
67857.description_html: The Eta Pi chapter of Alpha Delta Pi was founded at Virginia Tech in 1990. Alpha Delta Pi is a member of the National Panhellenic Conference with headquarters in Atlanta, GA. Alpha Delta Pi has around 187 active chapters and has more than 260,000 collegiate members nationwide. Our motto is "We Live for Each Other" and our philanthropic cause is the Ronald McDonald House Charities in Roanoke, Va.

65632.name: Alpha Epsilon Delta
65632.summary: Alpha Epsilon Delta is the National Health Preprofessional Honor Society. We foster the importance of scholarship & service and provide a community for pre-health students to connect and support one another. We are the future of healthcare!
65632.description_html: Alpha Epsilon Delta - the future of healthcare! We are AED, the National Health Preprofessional Honor Society at Virginia Tech. Applications are open to all students currently pursuing a career in any field of healthcare (pre-med, pre-dental, pre-optometry, pre-PT, pre-PA, nursing, etc.). We offer social and service events, leadership opportunities, study hours, professional development, and much more! Our mission is to create an inclusive community of high achieving, motivated future professionals and foster a supportive, fun, and beneficial environment. We strive to help all of our members succeed in achieving their career goals. Follow us on Instagram, check out our website, and reach out if you have questions! The next application cycle will be Fall 2024.

68103.name: Alpha Epsilon Pi
68103.summary: Alpha Epsilon Pi, the International Jewish Fraternity, was founded to provide opportunities for Jewish men seeking the best possible college and fraternity experience.
68103.description_html:
The mission of Alpha Epsilon Pi is to provide education, resources and training to the future leaders of the world’s Jewish communities. Alpha Epsilon Pi was founded to provide opportunities for Jewish men seeking the best possible college and fraternity experience.

Since our founding in 1913, more than 102,000 men have worn the badge of Alpha Epsilon Pi and each year, thousands of undergraduates perform the Ritual of Initiation, which remains the same ritual adopted decades ago.

Our basic purpose is to provide the opportunity for a Jewish man to be able to join an organization whose purpose is not specifically religious, but rather social and cultural in nature. Alpha Epsilon Pi is a Jewish fraternity and brotherhood that is open to all who are willing to espouse its values and mission.

69073.name: Alpha Gamma Rho
69073.description_html: National Social/Professional Agricultural Fraternity. Located at 1503 Toms Creek Rd in Blacksburg, Alpha Gamma Rho is a close group of agricultural men that are steadfast in the common bonds of friendship and agriculture.

64107.name: Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated
64107.summary: The Theta Phi Chapter has graced the campus of Virginia Tech since 1974. Thirteen exceptional young women who dedicate their talent, time, and hearts to the goals of Alpha Kappa Alpha currently comprise the chapter.
64107.description_html: Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated was founded on the campus of Howard University on January 15th, 1908. It is the first sorority established by African American women dedicated to serving all mankind. In the past years of sisterhood, our members have made strides in the African American community by upholding high scholastic and ethical standards and promoting peace worldwide. The Theta Phi Chapter of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc. was chartered on the campus of Virginia Tech Saturday, May 4th, 1974.

65886.name: alpha Kappa Delta Phi
65886.summary: alpha Kappa Delta Phi (aKDPhi) is the largest and only international Asian-interest sorority. aKDPhi promotes sisterhood, leadership, scholarship, leadership and service, in addition to its philanthropy, Breast Cancer Awareness.
65886.description_html:
In the Spring of 2001, the Virginia Tech interest group for alpha Kappa Delta Phi began to develop in order to provide Asian American women with a source of sisterhood, leadership, scholarship and service. Strong Individuals Striving Together As Sisters (SISTAS) was established by co-founders Tina Park and Alice Vuong with the intention of laying the foundation for a chapter of the sorority on campus. Following their belief that the sorority would provide Asian American women with a support system not otherwise found on campus, the ladies of SISTAS worked persistently to become a group that would acquire the respect and interest from the Virginia Tech campus, surrounding community of Blacksburg, and the existing chapters of alpha Kappa Delta Phi.

 

        Joined by Kokoro Fujiyama, Marylynn Jansak, Nicole Shin, Erica Sok, Carol Tsai, Hannah Xiu, and Melody Yok; the 9 women worked together to lay the foundation of friendship and sisterhood. Through their dedicated efforts, the ladies of SISTAS impacted the community with their message of Asian Awareness, sisterhood and charity. In the Spring of 2002, the sisters of the Theta Chapter of alpha Kappa Delta Phi at the University of Pennsylvania, the first full-fledged chapter on the East Coast, was granted the privilege of hosting the pledging colony of Virginia Tech. After almost a year of work in addition to the continued support of their host chapter, UPenn, and New Member Educator, Margaret Shea, the ladies at Virginia Tech were able to realize their own potential and abilities while reaching their long-held goals.

 

        On April 14, 2002, the ladies of SISTAS proudly became the 32nd chapter of the nation’s largest and most prestigious Asian American sorority, alpha Kappa Delta Phi. Now, loving and devoted sisters of the Alpha Theta Chapter of alpha Kappa Delta Phi at Virginia Tech work together to continue to grow as individuals and as sisters, through love and everlasting friendship! 🤍💜

68543.name: Alpha Kappa Psi
68543.summary: The Beta Xi chapter of the worlds largest, co-ed business fraternity. Recognized as the premiere developer of principled business leaders.
68543.description_html: The Beta Xi chapter of the worlds largest, co-ed business fraternity. Recognized as the premiere developer of principled business leaders. With over 80 brothers in our chapter, and many more world wide, AKPsi works through leadership events, conferences, speakers and business meetings to prepare its brothers for the business world.

68840.name: Alpha Omega
68840.summary: We are a Non-Denominational Christian Ministry that dedicates itself to following the Bible and strives to provide a dynamic fellowship in which members are supported in their efforts to know God and to make God known.
68840.description_html: Alpha Omega is a non-denominational Christian group associated with the Roanoke Valley Church, part of the International Churches of Christ. We strive to dedicate ourselves to imitating Jesus Christ, and to have a fellowship of believers living like the 1st-century church of Acts.  We have weekly bible discussions, Friday night devotionals, personal bible studies, and lots of other activities on campus! Come check us out!

69160.name: Alpha Omega Epsilon, Rho Chapter at Virginia Tech
69160.summary: We are the Rho Chapter of Alpha Omega Epsilon at Virginia Tech - a professional & social sorority promoting women in engineering & technical sciences.
69160.description_html:
Alpha Omega Epsilon (AΩE) is a professional and social sorority for women in STEM. Chartered on January 22, 2006, the Rho Chapter of Alpha Omega Epsilon at Virginia Tech serves to support women in STEM on campus while offering the bonds of sisterhood and a lifetime network. Sisters are from all walks of life with many different interests, and as a result, AΩE is involved in a variety of activities on campus such as service, philanthropy, intramurals, and professional development to name a few! 

 

Interested in learning more about AΩE and our Fall/Spring recruitment events? Fill out the following form to be added to our email listserv (Interest Form). Formal registration for Spring Recruitment has closed, but you can still register the day-of at check-in for Sisterhood Night, Service Night, and/or Professional Lunch (see below).

You can also find us on Instagram @vt_alphaomegaepsilon !

Visit our website: https://aoeexec-g.wixsite.com/my-site

68915.name: Alpha Phi
68915.summary: Panhellenic sorority - Eta Omicron chapter of Alpha Phi
68915.description_html:
The Alpha Phi Eta Omicron chapter at Virginia Tech is home to a sisterhood made up of women who are as unique as they are diverse. Established on campus in 1989 and part of a legacy that has thrived for over 150 years, our chapter is rooted in core values like intellectual growth, leadership, loyalty, service, and character development. Every day, we strive to better ourselves—not only as members of Alpha Phi but as students and sisters, upholding the ideals of our fraternity and the high standards set by Virginia Tech.

Life in Eta Omicron is filled with purpose and passion. Our members are deeply committed to making a positive impact, whether it's raising funds for Women's Heart Health through our philanthropy, organizing meaningful sisterhood events, or coming together to share quality time. Every interaction is an opportunity to strengthen our bonds and deepen our connection.

Our chapter is driven by a shared dedication to empowering one another, pushing each other to strive for leadership roles and to develop genuine, strong characters. We support and inspire each other to step outside our comfort zones, take on new challenges, and get involved in a variety of campus activities. Whether within Alpha Phi or through other campus organizations, our members are constantly seeking ways to grow, lead, and make a lasting difference in our community.

Amidst the adversity, challenges, and growth that college students experience, sisters of Alpha Phi find strength in knowing that we are united and supported by empowering women who stand by us every step of the way. Each member plays a vital role in what makes our chapter so special, and together, we are always striving to grow, make a lasting impact, and move forward with a shared mission and vision for the future. Union hand in hand.

67858.name: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
67858.summary: The Theta Iota chapter of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc. was chartered at Virginia Tech in 1973. Since then, we have remained steadfast in our mission, aims, and our motto; "First of all, Servants of all, We shall transcend all!"
67858.description_html: The Theta Iota Chapter of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc has continued to uplift the community since 1973, when it was first chartered at Virginia Tech. We are a student organization that commits to community service, while hosting social events on campus. Our motto is "First of all, Servants of all, We shall transcend all".

68838.name: Alpha Phi Omega
68838.description_html:
Alpha Phi Omega is a gender-inclusive service fraternity -- the largest in the nation! Our cardinal principles are leadership, friendship, and service, and our brothers strive to embody those principles every day. Our goal is to help our brothers grow into strong leaders, friends, and community servants. We accept all majors and years!

 

If you have any questions regarding the rush process do not hesitate to reach out to Owen and Joey, our Directors of Recruitment, through email (@apozbrecruitment@gmail.com).

 

Also, check our socials: Instagram (@vt_apo), Facebook (Alpha Phi Omega at Virginia Tech)!

69013.name: Alpha Pi Mu
69013.summary: Industrial and Systems Engineering Honor Society
69013.description_html: Alpha Pi Mu is the National Honor Society for Industrial and Systems Engineering.

82094.name: Alpha Psi
82094.summary: Purpose: To promote a stronger bond between the veterinary colleges of the United States and Canada; to create a better feeling among the students of all veterinary colleges, and to infuse a deeper interest in the study of veterinary science.
82094.description_html:
History of Alpha Psi

In 1906 veterinary students at Ohio State University saw the benefits of fraternal life but were frustrated by the lack of a national organization for their profession. After much study and work, 22 Juniors and Seniors founded the Alpha Chapter of Alpha Psi Fraternity and by 1915 chapters had been established at 15 schools. Today, there are eleven active Alpha Psi Chapters at veterinary schools across the country.If an honor roll were established for the all time leaders of the veterinary profession in the United States, it would be heavily weighted with Alpha Psi Fraternity Members. Certainly their accomplishments are the result of individual initiative and merit but in some instances leadership and communicative skills were strengthened by their fraternity experience.

The preamble to the Alpha Psi Fraternity constitution reads as follows:

"We, students of the College of Veterinary Medicine of the Ohio State university, in order to promote a stronger bond between the veterinary colleges of the United States and Canada; to create a better feeling among the students of all veterinary colleges, and to infuse a deeper interest in the study of veterinary science, do hereby establish this constitution for the ALPHA PSI, the national veterinary fraternity."

The constitution was written in 1907 and the objectives stated then are appropriate today. Alpha Psi is a social-professional fraternity which restricts its active membership to students who are enrolled in a school of veterinary medicine. It provides an opportunity for the development of lasting friendships between individuals in different classes or schools and is dedicated to the development of these individuals to better serve the veterinary profession.

History of Alpha Psi at the Virginia-Maryland Regional College of Veterinary Medicine

In early 1983, the Pi Chapter of Alpha Psi was founded at VMRCVM. Two individuals, Jim McDonald and Paul Howard, were instrumental in getting the chapter established. Members of the Lambda Chapter and National Officers of Alpha Psi conducted the first induction establishing 96 charter members of the Pi Chapter.

123131.name: Alpha Psi Omega at Virginia Tech (Alpha Psi )
123131.summary:
"To seek a life useful"

Alpha Psi Omega is a nationally recognized honors society. The School of Performing Arts at Virginia Tech hosts our chapter of Alpha Psi Omega for Theatre & Cinema students.
123131.description_html: This National Theatre Honor Society strives to bring excellence to the performing arts on undergraduate college campuses nationwide, including Virginia Tech. Generations of performing artists covet this organization and is a great honor to be a part of. Alpha Psi Omega’s national mission is to encourage dramatic production at every step of a person’s academic career. (APO website) On a local level, we will strive to bring thespians together as well as raise awareness for what the performing arts are (the hardships, the processes, etc) A𝚿𝛀 will provide opportunities for those involved to enjoy workshops and Q and A sessions to help them further their studies and passions in the theater. APO is a co-ed Theatre Honor Society that is completely student-run. Our mission is to become humble artists through collaboration, dedication, and self-discipline.

62842.name: Alpha Rho Chi
62842.summary: The national professional fraternity for architecture and the allied arts. Open to any undergraduate interested in architecture and related design majors.
62842.description_html: The National Professional Fraternity for Architecture and the Allied Arts. Our organization unites students for the purpose of fellowship and lifelong friendships and our mutual interest in professional development. Open to any undergraduate interested in architecture and related design majors.

210190.name: Alpha Sigma Kappa- Women in Technical Studies
210190.summary: Alpha Sigma Kappa is a sorority focused on uniting women pursuing technical majors. Our goal is to encourage sisterhood and academic achievement in women from different technical majors, and offer opportunities in leadership and a sense of belonging.
210190.description_html: The Omicron Chapter of Alpha Sigma Kappa at Virginia Tech is a sorority focused on uniting women pursuing technical majors. Our goal is to encourage sisterhood and academic achievement in women in Engineering, Architecture, Mathematics, and the Sciences. While women have an ever-growing presence in these fields, we remain a minority in collegiate and professional arenas which can prove challenging. As a sorority, we offer women the opportunity to develop leadership skills, friendships, a sense of belonging, and a network of support.

69143.name: Alpha Sigma Phi
69143.summary: To Better the Man, through the creation and perpetuation of brotherhood founded upon the values of character… Silence, Charity, Purity, Honor, Patriotism.
69143.description_html: The Delta Upsilon chapter of Alpha Sigma Phi was chartered at Virginia Tech in 1995 and is currently one of the fastest growing chapters on campus, growing from 47 brothers in Spring 2018 to 151 brothers in Spring 2023. Delta Upsilon is also the fourth largest Alpha Sigma Phi chapter in the United States. We strive for excellence in academics, athletics, philanthropy, and brotherhood development. Our chapter vision is "to Better the Man, through the creation and perpetuation of brotherhood founded upon the values of character: Silence, Charity, Purity, Honor, Patriotism."

369816.name: Alpha Tau Alpha- Alpha Lambda
369816.summary: Alpha Tau Alpha is a National Professional Honorary Agricultural Education Organization that plays a vital role in the preparation of those who have chosen a major in agricultural education or extension education.
369816.description_html: The purpose of this organization, as implied in the Preamble, is to promote the highest standards of agricultural education and a more intimate acquaintance and closer relationship with individuals who have chosen a major in agricultural education or extension education. By studying the life, preparation, and personality of great educators, by a better understanding of various aspects of the great vocations in agriculture, and life of the people engaged therein, we aspire to become such agricultural educators as shall wisely and sufficiently lead those who have chosen the vocation of agriculture, into fuller lives of success and happiness. We seek to find and enjoy the fellowship of individuals of high scholarship, of true teaching ideals, and of sincere desire to serve in agricultural leadership.

99309.name: Alpha Tau Omega
99309.summary: Alpha Tau Omega is America's Leadership Development Fraternity. We help college men develop their ability to be effective leaders for a lifetime. GIVE TODAY ABOUT ATO
99309.description_html:
As America’s Leadership Development Fraternity, ATO provides a great opportunity for men who are looking for a true fraternal experience. Since 1865, Alpha Tau Omega has been a provider of amazing personal growth potential, life-changing brotherhood, outstanding scholarship rewards, and unlimited leadership development. More than 208,000 men have become ATOs and taken advantage of an experience like nothing else.

Alpha Tau Omega (ATO) will be actively recruiting men to become members on your campus. Being a member is a privileged and unique opportunity to join a national fraternity, which allows you to partake in our traditions and experience. You will be able to continue the legacy of ATO. As a pledge, you will be a respected member of our organization from day one, and you will not be hazed.

This is your chance to be a part of a brotherhood that provides you with support when you need it and challenges you to be better than you were yesterday. ATO is a brotherhood for life. You will be able to interact and connect to a growing network of 160,000 alumni ATOs across the country. Just imagine tapping into such a network for career opportunities upon graduation.

You are highly encouraged to check out ATO and share this information with your friends. There is no obligation to join by attending any of our information sessions starting in September. These sessions are a great way to learn about ATO, meet the National Fraternity staff and area alumni, and determine if you’re into the idea of creating your own Fraternity experience.

72822.name: Alpha Zeta
72822.summary: The Virginia Chapter of Alpha Zeta is a professional, service, and honorary fraternity for men and women in the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences and the College of Natural Resources at Virginia Tech.
72822.description_html:
The purpose of The Fraternity of Alpha Zeta is to bind together a group of men and women interested in the continued advancement of agriculture and to foster and develop high standards of scholarship, character, leadership, and a spirit of fellowship among all its members. 

Pledging Requirements:

  • Must be enrolled in CALS or CNRE (major or minor) at Virginia Tech

  • Must have a minimum 2.75 GPA

Current Officers:

Chancellor: Abby Johnson

Censor: Katie Powell

Sergeant at Arms: Helen Levy

Pledge Coordinator: Kileigh Gainer

Advisors: Matthew Miller

356361.name: Alt Protein Project at Virginia Tech
356361.summary: The Alt Protein Project at Virginia Tech works to promote alternative proteins including plant-based meat, cultivated meat, and related fermentation products.
356361.description_html:
The Alt Protein Project at Virginia Tech is a chapter of an international student project led by the Good Food Institute. Our mission is to advance education, research, and innovation in three areas: plant-based meat, cultivated meat, and fermentation products. 

 

We hold several social and educational events each semester, which are announced on our Instagram page @vt.altprotein, on Gobblerconnect, and by emails to our members. Students from any major, graduate or undergraduate, are welcome to attend our events and to join our group.


If you are interested in working with us on any project related to our mission, please reach out to us at vtaltpro@gmail.com. We are always interested in new ideas, and would be happy to offer our support and resources.

400640.name: Alternative Fashion at Virginia Tech
400640.summary: A community dedicated to helping those interested in alternative fashion styles (ie. Goth, Emo, Punk, etc.) develop and cultivate their unique interest. We host DIY clothing, makeup, and social events to help foster the local alternative scene.
400640.description_html: A community dedicated to helping those interested in alternative fashion styles (ie. Goth, Emo, Punk, etc.) develop and cultivate their unique interest. Beginner-friendly and always looking for new members.

237897.name: Alternative Transportation
237897.summary: Supporting sustainable commuting methods and options at Virginia Tech!
237897.description_html:
Sustainable Transportation promotes and encourages bicycling, walking, vanpooling,

carpooling, car sharing, and transit use for local, regional, and out of state travel. Close coordination with

partners provide a robust array of travel options and resources, targeted at reducing single occupancy vehicle

reliance on campus.

401865.name: Alzheimer's Foundation Of America On Campus At Virginia Tech
401865.shortName: AFA On Campus at Virginia Tech
401865.summary: Welcome to the Alzheimer's Foundation of America at Virginia Tech! Our mission is to educate, fundraise and volunteer, and provide support for peers and families affected by Alzheimer's Disease.
401865.description_html: AFA on Campus is a division of the Alzheimer’s Foundation of America (AFA) that caters exclusively to students at colleges and universities across the country in an effort to engage them in awareness-raising activities and to groom tomorrow’s leaders in the Alzheimer’s community. We provide education, counseling, and support to young family members. We organize fundraising, volunteer and educational events related to Alzheimer’s care.

62819.name: Amateur Radio Association
62819.summary: To provide a station for the use of club members, and to provide emergency and public service communications. Questions? No questions, but you want to talk about radio? Join our Discord server! https://discord.gg/4AsxazStkM
62819.description_html:
Link to Discord server :^)

What is VTARA?

The Virginia Tech Amateur Radio Association is a student-run organization dedicated to advancing the amateur radio hobby in the Virginia Tech community. VTARA provides field communications, emergency communications, education, and volunteer testing services to the local community.

The principle members of VTARA are current students at Virginia Tech. An undergraduate serves as the President, with any current student performing the offices of Vice President, Secretary, Treasurer, and Maintenance Officer.

Because VTARA is a student organization at Virginia Tech, the rights and privileges of its members are largely determined by their student, faculty, and staff status at Virginia Tech.

Our Activities

Community Events

  • Annual Blacksburg Christmas Parade
  • Annual Virginia Tech Cycling Club Race

Amateur Radio Events

  • ARRL School Club Roundup
  • Virginia QSO Party
  • ARRL June VHF Contest
  • ARRL Field Day
  • ARRL November Sweepstakes (CW+SSB)

Club Events

  • Weekly meetings
  • Periodic presentations on various topics related to radio
  • Weekly “nets” on the air

Levels of Membership

VTARA holds open meetings and events.  Anyone interested may attend.  Full Members have equipment and shack access priviliges. Current dues are: $10/semester or $20/year.

Full Member (Voting)

Current dues-paying student, faculty, and staff at Virginia Tech. Membership expires at the end of the dues period (either beginning of the next semester if semester-only, or beginning of next academic year for annual). Only Full Members may cast votes at meetings.

 

Honorary Member (Non-Voting)

An Associate Member is voted to Honorary Member status. A Full Member must sponsor/nominate the person to be considered.  An honorary membership is a way of further recognizing and honoring community members that assist the club.  The membership may approve the creation of certificates, plaques, or other recognition for the Honorary Member

  

Associate Member (Non-Voting)

Any student, alumnus, faculty, staff, or community member who does not fall into any of the above categories.

 

How to Participate in VTARA Events

Weekly Meetings

As of Fall 2025 we meet every Thursday at 6:30-7:30PM in Squires 340 or 314. If you show up late and the room is empty, that's probably because we have moved to the ham shack (Squires 347). All are welcome!

Typical Meeting Agenda:

  • Call to Order, President or VP
  • Introductions, if necessary
  • Treasurer's Report (Income, Expenditures, Account Balance)
  • Discussion of Club Business:
    • Old Business
    • New Business
  • Presentations and/or Amateur-related discussion
  • Close of Meeting

Weekly Nets

VTARA sometimes holds weekly nets on the air, every Thursday at 9 PM, local time. The club uses the W9KIC repeater; 146.715 (-). The weekly net is an exercise in controlled traffic, and permits an opportunity for club members to test equipment and chat on the air about anything of interest.

387553.name: American Advertising Federation at Virginia Tech
387553.summary: The AAF Chapter improves students' skills in advertising and communications, offering networking, workshops, and competitions. Members tackle real-world campaigns for big name brands and local clients, aiming to foster future industry leaders.
387553.description_html:
The AAF Chapter at Virginia Tech is a student-led organization committed to enriching the educational experience for students interested in advertising, marketing, and communications. As an affiliate of the national American Advertising Federation, our chapter offers unique opportunities for members to interact with industry professionals, participate in educational workshops, and engage in real-world advertising challenges through national competitions like the NSAC.

 

Each year, our members tackle a case study provided by a corporate sponsor facing a real-world marketing challenge. Previous sponsors have included high-profile clients such as Indeed, Meta Quest, Bose, Coca-Cola, Snapple, Nissan, Pizza Hut, Tai Pei, Ocean Spray, and Adobe. Through this competition, students research the product and competition, identify key marketing issues, and develop a comprehensive advertising campaign. These campaigns are then presented to a panel of judges consisting of advertising industry professionals, client representatives, and advertising agencies, providing invaluable real-world experience and professional feedback.

 

Our mission is to build a community where future advertising leaders can learn, grow, and create impactful work, leveraging opportunities to contribute to significant projects and connect with established professionals in the field.

413612.name: American Choral Director's Association at Virginia Tech
413612.summary: ACDA at VT is a community of student musicians dedicated to the advancement of choral music and leadership. Open to all students with a passion for choral music, our chapter fosters collaboration, creativity, and lifelong engagement with the choral arts.
413612.description_html: As part of a nationally recognized professional network, our chapter supports emerging conductors, educators, composers, and performers by fostering professional growth and building community through music. Open to all Virginia Tech students—regardless of major—our chapter welcomes anyone with an interest in choral singing, conducting, or arts advocacy. Whether you're planning a career in music or simply looking to enrich your university experience through creative collaboration, ACDA at VT provides a space to connect with like-minded peers, develop valuable leadership skills, and contribute to the vibrant choral culture on campus and beyond.

176165.name: American Collegiate Horsemen's Association
176165.summary: A club dedicated to education and outreach opportunities related to the equine industry
176165.description_html: The American Collegiate Horsemen's Association at Virginia Tech is a multi-experience club that is open to all students regardless of background or major. Members will have the opportunity to learn more about horses and the equine industry through educational meetings, extracurricular activities, service opportunities, and more! If you are wanting to learn more about the equine industry, get more involved with horses, and meet new people who have the same interest, feel free to email us to get more information. We look forward to hearing from you!

69710.name: American Fisheries Society Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
69710.summary: VTAFS is the only student run chapter of the American Fisheries Society that strives to promote all aspects of fisheries science and its related topics among undergraduate and graduate students.
69710.description_html:
Chapter Mission

1. To promote the educational, scientific, and technological development and advancement of all branches of fisheries science and practice, including aquatic biology, engineering, economics, fish culture, limnology, oceanography, and technology.

2. To gather and disseminate technical and other information on fishes, fishing, fisheries, and all phases of fisheries science and practice.

3. To hold meetings for the presentation, exchange, and discussion of information, findings, and experiences on all subjects and techniques related to fishes, fishing, fisheries, and all phases of fisheries science and practice.

4. To encourage the teaching of all phases of fisheries science and the training of fisheries workers in accredited colleges and universities.

5. To promote the conservation, development, and wise use of the fisheries.

6. To promote fellowship and professionalism among members of this Chapter.

70342.name: American Foundry Society - Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
70342.summary: To educate students in metalcasting and foundry practices.
70342.description_html: We are the student chapter of the American Foundry Society Piedmont Chapter. Our goal is to educate students in metalcasting and foundry practices. On the high school level we host Foundry-in-a-Box where a portable furnace is taken to high school classrooms and students can get hands-on demonstration in metalcasting. On the university level we hold monthly meetings where we discuss scholarships available, internships and co-op experiences, and have guest speakers from foundries. We also tour a local foundry at least once a semester. To introduce students to industry professionals we attends AFS meetings on the local, regional, and national level.

335168.name: American Indian Science and Engineering Society at Virginia Tech
335168.summary: The American Indian Science and Engineering Society (AISES) serves as a forum for undergraduate and graduate students to build a native community in the STEM field by bridging science and technology with traditional values of cooperation and support.
335168.description_html: The American Indian Science and Engineering Society (AISES) serves as a forum for undergraduate and graduate students to build a native community in the STEM field by bridging science and technology with traditional values of cooperation and support.  In addition to increasing support and cooperation among the American Indian population at Virginia Tech, this organization would potentially work with other Virginia tribal nations to increase recruitment of the American Indian population at Virginia Tech through STEM-driven events.

72710.name: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics Student Branch at Virginia Tech
72710.summary: VT AIAA is dedicated towards fostering community and professional development opportunities for students interested in aerospace to strengthen their technical and professional knowledge of the aerospace field and to support career growth for all members.
72710.description_html:
The American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) Student Branch at Virginia Tech is dedicated to fostering a vibrant community for those passionate about aerospace. Our branch seeks to provide numerous opportunities for students to deepen their understanding of aerospace engineering and related fields through the fostering of a dedicated community, developmental workshops, and guest lectures from academics and industry professionals. We aim to create an inclusive environment where members can collaborate, innovate, and develop the technical skills necessary for a successful career in aerospace.

In addition to technical development, our branch places a strong emphasis on professional growth. We work to organize networking events, career-oriented discussions, and a supportive and nurturing atmosphere for all members. These initiatives are designed to help members navigate their career paths, build a strong professional network, and stay informed about the latest trends and opportunities in the aerospace industry. By joining our AIAA student branch, members gain access to a dedicated, friendly, and supportive community that is committed to their academic and professional success. All students interested in the aerospace field are encouraged to join regardless of major or academic year.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Elise Gage at eliselg@vt.edu.

96119.name: American Institute of Architecture Students
96119.description_html: The AIAS is committed to providing opportunities to its members in leadership, professional, educational, and social means. Through the AIAS you will gain networking experience, create bonds with other students both at your school and across the nation, as well as having the chance to serve in a leadership position. We host a wide range of events, held frequently through the semester, for members to attend freely.

69155.name: American Institute of Chemical Engineers at Virginia Tech
69155.summary: AIChE at VT is a professional organization devoted to the development of Chemical Engineers at VT through meetings, corporate relations, etc.
69155.description_html: VT AIChE is one of the largest student organizations at Virginia Tech, dedicated to supporting chemical engineering students both professionally and socially. We host a wide range of events throughout the year, including the National AIChE Annual Student Conference, the ChemE Career Forum, and various opportunities for professional development, mentorship, and community-building. Our mission is to help students achieve their career goals while making their college experience both enriching and enjoyable

122432.name: American Marketing Association
122432.summary: An organization where college students, of any major, interested in the field of marketing can organize for mutual benefit. The primary goal is to allow students to gain hands-on marketing experience through local businesses and client work.
122432.description_html:
As the leading organization for marketers, AMA is the trusted go-to resource for marketers and academics. We are counted on as the most credible marketing resource where our members can stay relevant with knowledge, training, and tools to enhance lifelong learning and obtain valuable information and connections.

The AMA is constantly innovating and evolving, helping to shape the field as well as keep abreast of the changing global marketplace to help our members excel in their careers.

The American Marketing Association is a professional association for individuals and organizations leading the practice, teaching and development of marketing knowledge worldwide. Gaining real world experience is what helps our members get jobs at the end of their college careers.

Our primary role is to serve as a forum to connect like-minded individuals and foster knowledge sharing, provide resources, tools and training and support marketing practice and thought leadership around the globe.

69376.name: American Medical Student Association Pre-Medical Chapter at Virginia Tech
69376.summary: The American Medical Student Association (AMSA) is the oldest and largest independent association of physicians-in-training in the United States. At the pre-med level, we focus on helping to guide you along the path to medical school.
69376.description_html:
About Us

We are students interested in learning about medical school and preparing for the application process while building relationships with our peers along the way.

 

Visit https://amsavt.wixsite.com/amsa to learn more about us under the “About Us” tab!

 

Requirements

There are no local dues. AMSA National membership is $35/year or $75/4 years. National membership is required to be considered a member.

 

(You can find more information on our website under the “Membership” tab)

 

Please reach out to us at amsavt1@gmail.com with your questions!

414728.name: American Muslim Medical Students Association
414728.summary: The American Muslim Medical Students Association (AMMSA) is a student led organization welcoming Muslim students, physicians, and leaders to explore the inherent intersection between Islam and medicine.
414728.description_html: To empower American Muslim medical students by providing opportunities for excellence in spiritual growth, professional development, and community building.

72947.name: American Nuclear Society at Virginia Tech
72947.summary: ANS at Virginia Tech is a Registered Student Organization of VT and a student section of the national American Nuclear Society. We are committed to assisting students interested in nuclear science or engineering.
72947.description_html:
The American Nuclear Society at Virginia Tech exists to aid students interested in nuclear science and engineering, and to promote the development and application of nuclear technology for the benefit of mankind including radiation medicine and nuclear energy.

We offer opportunities and programs to learn and get involved in the field of nuclear science, as well as a network to interact with like-minded individuals. We hold social and professional events every month to network, learn, and have fun. Most communication is done over Microsoft Teams; you can email Swinson6@vt.edu for a link to join or use the code msq0x2p.

69370.name: American Railway Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way Association Chapter at Virginia Tech
69370.summary: AREMA is an organization of engineering students interested in railroad engineering and the rail industry in general. All engineering majors are welcome.
69370.description_html:
Join our Slack Channel here: https://vt-arema.slack.com/archives/C09DMSLSRCJ

American Railway Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way Association (AREMA) at Virginia Tech is a multi-disciplinary engineering club with a focus on railway technology.  The focus of this organization is to provide students and companies opportunities to develop networking connections.  Students will be given opportunities to underline knowledge in the railway industry through professional guest speakers, field trips to railway facilities, and networking/career development events.

79363.name: American Sign Language Club
79363.summary: Come sign with us!! We are a group of passionate people excited to learn and spread awareness about ASL and Deaf culture. All levels of signing experience are welcome.
79363.description_html:
Come sign with us!!

We are a group of like-minded people excited to learn and spread awareness about ASL and deaf culture. We host and participate in a variety of events including ASL lessons, socials, and volunteer opportunities within the community to help bring ASL into southern Virginia. We are a community of friends with a passion for learning ASL. All are welcome to come out and join us anytime throughout the semester regardless of skill level.

Check out our instagram @vtaslclub for updates!

97316.name: American Society for Engineering Education Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
97316.summary: The American Society for Engineering Education (ASEE) Student Chapter at Virginia Tech is a student-based organization committed to furthering education in engineering.
97316.description_html:
The American Society for Engineering Education (ASEE) Student Chapter at Virginia Tech is a student-based organization committed to furthering education in engineering. The mission of The ASEE Student Chapter at Virginia Tech is to provide a forum to enhance teaching and research skills, promote careers in academia, and encourage and assist undergraduates considering graduate school in the field of engineering education. 

The ASEE Student Chapter at Virginia Tech shall focus efforts toward any of the following and more:

  1. Gaining insight into academic careers and teaching practices.
  2. Supporting and informing undergraduate VTSC members considering graduate school and teaching opportunities.
  3. Building a community of practice through social, not necessarily academic, events.

https://gobblerconnect.vt.edu/organization/ASEE/

72754.name: American Society of Agricultural and Biological Engineers
72754.summary: The American Society of Agricultural and Biological Engineers is a professional networking organization dedicated to the advancement of agricultural, food, and biological systems engineering.
72754.description_html:
Biological engineers develop efficient, environmentally sensitive methods of producing agricultural commodities, sustainable materials, bioinformatics systems, biomolecular research, biomedical technology, food science manufacturing processes, and renewable energy sources for an ever-increasing world population. Additionally, many of our engineers focus on improving and protecting ecosystems and water quality for our environmental, agricultural, and public health.

 

Our Virginia Tech chapter holds social, professional, and community service events centered around biological engineering and advancing our students knowledge of the biological world.

 

Founded in 1907 and headquartered in St. Joseph, Michigan, ASABE comprises 9,000 members in more than 100 countries. Every year, members of ASABE at Virginia Tech attend the Southeast Regional Rally conference. At this conference, members have the opportunity to network with individuals from other universities and in industry, in addition to being exposed to cutting-edge research projects and related graduate programs.

 

Virginia Tech hosted the Southeastern Rally in Spring 2022! See details here: https://dnn9n7kh1sandbox1.evoqondemand.com/news-detail/2022southeastrally

420435.name: American Society of Biomechanics Student Chapter at Virginia Tech/Wake Forest
420435.summary: The ASB Student Chapter aims to foster connections among ASB-affiliated students and faculty within and across universities. We will provide comprehensive intellectual and professional development among students interested in biomechanics research.
420435.description_html:
Our mission is to cultivate a collaborative and inclusive biomechanics community that spans Virginia Tech, Wake Forest, and beyond. We aim to empower students through professional development, interdisciplinary research dissemination, and meaningful outreach. By fostering connections across campuses and disciplines, we strive to advance the field of biomechanics and inspire the next generation of scientific innovators, educators, and leaders. 

 The purpose of the ASB Student Chapter is to foster connections among ASB-affiliated students and faculty within and across universities. In doing so, the ASB Student Chapter will provide comprehensive intellectual and professional development among students from a wide range of disciplines that contribute to the field of biomechanics.

70547.name: American Society of Civil Engineers at Virginia Tech
70547.summary: The ASCE Chapter at Virginia Tech seeks to create an environment that fosters interaction and communication between CEE students, faculty, and practicing engineers through events for professional and technical development and social engagement.
70547.description_html: Virginia Tech has one of the largest ASCE collegiate chapters in the nation with membership of over 200 students. VT ASCE has been actively involved with the campus and surrounding community since our foundation in 1923. We seek to create an environment that fosters communication and interaction between civil engineering students, faculty, and practicing engineers. We aim to do this through professional and social events, providing a variety of meetings and gatherings for our members. Some examples have been professional development coffee hours, flag football evenings, intramural teams and more.

69156.name: American Society of Landscape Architects
69156.summary: The Virginia Tech student chapter of the American Society of Landscape Architects.
69156.description_html: We conduct workshops, host lectures, organize social events, travel to conferences, and help foster relationships within the Schools of Architecture and Design, the College of Architecture, Arts, and Design, Virginia Tech, and the Blacksburg community through the exploration of landscape architecture.

83197.name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
83197.summary: The ASME Student Section at Virginia Tech is committed to developing the leadership, teamwork, and social skills essential for its members to succeed in today's workforce.
83197.description_html:
ASME, the American Society of Mechanical Engineers, founded in 1880 is a not-for-profit professional organization promoting the art, science, and practice of mechanical and multidisciplinary engineering and allied sciences through the world. 

The ASME Student Section at Virginia Tech is dedicated to building the leadership, teamwork, and social skills essential for its members to succeed as professionals in today's workforce. 

 

Our Student Development Programs include:

- Company Networking Events

- Hands-on Workshops & Educational Seminars

- Timed Design Competitions

- Student Design Teams

- Social Events

- Access to Industry Leading Tools

- And More!

 

We are here to get you a job and succeed in industry!

69909.name: American Water Resources Association Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
69909.summary: Our mission is to support local, regional, and national waterways through water education, service, management, and research.
69909.description_html:
Our mission is to support local, regional, and national waterways through water education, service, management, and research.

We organize in participate in educational programs with local middle schools, local water ways clean up, guest speakers, and water-themed movie nights.

Email: vtawra@gmail.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AWRAatVirginiaTech

Website: https://vtechawra.weebly.com/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/vtawra/

414606.name: Anatomy Student Club
414606.summary: The purpose of our anatomy club is to foster a deeper understanding and appreciation of human anatomy among medical students. Through interactive learning experiences, dissections, workshops, and educational events, we aim to enhance our members' anatomi
414606.description_html: The purpose of our anatomy club is to foster a deeper understanding and appreciation of human anatomy among medical students. Through interactive learning experiences, dissections, workshops, and educational events, we aim to enhance our members' anatomical knowledge, develop their clinical skills, and cultivate a supportive community where students can engage in collaborative learning and professional development. Our club strives to facilitate hands-on opportunities, promote interdisciplinary collaboration, and inspire a lifelong passion for anatomical sciences, ultimately contributing to the academic and clinical success of our members as future healthcare professionals.

414607.name: Anesthesiology Student Interest Group
414607.summary: Promote events and networking opportunities related to the field of Anesthesiology.
414607.description_html: Provide students with networking opportunities, panels, and workshops to promote Anesthesia!

400642.name: Animal Science Graduate Student Association
400642.summary: This organization shall be known as the Animal Science Graduate Student Association (ASGSA) and shall be the primary source of service and reference to graduate students in the School of Animal Sciences (SAS).
400642.description_html:
This organization is for the graduate students in the School of Animal Sciences at Virginia Tech. 

The purpose of ASGSA shall be: 

  1. To provide an organization to SAS graduate students that serves as an open forum for communication between graduate students and faculty and administration 
  2. To provide a source of information on university and departmental policies, career opportunities, and services to new and prospective graduate students as well as enrolled students. 
  3. To provide students with opportunities for involvement in professional and social gatherings that benefit the department, college, university and surrounding community.

187096.name: Apex Center for Entrepreneurs
187096.summary: Apex Center for Entrepreneurs inspires and empowers students to turn their passion, purpose, and ideas into action.

69297.name: Appalachia Service Project at Virginia Tech
69297.summary: We are a construction based service organization with the goal of making homes "Warmer, Safer and Drier." Join us on a weekend build to have fun, meet new people, and serve your community. No construction experience is required.
69297.description_html:
Welcome to the Appalachia Service Project!!

 

Who We Are:

We are a group of students who aim to have some fun while making homes in the Appalachian region "Warmer, Safer, and Drier."

If you enjoy working with your hands and learning/practicing construction techniques then this is the club for you.

No construction skills necessary just some interest and enthusiasm. 

 

What We Do:

We have biweekly meetings which are the place to be to participate in construction workshops, social activities, and be the first to sign up for upcoming builds.  We have many opportunities for people of all skill levels to get out into the community, work with their hands, and have a positive impact whether that be through our own builds or though builds we coordinate with organizations like Habitat for Humanity. 

We also fundraise by selling grilled cheeses downtown Blacksburg this is a great way for underclassmen to experience the nightlife and make a difference at the same time. 

Why We Do It:
The Appalachia Service Project at Virginia Tech (ASP-VT) was created in the fall of 2007 as an opportunity for students, faculty, and community members to join together to repair homes in the Appalachian region. Today, ASP-VT continues to grow and make a difference in the lives of our neighbors, communities, and members. Joining ASP-VT on a weekend build or trip is an excellent way to meet new friends, have fun, learn something new, fundraise, and serve your community.

If you want to be a part of our club we would love to have you so please reach out to any of our officers if you have questions. We look forward to seeing you at our meetings and builds! Feel free to join our GroupMe Page for all the latest info: https://groupme.com/join_group/102637918/yvG369KV

To join our email list, please fill out this form!: https://forms.gle/FK5drkCWzLsLasgf6

387527.name: Arab American Association of Engineers and Architects at Virginia Tech
387527.summary: The Arab American Association of Engineers and Architects (AAAEA) at Virginia Tech is dedicated to fostering academic and professional development opportunities for students while shedding light on the significant achievements of Arab Americans.
387527.description_html:
The Arab American Association of Engineers and Architects (AAAEA) at Virginia Tech is dedicated to fostering academic and professional development opportunities for students while shedding light on the significant achievements of Arab Americans in the STEM field. Our mission is to bridge the gap in resources and connections for Arab-American students, an often overlooked demographic within STEM.

 

Specifically, AAAEA-VT will serve as a central hub for students seeking resources to enhance their academic and professional journeys. Through workshops, mentorship programs, and collaborative initiatives, we will empower members with the tools and knowledge crucial for success in the STEM field. The organization would establish a partnership with the AAAEA Capital Area Chapter, a reputable professional organization in the DC area. This collaboration will provide our members with unique networking opportunities, access to industry professionals, and a bridge between the academic and professional realms.
