In summary, the Arab American Association of Engineers and Architects aspires to fill a crucial gap in Virginia Tech's current offerings, providing a supportive environment for Arab-American students to thrive academically and professionally in the STEM field.

124818.name: Arabic Language Club at Virginia Tech
124818.summary: The Arabic Language Club is a non-profit student organization that works on enhancing awareness of the Arabic language, heritage, and culture.
124818.description_html: The Arabic Language Club is a non-profit student organization that works on enhancing awareness of the Arabic language, heritage, and cultures in all their diversity through social, educational, and service events. The club provides an opportunity for interaction and engagement between students who are enrolled in the Arabic class at Virginia Tech and Arab students/native speakers of Arabic. The club also seeks to highlight the students’ academic and artistic work and to give them an opportunity to engage with the community of Blacksburg and beyond.  This allows the Arabic-language students to interact with students of Arab heritage in an informal setting that promotes cross-cultural understanding.

403422.name: Archery Club at Virginia Tech
403422.summary: The Archery Club at Virginia Tech is a club that is focused around recreational and competitive archery.
403422.description_html:
The Archery Club at Virginia Tech is a club that is focused around recreational and competitive archery.

 

GroupMe Link: https://groupme.com/join_group/103887544/mkGAHtO3

294027.name: Archimedes
294027.summary: We are a student-led organization that supports four freshmen-only engineering design teams. All STEM majors are invited to participate in collegiate challenges hosted by NASA, Microsoft, RESNA, and ASME.
294027.description_html:
Who Are We?

Archimedes is an umbrella organization that hosts four engineering design teams exclusively for first-years. Guided by upperclassmen leads and subject-matter experts, first-years have the unique opportunity to participate in STEM design challenges that feature hands-on work alongside industry professionals in places such as NASA and Microsoft.

 

Our Mission

Archimedes was founded in 2015 on the principle that STEM first-years are passionate, goal-driven problem solvers that are more than capable of conquering a design challenge. We strive to give first-years a more in-depth experience than they might find in an upperclassman-dominated team.

Archimedes provides first-year STEM students with the tools, funding, and mentors to excel in their respective design competitions. No matter your particular major or experience level, at least one of our three design teams will put your skills to the test and accelerate your capabilities as an engineer, scientist, or mathematician.

 

About: Astra

Participating in NASA's annual Micro-g NExT competition, Astra challenges undergraduate students to design, build, and test a device related to space exploration. Astra has built devices such as a spacesuit cooling system, a lunar anchoring device, an autonomous rescue boat, and more!

 

About: Infinitum

Participating in Microsoft's annual Imagine Cup challenge, Infinitum offers an exciting opportunity for first-years to develop and build hardware and software addressing real-world problems. Infinitum has tackled problems such as food recognition in fridges, restaurant food waste management, and more! Note that participants must be 18 or older to participate in Microsoft's Imagine Cup.

 

About: Juvo

Participating in RESNA's Student Design Challenge, Juvo uses engineering to help the community. Tackling impairments that affect millions of people every day, first-years are tasked with designing a solution for someone in the disabled community. In the past, Juvo has created solutions for accessibility in production, wheelchair disabilities, motor impairments, and more!

 

About: Terra

Terra is a robotics team that competes in the ASME (American Society of Mechanical Engineers) Student Design Competition. Each year, a new challenge is created for engineering students to tackle problems in sustainability, automation, efficiency, and more. This year's challenge is to create a robot that sorts waste as a model for waste collection robots in a city. Note that the ASME SDC restricts participants to engineering students.

 

Join Us

We welcome first-years who are willing to push their boundaries of knowledge and commit to a time-intensive design team.

Our applications are closed for the 2025-2026 cycle, but join us at our Professional Development events to deepen your knowledge and enhance your technical and professional skills!

 

Visit archimedesvt.org to learn more.

352425.name: Arm Wrestling Club at Virginia Tech
352425.summary: Our club aims to bring people from all levels of experience into this exhilarating sport of arm wrestling. We offer experienced athletes, training, knowledge, and technique work for anyone who is interested.
352425.description_html: Arm wrestling club at Virginia Tech hopes to bring community members together to partake in this surprisingly complex sport. We hope to get people of all strength and experience levels to join, so we can not only encourage safe and proper arm wrestling, but community bonding and growth.

79921.name: Armenian Student Association
79921.summary: The Armenian Student Association brings Armenians and non-Armenians together in a welcoming space free from political agendas or religious influence to connect, celebrate culture, and build meaningful community.
79921.description_html:
The Armenian Students' Association at Virginia Tech is devoted to bringing Armenians together, upholding the Armenian heritage and traditions. As an organization, we are focused on providing a space where Armenians can connect with their roots, network with one another, and give back to their communities -- be it on campus, the Armenian community, or the New River Valley area. We warmly welcome all non-Armenian who are interested to learn more about our culture, language, and socialize with Armenians.

Our organization exercises direct-democracy and has a non-hierarchical structure.

117894.name: Army ROTC
117894.summary: The Army Reserve Officer Training Corps is a college elective that develops Leadership Skills in our students as they prepare for Military Service. Army ROTC offers a commission as a second lieutenant in either the active Army or Reserve Forces.
117894.description_html:
The Reserve Officer Training Corps is a college elective that develops Leadership Skills in our students as they prepare for Military Service. Army ROTC offers a commission as a second lieutenant in either the active Army or Reserve Forces in a variety of career fields including combat or support areas such as Aviation, Armor, Artillery, Infantry, Engineers, Military Intelligence, Military Police, Finance and Logtistics.  There are two-, three-, and four-year scholarship programs available. Some cadets choose to join the National Guard or the Army Reserve while in Army ROTC, thus qualifying them for the Montgomery GI Bill benefits, in-state tuition (VANG) and other exciting benefits.
      Virginia Tech is one of the United States' six Senior Military Colleges and one of two such programs at a predominantly civilian university. As a graduate of a Senior Military College, a medically qualified cadet successfully completing all ROTC requirements is virtually assured of obtaining an active duty commission. A few cadets each year earn a reserve forces duty commission. These future lieutenants will serve as a commissioned officer in either the U.S. Army Reserve or the Army National Guard.

344678.name: Art Club at Virginia Tech
344678.summary: A club where people who wanted to take art classes or are interested in art can have the same art class experiences. We strengthen our technical skills, participate in figure drawing classes, and do critiques.
344678.description_html:
A club where people who wanted to take art classes or are interested in art can have the same art class experiences. We strengthen our technical skills, participate in figure drawing classes and do critiques. Here, like minded artists can come together and improve their skills together, share tips and overall have a fun time together!

Join our Discord server for updates!

193805.name: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Club at Virginia Tech
193805.summary: Explore data, algorithms, and endless possibilities. Ignite your passion for cutting-edge technology. Engage in lively discussions and collaborate on fascinating ML projects. Unravel the mysteries of AI with us!
193805.description_html:
Welcome to the AI/ML Club, where we explore the future powered by code! Join us weekly to delve into the world of artificial intelligence and machine learning. We're here to ignite your passion for cutting-edge tech. Be part of our community, engage in discussions, and collaborate on ML projects. Click the Discord link to join our exciting AI/ML adventure! #JoinTheFuture

Discord: https://discord.gg/WfQ8ECZqDv

Website: https://vtai.netlify.app/about

Lectures: https://tinyurl.com/vtaiml-lectures-1

294028.name: Ascend
294028.summary: Ascend is a leading organization at Virginia Tech that empowers Pan-Asian students to achieve professional development skills. We strive to cultivate a culture of collaboration, innovation, and service that will inspire future generations of leaders.
294028.description_html:
Ascend’s mission is to be the premier professional organization dedicated to enabling its members, corporate partners and the professional Pan-Asian community to leverage the leadership and global business potential of Pan-Asian professionals worldwide.

Please contact ascendatvt@gmail.com if you have any questions!

327216.name: Ascent Church at Virginia Tech
327216.summary: Ascent Church at Virginia Tech exists to connect students to Ascent Church where they'll encounter God and experience life in the church community.
327216.description_html:
Welcome to Ascent Church, students!  We know college can be a busy time, but God often uses this season to direct the course of your life. Our vision is to be a church where students can find lots of friends and grow alongside one another in a challenging and meaningful way. Students are a vital part of Ascent Church. We would love to have you join us!

 

We meet on Sundays at 10:00am. Our church building is located 3 minutes north of campus on Main Street across from Carol Lee's and next to Food Lion. Be sure to follow us on Instagram for updates (@ascentchurchblacksburg) and join our Student Groupme (https://groupme.com/join_group/109306071/4KWOscTE)!

 

We are part of a growing network of church-planting churches that strive to obey Jesus’ mission to make disciples in cities around the world. We are not a denomination, but like-minded in doctrine and style. We are friends who support and encourage each other, start new churches, and follow Jesus together. At the core of our beliefs is the good news of Jesus Christ—the wonderful truth that Jesus Christ was crucified and raised from the dead so that sinful people would trust in Jesus and be reconciled to God. This gospel is our primary passion and the driving influence in preaching, worship, small groups, prayer, and church planting.

69693.name: ASDA Pre-Dental Chapter at Virginia Tech
69693.summary: The Pre-Dental Club of Virginia Tech is designed to prepare the students of Virginia Tech for a career in dentistry. We create competitive applicants through educational workshops, general meetings with guest speakers, social events, and service events.
69693.description_html:
The Pre-Dental Club at Virginia Tech is designed to prepare Virginia Tech students for a career in dentistry. Meetings are designed to promote fellowship among pre-dental students. We aim to motivate interested students to pursue a career in dentistry. Over the course of the year, topics encompassing the entire field are discussed.

The club advises members on course requirements and recommendations in preparation for dental school. It also educates members on the application and interviewing processes and the Dental Admissions Test (DAT). The club also invites guest speakers, including dental admissions deans and counselors, private practitioners, professors, pre-health advisors, and other specialists, to present at meetings.

Overall, the Pre-Dental Club at Virginia Tech is designed to equip undergraduates with an interest in dentistry with the knowledge and resources to gain entrance into dental school.

66094.name: Asian American Student Union
66094.summary: The mission of AASU is to serve the Asian/Pacific Islander Desi American (APIDA) community within Virginia Tech.
66094.description_html: The mission of the Asian American Student Union is to serve the Asian/Pacific Islander/Desi American (APIDA) communities within Virginia Tech.  It shall act as an umbrella organization over the branching undergraduate APIDA organizations.  It shall strive to enhance and further the individual, cultural, and ethnic diversities that exist in the APIDA communities.  It shall make efforts to address the problems, issues, and concerns of the APIDA communities to the administration and other fellow student organizations.

414609.name: Asian Pacific American Medical Student Association
414609.summary: The Asian Pacific American Medical Students Association (APAMSA) is a national organization of medical and pre-medical students committed to addressing the unique health challenges of Asian and Pacific Islander American (APIA) communities.
414609.description_html: APAMSA serves as a forum for student leaders to engage these health issues and develop initiatives and projects addressing those needs. The local, regional, and national activities of APAMSA aim to promote the health of the APIA community and to help healthcare workers understand how to care for APIA patients in a culturally sensitive manner. Finally, APAMSA provides an important venue for medical students to meet, exchange experiences, and develop personally and professionally through leadership and service.

144174.name: Aspirations Fellows
144174.summary: ExperienceVT provides a framework to record and reflect on your experiences during your time at Virginia Tech.
144174.description_html: If you’re ready to explore new things and find out who you are and what you value, if you want to experience the exhilaration of working hard and reaching your goals, if you have a desire to positively change the world, then prepare yourself for the opportunity of a lifetime.

223062.name: Aspiring Journalists at Virginia Tech
223062.summary: Aspiring Journalists at Virginia Tech is an organization dedicated to help prepare students for a career in journalism and other communication fields. Our goal is to ensure students gain experience, leadership skills and help diversify the newsroom
223062.description_html: We are a student-run organization that supports journalism in every form and helps prepare students for the industry!

70345.name: Association for Bangladeshi Students at Virginia Tech
70345.summary: ABS serves to bring together the Bangladeshi community at Virginia Tech and surrounding areas. We look after the interests of the Bangladeshi students and aim to connect them with each other and the local communities.
70345.description_html:
ABS is a non-profit, non-religious, non-political, student organization at Virginia Tech looking after the interests of Bangladeshi students, as well as providing a platform for such students to showcase the education, history, culture, and development issues of Bangladesh. ABS also serves to bring together the Bangladeshi community at Virginia Tech and surrounding areas. Along with that, we sponsor a wide variety of events and activities, especially the celebration of Bangladeshi festivals and volunteer services.

By celebrating Bangladeshi festivals, we try to bring a taste of our beloved country and culture to this foreign and diverse land. Along with that, we participate in 'International Week' hosted by the university. We also arrange picnics and camping trips to nearby areas. Often our talented members participate in university cultural programs.

By participating in volunteer-based activities, we bring the flavor of Bangladesh to the diverse community of Blacksburg. We also frequently send contributions to charitable causes in Bangladesh and other countries with help from our members, friends, and alumni. Every year, ABS donates a large part of the year's raised funds to charitable causes in Bangladesh as well as other countries around the world. We have made some major contributions to Bangladeshi and world communities in the past decade and we sincerely hope our future members will continue to support worthy causes.

79362.name: Association for Supply Chain Management
79362.summary: The collegiate chapter of the Association for Supply Chain and Operations Management. We coordinate tours of warehouse facilities, manufacturing plants, and professional development for our peers by industry professionals.
79362.description_html: The ASCM mission is to provide a complete supply chain and manufacturing professional experience to students through education, leadership, and industry exposure to provide various career opportunities.

69723.name: Association for Women in Computing
69723.summary: The Association for Women in Computing is a student-run, non-profit organization at Virginia Tech. For almost 20 years, we have worked to promote the recruitment and retention of women in technology - and computer - oriented professions.
69723.description_html:
The Association for Women in Computing is a student-run, non-profit organization at Virginia Tech.  For over 20 years, we have worked to promote the recruitment and retention of women in technology - and computer - oriented professions. This organization is not exclusive! Anyone and everyone who is passionate about computing and gender equality in the field of computing is welcome! Most members are in Computer Science (CS), Computer Engineering (CPE), Electrical Engineering (EE), Business Information Technology (BIT), Mathematics (MATH), Computational Modeling and Data Analytics (CMDA), and Statistics, but anyone passionate about our mission can join AWC in our networking, social, educational, outreach, and technical events!

 

Visit our website to learn more about AWC

 

Join our listserv (VT emails only) to receive weekly emails and important information about AWC

62808.name: Association for Women in Mathematics
62808.summary: The purpose of the Association for Women in Mathematics is to create a community in which women and girls can thrive in their mathematical endeavors, and to promote equitable opportunity and treatment of women and others of marginalized genders.
62808.description_html:
We are a chapter of the Association for Women in Mathematics at Virginia Tech. 

The following is the mission statement for the association for women in mathematics national chapter: “The purpose of the Association for Women in Mathematics is to create a community in which women and girls can thrive in their mathematical endeavors, and to promote equitable opportunity and treatment of women and others of marginalized genders and gender identities across the mathematical sciences.”

The Virginia Tech student chapter aims to bring together undergraduate and graduate students interested in creating and maintaining such a community on Tech's campus. Any hokie who is "for" women in mathematics is welcome at all events.

We encourage our members to network through our study sessions, mentoring program, and social events. The members of our organization will be encouraged to live Virginia Tech's motto "ut prosim" by giving back to the community. This will be accomplished through outreach events in which we encourage K-12 students to be excited about math.

362485.name: Association of Asian Veterinary Medical Professionals
362485.summary: The goal of the Association shall be to inspire, support, and increase the voice and visibility of Asians, Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders (AAPI) in the veterinary profession and advocate for greater general diversity in the veterinary profession.
362485.description_html: The AAVMP was created to build a community for Asian veterinary professionals and to establish a veterinary field that reflects the diverse communities that we serve.

67236.name: Association of Chinese Students and Scholars at Virginia Tech
67236.summary: The organization. The Association of Chinese Students and Scholars at Virginia Tech (ACSS@VT) is established for the general welfare of the Chinese community at Virginia Tech.
67236.description_html: Our organization mainly provides activities and helps for Chinese group at Virginia Tech. We hold the Mid-Autumn Festival Gala and Spring Festival Gala every year. We also help new students with their life and study. Please contact any board members if you are interested to join us.

356340.name: Association of Latinos for Mental Health Awareness
356340.summary: The Association of Latinos for Mental Health Awareness is an organization whose mission is to promote and destigmatize the topic of mental health within the Latino community.
356340.description_html: The Association of Latinos for Mental Health Awareness was created in order to support the mental wellbeing of everyone around us. We aim to do this by being inclusive of everybody, destigmatizing mental health, creating a safe space for members to have open conversations, and providing resources available around campus. In addition to this we hope to inspire our members to be active in helping the community around them as well. We alone can help, but all of us together can make a difference.

193809.name: Association of Muslim Volunteers
193809.summary: Association of Muslim Volunteers is a group of students who are passionate about giving back to our local community through service
193809.description_html:
وَتَعَاوَنُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلْبِرِّ وَٱلتَّقْوَىٰ ۖ
"And cooperate in righteousness and piety" [5:2]

We are focused on community service through various activities and involvement in the Blacksburg community. The mission of AMV is to develop our members into leaders who can create everlasting and meaningful change in every community they currently belong to and every community they will belong to in the future

116340.name: Association of Property Management
116340.summary: We are Virginia Tech’s Association of Property Management Club. This club is made up of current students, from all majors, where members have the opportunity to interface and network with guest speakers from the property management industry.
116340.description_html: Property Management offers fast-growing career opportunities encompassing positions in luxury and affordable apartment developments, senior living communities, mixed-use developments, and office and retail properties.  Members of Association of Property Management have the opportunity to learn more about the field, network with others in the industry, and are placed in a great position to manage the future.

118300.name: Astrobotics at Virginia Tech
118300.summary: Astrobotics at Virginia Tech is a design team that participates in the NASA Lunabotics Competition.
118300.description_html:
Please do not request to join Astrobotics on Gobblerconnect.

We recruit exclusively early in the Fall semester. Recruiting is now closed for the 2024–2025 academic year.

The Virginia Tech Astrobotics team is one of about 50 teams that competes regularly in the NASA Lunabotics Competition. With NASA's current objective of using the moon as a checkpoint to interplanetary travel and colonization, locating water is highly important. During a previous design cycle, 2022–2023, our objective was to design and construct a lunar robot capable of autonomously navigating rugged terrain and mining icy regolith. The robot then had to return to the starting point and deposit the mined material. This objective helps NASA use the icy regolith beneath the surface for life-sustaining purposes. The competition also included presenting our final design and a systems paper describing the vital decisions that went into the team's design.

 

For the 2023–2024 season, we designed and built a robot that can construct a lunar regolith-based berm. This will be important in protecting man-made structures on the moon such as solar farms, landing sites, and nuclear plants.

 

Astrobotics at Virginia Tech also participates in outreach opportunities in order to help educate and interest the local community in STEM activities and careers. We hope not to be a strong robotics team but to inspire the next generation of Hokie scientists and engineers.

96975.name: Astronomy Club at Virginia Tech
96975.summary: This organization serves to foster and inspire interest in astronomy for both members and the general public.
96975.description_html:
The main purposes of the Astronomy Club of Virginia Tech (ACVT) are to promote the study of astronomy through public education in the Blacksburg community and to improve and increase each member's knowledge of astronomy.

ACVT is a general interest astronomy club; no experience or academic background is required.

 

We hold weekly Stargazing Sessions (Typically on weekday evenings) and Bi-weekly Meetings on the weekends.

 

ACVT Discord Link: https://discord.gg/ta7sFsf5E8

357887.name: Aurora
357887.summary: Located in Harper Hall, the Aurora Interfaith Living-Learning Community is for undergrads of any religious, secular, or spiritual background. Members learn listening and dialogue skills, and gain religious literacy that sets them up for lifetime success.
357887.description_html: The Aurora Interfaith Living-Learning Community at Virginia Tech is open to undergrads of any religious, secular, or spiritual background. Aurora is for students who want to make friends with people different from them, reflect on their values, and learn interreligious skills that will set them up for academic and career success.

178386.name: AutoDrive
178386.summary: A design team at Virginia Tech sponsored by General Motors and SAE to build a Level 4 autonomous vehicle on a Chevrolet Bolt EUV within 4 years. We work on cutting-edge research and implement our design on state-of-the-art equipment.
178386.description_html:
What is AutoDrive?
AutoDrive is a design team that competes in the AutoDrive Challenge sponsored by GM and SAE. This autonomous vehicle challenge is a four-year competition to take a production Chevy Bolt EUV and develop it into a level 4 autonomous vehicle by year 4. Each year we compete head-to-head with 9 other universities that were selected for the competition to complete challenges that build up to the goal of full autonomy.
Who can join?
We welcome both grad and undergrad students from all majors, and not just engineering! We are always looking for passionate and competitive students who enjoy working on big problems. Reach out to any of our officers with any questions!

176122.name: Autonomous Aerial Vehicles at Virginia Tech
176122.summary: Undergraduate design team featuring students from numerous Virginia Tech College of Engineering departments. Our objective is to fabricate and design custom autonomous unmanned aerial systems for the annual Robonation SUAS competition.
176122.description_html:
This organization focuses on designing, building, and programming autonomous unmanned aerial systems (UAS) for the annual Robonation SUAS competition.

Primary competition elements include autonomous waypoint navigation, target recognition, obstacle avoidance, payload delivery, and image recognition systems.

Website

Season Highlights

160675.name: AUVSI Student Chapter
160675.summary: The Association for Uncrewed Vehicle Systems International (AUVSI) Student Chapter provides students with professional and technical development opportunities within the uncrewed systems industry.
160675.description_html:
The Association for Uncrewed Vehicle Systems International (AUVSI) Student Chapter is part of the world's largest nonprofit organization devoted exclusively to advancing the uncrewed systems and robotics industry. With our vision of creating a career pipeline composed of workshops, projects, certifications, field trips, guest speakers, demonstrations, and more, we aim to foster growth and support students pursuing internships and/or full-time positions within the industry.

 

GoAERO at Virginia Tech, supported by the AUVSI Student Chapter, is a driven team of engineering students from various disciplines and academic levels. United by our passion for life-saving technology, we are tackling the undefined challenge of engineering a safe, portable, robust autonomy-enabled emergency response flyer. Our collaborative effort fosters practical problem-solving and leadership skills within a fast-paced environment, continuously seeking to improve both our teamwork and our drone.

Workshops Recap

63168.name: Badminton Club at Virginia Tech
63168.summary: The Badminton Club offers both casual and competitive play, with practices held at the Rec Field House and War Memorial Gym.
63168.description_html:
General Information

Badminton is a fast, dynamic sport played with a shuttlecock and racket. Our club welcomes all skill levels, from casual players to competitive athletes. We play on indoor courts, focusing on fitness, agility, technique, and having fun as a community.

 

Schedules and Locations:

  • Wednesdays, 6–9 PM at Rec Field House (6 courts)
  • Fridays, 6–10 PM at War Memorial (4 courts)
  • Sundays, 12:30–4 PM at War Memorial (4 courts)

P.S. The competitive team will reserve 2 courts on Wednesday at Rec, 2 courts on Fridays at War Memorial, and 2 courts on Sundays at War Memorial. (The competitive team consists of those who compete at tryouts and are selected by the board.)

 

Membership Options:

  • Regular Members: $25
  • Competitive Team Membership: $50
  • Fill out this form if interested in being a member (https://forms.gle/EXdLT92wMYE4WM219)

 

Payments :

  • Venmo: @Trevor-Thai
  • Zelle: 3476020308 (Luan Thai)

**Please pay your fee by Sunday, September 7. A late fee of $5 will be applied after the deadline. Include your Full Name_Badminton Club in the memo. 

 

Note: A flyer with additional details will be sent to all members in our WhatsApp group chat (https://chat.whatsapp.com/LP0Fs2gCmHqKLzFdCM6xNL?mode=ems_copy_t) and Instagram page @vt_badminton.

 

✨ Team Tryouts  for the competitive team will be held on Fri, September 12th (6pm-10pm) and might carry over to Sunday, September 14th (12.30pm-4pm) at War Memorial Gym. This is a great opportunity to showcase your skills and earn a spot on the team! Fill out this form if interested! (https://forms.gle/r9qSxAJ7UtwgUBwn7)

 

Upcoming Competitions:

  • UVA Open: 9/27 - 9 /28
  • Collegiate: 10/25 - 10/26
  • GMU Open: 11/8 - 11/9

 

Opportunities:

Join us in representing our team at tournaments. Only competitive team members can participate in open tournaments hosted by other colleges.

 

Reach out via Instagram @vt_badminton or email vtbadm1ntonclub@gmail.com if you are interested in being a part of the leadership team. Open positions: 

  • Spring 2026 (General Manager)
  • Fall 2026 (President & Vice President)

66040.name: Baja SAE
66040.summary: The Baja SAE at Virginia Tech is an engineering design team that participates in a national competition to design, build, and test a single seat off-road vehicle to compete in informal and SAE sanctioned events.
66040.description_html:
What is BAJA SAE?
The Baja team at Virginia Tech participates in a national competition to design, build, and test a single seat off-road vehicle to compete in informal and SAE sanctioned events.

 

Who can join?

Students from all majors are welcome to get involved with the team. There is no previous automotive experience required, by actively being in the Ware Lab you'll learn about all the different subsystems of the car.

 

How can I get involved?

Send an email to vtbaja@gmail.com and let them know you want to get involved. To access our bay in the Ware Lab, you will need to get a Ware Lab Badge.

When are the gen team meetings?

We meet every Monday from 6:30-7:30 pm. We hope to see you there! (Every once and a while these meeting dates do fluctuate and so please contact a team member to confirm time of meeting.)

403423.name: Baking Club at Virginia Tech
403423.summary: We are all about baking, bonding, and enjoying awesome desserts together! Whether you're a pro or just starting out, we encourage bakers of all levels to join our club. We host bake sales, baking competitions, baking parties, and more!
403423.description_html: The Baking Club at Virginia Tech is a student-led organization that brings together people who share an interest in baking. We organize and hold various events that allow members to learn, create, and connect through confections!

420436.name: Balkan Student Association at Virginia Tech
420436.summary: The Balkan Student Association at Virginia Tech promotes Balkan culture. You do not have to be Balkan to join. We host social events, give back to the community, and do all sorts of fun activities. The most important aspect is a respectful environment.
420436.description_html: We, the members of the Balkan Student Association, to the best of our ability, will include all Balkan & European students at Virginia Tech to foster an environment of community & commonality. Under one goal, the cohort will promote mutual respect & achieve collective responsibility. No duty shall go unfulfilled, nor any voice unheard; for through consistency and dedication, we shall build a lasting environment of support and pride.

65792.name: Ballet Project at Virginia Tech
65792.summary: The Ballet Project at Virginia Tech is the university’s only student-run ballet company. Our mission is to provide a fun and educational environment in which classical ballet can be explored, practiced and performed, along with other forms of dance.
65792.description_html:
The Ballet Project at Virginia Tech is the university’s only student-run ballet company. Our mission is to provide a fun and educational environment in which classical ballet can be explored, practiced and performed.

We provide performance opportunities with our Performance Company. Auditions are required for incorporation in this Company. Choreography and performances give us the opportunity to explore ballet and its relevance and appeal to modern society. By taking on the name, the "Ballet Project", we are not confined to the boundaries of strict, classical ballet.

We also hold classes that are open and free of charge, taught by members of the Performance Company. These classes are focused on ballet technique and pointe. We welcome dancers of all experience levels.

69014.name: Ballroom Dance at Virginia Tech
69014.summary: A student organization dedicated to providing affordable ballroom dance lessons to the community. All are welcome, no partner or experience necessary; beginner lessons start from scratch.
69014.description_html:
We're a social ballroom dance club for the casual dancer! No partner or experience necessary. 

All beginner lessons start with the basics, so even if you don't know how to dance, you are still welcome!

You are not required to be a student to join, all ages and experience welcome!

Dues are $40 for a semester, or $70 for the year. If paying dues is a hardship for you, please email bdatvt@gmail.com or talk to us in person at a lesson. We want everyone to be able to participate!

 

Most Thursdays, we will have a beginner lesson at 8:00pm and a social dance from 9-9:30pm in McComas Hall, Studio A or B.

We teach:

 - Waltz

 - Cha Cha

 - Tango

 - Foxtrot

 - Rumba

-  Swing

 - Hustle

 - And More!

 

**For those interested, we have a competition team. No experience necessary. Talk to any of the officers about joining or email bdatvt@gmail.com.**

There is a Newcomer level where you can compete against other dancers who are also just starting out.

 

For additional information or questions reach out to bdatvt@gmail.com

65700.name: Bamboom Dance Crew
65700.summary: Bamboom is a student run organization that is primarily a competitive dance group. We are a group of individuals who all share a passion for dance and strive to share that with the community.
65700.description_html: Established in February 2008, Bamboom Dance Crew is a student run organization here at Virginia Tech. Bamboom is made up of talented members who embrace their passion of dance and strive to share that with the community. Our styles range from classic hip-hop to modern contemporary, and everywhere in between. More than just a student organization, we are a family who aims to entertain the Virginia Tech community and inspire others to dance.

67880.name: Baptist Collegiate Ministries
67880.summary: Baptist Collegiate Ministries at Virginia Tech is a student organization that exists to equip students to be after God's heart, in community, and on mission. We do that through opportunities like Bible studies, student-led worship, service projects, etc.
67880.description_html: Baptist Collegiate Ministries at Virginia Tech is a student organization that exists to equip students to be after God's heart, in community, and on mission. We do that through opportunities like Bible studies, conferences, student-led worship, service projects, and mission trips.  We seek to connect students with local churches and see them become leaders in the community. The BCM made up of both undergraduates and graduates and is for more than just Baptist students, but it is sponsored by the Baptist General Association of Virginia.

420437.name: Barbie Club
420437.summary: Focuses on the Barbie Cinematic Universe (BCU) and the following movies, shows, and culture surrounding Barbie. Most meetings will involve watching Barbie movies, having food days, and discussing her impact and possible theories on Barbie.

183080.name: Beekeepers at Virginia Tech
183080.summary: An organization to promote apiculture in our community and school. We work to facilitate the involvement of our members in the art of keeping bees through group outings, educational lessons, and community outreach.
183080.description_html: We are a club that focuses on the art of keeping bees, exploring all aspects from hive management to honey production. We aim to grow our knowledge of bees and reach our community with the importance of apiculture. Through education and communication, we want to encourage everyone to have a part in keeping bees and cultivate the perfect hive of people!

414610.name: Believe in Art Club
414610.summary: This club will provide both a venue to delve into creative outlets and service opportunities through community outreach through the arts, such as projects with patients at Carilion Clinic.
414610.description_html: The idea behind the club revolves around art in medicine. Our goal is to build upon VTC's value domains by focusing on interprofessional development (working with community partners, art therapists, etc.), further sharpening clinical skills of observation and awareness through art, and utilizing art as learning activities for basic science concepts.

70346.name: Bengali Students' Association
70346.summary: A student-led organization which celebrates the cultural heritage of West Bengal, a small province in eastern India.
70346.description_html: Officially founded in 2007, the main purpose of the organization was and still remains to make the incoming international students from the province of West Bengal, India feel welcome and get comfortable in a new land. Many of the graduate students spend close to 5 years in VT essentially making it a home away from their homes. We celebrate two major festivals of the Bengalis, Durga puja in the Fall and Saraswati puja in the Spring. Over the years, these events have crossed regional boundaries and have attracted students from all around the world. We sometimes collaborate with Association for Bangladeshi Students' (ABS) and Indian Student Organization (ISA) in certain events.

357171.name: Beta Upsilon Chi Fraternity
357171.description_html: Beta Upsilon Chi (BYX), or Brothers Under Christ Fraternity, is a lifelong brotherhood of committed Christian men seeking the bonds of brotherhood and unity in Christ through the avenue of a social fraternity on a college campus.

116461.name: Bevlee Watford Society
116461.summary: The goal of the Bevlee Watford Society for diversity in mining is to promote diversity and inclusion through professional development in the mining industry and educational outreach to prospective students and the surrounding community.
116461.description_html: As a student-led organization, we aim to make the mining community a warm and welcoming environment for all individuals by promoting diversity in both the department and the mining industry through outreach and collaboration between the many mining student groups and organizations.

67281.name: Bhangra at Virginia Tech
67281.summary: Bhangra at Virginia Tech is a competitive, cultural dance team. Bhangra is a dance that originated in the state of Punjab, India. For over eighteen years, Bhangra @ VT has competed across the country while representing the Hokie pride and spirit.
67281.description_html: Bhangra at Virginia Tech is a competitive, cultural dance team. Bhangra is a dance that originated in the state of Punjab, India. For over eighteen years, Bhangra @ VT has competed across the country while representing the Hokie pride and spirit. We compete at various competitions throughout the country and perform at various school events, including Gobblerfest, Blacksburg Ki Badmaashi, and cultural shows. Please visit our Instagram for our most recent updates at all times.

362492.name: Bikesburg Transit Advocacy Group
362492.summary: Advocating for sustainable transportation on and around campus
362492.description_html: We are a group focused on increasing and improving sustainable transportation on and around campus, whether through bike and pedestrian transportation or public transportation.

408571.name: Bioinformatics at Virginia Tech
408571.summary: Bioinformatics at Virginia Tech aims to create a collaborative and inclusive environment for students interested in computational biology and bioinformatics.
408571.description_html: Bioinformatics at Virginia Tech as whole exists to help connect current students working in the areas of computational biology and bioinformatics as well as inform future students about the opportunities available to them in this research area. We hope to make the inertia of entering this domain much smaller as well as to clear up any doubts.

356378.name: Biological Sciences Student Ambassadors
356378.summary: Undergraduate Ambassadors for the Department of Biological Sciences.
356378.description_html: We are a diverse community of undergraduate students involved in building community, increasing programming, promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion, and improving communication in the department of Biological Sciences. We are a resource for departmental events such as recruitments, and seek to be an official undergraduate voice at the departmental level.

63459.name: Biological Systems Engineering Graduate Student Organization
63459.summary: Act as a responsible voice and facilitate communication between the graduate students and BSE faculty.
63459.description_html: The BSE Graduate Student Organization represents all graduate students in the department to the department administration and enhances the graduate academic experience through social and volunteer events.

151276.name: Biomedical & Veterinary Sciences GSA
151276.summary: We are the students and residents of the VMCVM BMVS graduate program seeking to promote academic, professional, socio-cultural, and service opportunities, as well as unity among graduate students and residents in the BMVS program.
151276.description_html: As graduate students of the Virginia-Maryland College of Veterinary Medicine's Research Graduate Studies, we comprise a Registered Student Organization working to represent the interests of BMVS graduate students in university activities and facilitate the exchange of information between the graduate students and the program, CVM, and/or the university through Virginia Tech's main campus GSA (GPSS). We are composed of BMVS doctoral, dual-degree, veterinary residents, and masters students.

82040.name: Biomedical Engineering Society
82040.summary: Our mission is to encourage the development, dissemination, integration, and utilization of knowledge in biomedical engineering, as well as to enhance interaction within the scientific community.
82040.description_html: The Biomedical Engineering Society (BMES) club is a joint BMES chapter for graduate students that was founded to help bridge the gap between the two campuses, Virginia Tech and Wake Forest University, and foster communication and collaboration among various research groups. Our mission is to encourage the development, dissemination, integration, and utilization of knowledge in biomedical engineering, as well as to enhance interaction within the scientific community. Our chapter offers unique ways for students to become involved in outreach projects, research collaborations, and social events with other biomedical engineering students, faculty, staff, and industry. We are involved in many service and outreach projects within the local community, and we participate annually at the BMES National Meeting.

408572.name: Biomedical Research Club at Virginia Tech
408572.summary: Our goal is to create a collaborative community that fosters knowledge sharing, offers strong peer support, and provides valuable resources for students pursuing research in this field
408572.description_html: We aim to connect students with an interest in research to those who have completed research and are advancing to graduate programs (PhD, medical school, etc.). Additionally, we seek to support academic and professional growth by assisting with the development of research presentations, including posters, oral presentations, and other formats.

69231.name: Black Graduate Student Organization
69231.summary: The Black Graduate Student Organization (BGSO) is dedicated to the procurement and facilitation of resources and activities for the social and academic development of graduate students of African descent at Virginia Tech.
69231.description_html:
Welcome to the Black Graduate Student Organization (BGSO) Web site!

BGSO at Virginia Tech was founded to promote a greater  sense of community among graduate students of African descent. Our mission  includes providing support networks, encouraging research and scholarship, along with  promoting exposure to information technologies. Our aim is to promote  cultural, educational, and professional development in the lives of the Black graduate students at Virginia Tech. 

PLEASE fill out one of the applications below.

Apply for General Body Membership Today!

Apply for Executive Board (until September 2025)

421289.name: Black Muslim Collective at Virginia Tech
421289.summary: The Black Mulsim Collective is dedicated to building a network for black muslims throughout campus to foster community, friendships, and strengthen faith.
421289.description_html: The purpose of the Black Muslim Collective is to unify black muslim students throughout campus and offer an inclusive space where students feel free to be their authentic self. The club aims to foster a sense of belonging while also serving as an educational platform for the broader student body to learn about the unique cultural and religious significance of black muslims within Islam.We offer an open space for all students from backgrounds to have opportunities for cultural exchange, unity, and discussion.

61043.name: Black Organizations Council
61043.summary: The Black Organizations Council (BOC) is the umbrella organization for the predominately African American organizations at Virginia Tech. The council serves as a liaison between the university administration, constituent organizations and the community.
61043.description_html: Founded on the Virginia Tech campus in 1985, the Black Organizations Council (BOC) is the umbrella and resource body for the Black student organizations.  BOC serves to ensure the betterment of the Black community through providing a unified voice for the Black community in a university population where the Black community lacks adequate representation. BOC also serves as a liaison between the administration, university organizations, and the Black community, provides a forum for the exchange of ideas and dissemination of information, promotes the Black organizations individually and collectively, coordinates events which require the participation of all entities of the Black community and supports the development of campus camaraderie within the university community. BOC has a mission of being the governing, representing, and coordinating body for the primarily African American student organizations.  We will also provide activism and advocacy, while meeting the challenge of the social and political forces affecting the Black community. We encourage each representative organization to empower themselves to create a paradigm in the area of leadership and service in the community.

61044.name: Black Student Alliance
61044.summary: The Black Student Alliance (BSA) hosts social and educational events aimed at promoting a better understanding of black culture. These events include poets, speakers, concerts, comedians, and holiday celebrations.
61044.description_html:
The purpose of the Black Student Alliance at Virginia Tech is to promote a greater understanding of black culture among students, employees, and community members at Virginia Tech. This will occur through the presentation
of diverse programs that showcase the educational and artistic contributions of African Americans.

294030.name: Black Students in STEM
294030.summary: The mission of Black Students in STEM is to provide students of African descent within VT's College of Science with beneficial academic, professional, and entertaining, opportunities, resources, and activities.
294030.description_html: The mission of Black Students in STEM is to provide students of African descent within Virginia Tech’s College of Science with academic, professional, and entertaining, opportunities, resources, and activities that will be beneficial within both their undergraduate and postgraduate career. Black Students in STEM strives to create a safe space for club members that will foster a sense of community and togetherness as well as achieve significant personal and professional development.

168649.name: Blacksburg Blades
168649.summary: Blacksburg Blades is an organization dedicated to studying and practicing HEMA, or Historical European Martial Arts and other Historical Martial Art forms. We study Longsword, Saber, and other weapons systems. All are welcome, no experience needed!
168649.description_html: The Blacksburg Blades is an organization dedicated to studying and practicing HEMA, or Historical European Martial Arts as well as other Historical Martial Art forms. We study a diverse number of weapon systems, such as German Longsword, Hungarian Saber, sword and shield, and axe-fighting to name a few. While Western Europe is main region of focus, there is growing interest in systems from other regions of the world including Eastern Europe, North Africa, and China. Absolutely no experience is necessary, all are welcome! Whether you are brand new to HEMA or fencing, experienced, or just love history, you will find a like minded group here.

400643.name: Blacksburg Christian Fellowship College Ministry
400643.summary: We seek to be a fellowship of ministers growing in the Lord Jesus Christ, sharing God’s Love and the joy of knowing Him with the world. As part of our mission we seek to build community and to grow in our faith in Jesus Christ.

220266.name: Blacksburg Ki Badmaashi
220266.summary: Blacksburg Ki Badmaashi (BKB) is an intercollegiate dance competition in the Blacksburg, VA area that focuses on Fusion and Raas.
220266.description_html: Blacksburg Ki Badmaashi (BKB) is a dance competition in the Blacksburg, Virginia area featuring Raas and Fusion teams from all across the country. 16 teams, 8 of each genre, will compete to win top three placings for each genre. Our main goal is to spread the joy of dance through some friendly competition! Additionally, we are a non-profit organization that donates all proceeds to Pratham, an organization that works to ensure impoverished children in India receive an education.

362529.name: Blacksburg Partners
362529.summary: Blacksburg Partners provides Virginia Tech students the opportunity to better position themselves for careers in Investment Banking, Private Equity, and Hedge Funds.
362529.description_html: The Investment Banking Group (IBG) is designed to provide students from Virginia Tech the opportunity to better position themselves for a career in Investment Banking, Private Equity, and Hedge Funds. The group helps members develop themselves with regard to networking, professional development, recruitment preparation, and much more. Among recruitment preparation topics, financial modeling and valuation methodology training are some of the focal points for IBG.

420438.name: BLOCK
420438.summary: BLOCK is a student-led digital asset reserve and trading organization centered around education and professional development.
420438.description_html: BLOCK will allocate a large portion of its funds to a long-term cryptocurrency reserve, while dedicating a smaller portion to an active trading organization where students can gain hands-on experience in the crypto markets. We will also provide educational opportunities and invite guest speakers to teach about cryptocurrency in the professional space, while helping students build connections with alumni in the industry.

70349.name: Block and Bridle Club at Virginia Tech
70349.summary: Block and Bridle Club is an inclusive service organization that strives to promote a better understanding of animal agriculture and brings together those with an interest of Animal Science* as a career. *We take all majors!
70349.description_html:
Objectives:

First - To promote a higher scholastic standard and a more complete understanding of the field of Animal Sciences among student members.

Second - To promote Animal Sciences through the development of a program of activities, especially all phases of student Animal Science work in colleges and Universities.

Third - To bring about a closer relationship among all students pursuing some phase of the Animal Sciences as a profession. 

(IF INTERESTED, EMAIL ONE OF PRIMARY CONTACTS)

420439.name: Bluegrass at Virginia Tech
420439.summary: Bluegrass Club is a laid-back group for anyone who loves picking, singing, or just listening to bluegrass music. All instruments, skill levels, and styles are welcome. Whether you’re a beginner learning your first tune or a seasoned picker, come jam!
420439.description_html: Bluegrass Club brings together students who love bluegrass, old-time, and acoustic music. We meet to play tunes, share songs, and build a community of musicians in a fun, low-pressure environment. No experience required. Just bring your instrument and play!

171899.name: Board Game Club at Virginia Tech
171899.summary: We play some hype board games every Friday at 6pm in New Classroom Building.
171899.description_html:
We are a strong and welcoming community that gets together weekly to play some hype board games and card games. We play all types of board games ranging from lighter social games (Coup, The Resistance) to heavy strategy (Terra Mystica, Terraforming Mars), with everything in between (Catan, Betrayal at House on the Hill). Feel free to bring your own games to play or play someone else's!  There's always people ready to play games. Anyone is welcome to join!

 

Join our discord to get involved and talk to us online!

 

We usually meet every Friday at 6 pm in New Classroom Building! Check our Discord for the official location. Hope to see you there!

327217.name: Bob Ross Club at Virginia Tech
327217.summary: As the lovable Bob Ross says, "Everyone needs a friend". Come make new friends and paint along with Bob Ross with episodes from his show "The Joy of Painting"! Everyone is welcome and you don't need to be at a Bob Ross level of painting to join the fun!
327217.description_html:
Bob Ross Club is dedicated to opening a platform for all Virginia Tech students to come together under the shared love of Bob Ross to create beautiful paintings. Paint Night Event admission fees will be used for donations to a multitude of charities such as the Alzheimer's Association and Lymphoma Research Foundation as well as club materials. No painting experience is required to be a part of our club!

Bob Ross Club hosts Painting Nights where we paint along with an episode of Bob Ross' show "The Joy of Painting"! Registration is required for Painting Nights and admission costs are $5 and cover paint, brushes, and a canvas to create your artwork. We also host virtual events like Quiplash and Trivia Nights! Event information and registration for Paint Nights are primarily sent via email so please check out the Google Sheets link below to join our email list! Event info can also be found on our Instagram @bobrossclubatvt as well as GobblerConnect

If you have any questions please email bobrossclubvt@gmail.com.

 

If you would like to be apart of our email list, fill out this form!

https://forms.gle/Aw1QVm6FhnsMSn9N8

362531.name: Bodybuilding Club at Virginia Tech
362531.summary: The Bodybuilding Club at Virginia Tech is for individuals serious about fitness and looking to further themselves in their area of interest. It is a great way for individuals to connect, collect and share information in and around the fitness community.
362531.description_html: This club was started with the intention of creating a community for people with a passion for health and fitness, in particular moving a lot of weight around. The focus of this club is centered around bodybuilding but, it is not exclusive. We welcome individuals focused on other disciplines such as powerlifting, power building, and performance training. No amount of experience is needed and all experience levels are welcome. The primary goals of this club are to share knowledge and experience. There will be informational meetings on topics of nutrition, lifting techniques, and several aspects of the sport of bodybuilding. If you have joined and do not have Instagram please join our Groupme to stay up to date on club activities. https://groupme.com/join_group/90176044/IZMm9FWs

73943.name: BOLT
73943.summary: BOLT is an engineering design team dedicated to maintaining Virginia Tech's history of innovation by building an all-electric racing motorcycle.
73943.description_html:
PLEASE NOTE: To apply to the team, please do not use GobblerConnect. Apply here instead.

 

BOLT is an engineering design team located in the Ware Lab that designs, builds, and races an all-electric, performance motorcycle. We strive to prove not only that electric motorcycles are capable of high performance, but that someday they will exceed that of combustion motorcycles. BOLT is primarily comprised of mechanical, electrical, and computer engineering majors, however, all applicants with relevant skills and interests are considered. Join us as we help guide the way into the future of electric motorcycle racing.

For more information or recruitment details, please visit our website at https://www.vtbolt.com/.

Note: We annually recruit during the fall, starting with CEED O-Show and ending after the Engineering Expo. The best way for you to get on our recruitment email list is to stop by our booth at GobblerFest. Additionally, we do not accept seniors, as we require members to have at least one year of experience on the team before being on senior design.

414613.name: Bradley Free Clinic
414613.summary: VTCSOM medical students partner with the Bradley Free Clinic to organize and run weekly evening clinics that provide free health care to low-income, under-insured, and non-insured individuals. Students gain experience seeing patients as part of a clinica
414613.description_html: BFC in partnership with the medical students at VTCSOM strives to increase access to health services and provide equitable, compassionate, and comprehensive health care to vulnerable communities within Roanoke.

172181.name: Bradley Study Center
172181.summary: The Bradley Study Center serves Virginia Tech students, faculty/staff, and the larger community – by exploring the intersection of faith, learning, and calling within the life of the university.
172181.description_html:
The Bradley Study Center exists to cultivate a thoughtful exploration of the Christian faith at Virginia Tech.  Focusing on students, faculty, administrators and alumni, the Center seeks to explore how faith, learning, and calling relate to one another in advancing the common good for all.  Believing that the Christian intellectual tradition can contribute a vibrant voice to the academic life of a public university, the Bradley Study Center offers opportunities to:

  • engage students and faculty in the rich intellectual traditions of the Christian faith – connecting it meaningfully to their studies, work and lives;
  • encourage and support Christian faculty and students in their academic pursuits and their current and future vocations; and
  • promote the pursuit of knowledge and truth on the important questions of life in an environment of open and civil academic dialogue.

369947.name: Brain Bee at Virginia Tech
369947.summary: Our organization aims to motivate local high school students to learn about the brain and inspire them to pursue careers in neuroscience.
369947.description_html: Brain Bee at Virginia Tech strives to expose students in the community to neuroscience through educational events, with our priority being the local quiz bowl competition. We hope to build a bridge between high school and college to provide prospective students with the opportunities to form interests in studies and careers in neuroscience.

116112.name: Breakdance (Bboy/Bgirl) Club
116112.summary: We are the Flowmigos aka the Breakdance Club at Virginia Tech, a dance organization for all bboys and bgirls. We hope to spread hip-hop culture and help people find community and family through our club!
116112.description_html:
We are the Flowmigos aka the Breakdance Club at Virginia Tech, a dance organization for all bboys and bgirls. Regardless of experience, if you have any interest at all come out and learn/dance with us! We hope to spread hip-hop culture and help people find community and family through our club!

Official Meeting Schedule

M, W, Th @6:30-8:30 in the *McBryde 100 Lobby, accessible from outside.

Location weather dependent, we like to be outside when it's nice out!

Join our groupme for additional updates on practices and events!
http://tinyurl.com/vtbreak

https://gobblerconnect.vt.edu/organization/VTBreakdanceClub

https://groupme.com/join_group/20083075/38FqZv

62509.name: Breakzone Recreation Center
62509.summary: Breakzone is Virginia Tech’s home of billiards, bowling, table tennis, gaming and tournaments.
62509.description_html:
We provide various tournaments and other events where students have the opportunity to have some fun and maybe win a prize!! 

Join us on GobblerConnect and Follow us on Instagram @VTBreakzone to keep up to date on our events!

You can find more information about Breakzone on our website at https://campuslife.vt.edu/student_centers/Squires/BreakZone.html 

Breakzone Hours posted at https://saapps.students.vt.edu/schours/

420440.name: BridgeUSA at Virginia Tech
420440.summary: BridgeUSA is a nonpartisan organization that hosts moderated discussions around current political events. We have the objective of encouraging students to engage in differing beliefs, experiences, and perspectives. What unites us is a shared mindset.

161222.name: Building Goodness Foundation at Virginia Tech
161222.summary: A group committed to helping the local and international community by designing, building, and funding construction-based projects for those in need.
161222.description_html:
We are a non-profit construction service organization, specializing in small-scale community-based projects. Our primary markets are assisting other non-profit organizations by providing construction-based support as well as undertaking small projects of our own. We pair industry professionals with passionate volunteers to provide struggling non-profits with a new or renovated space. 

If you would like to learn more, please email jessicas05@vt.edu.

413613.name: Building Impactful Tech with Students at Virginia Tech
413613.summary: BITS@VT gives students the chance to build meaningful, real-world tech projects—like course planning tools and AI study assistants—while growing their skills, leading teams, and making a real impact on the Virginia Tech community.
413613.description_html:
BITS (Building Impactful Tech with Students at Virginia Tech) is a student-run organization that gives Virginia Tech students hands-on experience building real software from the ground up. In our organization, CS-oriented students to work can work on, manage, and lead full-stack projects that directly benefit the VT community.

At BITS, members can join existing projects or pitch and lead their own, gaining real technical skills and project management experience. Our primary focus is engineering and execution, but we also support career development through events and mentorship from students with offers at major tech companies (Google, LinkedIn, Apple).

Visit our linktree for membership forms and our socials. The best way to get involved is through our discord!

117605.name: Building Women in Construction
117605.summary: Building Women in Construction is an organization provided to help women build successful careers and make meaningful connections in the construction industry.
117605.description_html:
Building Women in Construction was founded in 2014 by five women in the Myers-Lawson School of Construction. The organization's purpose is to provide women within the construction industry with additional support and resources to succeed in the construction industry. The purpose of BWIC is not only to unite women in the industry, but also men. BWIC aims to offer young women the chance to network within the university, community, and industry. 

 

Please check out our 2020 recruitment video!
https://www.youtu.be/gO_OMA6tkQ0

69298.name: Burkhart Mining Society
69298.summary: Burkhart Mining Society is the Virginia Tech student chapter of the Society for Mining, Metallurgy, and Exploration (SME).
69298.description_html: Burkhart is the student chapter at Virginia Tech for the national organization of Society Mining, Metallurgy, and Exploration. We provide an opportunity for our members to learn more about the Mining industry as well as connect with professionals and alumni. Most of the members are Mining Engineers, but anyone is welcome to join!

67268.name: Business Horizons
67268.summary: Business Horizons sponsors the Business Horizons Career Fair that is held each Fall and Spring. The team is comprised of Executive Leaders and four Committees: Corporate Correspondence, Hospitality, Treasury, and Marketing.
67268.description_html: The student-run planning committee that puts on the Pamplin College of Business Career Fair. Great experience for business students looking to network and gain knowledge about the fair!

62957.name: Business Leadership Center
62957.summary: The Business Leadership Center provides the leadership education necessary for students to excel and prosper in the workplace of the twenty-first century.
62957.description_html: Through the center, leaders and future leaders gain access to the concepts, practices, skills and values necessary for this critical component of their work. The center fosters leadership development through intellectual stimulation in the classroom, interaction with successful business leaders and scholars and participation in leadership roles throughout the Virginia Tech community and beyond.

305220.name: Camp Kesem at Virginia Tech
305220.summary: Camp Kesem is a nationwide community, driven by passionate college student leaders, that supports children through and beyond their parent's cancer by providing innovative, fun-filled programs that foster a lasting community.
305220.description_html:
What We Do

Kesem is a nationwide community, driven by passionate college student leaders, that supports children through and beyond their parent’s cancer. Kesem is the largest national organization dedicated to supporting children impacted by a parent’s cancer, at no cost to families. Our innovative and fun-filled programs provide children with peers who understand their unique needs, and create long-lasting impact.

 

How We Do It

The true power of Kesem comes from empowering passionate college student volunteers to become leaders in their own local communities. We are proud to continually invest in training, support, and leadership development opportunities for our student leaders, as they prepare to provide life-changing experiences for our families nationwide.

 

Kesem's flagship program, Camp Kesem, operates free summer camps for children who have been impacted by a parent's cancer. Camp Kesem boasts over 100 chapters across the country - all run by highly motivated college student leaders who work together during their school year to organize all aspects of their local camps - which are held at fantastic, fun sleep-away campsites.

 

Students volunteer year-round to contribute in areas of community outreach, campus recruitment + promotion, marketing, and fundraising. Beyond that, we also support camper families by providing year-round programming in the Blacksburg community, such as sending care packages and birthday cards to campers and hosting Friends + Family Days!

420441.name: Campus Hugs at Virginia Tech
420441.summary: Campus Hugs at Virginia Tech brings a piece of home to campus by connecting students with local parents who offer hugs, snacks, and support throughout the semester.
420441.description_html: Campus Hugs at Virginia Tech is a student-run organization dedicated to bringing a piece of home to campus. Our mission is to support students by connecting them to the Blacksburg community. We invite local parents to campus to offer hugs, encouragement, and snacks to students as they head to class or take study breaks. Our student members serve as the bridge between volunteers and the university by coordinating events and ensuring every student feels supported and seen.

63146.name: Campus Scouts at Virginia Tech
63146.summary: The Campus Scouts is an organization that provides opportunities to be involved in Scouting and leadership development by hosting events for local Boy and Girl Scout communities.
63146.description_html:
The Campus Scouts at Virginia Tech is an organization that provides opportunities for college students to be involved in Scouting and leadership development by hosting events for the local Scouting America and Girl Scout communities and by providing opportunities for socialization and fellowship through events like hiking and camping.

 

You do not have to be a former Scout to be a member of the Campus Scouts at Virginia Tech.

 

The Campus Scouts meet weekly on Tuesdays at 7:00 PM in Robeson Hall, Room 116.  We hope to see you there!

221269.name: CanSat at Virginia Tech
221269.summary: CanSat is a competitive design team that focuses on designing, manufacturing, and testing small-scale satellites. We participate in an annual international design-build-launch competition sponsored by industry leaders to launch a programmable payload.
221269.description_html: Based in the Aerospace Engineering Design Lab, CanSat @ Virginia Tech is a competitive design team that focuses on designing, manufacturing, and testing small-scale satellites. Our core objective is to ignite passion for aerospace themes while bringing students invaluable practical exposure to the engineering design process. We participate in an annual international design-build-launch competition, backed by influential industry figures including the US Naval Research Laboratory, NASA, and Lockheed Martin. While the competition's specific goals vary, they consistently center around crafting a programmable payload for release from a rocket that can accurately transmit flight data to a ground station.

417617.name: Capital Area Student Planning Association
417617.summary: Capital Area Student Planning Association, in the Washington D.C. area for Urban and Regional Planning graduate students.
417617.description_html: Capital Area Student Planning Association, in the Washington D.C. area for Urban and Regional Planning graduate students

69163.name: Car Club at Virginia Tech
69163.summary: An organization for all people with a common love for cars. Events range from weekly social meets, autoX events, cruises, road trips to shows. Our mission is to provide a safe, legal, inclusive and fun environment for all types of automotive enthusiasts!
69163.description_html:
Car Club at Virginia Tech is a student-run organization for car enthusiasts of all types. From people who are new and want to get involved to people who have been in the automotive scene before, we provide an excellent knowledge base, social scene, and gateway into the automotive and racing world. The club has a vibrant community of enthusiasts with domestic, German, JDM, and more, you're bound to find people as passionate as you. We host automotive events, car shows, and participate in autocross races regularly. We hold weekly meets and regular gatherings. If you are interested in learning how to work on cars, this is also the place for you! You can learn without judgment and have help from others. Anyone with a general interest in cars/trucks is welcome! Car club at Virginia Tech welcomes you to join.

Meets are Thursdays at 7:00pm

Be respectful to the places that allow us to meet, no excessive noise, burnouts, dangerous driving, etc., please and thank you.

Check out our Instagram page carclub_vt for photos and info about our meets

70188.name: Career and Professional Development
70188.summary: Career Services welcomes and serves all students in all majors at Virginia Tech, freshmen through graduate level.
70188.description_html:
The overall mission of Career and Professional Development is to help students EXPLORE and choose academic majors and career options, obtain and reflect upon career-related and other EXPERIENCES, DEVELOP professional presence and essential skills, and LAUNCH post-graduation career plans, including graduate/professional school and employment.

You can schedule an appointment with a career advisor, or you can stop by Monday - Friday between 11 a.m. and 3 p.m. to speak with an advisor. We have a Career Resource Center where you can research careers and also find helpful information on how to conduct a job search.

If you're seeking a job on campus, a co-op or internship, or full-time employment, check out Handshake vt.joinhandshake.com, our career management platform. This system also gives you access to upcoming career events and employer information sessions. We have other job search resources: CareerShift, GoinGlobal, and LinkedIn.

Once you have a job interview, we can help you prepare for the interview. You can practice online with InterviewStream, and you can come in for a practice face-to-face interview with career advisors.

70665.name: Caribbean Student Organization
70665.summary: CaribSO is a student-run organization that aims to share the varied and unique cultures of the Caribbean with the Virginia Tech Community, and facilitate the gathering of Caribbean people attending the university.
70665.description_html: The Caribbean Student Organization at Virginia Tech was founded to ensure a space of learning about Caribbean culture for all members of community. We are a group of students committed to nourishing cultural, intellectual, political, and economic awareness about the Caribbean continent and its connection to Virginia Tech’s community. We value people from different backgrounds who hold different ideas about life and we celebrate the increasing diversity of our campus and our world. We also organize various cultural, educational, and social events to enrich the VT community and foster collaboration amongst Caribbean students and those interested in learning more about the Caribbean. Finally, we aim to encourage awareness of the Caribbean within our community and in the Blacksburg area, ultimately contributing back to our culture.

413614.name: Cascade Markets Group
413614.summary: Cascade Markets Group is a student-led organization at Virginia Tech for students passionate about markets, focused on building investment acumen through research, discussion, and career preparation in markets-facing roles.
413614.description_html:
Cascade Markets Group is a student-led organization at Virginia Tech for students who are passionate about the financial markets and deeply motivated to develop their investment knowledge and market intuition. Our members are intellectually curious, thrive in fast-paced environments, and are eager to learn, improve, and challenge themselves through research, analysis, and debate.

 

The primary mission of CMG is to build strong market knowledge and investment acumen through rigorous exploration of financial markets. We do this by engaging in macro and microeconomic research, tracking global market developments, debating ideas, and fostering a culture of continuous learning.

 

While many of our members pursue roles in asset management, wealth management, sales & trading, investment research, and capital markets, our core identity is centered around one thing: a relentless interest in how markets move and why.

 

Our Focus Areas: Market Education: In-depth exploration of macroeconomic indicators, yield curves, credit spreads, equity indexes, and asset class fundamentals.

 

Investment Research: Thesis development, valuation work, modeling basics, and investment pitches grounded in real-world data.

 

Market Awareness: Weekly updates and structured discussions of current market events and cross-asset themes.

 

Career Preparation: Recruiting preparation for S&T, investment research, asset and wealth management, and capital markets roles.

 

Apply through this link! https://forms.office.com/r/FQVNBjsibT

Applications are due September 28th, at 11:59 PM.

135568.name: Cassell Guard
135568.summary: Cassell Guard is the official student section for the Virginia Tech Men's and Women's Basketball teams. Cassell Guard enhances our teams' home-court advantage at Cassell Coliseum and is now regarded as one of the best student sections in the nation.
135568.description_html:
Cassell Guard, the student section in Cassell Coliseum, has two components: General Membership and the Executive Board. Every student who sits in the student section on game days is considered to be an important member of Cassell Guard.
