The Executive Board consists of die-hard Virginia Tech Basketball fans that are hand-selected each year through an application process (around March/April, following the basketball season). Our team works alongside VT Athletics to help organize giveaways for students, run the social media accounts, plan events to boost fan interaction, and play a part in recruit visits. We are at every men's and women's basketball game.

We love to hear new ideas from our fellow students to improve the student section experience and environment. Both components of Cassell Guard play integral roles in creating a more unified and inclusive cheering section for Virginia Tech Basketball. 

The Cassell Guard culture is like no other student section. If you are interested in getting involved, or have any questions relating to the Exec application process, please DM us on social media or send us an email cassellguard@hokies.vt.edu

63434.name: Catholic Campus Ministry at Virginia Tech
63434.summary: Newman is the Catholic Community at Virginia Tech, founded on Christ’s teachings and the Eucharist. We welcome all to grow in faith as we challenge each other to imitate God’s love.
63434.description_html:
Welcome to the Catholic Campus Ministry at Virginia Tech!

Our mission is to support, challenge, and inspire Hokies to grow in faith and live out their call to be true disciples of Christ on campus and in their daily lives. Founded on Christ’s teachings and the Eucharist, we prepare Catholic leaders for service to the Church and world through the pillars of faith, community, and service. Check out our website for a full list of resources and events!

 

FAITH

We celebrate Sunday Mass at 10am, 12pm, and 8pm weekly in War Memorial Chapel.

Daily Mass, Confession, and daily adoration are available at the Newman House. Check our website for the full schedule or contact us with the information below!

SERVICE

Through the Newman Outreach Project, we build relationships through service.

Each year, we send close to 100 students on alternative spring break trips. We also participate in the Big Event and Relay for Life!

COMMUNITY

Every week, we host a variety of events such as Sunday Suppers, bible studies, formation nights, and more to build a community rooted in faith. Check out our social media for updates on everything going on in the community!

The Catholic Campus Ministry at VT works with the Fellowship of Catholic University Students (FOCUS) to reach more students on campus. One of our favorite ways to do this is through Small Groups!

75727.name: Cedars of Lebanon
75727.summary: To spread and promote Lebanese culture to all those interested campus-wide and throughout the community.
75727.description_html: We meet once a month and aim to cultivate an environment of inclusivity so that Lebanese Hokies can have the opportunity to explore their heritage and connect with other Lebanese Hokies!

293521.name: Center for Business Intelligence & Analytics
293521.summary: The Center for Business Intelligence and Analytics (CBIA) is home to Virginia Tech's master's program in business analytics (known as the MSBA-BA).
293521.description_html: The Center for Business Intelligence and Analytics (CBIA) is home to Virginia Tech's master's program in business analytics (known as the MSBA-BA), producing next-generation, high-impact business analytics leaders. This one-year program is open to all.

404900.name: Center for Engineering Excellence and Discovery - Graduate Student Programs

404988.name: Center for Engineering Excellence and Discovery - Peer Mentoring

401689.name: Center for Engineering Excellence and Discovery - Undergraduate Student Programs

413615.name: Center for Human Computer Interaction Student Council at Virginia Tech
413615.summary: In alignment with the CHCI's mission, the CHCI Student Council was established to further enhance student engagement within the HCI community at Virginia Tech.
413615.description_html: The Center for Human-Computer Interaction (CHCI) at Virginia Tech is a university-wide research center dedicated to advancing the field of Human-Computer Interaction (HCI). HCI is a multidisciplinary domain that encompasses human sciences, computational sciences and engineering, information technologies, arts, and design. The CHCI focuses on all aspects of the interplay between people and interactive technologies, with applications spanning various domains. The center supports research excellence through funding programs and shared resources, contributes to the education and training of HCI professionals and scholars through participation in various degree and certificate programs, and fosters a strong community around HCI through forums for idea exchange. In alignment with the CHCI's mission, the CHCI Student Council was established to further enhance student engagement within the HCI community at Virginia Tech. The council aims to provide an inclusive and creative space for students to find common ground, network, and collaborate both academically and artistically. It fosters a strong community among students involved in CHCI by showcasing human-computer interaction design work and research, with a focus on providing unique social opportunities. The Student Council's mission is inspired by Virginia Tech's motto, *Ut Prosim* (That I May Serve), striving to build a stronger student-based community within CHCI and to promote student engagement in the ongoing interdisciplinary efforts by the HCI community at Virginia Tech. By organizing events such as the Student Research Symposium and weekly Hack-and-Yak sessions, the CHCI Student Council provides ongoing opportunities for students to engage with peers and faculty across disciplines, fostering a collaborative environment that complements existing academic programs at Virginia Tech.

117754.name: Center for Instructional Development and Educational Research
117754.summary: CIDER fosters the design, development, implementation, and evaluation of disciplinary and interdisciplinary learner-centered instruction.
117754.description_html: The Center for Instructional Development and Educational Research (CIDER) fosters the design, development, implementation, and evaluation of disciplinary and interdisciplinary learner-centered instruction; promotes and recognizes excellence in higher education instruction; supports and conducts research on the scholarship of teaching and learning; and advocates for a campus climate that values educating the whole student through effective, innovative and transformative instruction.

408574.name: Center for Refugee, Migrant, Displacement Studies Student Org.
408574.summary: Our mission is to promote belonging and solidarity by uplifting individuals through language exchange programs, mentorship, and community events--advocating for equity and inclusivity on campus and beyond.
408574.description_html: Our mission is to promote belonging and solidarity by uplifting individuals through language exchange programs, mentorship, and community events--advocating for equity and inclusivity on campus and beyond. We work with other student clubs to host activities, fundraise money, and serve our community.  Through our social events, we bring people together to learn from each other, celebrate differences, and support each other.

224946.name: CHAARG at Virginia Tech
224946.summary: CHAARG [Changing Health, Attitudes, + Actions to Recreate Girls] is a women's health + fitness organization whose mission is to liberate girls from the elliptical + show them that fitness can ++ should be fun! : )
224946.description_html:
A CHAARG membership includes --
1] Weekly Workouts [1x/week] -- Weekly Workouts show you that fitness can be fun + different! Some workouts we have done in the past include aerial yoga, Zumba, boxing, weightlifting, HIIT, + dance! These workouts are exclusive to members of our Chapter! : )
2] Small Groups [1x/week] -- Every member can sign up for a Small Group each semester! Small Group Coordinators lead Small Groups, + Small Groups serve as an excellent way for members to have a closer relationship with a few members of our Chapter. In Small Groups, we work out, practice self-care activities + techniques, try new recipes, study together, ++ more!
3] Socials + Formals [1x/month] -- Various social events help members bond + strengthen their relationships with one another in ways different from exercising! In the past, we have done self-care socials, movie nights, picnics, Olympics events, + more! : )
4] FitPlan + Body Positive Programs -- CHAARG Nationals creates programs each season that members can purchase or win! For example, one of CHAARG's most popular programs is the CHAARG Run Club!
5] Community + family of over 10,000+ CHAARG members nationwide -- Chapters across the United States stay connected via social media pages [CHAARG Instagrams] + through challenges created by CHAARG Nationals!
6] CHAARG website -- CHAARG's website contains blogs, recipes, workouts, podcasts + more for you to explore + use on your mindfulness ++ fitness journey!

63157.name: Chabad at Virginia Tech
63157.summary: To create a home away from home for every Jewish student. Provide religious & social events including Shabbat dinner, Torah classes & additional services that enrich Jewish student life.
63157.description_html: Chabad at Virginia Tech’s purpose is to bring traditions in a fun and educational style to the students at Virginia Tech. Chabad provides religious & social events to help Jewish students connect with each other and with their Jewish roots.

356344.name: Chamber Music at Virginia Tech
356344.summary: Chamber Music at Virginia Tech is a student-led organization for those who want to play instruments in a small group setting.
356344.description_html:
At Chamber Music at Virginia Tech, we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to continue their passion for music, regardless of their major or academic commitments. We understand that traditional music courses and ensembles may not fit into every student’s schedule, so our organization provides a flexible and supportive space for musicians to collaborate and perform on their own terms.

 

Chamber Music at Virginia Tech is open to all Virginia Tech students with prior musical experience who want to connect with fellow musicians and explore their instrument in a self-directed setting.

 

Members can form small groups of 2-6 musicians or play solo, meeting on a weekly to biweekly basis to rehearse their chosen repertoire. Any genre of instrumental music is welcome! Each semester, we host a casual yet refined recital where members have the opportunity to showcase their music in a welcoming environment.

 

While we are not a teaching organization, we encourage musicians of all backgrounds to join. If you’re unsure whether this club is the right fit for you, feel free to reach out—we’d love to chat!

 

Fall 2022 Recital Videos

72132.name: Chamber Singers at Virginia Tech
72132.summary: The Chambers Singers at Virginia Tech is the university's premiere mixed choral group. Chamber Singers performs a wide variety of music, ranging from Baroque classics to spirituals, pop, master works and more.
72132.description_html:
The Virginia Tech Choirs (Chamber Singers, Tech Men, and Women's Chorus) are open to all Virginia Tech students, whether undergraduate or graduate, of any major. Under the direction of Dr. Dwight Bigler, the choirs sing the finest choral repertoire from all time periods and genres.

Sign up for auditions in person at Dr. Bigler's office (242-J Squires Student Center, facing Alumni Mall) by the first day of each semester. Sign up sheets are posted on the wall by Dr. Bigler's office at least three days before each semester begins. Auditions occur throughout the first week of each semester.

103855.name: Chaoxic Dance Club
103855.summary: Chaoxic welcomes everyone who enjoys dances including Hip-hop, K-pop, jazz, Chinese-inspired choreography, and more. We hold weekly workshops and participate in cultural performances each semester.
103855.description_html: Chaoxic Dance Crew is a Chinese-led dance community that is open to everyone who enjoys practicing and performing dances including Hip-hop, K-pop, jazz, Chinese-inspired choreography, etc. We provide opportunities for dancers of all backgrounds and experience levels to move, learn, and connect through weekly workshops and rehearsals. We aim to promote the beauty of Chinese-styled dances and the appreciation for diverse dancing styles. Each semester, we participate in performances across campus celebrating Chinese, Asian, and international cultures.

158580.name: Chapter of the Student American Veterinary Medical Association
158580.summary: Our VMCVM SAVMA chapter exists to support, empower, and inspire all veterinary students in improving their lives, education, and career, along with securing a better future for our profession through collaboration with our parent organization, the AVMA.
158580.description_html: SAVMA serves as the main VMCVM organization, which oversees the other organizations and clubs within the college. Along with fostering multiple social and professional activities for students, SAVMA serves as a focus of student opinion and provides a formal liaison between the student body and the administration of the College. Our VMCVM SAVMA chapter exists to support, empower, and inspire all veterinary students in improving their lives, education, and career, along with securing a better future for our profession through collaboration with our parent organization, the AVMA.

168046.name: Chem-E-Car at Virginia Tech
168046.summary: Design, build, and tests a car that is controlled by chemical reactions with the goal of stopping as close to a set distance as possible. We compete in Regional and National AIChE competitions throughout the year.
168046.description_html:
Goals
We are tasked with building a shoebox-sized vehicle that is controlled by chemical reactions. The team applies fundamental chemical engineering principles, in addition to skills in programming and mechatronics, to control our vehicle. More competition specifics may be found at our website: 
 
Team website: http://chemecarvt.wixsite.com/vtcarteam
Main organization website: http://www.aiche.org/community/students/chem-e-car
 
Purpose
Team members apply problem-solving and engineering skills such as circuitry, programming, and soldering to plan long-term changes and tackle immediate issues. We aim to provide a framework of industry-relevant research and design experience to members, and many team members discuss these problem-solving and teamwork experiences in job interviews.  
 
Outcomes
The team participates in competitions at a regional and national level. The team won the International Competition in 2019 and placed in the top ten internationally in the prior two years. Additionally, we have won awards for the best video, poster, and safety in design.

347779.name: ChemE Cube at Virginia Tech
347779.summary: We are a team that designs, builds, and showcases a 1 cubic foot chemical plant to complete a chemistry challenge provided by AIChE every year. We use a variety of chemistry, controls, and mechanics to achieve our goal.
347779.description_html: Chem-E-Cube is a design team for chemical engineering students. It incorporates the full scope of an engineering project from conception to sale. This competition is designed to be very practical and develop skills that will be beneficial to anyone. The goal is to build a miniature plant that meets the design specifications set by AIChE each year.

352396.name: Chemistry Graduate Student Senate
352396.summary: The Chemistry Graduate Student Senate (C-GSS) serves the graduate student body of the Chemistry Department. Our goal is to represent the interests of chemistry graduate students in all university activities.
352396.description_html: The CGSS was created by 8 students with the aim of representing, promoting, and advocating for chemistry graduate student opinions and concerns to department faculty. We also want to bring a sense of community, equity, diversity, and inclusion to the student body by organizing different social events where students from all backgrounds can connect with each other.

73933.name: Chess Club at Virginia Tech
73933.summary: We are dedicated to providing a friendly environment for learning and playing chess at Virginia Tech. We meet every Sunday in Squires 219 and Wednesday in Squires Brush Mountain B (343).
73933.description_html:
The Chess Club at Virginia Tech is a Registered Student Organization at Virginia Tech. We are dedicated to providing a friendly environment for playing and learning the sport of Chess. During Fall 2025, we meet on Sundays from 3:30 p.m. to 6 p.m. in Squires 219 and Wednesdays from 4:00 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. at Squires Brush Mountain B (Room 343). If you are busy, you can come late or leave early. We also have a very active Discord group where we discuss games, and problems, and socialize. Our goals are to make chess available to Virginia Tech as a whole and to train for the annual VA State Chess Tournament as well as other tournaments.

https://lichess.org/team/vt-chess-club | https://www.chess.com/club/virginia-tech-hokies-chess-club

67269.name: Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship
67269.summary: A diverse community that seeks to know God, love one another, and impact the campus. Our vision is to reconcile Virginia Tech students to Christ, and build a strong foundation for a lifelong relationship with Him!
67269.description_html: We meet weekly for worship services, small group bible studies, prayer meetings, social events, outreach events, and much more!

68545.name: Chi Delta Alpha
68545.summary: Chi Delta Alpha is Virginia Tech's oldest all-female service organization open to all women on campus. The sorority contributes to the New River Valley through numerous service efforts.
68545.description_html:
Chi Delta Alpha is Virginia Tech's oldest all-female service organization open to all women on campus. The sorority contributes to the New River Valley through numerous service efforts as members are required to complete at least 32 hours per semester.

Members are required to complete at least 32 hours of service per semester, as well as attend various required functions. These include functions dealing with sisterhood, the pledging process, and initiation. We are a non-Greek organization, focusing on service while providing members with the joy of sisterhood.

Chi Delta Alpha encourages interested women with a heart for service to investigate what we have to offer.

238608.name: Chi Epsilon Pi at Virginia Tech
238608.summary: Chi Epsilon Pi is the national meteorology and atmospheric science honor society.
238608.description_html: The mission of the Chi Epsilon Pi National Meteorology Honor Society at Virginia Tech is to recognize students studying meteorology for their outstanding achievements both in and out of the classroom and to provide networking and career development opportunities to help them succeed in their post-graduation endeavors.

68685.name: Chi Omega
68685.summary: Virginia Tech’s chapter of Chi Omega was founded in 1987 and has grown into a strong sisterhood of diverse women. Sisters are involved both in the Greek community and the Virginia Tech community.
68685.description_html: Chi Omega Fraternity is the largest women’s organization in the country. Since it was founded on April 5, 1895, at the University of Arkansas, Chi Omega has grown to over 180 collegiate chapters. Chi Omega was founded to foster friendship and respect for the potential and inherent value of women.

66177.name: Chinese American Society at Virginia Tech
66177.summary: The Chinese American Society (CAS) at Virginia Tech is a student organization that aims to introduce and promote Chinese culture to the general student body and the local community.
66177.description_html:
The Chinese American Society (CAS) at Virginia Tech is a student organization that aims to introduce and promote Chinese culture to the general student body and local community. We are an inclusive and welcoming organization that welcomes students of any cultural background. CAS strives to emphasize diversity and raise awareness of what it means to be an Asian-American living in modern times.

 

CAS is open to all students, regardless of race, ethnic background and nationality. Our mission is to provide an opportunity for students to come together as friends and peers who share an interest in Chinese culture as well as a desire to meet others. 

Please visit our Facebook page "Chinese American Society (CAS) at Virginia Tech" to keep up with our most recent updates and events!

362489.name: Chinese Basketball Club at Virginia Tech
362489.summary: A Chinese basketball club offers chances for anybody who is interested in playing basketball.
362489.description_html:
The Chinese Basketball Club at Virginia Tech is a student-led organization that brings together both graduate and undergraduate students who share a passion for basketball and community. Our mission is to promote physical wellness, cultural connection, and friendship among Chinese and international students through regular sports activities and team engagement.

We host weekly members-only basketball practices and pickup games on campus, offering a consistent opportunity for students to stay active, improve their skills, and build meaningful relationships. Beyond campus, the club proudly represents Virginia Tech in off-campus basketball tournaments and friendly matches with other universities and local teams—fostering school pride, teamwork, and competitive spirit.

Whether you're looking to unwind after class, play competitively, or simply connect with others through the game, the Chinese Basketball Club provides a welcoming and supportive space for all student members.

95658.name: Chinese Language and Cultural Club
95658.summary: The Chinese Language and Culture Club at Virginia Tech is a fun, welcoming space for anyone interested in Chinese culture and language! As both a social and cultural organization, we host events and activities exploring China’s culture and tradition.
95658.description_html: The club will function as a platform for all students interested in Chinese culture to engage, interact, and learn from each other, fostering a sense of camaraderie among participants. Our goal is to promote the learning of the Chinese language and culture through social events where students will engage with each other in order to better understand the traditions and history of the past and present China.

408575.name: Chinese Language Club at Virginia Tech
408575.summary: A casual club to encourage more people to learn about and practice the Chinese language, as well as related activities such as watching movies and learning traditional Chinese dance.
408575.description_html: A casual club to encourage more people to learn about the Chinese language and to offer a place for people learning Chinese to practice with their peers. Includes activities like movie nights and speaking practice nights.

117305.name: Chocolate Milk Monday Club
117305.summary: Mondays bringing you down? Want to make some new friends? Like quality chocolate milk? Try Chocolate Milk Monday! We meet every Monday at 6:00 at D2 in Dietrick Hall, so come join us as we do everything fun in and around Blacksburg! All are welcome.
117305.description_html:
If you are here new to the club, Click THE LINK to join our email list!!!!!!!  THIS IS OUR MAIN FORM OF COMMUNICATION!!! https://forms.gle/Gkbgd7UsTyCzyZpE6
 
We meet EVERY MONDAY at 6:00 PM at D2 in Dietrick Hall (Many of us meet outside the building right before the meeting). Our meetings are a great chance to simply relax, play games and make a lot of new friends. Membership is as easy as joining us for as many Monday meetings as you can!
 
Additionally, we host WEEKLY social events. They vary, but in the past, we've done all kinds of events such as tubing, hiking, laser tag, movie nights, club collabs, and much much (much) more. 
 

If you are interested in learning more about either our weekly meetings or our various ongoing weekly events, feel free to contact the club President, Andrew Peterson (andrewp349@vt.edu) with any questions you may have! Additionally, please signup for our weekly email and follow us on Instagram, @chocolatemilkmonday!

May all your Mondays be milky and your milk be chocolate!

413616.name: Christ Episcopal Church Student Ministry
413616.summary: Canterbury Fellowship is an Episcopal Church campus ministry group focused on helping us build our relationship with God by challenging us to expand our beliefs.
413616.description_html:
As Virginia Tech students, we prefer to ask questions and come to our own conclusions. Canterbury Fellowship is an Episcopal Church campus ministry group focused on helping us build our relationship with God by challenging us to expand on our beliefs. When we meet on Wednesday nights, we don’t have a sermon but have a discussion where everyone is welcome to meditate and voice their opinions about the scriptures with an open mind.


All are welcome! You don’t need to be Episcopalian, just come with an open mind!

62809.name: Christ's Church at Virginia Tech
62809.summary: Love God. Love Others. Lead students to His Grace. Raise up Kingdom Workers on Campus.
62809.description_html:
Our Mission:

The mission of CCVT is to Love. Lead. and Live.

to Love God, love others.Lead students to the grace and love of Jesus.

and raise up kingdom-workers on campus and to the world.

 

What We Are:

We are a campus ministry at Virginia Tech - a mission on Tech's campus. We strive to reach out to students and give them a place where they can establish and grow their faith throughout their college experience.

We offer students a place to call home, when they are away from home. A place to experience fellowship, to get plugged into the local and global church, to serve, to ask hard questions and seek answers, to be welcomed in despite their differing backgrounds, and to know they are truly loved by everyone here and by their God.

 

What We Do:

Here are a few of the things we do here at CCVT: weekly free dinner every Thursday night provided by the local body of believers, followed by a worship service geared towards the college experience; multiple bible studies including one at Radford and New River Community College; staff that are always willing to meet individually with students; discipleship with upperclassmen or staff; a monthly mission with service projects and much more! Check out our events pages for more specifics on weekly and special events! Feel free to reach out to us with any questions you have!

 
Most of our events happen at the CCVT campus house right on the edge of campus by the dorms at 413 Clay Street SW, only 100 yards from the Washington Street tennis courts bus stop. If you drive, you can park at the campus house. 
 
Let us know if you have any questions. We'd be glad to answer them. 
 
God bless you and we look forward to meeting you very soon!

414614.name: Christian Medical and Dental Associations
414614.summary: CMDA educates, encourages, and equips Christian healthcare professionals to glorify God.
414614.description_html: Christian healthcare professionals glorify God by following Christ, serving with excellence and compassion, caring for all people, and advancing Biblical principles impacting healthcare within the Church and throughout the world.

137019.name: Christian Veterinary Fellowship
137019.summary: Veterinary school students, staff, and faculty encouraging one another towards Jesus Christ through Bible study, prayer, fellowship, outreach, and mission trips. A chapter of Christian Veterinary Mission.
137019.description_html: CVF at VA-MD Vet Med is a student chapter of Christian Veterinary Mission (CVM) that promotes the spiritual growth and professional development of veterinary school students, staff, and faculty. We encourage each other toward the excellence and sufficiency of Jesus Christ during weekly Bible study meetings. We seek opportunities to practically bless our peers, and meet regularly to fellowship and pray on behalf of our fellow students. VA-MD students have also participated in short-term veterinary missions to Honduras, Haiti, Uganda, Malawi, Kenya, and Nicaragua.

65759.name: Church on Main College Ministry
65759.summary: Church on Main College Ministry:  A place of love, hope, and healing -- Your home away from home!
65759.description_html: Church on Main College Ministry:  A Place To Be Loved and To Be The Light. We seek to be like Jesus by bringing God’s light into the world through love, hope, and healing. Our mission is to be welcoming and accepting of everyone in the love of Christ; growing disciples in the spirit of Christ, sending servants as the light of Christ.

356345.name: Cinema at Virginia Tech
356345.summary: A student run club dedicated to making student films. We want to focus on creating content, learning to operate film equipment, and building a community of like minded filmmakers! We also hold two film festivals, Progeny (Fall) and Genesis (Spring).
356345.description_html:
Meetings on Wednesday at 7:30 pm in Henderson 204

The goal of Cinema at VT is to cultivate a community of filmmakers. We urge our members to create scripts and promote them in the club for potential production. As a club we will work on group projects as well as promoting personal endeavors. We also hope to host club watch parties in which we all take a trip to the theatre! 

As well as club meetings we also host two film festivals. Progeny, which is held in the fall, is a global festival with submissions from all over. We tend to have live music, and it will be held in the Lyric. Genesis, which will be held in spring, focuses more on Virginia Tech student films. Location is tbd. 

If you are at all interested in filmmaking, please come join our community!

Join our GroupMe:

https://groupme.com/join_group/89295652/hZsIhjBs

62810.name: Circle K International at Virginia Tech
62810.summary: Circle K International is a collegiate organization that creates and attends various service projects in the Blacksburg community and promotes service, leadership, and fellowship for members. We are a sponsored service program of Kiwanis International.
62810.description_html: We are a student-led volunteer organization that promotes service, leadership, and fellowship. We partner with various programs/ organizations in the Blacksburg community for various service projects as well as putting on our own in order to give back to the community and live out Ut Prosim. If you have any questions or desire to join our organization, please email membershipvp.vtcki@gmail.com.

344849.name: Civil and Environmental Engineering Graduate Student Council
344849.summary: The GSC is a student-run organization which aims to build a community among the Civil and Environmental Engineering (CEE) graduate students and facilitate networking .Our mission is to foster a sense of community among CEE graduate students.
344849.description_html:
Introduction

We are a student-run organization which aims to build a community among the Civil and Environmental Engineering (CEE) graduate students and facilitate networking.

Our Mission

Our mission is to foster a sense of community among graduate students of the Charles E. Via Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering and to collectively represent the graduate student community. We serve to promote professional and social networks among civil engineering graduate students as well as become the liaison with the administration, undergraduate students, and broader Virginia Tech community.

Our Goal

The goals of the CEE GSC are to:

  • Expand the networks of graduate students and professors across civil engineering disciplines.
  • Encourage interdisciplinary research across disciplines.
  • Improve the overall experience of CEE graduate students at Virginia Tech.
  • Become the ASCE’s liaison to the graduate community, improving ties between the undergraduate and graduate students to promote research and graduate studies, and better inform undergraduates of our experiences.
  • Represent the CEE department in the Graduate Student Assembly (GSA).

420442.name: Clash at Virginia Tech
420442.summary:
a club open to anyone where we do friendly clash royale matches, tournaments and gatherings. Join our discord for more information:

https://discord.gg/BYTnuPxZRy
420442.description_html:
a club open to anyone where we do friendly clash royale matches, tournaments and gatherings. Join our discord for more information:

https://discord.gg/BYTnuPxZRy

391031.name: Class Programs of Virginia Tech
391031.summary: Class Programs is a student organization that uplifts some of the oldest and unifying traditions at Virginia Tech on behalf of the student body, including Ring Premiere, Ring Dance, Giving Day, Homecoming, Grad Fairs, and Grad Bash.
391031.description_html:
The Virginia Tech Class Programs is a student-run organization comprising of teams from each class that work to continue some of the most important unifying traditions at Virginia Tech. Class Programs is a University Chartered Student Organization, and represents each of the class years active at Tech. While working to ensure that all students are able to experience an inclusive and memorable college career, Class Leadership work in their distinct committees: School Spirit, Unity, and Affinity, to help further the traditions of designing the Class Ring, Class Logo, Class Motto, Class Colors, Ring Dance, Grad Bash, and so much more! To stay updated on your class events and activities, please contact us via email at vtclass@vt.edu or through the official class Instagram pages.

Instagram pages

Class of 2025:

Class of 2026: @vtclassof26

Class of 2027: @vt_classof27

Class of 2028: @vtclassof2028

Class of 2029: @vtclassof29

97291.name: Classics Club of Blacksburg
97291.summary: Students interested in Classical Studies are invited to join the Classics Club. The group gathers each week: Fridays, 4 pm at PK's on Main St. The club hosts movie nights, reading marathons, road trips, and the annual Saturnalia and Bacchanalia parties.
97291.description_html:
The Classics Club hosts movie nights, reading marathons, road trips to lectures and conferences, the annual Saturnalia and Bacchanalia parties, and the annual Classics t-shirts.

The club also engages in service and outreach, including participation in Virginia's Senior and Junior Classical League. Students have also worked with Governor's Latin Academy, Blacksburg Middle School, Blacksburg High School, and local elementary schools.

Get involved! Come to a Classics Table on Fridays, 4 pm, or contact Jacqueline Mann or Isaac Horger, Classics Club Co-Emperors (jdmail@vt.edu, isaacpop23@vt.edu). 

All students interested in Ancient History, Classics, or Classical Languages are invited to join the program's vibrant Classics Club. The group gathers informally each week on Fridays at 4 pm at PK's.

177886.name: Club Jump Rope at Virginia Tech
177886.summary: The purpose of Club Jump Rope is to increase awareness of and involvement in the sport of jump rope and provide opportunities for performance, competition, and teaching in a fun, inclusive environment for students at Virginia Tech.
177886.description_html:
The purpose of Club Jump Rope at Virginia Tech is to increase awareness of and involvement in the sport of jump rope, promote physical fitness and healthy lifestyles, engage in volunteering and mentoring in the community, provide opportunities for performance, competition, and teaching, and to offer a fun, inclusive, and athletic environment for students at Virginia Tech.

We hold weekly open practices, no experience required! Click here for prospective member info or here to join our interest/mailing list to get practice updates.

Check out our website for more information!

356346.name: Club Management Association of America at Virginia Tech
356346.summary: Learning about different careers in Club Management through education, networking, and club tours.
356346.description_html:
Join a group of students passionate about club management and meet more across the country! CMAA is a nationwide organization that includes club managers, aspiring club managers, club staff, and hundreds of students.

Our organization focuses on all different types of clubs including country, yacht, and city clubs. Each year, we have several opportunities to visit clubs across the country, hear from industry professionals, and attend a world and student conference. We also partner with JMU in attending/volunteering at Virginia's Chapter of CMAA's events and going on networking trips. 

CMAA is a great opportunity because student members get access to all of the Association's resources including mentor programs, internship and job boards (only offered to members of CMAA), and scholarships.

You do not have to know anything about private clubs to join – you can just come and learn! Along with learning about clubs, we also have social events and do group bonding activities. Feel free to reach out with any questions!

89944.name: Cochrane Hall Community
89944.summary: A gathering space for the residents of Cochrane Hall.
89944.description_html: A gathering space for the residents of Cochrane Hall.

89945.name: Cochrane Hillcrest RA Staff
89945.summary: A gathering space for the resident advisors of Cochrane Hall and Hillcrest Hall.
89945.description_html: A gathering space for the resident advisors of Cochrane Hall and Hillcrest Hall.

420443.name: Code Maroon
420443.summary: Code Maroon helps students gain valuable healthcare experience and a chance to network with professors and medical professionals.
420443.description_html: Code Maroon is a student led healthcare organization that connects students with experiences in the medical field. The club also offers shadowing opportunities, hosts guest talks from professors and healthcare professionals, and helps members explore various career paths in medicine, public health, and related fields. Through networking events and mentorship, Code Maroon prepares students for future roles in healthcare while fostering a supportive and informed community.

413617.name: Coffee Chats at Virginia Tech
413617.summary: Accelerating Hokies' careers through facilitating connections to industry professionals, hosting interactive workshops, upperclassmen mentorship opportunities, company panels, collaboration events, socials, and more.
413617.description_html: Coffee Chats @ Virginia Tech works towards accelerating Virginia Tech students' careers through one-on-one connections and support. From facilitating mentor relationships with industry professionals, hosting interactive workshops and coffee socials, among others, our goal is to be an open source for Hokies to discover opportunities and achieve their goals.

65692.name: College Life in Christ
65692.summary: College Life in Christ is a diverse group of young people made up of students attending Virginia Tech, Radford, NRCC, and VCOM. We believe it is vital for us to share Christ together while sharing our lives together as college students.
65692.description_html:
College Life in Christ is a diverse group of young people made up of students attending Virginia Tech, Radford, NRCC, and VCOM. We believe it is vital for us to share Christ together while sharing our lives together as college students.

We have regular meeting times and activities ranging from game nights, hiking, bonfires, PowerPoint nights, Bible studies, and Fall and Spring retreats.

Ask us about our annual Immersion Week trips!

Our mission is to "Make servant leaders who make disciples". We are all growing in our pursuit of Jesus and we'd love for you to join us on our mission to be like Him!

 

Here are a few of our weekly events:

- Sunday: 9:30 am College Bible Class, 10:30 am Worship, 6 pm Community Group

- Tuesday (begins September 5): 4:00 pm Common Ground - Christian mentorship for local elementary school kids

- Thursday: 7:00 pm Bible Study - at our Campus House                                                                          


For more info, check us out on Instagram @CollegelifeinChrist Facebook & Twitter @CliC4Christ or complete this brief survey: https://forms.gle/Huy7ZLNwXsNucJ9MA .

122936.name: College Mentors for Kids at Virginia Tech
122936.summary: Mentoring transforms lives! College Mentors for Kids connects kids in and around the Blacksburg community to college students at Virginia Tech through weekly on-campus activities that inspire growth, confidence, and brighter futures.
122936.description_html:
Our Mission: We connect kids to college students through weekly on-campus activities that inspire growth, confidence, and brighter futures.

Through weekly after-school activities focused on higher education and career, culture and diversity, and community service, mentors help their "little buddies" understand the importance of education, show them the benefits of cultural understanding, and teach them ways to give back to their community.

By bringing the children to college campuses they are exposed to higher education at a young age. This has the greatest impact on their impressionable minds because it is when habits are still forming.

Mentoring relationships are not only beneficial for children but the college students as well. Mentors learn about the resources their campus offers, leadership skills, and the need for positive role models in their communities.

At College Mentors for Kids, we motivate kids and college students to reach their full potential to positively impact the community. We bring our mission to life by fostering inspiration to transform lives, educating to change attitudes, and creating connections to increase opportunities. Our vision is to help school children look forward sooner and be able to give back later.

Our Chapter works with Margaret Beeks, Falling Branch, Price's Fork, and Eastern Montgomery elementary schools. If you would like to be a mentor, you can apply at collegementors.org. Your application will go to our database and you will be notified if we are participating in mentor recruitment. Please note, being a member of our GobblerConnect page does not mean you are a mentor in the organization!

137016.name: College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Diversity Council
137016.summary: The College Diversity Council provides college-wide leadership to promote diversity, guides the recruitment and retention of employees, and supports the inclusion of all people in educational programs and services.
137016.description_html:
The College of Agriculture and Life Sciences is committed to creating a climate that reflects the diversity of its students, staff, and faculty in its teaching, research projects, Extension programs and international activities. Likewise, the College respects individuals for their unique qualities, and their many contributions toward enhancing a culturally rich, university environment.    

The College Diversity Council provides college-wide leadership to promote diversity, guides the recruitment and retention of employees, and supports the inclusion of all people in educational programs and services  The Council’s goal is to support Virginia Tech in its quest to be a supportive, academic environment that is fully cognizant of individual differences. The Council is also committed to help each person fulfill his/her potential for academic excellence.

123392.name: College of Natural Resources and the Environment Student Council
123392.summary: We want to create a relevant organization that is an integral part of the CNRE culture. In order to provide students with the opportunity to empower themselves and be involved with the entirety of the whole CNRE.
123392.description_html: We, the CNRE Student Council at Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, henceforth referred to as Virginia Tech, recognize the need for enhanced communication, engagement, and cooperation between the organizations within the CNRE, the student body of the CNRE, and the administration of the CNRE. We also recognize the need for a collective, unified, and representative voice for the values and interests of the departments and the organizations within the CNRE. The comprehensive, collaborative efforts of the CNRE Student Council will be directed towards the improvement of, promotion of, and service to the student body of the CNRE.

374127.name: College of Science
374127.summary:
Study Science. Do Science.

We're the College of Science, where we educate future scientific leaders.
374127.description_html: Welcome to the College of Science's GobblerConnect page! This page will have event information for students, like our community nights and our Undergraduate Research Mixer.

69164.name: College Republicans at Virginia Tech
69164.summary: The College Republicans' mission is to help students engage in the political process, build contacts in the political arena, and to organize students into an effective force to secure the election of Republican candidates to all levels of public office.
69164.description_html: Virginia Tech's Premier voice and organization for young conservatives. Whether you lean libertarian, or classically conservative, CR's may be for you. We strive to promote conservative values, and work to get GOP candidates elected to public office. Opportunities to build connections within the Republican caucus in Virginia and get involved in the political process.  Interested in helping Republican Candidates win around the New River Valley and VA?  This is the club for you!

69709.name: Collegiate Beef Leadership Council at Virginia Tech
69709.summary: The purpose of this Council and its members shall be to serve as knowledgeable advocates for the beef industry to the general public, with a special emphasis on the Virginia Tech campus community.
69709.description_html: The purpose of the Collegiate Beef Leadership Council at Virginia Tech and its members shall be to serve as knowledgeable advocates for the beef industry to the general public, with a special emphasis on the Virginia Tech campus community, to develop and strengthen relationships between Virginia Tech students and beef industry leaders, and to promote the development of leadership among members to secure a positive future for agriculture and the beef industry.

62918.name: Collegiate Times
62918.summary: The Collegiate Times is an independent, student-run newspaper that serves the Virginia Tech campus and Blacksburg. It is printed once a week during the school year and publishes continuously at collegiatetimes.com. We're always looking for new members!
62918.description_html:
Welcome! The Collegiate Times is an independent, student-run newspaper that serves both Virginia Tech and Blacksburg. Our coverage ranges from football games and town council meetings to movie reviews and political columns. Staff members include writers, designers, photographers, multimedia producers and copy editors. 

The paper is printed weekly during the academic year, but we are continuously publishing on our website at collegiatetimes.com. We are also very active on social media including Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Follow us @CollegiateTimes If you are interested in staying up-to-date on the latest news on campus, follow us there or sign up for our Tuesday/Friday email newsletters on our website!

If you are interested in joining, we'd love to have you on board! We take students from all backgrounds — not just journalism. We have editors who are political science, physics and mathematics majors as well. Most sections have some basic training that new writers need to complete to help get you started with your first story. The Collegiate Times is a fantastic way to build a portfolio, gain experience, learn new things and meet new people. If this sounds like it is for you, send an email to the editor at editor@collegiatetimes.com.

109342.name: Collegiate Women in Business
109342.summary: Our mission is to inspire and develop world class-leaders in business, foster interactions with successful role models, and build the confidence, courage and the will to create meaningful impact.
109342.description_html:
Follow our social media channels for more information. VTCWIB on Twitter and Facebook and vt_cwib on Instagram.

Collegiate Women In Business, (CWIB) is a well-recognized student organization centered around the guiding principles: EMPOWER, PREPARE & CONNECT.​ 

 

As a member, you attend monthly meetings, most of which feature powerful speakers. We provide workshops on professional growth of many kinds, networking opportunities with alumni, social opportunities with other student organizations, and treks to visit company headquarters in places like ATL, D.C., Charlotte, NYC, and more! 

 

JOIN US at Gobblerfest! Meet with our leadership team and hear why you should join CWIB!

74311.name: Collegiate Young Farmers at Virginia Tech
74311.summary: Collegiate Young Farmers at Virginia Tech supports agriculture through production, education, promotion, advocacy and leadership. We are affiliated with the Virginia Farm Bureau Young Farmers.
74311.description_html:
Collegiate Young Farmers at Virginia Tech are young adults who share an interest in supporting agriculture through production, education, promotion, advocacy, and leadership. We are affiliated with the Virginia Farm Bureau Young Farmers and meet on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday of every month. Any undergraduate with an interest in agriculture can join at any time. Please attend one of our meetings to find out more! Check out our Facebook and Instagram page for more information!

https://www.instagram.com/virginiatechyoungfarmers/

https://www.facebook.com/VirginiaTechCollegiateYoungFarmers

387539.name: ColorStack at Virginia Tech
387539.summary: A supportive organization created to help Black & Latinx Computer Science Students to complete their degrees and gain rewarding technical careers.
387539.description_html: ColorStack's mission is to increase the number of Black and Latinx Computer Science graduates that go on to start rewarding technical careers

139707.name: CommLab
139707.summary: CommLab provides VT students with constructive feedback and practical resources for improving oral presentations. By visiting, students will gain valuable presentation-related insight and develop the necessary toolsets to become successful presenters.
139707.description_html:
CommLab extends the classroom experience and provides support for public-speaking based class assignments and special projects. Graduate and undergraduate students trained in public speaking are available to help students with all areas of the speech making process, including

  • Topic Selection
  • Researching content
  • Organizing and outlining main points
  • Source citations
  • Physical and vocal delivery
  • Presentational aids

158469.name: Commodity Investing by Students
158469.summary: Commodity Investing by Students (COINS) is the only student-run commodities trading group in the United States and invests a portfolio of $1.3 million of the Virginia Tech Endowment in futures-based ETFs and ETNs.
158469.description_html:
Commodity Investing by Students (COINS) is the only student-run commodities trading group in the United States and invests a portfolio of $1.3 million of the Virginia Tech Endowment. The organization is currently composed of four divisions: Agriculture, Metals, Energy, and Quant. Trades are bases on a combination of technical and fundamental analyses. COINS has a goal to outperform the Bloomberg Commodity Index, a benchmark set by the Virginia Tech Foundation.

In addition to providing invaluable, hands-on, educational experiences, COINS offers several types of scholarships to exemplary team members. The Holland family is recognized as a distinguished donor to COINS scholarships and funding. Aside from scholarships, several student members have also pursued commodity-related research with various faculty members and companies that visit and speak to the group. COINS attains 100% job placement.

COINS recruits members through an application process every fall semester. For more information about recruitment, email coinsvirginiatech@gmail.com, or visit our website: https://coins.aaec.vt.edu/

132316.name: Communications and Innovative Technologies
132316.summary: Provides communication and marketing support for Student Affairs.
132316.description_html: Provides communication and marketing support for Student Affairs

235444.name: Community Change Collaborative
235444.summary: The Community Change Collaborative (CCC) is a research-oriented group interested in the methods, frameworks, and forces shaping community development, approaches to community engagement, and how to build sustainable, cross-sectoral partnerships.
235444.description_html:
The Community Change Collaborative (CCC) is a graduate student group that examines the methods, frameworks, and forces shaping community development, approaches to community engagement, and how to build sustainable, cross-sectoral partnerships. Our interdisciplinary research interests range from local to international case studies, applying a variety of qualitative and mixed methods approaches to connect theory and praxis for the benefit of our members, community partners, practitioners, and researchers interested in community change. We meet weekly as a group to explore theories and methods critically, which often leads to lively, educational discourse that informs our professional and personal development.

Another key component of our collaboration is to engage the public through a lecture series and facilitated discussions with academics and practitioners who have expertise in community development. As part of the lecture series, graduate students facilitate podcast interviews with influential leaders (thinkers, practitioners, journalists, authors, and change-makers), which are professionally recorded by the VT Institute for Policy and Governance (IPG) Senior Fellow Andy Morikawa, and stored online for public access as a resource to anyone who would like to learn about the topic. Our four-pronged approach to student-centric and community-oriented learning includes a Speaker Series, Film Series, CCC Forum, and Community-Based Projects.

137144.name: Companion Animal Club
137144.summary: Companion Animal Club promotes opportunities for veterinary students in the field of companion animal medicine, including shelter medicine and integrative medicine. Opportunities include wet labs, speakers, and rounds.
137144.description_html: Companion Animal Club’s goal is to emphasize the many facets of small animal medicine, particularly specialized disciplines not emphasized in the DVM curriculum such as dentistry, nutrition, shelter medicine, integrative medicine, and feline medicine. Opportunities include wet labs, speakers, rounds, and clinical shadowing experiences. This club is restricted to DVM students at Virginia-Maryland College of Veterinary Medicine only.

186975.name: Competitive Mock Trial Team at Virginia Tech
186975.summary: Mock Trial is an organization of students who work to research and prepare for national competitive mock trials.
186975.description_html:
Competitive Mock Trial at Virginia Tech is an organization designed to help students become more exposed to the courtroom, improving public speaking skills, adaptability, and interpersonal relations with others interested in the legal field. During the course of the year, the team works together to prepare cases, learning the ins and outs of the courtroom.

Competitive Mock Trial is a simulated trial experience where students are tasked with portraying both attorneys and witnesses. Students are given a case and are asked to prepare materials for both sides of the case. During the competition, students are assigned which side they go on and compete against other prestigious universities on a national scale. The organization also helps each of its members grasp the foundations of being a successful lawyer while also giving real life experiences in a court.  

What are we looking for?

  • Any kind of public speaking/performing experience (nice, but not necessary)
  • Actors 
  • Experience working in a team environment
  • A passion for and commitment to competing at the highest level
  • Individuals committed and willing to devote TIME and INTEREST to an organization such as this. 

https://forms.gle/kn48kzjBCRdeMdNF8

370432.name: Competitive Robotics Organization at Virginia Tech
370432.summary: Our multidisciplinary club features over six specialized robotics design teams and four support teams.
370432.description_html:
Learn more and apply on our website! vtcro.org

We are VT CRO—the Competitive Robotics Organization at Virginia Tech and the largest design team on campus. Our multidisciplinary club features over six specialized design teams and four support teams out of three labs.

344669.name: Compress and Shock at Virginia Tech
344669.summary: An organization dedicated to further fulfilling the mission of the Compress and Shock Foundation of teaching the life skills of CPR and AED usage to everyone, specifically targeting the Hokie community.
344669.description_html: An organization dedicated to further fulfilling the mission of the Compress and Shock Foundation of teaching the life skills of CPR and AED usage to everyone, specifically targeting the Hokie community. Our club is dedicated to providing monthly CPR and AED education classes at Virginia Tech and local NRV communities with the goal of expanding knowledge and participation in our local communities.

135379.name: Computational Modeling and Data Analytics Club
135379.summary: CMDA Club is an interdisciplinary academic club serving not only CMDA students, but any students in relevant studies, or with interest in the field. CMDA Club members will have the opportunity to participate in events that facilitate professional growth.
135379.description_html:
CMDA Club is an interdisciplinary academic club serving not only CMDA students, but any students in relevant studies, or with interest in the field. CMDA Club members will have the opportunity to participate in events that facilitate professional growth, such as technical workshops, events with company partners, and networking events with peers. 

The CMDA club assists in hosting the Fall Data Competition as well as the Spring ASA Datafest, providing students with experience with hands-on data analytical practices using company provided datasets.

362753.name: Computer Science Careers at Virginia Tech
362753.summary: CS Careers @ VT is an organization for Computer Science students to receive aid in building their careers and network with other hardworking, like-minded students.
362753.description_html:
CS Careers @ VT is your gateway to unlocking a successful future in the tech industry! Established in the Fall of 2022, our organization has rapidly become a hub for connecting ambitious students like you with top companies and tech opportunities. Whether you're majoring in Computer Science or have a passion for technology, CS Careers @ VT is the community for you.

 

Why join CS Careers @ VT?

Because here, your future in tech is our priority. From career guidance and personalized insights to help you land your dream job, to specialized interview prep and resume assistance, we offer a comprehensive suite of resources. Our community of over 950 students and alumni is vibrant and inclusive, offering a unique blend of mentorship, networking, and support. Whether you're majoring in Computer Science or simply have a passion for technology, CS Careers @ VT welcomes you with open arms, united by a shared interest in innovation and success

 

Join Our Thriving Community

We're more than just an organization; we're a family dedicated to helping each other grow. We invite you to fully immerse yourself in our community by joining our thriving Discord server, where you'll find interactive discussions, real-time support, and much more.

Click here to join our Discord Server of over 950 current students and alumni!

 

Embrace the opportunity to grow, learn, and succeed with CS Careers @ VT. We look forward to guiding you on your journey toward an extraordinary career in tech!

413618.name: Computer Science Graduate Council at Virginia Tech
413618.summary: The Computer Science Graduate Council (CSGC) fills two purposes. Facing inward, CSGC helps govern the CS graduate student body. Facing outward, the CSGC represents the CS graduate student body to external parties, including the VT CS department & GPSS.
413618.description_html: The Computer Science Graduate Council (CSGC) fills two purposes. Facing inward, the CSGC helps govern the CS graduate student body. Facing outward, the CSGC represents the CS graduate student body to external parties, including the VT CS department and the VT Graduate and Professional Student Senate. Specific examples of CSGC responsibilities are: to help incoming students become familiar with the activities in the department; to voice student opinions in various faculty and graduate school committees (i.e. the CS Department Graduate Program Committee, the Graduate and Professional Student Senate, the CS Department Faculty meetings);  to organize department events such as Orientation Sessions, Course Request Panels, Academic Job Panels, Student Advisor Relationship Workshops, Lightning Talks, Recruitment Weekend, etc; assist the CS department chair with the disbursement of the department’s Graduate Student Travel Fund.

164798.name: Concrete Canoe at Virginia Tech
164798.summary: Concrete Canoe is a multidisciplinary engineering design team that designs, fabricates, and races a canoe made entirely out of concrete. The team is an affiliate of the Virginia Tech ASCE chapter.
164798.description_html:
Concrete Canoe is a multidisciplinary design team that designs, fabricates, and races a canoe made entirely out of lightweight concrete. The team focuses on six primary design aspects: concrete mix design, hull design, structural design,  construction, and aesthetics.

In the fall semester, the team is tasked with designing a canoe hull and concrete mixture that meets the Rules and Regulations from ASCE (American Society of Civil Engineers). We perform testing trials and research to determine which design will be used for the competition. We use CNC routers and 3D modeling software to design and develop our canoe hull. In the spring semester, construction begins in the VT Structures Lab. The canoe hull is developed and the concrete is hand placed. The canoe then cures for 28 days in the form, is removed, sanded, and finished. We then present our work at the ASCE VA Section Regional Competition and have the opportunity to race our canoe, with the chance of advancing to the national ASCE competition. 

Although civil engineering is the primary focus of the design team, the team is in need of engineers from all disciplines! Any individual is able to join the team, regardless of major or experience. We will teach you all you need to know and learn from you at the same time!

123129.name: Cook Counseling Center
123129.summary: Thomas E. Cook Counseling Center is the mental health resource on campus for Virginia Tech students.
123129.description_html: Thomas E. Cook Counseling Center is the counseling and mental health resource on campus for Virginia Tech students. Cook Counseling Center is committed to offering counseling services to Virginia Tech students no matter what is troubling them. These services include individual counseling, group counseling, couples therapy, career counseling and more. Thomas E. Cook Counseling Center provides opportunities for students to learn more about themselves as individuals, form deeper relationships with their peers and grow to benefit our community and society at large.

68876.name: Cornerstone Christian Fellowship
68876.summary: "The dream of a community being transformed into Christ’s image through the power of His Holy Spirit, finding healing in their hurting, understanding God’s plan, and making His love known to all."
68876.description_html: Cornerstone Christian Fellowship (CCF) is a campus fellowship at Virginia Tech.  We are a member fellowship of Servants Ministry, a network of campus fellowships in the DC, Maryland, Virginia area.

294041.name: Cosplay Club at Virginia Tech
294041.summary: Cosplay Club at VT is dedicated to uniting and providing unique resources to people who enjoy creating costumes (whether bought or handmade), taking photos with unique themes/models, and attending conventions.
294041.description_html:
Cosplay /ˈkäzˌplā,ˈkäsˌplā/ : the practice of dressing up as a character from a movie, book, or video game

~

Hello and welcome to Cosplay Club (at VT)!

We are a group of students deep in the nerd fandom who enjoy dressing up as our favorite characters. Join us as we embark on a journey to creating our own costumes and attending conventions as a group!

This club's main goal is to provide cosplayers with a place to create, provide tools not easily accessible, and workshops on general crafting necessities, such as sewing techniques and prop making! We are open to all majors, experience-levels, and people alike (faculty members are welcome)!

Meetings take place every Saturday from 3:00-6:00pm in Squires Student Center! Room numbers are announced every week on our Discord server and Remind.

~

Join our Discord server via the Virginia Tech Student Hub on Discord!

Join the Mailing list with Remind!: https://www.remind.com/join/ccatvt

61197.name: Council of International Student Organizations
61197.summary: The Council of International Student Organizations (CISO) is an umbrella organization representing international student organizations at Virginia Tech.
61197.description_html:
Founded in 1987, the Council of International Student Organizations (CISO) is one of the 18 University Chartered Student Organizations (UCSO) on campus. We serve as the governing body for all international student organizations at Virginia Tech. We work directly with the Cranwell International Center to represent the international community on campus and provide opportunities to showcase their cultures. We serve as a liaison between our constituents and university administration of Virginia Tech, campus entities, and the Blacksburg, VA community.

Office hours are posted on our Instagram.

100471.name: Cranwell International Center
100471.summary: Cranwell International Center promotes intercultural exchange, fosters a welcoming environment, and enhances the experience of all university and community participants.

382784.name: CREATe Student Association
382784.summary: The CREATe Student Association serves graduate/undegraduate students within the Center for Research and Engineering in Aero/Hydrodynamic Technologies.

223948.name: CreativiTea
223948.summary: If you like creative writing, you've come to the right place! CreativiTea is a community of writers at Virginia Tech who enjoy pursuing, learning, and sharing original work in various forms of poetry, prose, and other literary expression.
223948.description_html: Hello! We are CreativiTea, a creative writing club at Virginia Tech. We're a group of people who like to write and encourage each other to do so! We welcome people interested in any form of writing: poetry, fiction, non-fiction, etc. Any level of experience with writing is wholeheartedly welcomed - if you've never written, but are interested in getting started, feel free to reach out! Come start your story with us :)

357878.name: Creativity and Innovation District Living Learning Program
357878.summary:
CID is home to 596 students from a variety of academic majors and graduating classes.
Home to Innovate LLC, Rhizome LLC, Studio 72 LLC, and first year student athletes.

137172.name: Criminology and Sociology Club
137172.summary: Criminology and Sociology Club is an academic club open to all students of all majors. Our highlighted events are murder mystery night and career panels/workshops.
137172.description_html: Our purpose is to connect students to peers of similar interests, as well as to resources such as discussions with field professionals. We host bi-weekly meetings to encourage student involvement within the disciplines of Criminology & Sociology. We'd love to have you join our club!

352398.name: Crochet Club at Virginia Tech
352398.summary: We are a club dedicated to providing a space for fellow Hokies to crochet, learn to crochet, and have fun! Follow @crochetclubatvt on Instagram for updated info!
352398.description_html: Our club is meant for any students interested in crochet, but other yarn/textile arts are welcome! We meet weekly and love to spend time together working on various projects. We also put on workshops as well as coordinate group projects each year. We primarily communicate on our Instagram @crochetclubvt

64454.name: Cru
64454.summary: Cru is a community where the gospel captures hearts, transforms lives, and launches men and women into a life-long adventure with Jesus.
64454.description_html: We are a campus ministry that meets in Squires Colonial weekly on Thursday nights at 7:30pm. We want to get people connected with other Christians in order to form meaningful relationships and encourage each other in our faith. We also desire to provide opportunities for students who aren't Christians to understand our faith and engage in our community. All are welcome!

356348.name: CS Squared
356348.summary: Community service in computer science. We are an organization dedicated to providing computer assistance to the Blacksburg community. We meet weekly at the Blacksburg community center and online.
356348.description_html:
The mission of CS Squared is to use our Computer Science skills for Community Service. We empower the community through building tomorrow's leaders and bridging the digital divide by putting our skills to help others. Through serving children and elders throughout the community, our goals of inspiring the young and old about technology is propelled forward.

A major part of our activities is weekly tech help sessions at the Blacksburg Community Center. These happen on Fridays from 4-5pm EST. We also run a coding club for kids that happens every other week. We have GBM and various short-term events throughout the year so be sure to register! 

To get involved and be updated with upcoming events, join our Discord: https://discord.gg/hKEBRzkzVs 

Check out and follow our Instagram page: @vt_cs2

163950.name: Cubing Club at Virginia Tech
163950.summary: Welcome to the Rubik's Cube Club at Virginia Tech! We hold weekly meetings, which can range anywhere from practice competitions, master classes/how-to lessons, and chill social hangouts.
163950.description_html:
This club is open to everyone! Whether you're just learning how to solve the cube or you're a top-ranked speedcuber, we hold events and have meetups for all levels. While many of us focus on the 3x3 Rubik’s Cube, we also love solving a wide range of other puzzles (Pyraminx, 2x2, 4x4, blindfolded, clock, etc.), so don’t worry if 3x3 isn’t your main!

If you're interested in more, join our Discord server where we communicate! https://discord.gg/gMZQsqgxua

Check out our official website! vtcubing.org

64658.name: Cyber Security Club at Virginia Tech
64658.summary: Develop awareness in all areas of cyber security through study and practice.
64658.description_html:
The Cyber Security Club at Virginia Tech is a student organization at Virginia Tech founded in 2011 with the goal of encouraging and expanding the study of cyber security and related fields. We aim to develop awareness in all areas of cyber security including physical, social, hardware, and software. Our only club requirement is that you know how to turn on and navigate your computer.

 

For Fall 2025, we are hosting General, Attack/Defense, and CTF Team meetings. You are welcome to join any or all of them. The schedule for these is available on our website.

76059.name: Dairy Club at Virginia Tech
76059.summary: The Dairy Club is dedicated to making a positive difference in the lives of youth and students by expanding dairy industry awareness, premier leadership, personal growth and career opportunities through community service and club activities.
76059.description_html:
The objectives of the Dairy Club are:

  • To promote the dairy industry to the public within our communities by increasing consumer awareness through education regarding the benefits provided by milk, milk products, and the daily operation of a dairy farm
  • To develop future leaders in the dairy industry by providing club members with the opportunities to build leadership skills and abilities, by serving as officers and committee chairpersons
  • To organize events that broaden and enhance the education and experiences of members, by providing “hands-on” activities to complement classroom instruction, and by providing members with opportunities that may otherwise be unapproachable
  • To provide social activities that cultivates fellowship and friendship among students.  This in turn provides for the close-knit family atmosphere for which the Dairy Club at Virginia Tech is recognized
  • To conduct fund raising projects that teach sound business principles, and the importance of good leadership skills and work ethics, as well as generate funds necessary to support our many activities, while supporting and promoting the dairy industry
  • To recognize and honor individuals who have continuously made outstanding contributions to the dairy industry and / or the Dairy Club at Virginia Tech
  • To strive for excellence in the achievement of all club activities

62812.name: Dance Company at Virginia Tech
62812.summary: The Dance Company at Virginia Tech is a student-run organization united by a shared love of dance. We promote self-expression, community, technique, and performance through weekly rehearsals, on-campus shows, and special events throughout the year.
62812.description_html:
Dance Company at Virginia Tech (DCVT) is a student-led performance group built on creativity, community, and a shared passion for dance. Our members come from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we celebrate that diversity through original choreography and a mix of styles including contemporary, tap, hip-hop, tap, jazz, lyrical, ballet, musical theater, modern, and heels. Every piece we perform is choreographed by our own dancers, making each performance a true reflection of our team’s talent and vision.

We host two major showcases each year, one in the fall and one in the spring, along with performances at basketball games, university events, and local community functions. Outside the studio, DCVT is also a family. From formal dances and date parties, to socials with other campus organizations, we value creating memories as much as we value movement.

Being a part of DCVT means growing as a dancer, performer, and friend. Whether you're here for technique, expression, connection, or all three, there’s a place for you.

Auditions are held at the beginning of each fall semester. Be sure to follow us on social media and check out our website for updates, performance videos, and audition details!

 

Check out our new website here!

Email Us: dancecompanyatvirginiatech@gmail.com

Instagram: @dancecompany_vt

Tik Tok: @dancecompany.vt

68839.name: Dancing's Our Poison
68839.summary: Founded in May 2009, DOP is a hip hop dance crew that has since hosted weekly dance workshops at the Virginia Tech campus during the school year & performed at various showcases to inspire others not only to dance but also to pursue their passions.
68839.description_html:
Founded in May 2009, DOP is a dance crew that hosts weekly dance workshops open to the Virginia Tech community. Our team members also perform at various showcases to inspire others not only to dance but also to pursue their passions. 

Dancing’s Our Poison (DOP) has the mission to dance with an innate passion while inspiring others to have the courage and perseverance to chase their own dreams. We do this through the training and improvement of ourselves as individuals and dancers, while simultaneously fulfilling our civic duties of building and giving back to the community.


-- More info on our FREE weekly dance workshop --

Description: These workshops are weekly dance classes to inspire dancers and non-dancers to purse their passions! They’re open to everyone (even if you’re not a Tech student)
Date: EVERY THURSDAY (during the school year)
Time: 8:30pm-10:30pm
Location: War Memorial Hall Studio 160

 

Follow our Instagram for more info on the workshops!

365289.name: Data Structures and Algorithms at Virginia Tech
365289.summary: Coalition of students interested in the data structure and algorithim based problems at LeetCode.com. A community to discuss strategy's for solving problems and improving over problem solving skills
365289.description_html:
We aim to create a community of students who are interested in learning and studying data structures and algorithms. The club provides a platform for members to prepare for technical interviews by discussing DSA topics and questions. Members can collaborate and learn from one another in a supportive environment. The club is dedicated to fostering a passion for computer science and developing technical skills among its members.

Join our discord here: https://discord.gg/fa8YAtVpPW

420444.name: Day Trading Club at Virginia Tech
420444.description_html: The Virginia Tech Day Trading Club (DTC) is dedicated to developing the next generation of traders and financial thinkers through real-time market analysis, collaborative learning, and professional-level strategy building. Our members gain practical exposure to multiple asset classes while building a foundation in risk management, market psychology, and discipline.

369725.name: DC-Graduate School
369725.description_html: This is the DC Area branch of the Virginia Tech Graduate School.

392025.name: DC-Graduate Student Assembly
392025.summary: The DC-GSA represents VT graduate students in the D.C. area, working with the GPSS in Blacksburg. It advocates for student concerns & liaises with the University. It improves campus life and community through academic, professional life, & social events
392025.description_html:
The DC-GSA is the official representative body of the VT graduate students in the greater

Washington, D.C., metro area, and works closely with the GPSS organization

headquartered in Blacksburg. DC-GSA is dedicated to advocating for graduate students’

concerns and to serve as their liaison with the University Administration. Every year, they

work to improve campus life, scholarly development, and graduate community by

organizing academic, professional, and social events.

286060.name: Dean of Students Office
286060.summary: The Dean of Students Office offers care and support to students to assist them in flourishing personally, academically, and socially. The DOS supports all students, providing assistance in times of need and engagement in meaningful experiences.
286060.description_html:
The Dean of Students is committed to offering care and support to students so they flourish in nearly every imaginable way.

Advocates:

  • Engage, educate, equip, and empower students.
  • Support and care for students in the midst of crisis.
