  • Encourage students to utilize university and community resources.
  • Work and advise with both our heads and our hearts.
  • Respect the student and the advocacy process by recognizing our own biases and by collectively pursuing greater self-understanding and integrity.

69165.name: Debate Club
69165.summary: The club/team competes in debate competitions against other schools, locally and nationally. Meetings and events are held throughout the year to help members hone their debating skills.
69165.description_html: VT Debate is an organization with a large network of resources, people, and ideas all intended to help members hone their skills over a myriad of debate forms. The goal is to cultivate a strong team with strong skills to apply over tournaments.

404540.name: Debate Team at Virginia Tech
404540.summary: A place to learn competitive debate skills & eventually be able to use those skills to compete.
404540.description_html:
Fill out our interest form!

https://forms.gle/pgmhPeHNxNXQFgAB9

Join our GroupMe!

https://groupme.com/join_group/103105020/cvnpEBzg

391581.name: Deeper Life Campus Fellowship
391581.summary: Deeper Life Campus Fellowship at Virginia Tech is to be a diverse group of Christian students, staff, and associate members' organization who are committed to serving the Virginia Tech campus
391581.description_html: Deeper Life Campus Fellowship is a gathering for people to practice the love of God. We teach, practice, and follow the Bible to be prepared for life after this world. This is an organization that stands on holiness. Your spiritual, mental, and physical well-being is our concern.

210235.name: Delta Chi Fraternity
210235.summary: Delta Chi was started by a group of 67 men in the fall of 2018. We have just finished initiating our Nu Class into full brotherhood! If you're interested in joining, please contact us through our recruitment email: vtdeltachirecruitment@gmail.com
210235.description_html:
The best description of Delta Chi is shown through our Preamble‘s principal ideals that serve as a guide to the daily life as a brother. Furthermore, Delta Chi has developed the Eleven Basic Expectations of each member, as a way to embody and employ these principal values.

Our four most important principals: “Friendship”, “Character”, “Justice”, and “Education”. Instead, it is suggested that the four most important words are “Promote,” ”Develop,” “Advance,” and “Assist.” The point is that “Fraternity” and, in particular, “Delta Chi” is not just about what “is” but what we, as members, should actually be doing. It is our actions that make Delta Chi, which is why the key words are verbs instead of nouns.

Our mission is to strive to do fraternity right by living out our core values of Action, Academics, Accountability, Alliance, and Assistance.

Contact our Recruitment Chair (vtdeltachirecruitment@gmail.com) for any questions regarding membership. Please feel free to contact our President (vtdeltachia@gmail.com) for any other inquiries.

107820.name: Delta Chi Gamma
107820.summary: Delta Chi Gamma is a service and leadership sorority founded at Virginia Tech in Spring 2014. Please follow our Instagram to keep up to date with events and recruitment information! Don’t hesitate to reach out!
107820.description_html:
Delta Chi Gamma is an independent service sorority founded at Virginia Tech in Spring 2014. Built on the pillars of service, sisterhood, and academics, we offer a welcoming space to give back to the community and build lasting friendships.

 

Our members volunteer with local organizations like the YMCA, Micah’s Backpack, and Millstone Meals Kitchen, and enjoy fun sisterhood events such as themed movie nights, craft nights, and game nights. We also support academic success through weekly study hours and encourage personal growth through leadership opportunities.

 

With a smaller chapter size, it’s easy to get involved, bring your ideas to life, and truly get to know everyone. We pride ourselves on keeping dues and requirements accessible to all and will work with you should you have any concerns.

 

More information about our events, rush process, requirements, and team can be found on our website.

Please reach out to us via email or Insta. if you have any questions! We’d be so lucky and grateful to have you!

67271.name: Delta Delta Delta Sorority
67271.summary: Delta Delta Delta is a proud member of Fraternity and Sorority Life at Virginia Tech. Our chapter is founded on sisterhood, academics, and philanthropic service to our national partner, St. Jude Children's Hospital.
67271.description_html: Delta Delta Delta is a proud member of the Virginia Tech greek community.  Our chapter is founded on sisterhood, academics, and philanthropic service. We are leaders in every way on our campus, we currently hold the highest sorority grade point average, and attain incredible professional achievements. Furthermore, we raise an impressive amount of money for St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. This year we have raised over $80,000 in hopes to support St. Jude in their mission to end childhood cancer.

108083.name: Delta Epsilon Mu
108083.summary: Delta Epsilon Mu is the nation's premier Professional Pre-Health Co-Ed Fraternity. We are open to all students who have an interest in a Health-related career, professional development, and social involvement.
108083.description_html:
Mission Statement:

The Alpha Gamma chapter of Delta Epsilon Mu (ΔEM) is dedicated to connecting students of diverse backgrounds who are pursuing careers in the varying health fields by providing a platform for professional development, academic support, and personal growth. Our mission is to prepare our members to navigate the challenges of a profession in the healthcare field through a unique blend of professional programming, community service, and social networking events.

 

About Us:

The Alpha Gamma chapter of Delta Epsilon Mu was founded in the Spring of 2015 following more than a year of hard work by the Infinity Class. Our fraternity is a strong group of dedicated pre-health students who work hard every day to build upon our organization, all while building upon ourselves. Founded on the principles of loyalty, dedication, friendship, and support, Delta Epsilon Mu is a nationally recognized co-ed professional fraternity that fosters a close-knit community of like-minded individuals passionate about healthcare.

 

We take pride in our organization's inclusive environment where members can cultivate lasting relationships while advancing their professional goals. Our organization is committed to preparing its members for successful careers in various health professions, including medicine, dentistry, nursing, physical therapy, veterinarian science, pharmacy, genetic counseling, public health, and so much more.

 

What ΔEM Provides:

  • Professional Development: Workshops, guest speaker events, seminars, and networking opportunities with healthcare professionals, including our organization's alumni, provide insight into members' chosen fields.
  • Academic Support: Study groups, peer mentoring, professors, and resources help members excel in their coursework and prepare for graduate and professional school after graduation. Mentorship programs and experienced alumni guide students through their academic and professional journey.
  • Community Service Opportunities: Volunteering and service projects give back to our local community and support public health initiatives. Members are encouraged to participate in health-related service projects and community health education. 
  • Social Activities: A variety of social events, including date parties and big/little pairings, build siblinghood and foster a sense of community among members. Casual get-togethers, intramural sports, and retreats help foster a family-like community in our fraternity. 

 

Join Us This Spring:

Delta Epsilon Mu is looking for dedicated, compassionate, and driven students who are committed to pursuing a career in healthcare. If you are looking to enhance your professional journey, make meaningful connections, and contribute to improving our local community, we highly encourage you to explore membership with DEM. Please email demvirginiatech@gmail.com for questions or more information about Spring 2025 Recruitment!

 

Check out our website and follow us on social media @dem_alphagamma (Instagram) and Delta Epsilon Mu (Facebook) for updates and information!

69015.name: Delta Gamma
69015.summary: Delta Gamma at VT is a local Panhellenic Greek sorority and a national fraternity that promotes high ideals of friendship, service, and character. We support the Service for Sight Foundation, an organization devoted to the visually impaired.
69015.description_html:
Membership in Delta Gamma brings endless memories and experiences that will shape its members for years to come. 

Consistent with our Founders' thoughts in 1873, our primary purpose is to create an environment for our members in which lasting friendships and our vows of sisterhood emanate all aspects of our Fraternity.  Our members live  Delta Gamma has created an environment to commit to uplifting members through personal growth, academic challenges, and service. This commitment has fostered a sense of belonging and responsibility throughout members' collegiate years and enhances members' college experience. 

Delta Gamma is more than just a collegiate experience; it is a lifetime of commitment, support, and opportunity awaiting you. It marks the beginning of a relationship that will last for a lifetime.

340357.name: Delta Lambda Phi
340357.summary: Delta Lambda Phi is a social fraternity for progressive men and members of the LGBTQ+ community
340357.description_html:
In 1986, Delta Lambda Phi Social Fraternity was founded by gay men for all men. For over twenty-five years, Delta Lambda Phi has offered these men the opportunity to lead, to grow, and to form lifelong bonds of friendship with other like-minded men. 

 

We are the Delta Lambda Phi Provisional Chapter at Virginia Tech  

 

Motto: "Making our presence make a difference" 

Values: Excellence, Integrity, Diversity, Service, Friendship, Justice, Commitment

65693.name: Delta Omicron, Gamma Mu Chapter
65693.summary: Delta Omicron is a co-ed professional music organization. Our mission is to promote and support excellence in music and musicianship through a variety of service projects and musical events that benefit the campus and surrounding community.
65693.description_html: Delta Omicron's goals include fostering fellowship through music, developing character and leadership, encouragement of excellence in scholastic attainment and performance, and providing a place for musicians to come together in their love of music.

69016.name: Delta Psi Nu Local Leadership Fraternity
69016.summary: Delta Psi Nu is a local co-ed fraternity for undergraduate students founded in 2011 to inspire leadership within its brothers and contribute to the local community of the New River Valley area.
69016.description_html:
Delta Psi Nu service and leadership club is back at Virginia Tech! DYN is excited to offer new service events this semester, collaborating with many organizations including Blacksburg Interfaith Food Pantry, VT Community Gardens, Pathways Free Specialty Clinic, and other VT clubs.
 
Whether you're on a pre-health track or another major, we provide an excellent opportunity for accessible volunteer opportunities, leadership roles, and event planning experiences. Contact Lynn Mawaldi at lynnmawaldi@vt.edu for further questions.

64108.name: Delta Sigma Phi - Kappa Delta Chapter
64108.summary: Delta Sigma Phi is a premiere social fraternity at Virginia Tech dedicated to the development of better men and better leaders brought together by the values of Culture, Harmony, and Friendship.
64108.description_html: Delta Sigma Phi is a premiere social fraternity at Virginia Tech dedicated to the development of better men and better leaders brought together by the values of Culture, Harmony, and Friendship. We are active on campus not only through Greek life, but also in academic communities, sports, philanthropies and more.

69017.name: Delta Sigma Pi
69017.description_html:
ΔΣΠ believes in upholding the highest standards of professionalism, service, and scholarship while enhancing people skills to improve individuals as a whole in their personal and professional encounters.

 

Professional: For over 100 years, Delta Sigma Pi has encouraged, supported, and shaped the professional goals and personal aspirations of thousands of members. It is the foremost professional fraternity for men and women pursuing business careers. Delta Sigma Pi has brothers placed at top companies all across the country.

 

Service: Delta Sigma Pi is dedicated to making a difference because business has both a unique opportunity and a compelling duty to contribute to the larger community. Frequent involvement in the community instills deep feelings of brotherhood while developing business skills.

 

Scholarship: Delta Sigma Pi funds educational programs through the Delta Sigma Pi Leadership Foundation, which provides financial assistance for scholarships, leadership development and training, and personal and professional improvement. Funded by individual and corporate contributions, the Leadership Foundation offers many levels of participation.


Social: Delta Sigma Pi facilitates social activity among students, the community, and business organizations. The network of members around the world provides a wealth of business resources, professional contacts, continuing education opportunities, and community support to even the newest business graduate.

 

Come find your brotherhood and better yourself personally, professionally, and socially!

64659.name: Delta Upsilon
64659.summary: Delta Upsilon is committed to building better men through our four founding principles. Delta Upsilon is proud to be the first non-secret and non-hazing International Fraternity. We are so excited to be back at Virginia Tech!
64659.description_html:
Mailing Address:
117 New Hall West (0428)
Blacksburg, VA 24061

Our Chapter: https://fsl.vt.edu/organizations/chapters/delta-upsilon.html

286737.name: Department of Fish and Wildlife Conservation
286737.summary: Academic department offering a Degree in Fish & Wildlife Conservation, with majors in Fresh Water Fish Conservation, Marine Fish Conservation and Wildlife Conservation.
286737.description_html: Academic unit offering degree in Fish & Wildlife Conservation, with Majors in Freshwater Fish Conservation, Marine Fish Conservation, Wildlife Conservation and a Pathways Minor in Biodiversity Conservation.

127296.name: Department of Philosophy
127296.summary: We are the Department of Philosophy @ VT.
127296.description_html: We teach courses in Philosophy, and sponsor the majors in Philosophy, and Philosophy Pre-Med track, and the minors in Philosophy, and PPE (Philosophy, Politics, and Economics).

160101.name: Department of Plant Pathology, Physiology, & Weed Science
160101.summary: We engage in innovative research in plant protection and productivity, provide world-class academic programs and training for students, and deliver solutions to agricultural problems to stakeholders.
160101.description_html: The Department of Plant Pathology, Physiology and Weed Science consists of 22 tenured or tenure track faculty at our Blacksburg location or one of five Agricultural Research Extension Centers in the Commonwealth.

414619.name: Dermatology Interest Group
414619.summary: Dermatology Interest Group at VTCSOM promotes student interest in dermatology through education, community outreach, and advocacy for skin health.
414619.description_html: The Dermatology Interest Group at VTCSOM aims to spark student interest in dermatology, provide educational opportunities, promote community engagement, and raise awareness about skin health, sun safety, and the diverse career paths in dermatology.

379999.name: Design
379999.summary: We are a South Asian American Christian Community that seeks to Honor Christ and celebrate desi culture.
379999.description_html: We are a student-led ministry movement that meet weekly for Bible Studies. We also have different opportunities to socialize together throughout the year. Our goal is to bring together South Asian/South Asian American students and grow in our walk with God and ultimately build friendships with other South Asian believers. We are dedicated to  Honoring Christ as well as celebrating Desi Culture. If you are looking to explore faith and find a good community. This is a space for you!

70430.name: Design Build Fly
70430.summary: Design Build Fly at Virginia Tech is an engineering design team that competes in the annual AIAA Design, Build, Fly competition sponsored by Raytheon and Textron. In the 2024 competition our team placed 4th out of 106 teams!
70430.description_html:
Design Build Fly at Virginia Tech is an engineering design team that competes in the annual AIAA Design, Build, Fly competition sponsored by Raytheon and Textron. The challenge is to design, build, and fly an RC aircraft in accordance with the year's rules then compete in the competition either at Wichita, Kansas or Tucson, Arizona. You can see this year's rules here: http://www.aiaadbf.org/

 

The team is split into seven unique sub-teams, each responsible for a different aspect of the engineering process: Aerodynamics, Stability and Control, Structures, Electronics and Propulsion, Systems, CAD, and Manufacturing. Members are encouraged to assist in any (or all) sub-teams they find interesting.

 

Students of any major are welcome to join, and there is no formal time requirement; whatever you put into the team is what you'll get out of it. Join our team's Slack to find more information on how to get involved. Click here to join!

382608.name: Destructive Arena Robotics Team at Virginia Tech
382608.summary: DART is a robotics team focused on the iterative design, rapid development, and testing of combat robots in weight classes of 3lb and lower for competitions year-round. With a focus in reparability and design for assembly, we are open to all engineers.
382608.description_html:
DART is a design team focused on iterative design, experimentation, project planning, rapid development, testing, reparability, and design for assembly. We create robots at various weight classes for year-round robot fighting competitions that will serve to test our robots, guide our iterative design process, and test our modularity and reparability. Ultimately, we are a quick-moving team emphasizing our process of planning, modeling, building, and competing, while trying to emulate expectations from industry.

 

DART is a design team focused on iterative design, experimentation, project planning, rapid development, testing, reparability, and design for assembly. Our purpose is to deliver small battle robots with scrutiny on a set 6-week schedule, with in-depth analysis within each design cycle and data analysis on the organizational scale between iterations and designs. We create these robots at various weight classes for year-round robot fighting competitions (one or two each Fall and each Spring semester) that ultimately serve to test our robots, guide our iterative design process, and test our modularity and reparability. We are a quick-moving team emphasizing all aspects of a design cycle.

68104.name: Dhamaal at Virginia Tech
68104.summary: Since 2004, Dhamaal at Virginia Tech has been a co-ed competitive Raas/Garba dance team. Dhamaal works to promote the rich culture and vibrant traditions of Indian dance while representing the Hokie spirit in all their performances.
68104.description_html: We are Virginia Tech's premiere Garba/Raas team. Dhamaal is a co-ed competitive dance team that strives to bring attention and pay homage to the garba/raas folk dance of our ancestors. Founded in 2004, Dhamaal at VT works to promote the rich culture and vibrant traditions of Indian dance. Our team showcases their energy and love for garba/raas though on-campus events, various performances and competitions. We would love to share our energy, dance, and passion with you!

375995.name: Digerati Living-Learning Community
375995.summary: Digerati is an interdisciplinary living learning community located in Pritchard Hall for students with career interests in various aspects of information technology such as computer science, computer engineering, business information technology, and cybe
375995.description_html:
Digerati students are required to take first-year classes to learn and practice project management approaches commonly utilized in professional information technology environments and will gain certifications that are commonly held by IT professionals. Students will utilize professional project management practices as they collaborate on academic, career, outreach, and social experiences associated with the community. As such, the community will require students to actively participate in the aforementioned activities as they are intertwined with course-related content.

We invite students to join the Digerati family and experience an inclusive culture of support focused on the academic success, and the career preparation of emerging IT professionals.

74554.name: Dining Services
74554.summary:
Part of the Division of Student Affairs, Virginia Tech Dining Services operates the award winning dining facilities at Virginia Tech.
For more information visit our website at www.dining.vt.edu.
74554.description_html: VTDining is ranked among the nation’s best, providing our Hokies with service committed to innovation, satisfaction, & chicken parm. 🦃🧡

96970.name: Disc Golf Club at Virginia Tech
96970.summary: The organization is intended to congregate and expand the disc golf community at Virginia Tech. There will be meetings throughout the semester that are open to all skill levels, as well as a team of advanced players that compete in collegiate tournament.
96970.description_html: Our main goal as an organization is to congregate and expand the disc golf community at VT. We plan to put together certain events throughout the school year for all skill-level players to compete in. We also want to put together a competitive team of advanced players to compete in collegiate events with a goal of qualifying for and attending the national championship tournament, which is held in Rock Hill, SC.

403397.name: Disney Club at Virginia Tech
403397.summary: Providing students with valuable insights into career paths and professional opportunities at the Disney company, facilitated by current students with firsthand experience. Additionally, the organization serves as an engaging social hub for Disney fans!
403397.description_html:
The Disney Club at Virginia Tech is a student-led organization dedicated to helping members explore career paths and professional opportunities within The Walt Disney Company. These events are led by students who have completed the Disney College Program and now serve as Program Representatives, bringing firsthand experience and insight to the organization.

In addition to professional development, the organization also serves as a vibrant social hub for Disney fans on campus! Whether you're passionate about animation, hospitality, marketing, or just love all things Disney, this organization offers something for everyone!

62813.name: Diversity Network
62813.summary: Virginia Tech’s hub for diversity-focused opportunities and early career development.
62813.description_html: The mission of Diversity Network is to empower and support students in their professional journey. Our organization is dedicated to bridging the gap between talented students from diverse backgrounds and the vast array of internship opportunities available across various industries. We aim to create an environment where every student, regardless of their background, feels included and has equal access to the tools, resources, and networks necessary to succeed in the competitive world of jobs.

177478.name: Division of Information Technology
177478.summary: We are responsible for data networks, internet and telecom services, computing & software, enterprise-level business services, classroom technology, IT security/identity mgmt, collaboration platforms, helpdesk services, outreach, and customer support
177478.description_html: We are responsible for data networks, internet and telecom services, computing & software, enterprise-level business services, classroom technology, IT security/identity mgmt, collaboration platforms, helpdesk services, outreach, and customer support

349807.name: Donaldson Brown Hall Community
349807.summary: Residents and Friends of Donaldson Brown Hall.

414615.name: Dr. Lorna Breen Heroes Foundation Medical Student Coalition
414615.summary: We advocate for medical student well-being by raising awareness, providing education, and advancing solutions to address burnout and mental health.
414615.description_html: The DLBHF MSC advocates for medical student well-being by raising awareness, providing education, and driving change around burnout and mental health. We aim to foster a culture of support, resilience, and career satisfaction in medicine.

294046.name: DreamCorps chapter at Virginia Tech
294046.summary: We dedicate to spread the awareness of education in rural China on the VT campus. By connecting our members to different domains of human services programs in our community, we want to be inspired to be more involved members of society.
294046.description_html: DreamCorps International is a non-profit organization that is dedicated to helping to solve education inequality through promoting reading in schools in rural China. Founded by a group of Chinese scholars in North Carolina. There are 11 chapters in universities in the US and Canada; the DreamCorps at Virginia Tech chapter will be serving children in rural China by bringing awareness of the situation in rural China and recruiting volunteers for summer service trips. More importantly, we are here to help our student body to become more responsible social members by serving our community.

176121.name: Drone Racing Team
176121.summary: 2X collegiate champions - 2024, 2025! The VTDRT is an organization dedicated to teaching students how to build and fly FPV drones. We compete nationally as members of the Collegiate Drone Racing Association. Join us at the Drone Park on Sundays 12-4pm
176121.description_html:
Started in 2016 by two guys and a dream, the Drone Racing Team at Virginia Tech strives to teach interested students how to build, fly, and race FPV drones at speeds reaching over 100mph. We compete nationally with the Collegiate Drone Racing Association, and are cuurently two time reigning collegiate champions, winning in 2024 and 2025.

If you're interested in applying mechanical, electrical, and aerospace concepts through the designing, building, programming, and flying of FPV racing drones, you're in the right place. You do not need any experience (or a drone) to join the team. We've got you covered! Join our discord (https://discord.gg/wX2hp66ppC) or dm us on Instagram (@VTDRT) if you have any questions.

76211.name: DSA HR
76211.description_html: Provide Human Resources Support to the Division

85748.name: DSA Muliticultural Competence Committee
85748.summary: The DSA-MCC has been charged to develop a framework for cultural competency education and training within the Division of Student Affairs.

84584.name: DSA Student Employee Development Forum
84584.summary: The purpose of the DSA Student Employee Development Forum is to provide a network of resources for DSA employees who provide training and development to student employees who work for the Division of Student Affairs.
84584.description_html: The SEDF is a network of professionals who provide training and development to DSA student employees.

420445.name: Duck Pond Club at Virginia Tech
420445.summary: Duck Pond Club: Where the Good Times Quack!
420445.description_html:
Tired of the usual campus chaos? Come relax with the Duck Pond Club! We're all about appreciating the simple joys of the local duck pond—be it the friendly quacks of our feathered residents, the soothing sounds of the water, or just a great place to hang out with friends. We organize regular meet-ups for casual wildlife watching and peaceful conversation. Whether you're an ornithology major or just need a chill spot, join us for some guaranteed good vibes and great company!

Anyone who loves nature, enjoys a relaxing atmosphere, or wants to make friends outside the classroom can join our Club.

98906.name: Ducks Unlimited Chapter at Virginia Tech
98906.summary: Ducks Unlimited conserves, restores, and manages wetlands and associated habitats for North America's waterfowl. The Chapter at Virginia Tech focuses on fundraising to support National DU's conservation efforts.
98906.description_html: Ducks Unlimited's vision is to support wetlands in order to fill the skies with waterfowl today, tomorrow, and for the years to come. Through fundraising banquets, engaging socials, and your membership, our chapter will help achieve this vision by supporting our national chapter. We encourage anyone to join us at a meeting, regardless of experience or knowledge, because conservation is something that impacts everyone everyday whether we know it or not.

236390.name: e-NABLE at Virginia Tech
236390.summary: e-NABLE at Virginia Tech is a charitable, design-based club that creates assistive devices for children, adults, and pets in need.
236390.description_html:
e-NABLE at Virginia Tech

e-NABLE at Virginia Tech is a charitable, design-based club that creates a variety of assistive devices for community members that live in the New River Valley and beyond. In the 2023-24 academic year, some of the projects we completed includes:

- A prosthetic to help a community member's dog with a missing leg walk better

- Keyguard guides for iPads to assist students with special needs in communicating more easily

- A custom bike to help a student with dyspraxia enjoy riding with her parents

- A proof of concept for a low cost electrically powered prosthetic hand

- A 3-D printable gun lock and an eyedrop assistive device for the elderly

Our club employs additive manufacturing, 3D modeling, and engineering design skills to create a variety of devices that significantly aid both local and global partners.

We collaborate with the Biomedical Engineering and Mechanics Department, the Carilion Clinic Center Center for Simulation, Research and Patient Safety, and the Virginia Department of Education’s Training and Technical Assistance Center.

Skills You Will Develop:

- SolidWorks 3D modeling

- Prototyping abilities

- Research and Development (R&D) skills

- Networking

- Arduino programming

- Formal presentation skills and poster presentation skills

We occasionally offer design competitions and design-a-thons for select members who demonstrate exceptional teamwork and design skills. We also support and encourage teams who have performed exceptionally to present at prestigious conferences such as the National Collegiate Research Conference at Harvard and the National Conference of Undergraduate Research. However, all members will have opportunities for professional development, design workshops, and listening to guest speakers.

Join Us:

Experience with CAD and 3D printing is helpful but not required; we will teach you everything you need to know. We welcome students from all majors, as diverse perspectives are valuable in the engineering process.

If you're interested in joining or would like more information, you can contact one of our officers, email us, or stop by our meetings once they begin in September. We look forward to meeting you!

Sign Up and Follow Us:

Copy and paste the link to sign up, follow our Instagram, and join our email list: linktr.ee/enable.hokie

 *Or scan the QR Code found in the gallery.

137206.name: Earthquake Engineering Research Institute
137206.summary: EERI is a national, nonprofit, technical society dedicated to reducing earthquake risk by advancing the science and practice of earthquake engineering. Participation ranges from officer roles, seismic design team members and general body members.
137206.description_html:
We are representing a student chapter of the Earthquake Engineering Research Institute (EERI) headquartered at th Department of Civil Engineering at Virginia Tech. Our mission is to promote earthquake engineering research and education among students, communities, and industries through:
  • Improving the earthquake engineering understanding
  • Engaging students in earthquake engineering
  • Preparing a ground for students for networking with earthquake engineering professionals
  • Interacting with industry
  • Exposure to seismic design through our Seismic Design Competition Team
Student members of EERI gain the valuable experience of interacting with a professional organization, which is an important part of their future as earthquake professionals.

64994.name: East Campbell Hall Community
64994.summary: Residents and Friends of East Campbell Hall

349808.name: East Eggleston Hall Community
349808.summary: Residents and Friends of East Eggleston

97172.name: Economics Club at Virginia Tech
97172.summary: The economics club is a place for students of all majors with an interest in economics to come and learn more about the subject and connect with other like minded students interested in economics at Virginia Tech.
97172.description_html:
The mission of the Economics Club is to create a space for all students interested in Economics to discuss and collaborate with each other as well as give students the opportunity to connect with faculty and guest speakers. Further, the Economics Club will serve as a hub for students interested in the Economics department and/or individual Economics courses to learn more about them. The Economics Club will connect students with potential jobs and/or research opportunities and will provide a variety of professional and social events.

To learn more about us and our future events follow our Instagram @economicsclubvt and join our GroupMe! This is where we post all important updates and meeting times.

344671.name: Economics Graduate Student Association
344671.summary: EGSA is a student organization formed by graduate students of Economics. The main goal of EGSA is to communicate needs of graduate students in the department.
344671.description_html:
EGSA is a student organization formed by graduate students of Economics. All current and future graduate students with an Economics major can become EGSA members. The main goal of EGSA is to communicate the needs of graduate students in the department and provide the necessary support for them to pursue their educational purposes, such as participating in conferences, workshops and attending the review sessions. Also, we would like to help students accomplish their research goals by inviting speakers.

We have plans to get help from the Department Head and Graduate Director to discuss the job market topics with students.

115010.name: EDM Club at Virginia Tech
115010.summary: EDM Club is a social organization/community created for those who are passionate about electronic music. We organize events to enjoy music, make connections, and create a tight-knit community here at Virginia Tech.
115010.description_html:
The EDM Club at Virginia Tech is a social organization/community created for those who are passionate about electronic music. We organize events to enjoy music, make connections, and create a tight-knit community here at Virginia Tech. Along with this, we travel as a group to different concerts and music festivals. Everyone is invited to join!

Discord: https://discord.gg/fXpSct4p

Instagram: @EDMClubatVT

82561.name: Egyptian Student Association
82561.summary: This is an organization aimed at building a collaborative Egyptian community that supports its members and promotes Egyptian culture to the Virginia Tech community.
82561.description_html: Egyptian Student Organization is an organization dedicated to gathering the at-large Egyptian community at Virginia Tech and connecting them with one another, while simultaneously celebrating and sharing Egyptian culture with all members of the community.

374062.name: Elevate Magazine
374062.summary: Elevate Magazine is a student-run publication dedicated to culture, fashion, and the arts. Elevate Magazine's mission is to stimulate the minds of our communities, promote a love of culture, and share a desire for creative expression.
374062.description_html:
Elevate Magazine is a student-run publication dedicated to culture, fashion, and the arts. Elevate Magazine's mission is to stimulate the minds of our communities, promote a love of culture, and share a desire for creative expression. Alongside this mission, we strive to acknowledge and spotlight academic and extracurricular accomplishments within our community. Elevate acts to lower the division between marginalized groups and create solidarity between our respective communities. 

 

The publication will accomplish this mission by creating a magazine showcasing arts and culture within the ethnic minority population in the Virginia Tech community. The publication will include creative and journalistic writing, photography, all art forms, and graphic design. Alongside the publication, there is a blog consisting of writers from minority communities on campus. The blog's content ranges from social commentary to lifestyle content. Participants of Elevate are encouraged to devote themselves to creative expression and authenticity. 

 

Creatives of all trades have a place in Elevate including writers, artists, photographers, videographers, graphic designers, models, and makeup artists. Aside from creatives, Elevate Magazine also welcomes business, financial, and public relations professionals.

362504.name: Embroiderers' Guild of America at Virginia Tech
362504.summary: We are an organization promoting a creative and healthy way to destress through the art of embroidery!
362504.description_html:
The Embroiderers' Guild of America at Virginia Tech is chapter of the National organization, Embroiderers' Guild of America (EGA). EGA's mission is to preserve and promote needle arts. EGA at Virginia Tech believes in this mission while also focusing on using needle arts as a creative and healthy way to destress as college students.

We welcome students of all experience levels to join us! We provide lessons during each meeting along with extra time to practice and create works of art! Here is our linktree to our email list, instagram, discord, etc. EGA@VT🪡🧵 | Instagram, Facebook | Linktree

If you have any questions please email: vtechega@gmail.com

414620.name: Emergency Medicine Interest Group
414620.summary: EMIG fosters interest in EM through mentorship, hands-on training, networking, and skill-building for future emergency medicine physicians.
414620.description_html: Provide opportunities for medical students to develop essential emergency medicine skills, engage in simulation training, network with emergency physicians, and explore the dynamic, fast-paced nature of the specialty.

369825.name: Engineering Volleyball League at Virginia Tech
369825.summary: We run a volleyball league in the Spring semester where teams representing each major compete to crown the best engineering major. This is meant to be a fun environment for people of all skill levels to have fun and meet people.
369825.description_html: Teams from each engineering major get the opportunity to play against each other every Friday during the spring semester. Our league culminates in a tournament to crown the best major and win a trophy for your department. All skill levels are welcome to play. We are looking to create a fun and inviting atmosphere for students to de-stress from classes and meet other engineers. Please join us on discord for news and updates here: https://discord.gg/u44EAdPpQG

69161.name: Engineers in Action at Virginia Tech
69161.summary: To advance students and empower underdeveloped communities through bridge building that will create sustainable economic change.
69161.description_html: Engineers in Action (formerly known as Bridges to Prosperity) at Virginia Tech is a student led service organization that seeks to empower developing communities through the design and construction of footbridges thereby advancing community public works, economic prosperity, and community access to schools, medicine, jobs, and markets. Engineers in Action seeks to advance the lives of each student involved by providing an opportunity to broaden cultural perspectives, gain hands-on professional experience, and by allowing each student to use their own education to serve others who are less fortunate.

69147.name: Engineers Without Borders
69147.summary: EWB supports community-driven development programs worldwide by collaborating with local partners to design and implement sustainable engineering projects, while creating transformative experiences and responsible leaders.
69147.description_html:
Hello from Engineers Without Borders—Virginia Tech! EWB is a student chapter of the national organization Engineers Without Borders. Our mission is to partner with disadvantaged areas to improve their quality of life through the implementation of environmentally, equitably, and economically sustainable engineering projects, while developing internationally responsible engineers and engineering students through education, encouragement, and experience.

 

Our organization independently operates and executes 3 design projects: Uganda, Kenya Bridge, and Kenya Water! Our members typically meet with their teams once a week to discuss, plan, design, coordinate, and eventually travel for assessment and implementation of our own projects. 

 

What this really comes down to is that we are a group of students - all students (not just those in engineering) - who are trying to assist our fellow members of the local and global community as best we can. By helping out in our community, we gain many skills and have wonderful unique experiences. 

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IdPZoLDn9jc

 

To get additional information about the organization or the next meeting, join on this page to get on our email list, and email willtuck@vt.edu if you need additional help.  If you have any questions click on the Contact button above and send us an email. We will respond to you usually within 24 hours.

 

Kenya Water Project:

The Kenya Project is the newest project in our chapter. It is a water access and sanitation project for a community in Western Kenya. We have already implemented a hand pump in the Masara Steel Community in Migori County. We are working towards monitoring the well and building a second well. Eventually we want to make both wells solar powered for easier use/access. This project has brought clean and accessible water to the community and we are continuing to help improve their situation. 

Uganda Project:

The Uganda Project team has been working on providing electricity to rural communities in Uganda by implementing small scale solar systems for 13 years. In August of 2019, a group of five students from the Uganda Project along with Professional Engineer Phil Powell and KBJW Vice President Brent Johnson, two members of the Central Virginia EWB Chapter, traveled to rural southwest Uganda. There, the team worked at St. Michael’s Primary School to help finish the installation of a 10-panel solar power system. The system powered the lighting around campus and a 10 student computer lab that was also installed by the VT Uganda Team. The team also surveyed St. Michael's and uncovered their challenges with supplying clean water. In 2022, a 4kW solar power system was installed at a second school, Kshek Jr. School. It provides indoor lighting and outdoor security lighting to the schools grounds. In 2023 we are working towards water implementation at Kshek to bring them clean water, which is healthier then the current turbid water flowing directly from the River Atar to the schools reservoir. 

 

Kenya Bridge

New project for 2025-2026! Rebuilding a bridge that connects two rural villages.

69301.name: Engineers' Forum Magazine
69301.summary: Engineers' Forum is a paid student magazine publication team that has been in operation for the past 30 years. We write articles that highlight the latest engineering and technology trends, with a focus on the Virginia Tech student engineering experience
69301.description_html: Engineers' Forum Magazine highlights the exciting engineering-related activities, organizations, and events happening on the Virginia Tech campus and throughout the Blacksburg community. We hire undergraduate and graduate authors, photographers, and designers and seek to give them an outlet to develop unique skillsets that can differentiate them. We also seek to help publish groups around campus who wish to share more information with a diverse community of passionate engineering students.

109179.name: English Club at Virginia Tech
109179.summary: The English Club at Virginia Tech is for students interested in English, whether that be writing or reading, to come together to make friends and share interests. We hope to encourage involvement in the department and the Blacksburg community.
109179.description_html:
VT English Club is for students interested in English, whether that be writing or reading, to come together to make friends and share interests. We hope to encourage involvement in the department and the Blacksburg community. 

The English Club at VT is for students interested in all things English, whether that be writing, reading, or simply coming together to make friends and share interests.

 

In the English Club, we plan various excursions and events for our members to enjoy together, creating lasting friendships, fostering community, and promoting engagement. Our unique contributions include finding opportunities for members to get involved in the English department–whether it's volunteering for events or collaborating with faculty members. We are a service-oriented organization eager to serve the local community through activities such as collaborating with local bookstores and providing students with educational and professional information sessions through our recurring guest speaker nights. We also participate in fun events such as hosting movie nights, book clubs, writing workshops, and other English-related activities during our bi-monthly meetings. As students of Virginia Tech’s English Department, and members of the greater Blacksburg community, with our work we hope to encourage involvement across the entire community.

352399.name: English Graduate Student Organization
352399.summary: The English Graduate Student Organization is a group for English Graduate Students who are interesting in networking and supporting each other during their time here at Virginia Tech.
352399.description_html: The English Graduate Student Organization (EGSO) is a community organization for English department graduate students across all programs (MA, MFA, and PhD) at Virginia Tech. EGSO provides opportunities for social engagement, fellowship, and collegiality throughout each semester, with the goal of supporting students department-wide.

69130.name: Entrepreneurship Club at Virginia Tech
69130.summary: The Entrepreneurship Club at Virginia Tech brings together the most creative and action-oriented students to build world changing ideas. Please join the newsletter at eclubvt.com to keep up-to-date with our events.
69130.description_html:
Join Us.

The purpose of Entrepreneurship Club is simple: we create a community of individuals who are comfortable and confident in starting projects and building ideas.

We provide connections, knowledge, and inspiration for students to get started. Connections to other like minded-students, plus local and visiting entrepreneurs.  Knowledge about entrepreneurship and business principles. Inspiration and encouragement that it can be done!

Our typical initiatives include Treks to innovative cities nationwide, tours of local startups and progressive organizations, workshops to develop relevant skills, Fireside Chats with successful entrepreneurs, pitch competitions, networking, and social events with other student entrepreneurs.  

Virginia Tech has had a long history of producing great startups: Ozmo, Shade Inc., Modea, Webmail.us (acquired by Rackspace in 2007), TORC Robotics, Taaluma Totes (seen on Shark Tank), Koofers.com, SkillCapped, Mindsense, Heyo, VirtualU, CardIsle, Follow My Vote, and LawnStarter to name a few. We want this list to be longer.

Click this link to become a member.

66551.name: Environmental Coalition
66551.summary: Meetings are held every Wednesday at 7pm in Seitz 300! Environmental Coalition is an organization made up of student leaders dedicated to advocating for a more sustainable future at Virginia Tech, the NRV, and various communities.
66551.description_html:
Environmental Coalition (EC) at Virginia Tech is a student-run, horizontal organization dedicated to empowering and educating VT students about environmental issues. Our mission is to advocate for a sustainable future by uniting, educating and motivating community members to serve at the local, state, and national levels through promoting sustainability, fostering environmental awareness, and enabling positive change on the Virginia Tech campus and surrounding Blacksburg area. Anyone is welcome and encouraged to join us in our weekly meetings and any other event we hold with an attitude of mindfulness and respect for each other's being and ideas. There are no dues to be a member nor financial requirements to attend events.

In the past EC has devoted itself to pushing the administration to create and update its Climate Action Commitment, a campaign to preserve Stadium Woods, The Big Plant, and much more. Currently, EC is working on multiple campaigns; a fossil fuel divestment campaign, awareness on the Radford Arsenal along the bank of the New River, and the development of an impactful Earth Week.

420446.name: Environmental Data Science Club at Virginia Tech
420446.summary: The Environmental Data Science Club builds community and provides professional skills & opportunities for students interested in the intersection of environmental science, data analysis, and technology.
420446.description_html: The mission of the Environmental Data Science Club is to build a community for students interested in the intersection of environmental science, data analysis, and technology. Our goal is to bridge the gap between environmentally focused programs and technical data science organizations by providing a space where students can develop both skill sets. We aim to help members strengthen their technical abilities through workshops, project collaborations, and discussions about research and career opportunities while also creating connections through social events and networking. Ultimately, the club seeks to prepare students, whether Environmental Data Science majors or not, to use data-driven approaches to address real-world environmental challenges and to create a supportive, interdisciplinary community within Virginia Tech.

69724.name: Epsilon Sigma Alpha
69724.summary: ESA is a co-ed service and leadership fraternity founded at VT in 2007. We are Good Friends, Good Work, and Good Times. We create activities and support causes that let us surround ourselves with welcoming, positive people who enjoy making a difference.
69724.description_html: Epsilon Sigma Alpha is all about service! Here at Virginia Tech we are surrounded by awesome people who want to help out in the community, and we want to help them do that! We are co-ed service fraternity that focuses on helping out in our local community and fundraising for our primary philanthropy, St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital. We are a close-knit group that also strives to build a sense of community and camaraderie. We also attend educational opportunities and other outreach events in order to encourage our members to better themselves. If you are interested in service, making some friends, or getting more involved in the community, please consider joining ESA!

420447.name: Equine Medicine Club
420447.summary: We hope to educate aspiring and developing students to pursue a career in equine medicine and promote equine welfare.
420447.description_html: We hope to educate aspiring and developing students to pursue a career in equine medicine and promote equine welfare. Our organization will accomplish this by educating members on equine husbandry and treatment, and discussing equine-related health topics. We will also help students explore pathways within Equine Veterinary Medicine by connecting them with professionals and offering developmental opportunities within the field.

122404.name: Eritrean-Ethiopian Student Association at Virginia Tech
122404.summary: EESA is an organization that allows students to remain connected to their Eritrean/Ethiopian heritage no matter how far from home they have traveled to attend VT. With opportunities for socializing and networking, we want students to thrive.
122404.description_html: Eritrean/Ethiopian culture is both rich and diverse. It consists of traditions from many tribes, different languages, and a variety of foods. The purpose of EESA is to share this culture with those who are and aren't familiar with it. With members consisting of American and international students, we are a space that provides support for academic endeavors through guidance and networking opportunities with VT alumni. A space that hopefully feels like home for students.

69149.name: Eta Lambda Chapter of The Omega Psi Phi Fraternity Inc.
69149.summary: Omega Psi Phi is a National Pan Hellenic organization founded on the campus of Howard University on November 17, 1911. Our cardinal principles are Manhood, Scholarship, Perseverance, and Uplift. Eta Lambda was chartered here on September 22, 1979.
69149.description_html:
The History of Eta Lambda

In the winter of 1976, Barry Griffin approached several other black male students about bringing an Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc. chapter to the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University (Virginia Tech) campus in Blacksburg, Virginia.  Many fraternity leaders did not wish to travel so far for only a few interested individuals.  After meeting with Barry Griffin, Dr. William Young, a biology professor and a brother (Bro.) initiated at Rho chapter (Johnson C. Smith University), agreed to become the chapter advisor.

Finally, in October of 1977, Third District Representative Bro. Charles Chambliss held the first Smoker on Virginia Tech’s campus.  The interesting aspect of the first open Smoker was more women attended than men.  At the Smoker, Bro. Chambliss told all interested men to present their case for the establishment of a chapter during the 1978 Third District meeting in Natural Bridge, Va.  Three young earnest individuals: Barry Griffin, Stan Harris and Peter Holmes set out on a road trip to seek Omega.  After a two-hour journey, Bro. Chambliss met with them and told them he would discuss their case with the Third District leadership.  After traveling two hours, the enthusiastic undergrads wanted to plead their own case! Bro. Chambliss told them to go back to Blacksburg and wait.  They left with great anticipation.

Before the end of the following spring quarter in 1978, Bro. Alfred Prunty of the Gamma Alpha Chapter in Roanoke, Virginia contacted the three enthusiasts.  He informed them that they needed to get all paperwork together for a fall 1978 pledge line.  In October 1978, Gamma Alpha inducted Rick Monroe, Stan Harris, Barry Griffin, Peter Holmes, D.K. Brockett, Darrell Davis and Wayne Robinson into its Lampados Club.  The line name was Genesis.

On January 26, 1979, Stan Harris, Barry Griffin, Peter Holmes and D.K. Brockett crossed the burning sands.  On January 30, 1979, Rick Monroe was initiated.  Though three more members were necessary to create a charter, the new brothers conducted all fraternity business under the name The Omegas of Blacksburg.  The officers were: Bro. Barry Griffin, Basileus; Bro. Peter Holmes, Vice-Basileus; Bro. Stan Harris, Keeper of Records and Seals; and Bro. D. K. Brockett, Keeper of Finance.

The first pledge line of the Omegas of Blacksburg was the duo of Boo-Boo and Sir Laugh A Lot otherwise known as Dennis Scott and Larry Fallen.  They were initiated into the fold on May 27, 1979.  On September 22, 1979, Wayne Robinson, was initiated.  The Omegas of Blacksburg now had the eight men necessary to officially establish an undergraduate chapter.  Third District Representative Bro. Kenny Brown officially chartered the Eta Lambda Chapter of Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc. on September 22, 1979.  The first chapter officers were: Bro. Stanley Alvin Harris, Basileus; Bro. Barry Ivan Griffin, Vice-Basileus; Bro. Peter Everett Holmes, Keeper of Records and Seals; Bro. Donald Keith Brockett, Keeper of Finance and Bro. Ricky David Monroe, Keeper of the Peace.

68689.name: Eta Sigma Delta
68689.description_html: Eta Sigma Delta is the Hospitality Honor Society and invites students to become members once they have reached minimum 60 credit hours (50% of total credit hours)  and have met eligibility criteria. These criteria consist of an overall GPA of at least 3.0, be a distinguished graduate student, or meet the exception noted. The goal of this organization is to promote academic excellence and to provide professional development opportunities in the Hospitality and Tourism industry.

388728.name: Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church Campus Ministry at Virginia Tech
388728.summary: Join EOTC Campus Ministry for transformative spiritual growth, deepening your faith, and building meaningful fellowship on campus. Embrace the journey with us as we explore our shared beliefs and values. All are welcome to join our community!
388728.description_html: The Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church Campus Ministry at Virginia Tech is a community dedicated to spreading the gospel and fostering spiritual growth and deepening the understanding of the Ethiopian Orthodox faith among students on campus. Rooted in the ancient traditions of the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church, our organization provides a welcoming space for students to explore and strengthen their faith journey. Through regular gatherings, prayer meetings, and educational activities, we aim to empower our members to embrace their religious identity and deepen their connection to God. Whether you're a devout follower of the Ethiopian Orthodox Church or someone seeking to learn more about our faith, we invite you to join us as we seek to grow together in faith, fellowship, and spiritual enrichment.

387523.name: European & Transatlantic Affairs Organization
387523.summary: The European & Transatlantic Affairs Organization aims to facilitate a community of students interested in European events through research, student-led discussion, experiential learning opportunities, and networking opportunities
387523.description_html:
Interested in international affairs? Looking for opportunities to travel, conduct research, and represent Virginia Tech at national and international conferences? If yes, consider joining ETAO!

 

The European & Transatlantic Affairs Organization (ETAO) aims to inform students about current events and historical relations within the transatlantic region while also preparing our members for careers in international and foreign affairs. Working directly with the Center of European and Transatlantic Studies at Virginia Tech, ETAO prepares students for a variety of experiental learning activites and competitions (Model NATO, EU Simulation, and the Schuman Challenge) and offers its members unique opportunites to increase their knowledge of the region through "internships" at CEUTSS.

 

As the world becomes increasingly unpredictable, it is essential for students interested in global affairs to understand the transatlantic relationship between the EU and the U.S.—one of the strongest partnerships in the world.

101968.name: Eventing at Virginia Tech
101968.summary: The purpose of Eventing at Virginia Tech is to promote the education and training of Eventing team riders, and encourage our members to compete and grow in their equine experience and knowledge.
101968.description_html: The purpose of our club is to function as a team and participate in local horse trials and sanctioned intercollegiate horse trials, as well foster a community and support system of eventers, show jumpers, and dressage riders, in college and graduate school, supporting each other through encouragement and education.

157501.name: Exodus at Virginia Tech
157501.summary: Exodus at Virginia Tech is a K-Pop dance club welcoming anyone who wants to dance, regardless of experience.
157501.description_html:
Exodus at Virginia Tech is a video and stage performance crew that focuses on presenting Korean Pop music to the public. Members with varying dance experience actively pursue their interests via consistent practices to present impactful performances. Our goal is to introduce people to dance and provide opportunities to improve their skills while building a close-knit community. 

Join our Discord ! This is our main source of information, updates, and our community!

69148.name: Fashion Merchandising and Design Society at Virginia Tech
69148.summary: A professional society for Virginia Tech students interested in the Fashion Industry. We provide students with the opportunity to attend fashion related events, connect and network through social activities, and give back to the community.
69148.description_html: FMDS at Virginia Tech's mission is to connect the Fashion Merchandising and Design program and all the fashion related organizations into a unified community. FMDS at Virginia Tech provides workshops and activities to all students (of any major, all are welcome!) to develop skills in all aspects of the industry. This club also provides leadership opportunities through both FMDS and through the NRF Foundation.

117082.name: Fellowship of Christian Athletes at Virginia Tech
117082.summary: Sports Ministry seeking to see the world transformed by Jesus through the influence of coaches and athletes.
117082.description_html: The FCA is touching millions of lives... one heart at a time.  Since 1954 the FCA has been challenging coaches and athletes on the professional, college, high school, jr. high and youth levels to use the powerful medium of athletics to impact the world for Jesus Christ.  FCA at VT focuses on serving the college sports culture at by equipping, empowering and encouraging athletes and coaches to make a difference for Christ.

387554.name: Fem at Virginia Tech!!!
387554.summary: Interested in presenting more feminine, but don't know how to start? Join our club! Everyone is welcomed! <333
387554.description_html:
Interested in presenting feminine, but don't know how to start? Join our club! Everyone, and I really do mean everyone; queer or not, Blacksburg area or not, are welcomed! <333
We host events every Saturday from 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM at the Data and Decision Sciences Building! (room location changes based on availability).

 

Most meetings will go over skincare tutorials, haircare tutorials, hair shaving tutorials, finding out your undertones, makeup tutorials, how to shop online for clothes, etc. We also will do group shopping trips to places like Ulta Beauty, and various hair salons together so that you don't have to worry about feeling too embarrassed to buy makeup and clothes on your own! We will try to host a few cute parties here and there, and possibly other social events as well!

 

Come join our Discord Server!!! All of our events and tutorials are posted there!!! 

Follow our Instagram for updates on new events, as well as cross promotion of other clubs' events, club event photos, behind the scenes getting ready videos and makeup sessions!

158472.name: Field Hockey Club
158472.summary: Love field hockey? Want to play just for fun? Well, this is the club for you! This club offers its members the opportunity to play the sport they love without the commitment of a club/intramural sport or the fear of try-outs! JOIN TODAY!
158472.description_html: This club opens the door to those who missed playing field hockey and have no time to be dedicated to a club/intramural sport. This environment is laid back and welcoming to anyone who wants to join! Make new friends and bond over a sport that we all love!

65699.name: Filipino American Student Association
65699.summary: The Filipino American Student Association (FASA) is a student-led organization at Virginia Tech that strives to promote Filipino culture and heritage to students who are interested in learning more while aiming to provide a safe space for our members.
65699.description_html: Through our main purposes, FASA strives to promote the Filipino and Filipino-American culture through cultural, educational and social activities. We hope to enhance interaction between Filipinos and other students, faculty, and staff of the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. Through our organization, we strive to encourage the growth of the talents and intellect of Filipino Americans and also foster a sense of unity and pride within the organization. FASA also provides a supportive community for Filipino American students, helping them to connect with one another and build friendships.

420448.name: Film Photography Club at Virginia Tech
420448.summary: Our goal is to introduce people to the art and science of film photography, photo development, and its link to local history. By using our resources we try to eliminate barriers to entry in this incredible hobby!

70356.name: Finance Club
70356.summary: The Finance Club at Virginia Tech brings together people from across VT that have a common passion for finance. The club is open to students from all majors and offers an opportunity for them to further their education and interpersonal skills.
70356.description_html:
About the Finance Club at Virginia Tech

 

The Finance Club at Virginia Tech is a dynamic club that brings together people from across Virginia Tech that all have a common passion for finance. The club is open to students from all majors and offers an opportunity for them to further their education and interpersonal skills outside of the classroom. As a socially and event focused organization, we seek to provide a relaxed outlet for student networking, career education, and interaction amongst students and faculty with an interest in finance.

What we do:

Career Advice/Counseling:
On a regular basis, the Finance Club sponsors information sessions with some of the largest financial services companies in the US. These events give members an opportunity to network with corporate recruiters and gain the industry insight that will help identify ideal careers in finance. We also hold events that will increase students' familiarity and comfort with the recruiting process. This is accomplished through resume building workshops and advice from Pamplin's wonderful Career Advisors.

Social Events:
The club hosts regular socials at some of Blacksburg's best local venues. These events give members the chance to meet and interact with peers and faculty in a comfortable environment. Gain an edge over your classmates by taking the advice of students who have already taken the classes you are in now!

 

Frequently Asked Questions:

How do I join?
Fill out our interest form here. Next, Venmo $30 to vtfinclub and include "Name - email address" in the payment. After this, you are officially a member! At this point, be sure to check your email to stay up to date on upcoming events. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to financeclubvirginiatech@gmail.com

What does the Finance Club at Virginia Tech do?
The club frequently has social events, sponsors guest speakers, and hosts career events and networking opportunities with companies in the financial services industry. The club is a great place to build your resume and is a great opportunity for those interested in networking.

How do I find out about Finance Club at Virginia Tech events and meetings?
Once you join, you will be added to the club's email list and receive regular emails containing all the information you will need to attend club-sponsored events. Follow our Instagram @finclubatvt for updates. Also, check the website frequently for new information.

Is it too late for me to join the Finance Club at Virginia Tech?
Not at all! You can join the club at any time.

108121.name: Finance for Females and Friends at Virginia Tech
108121.summary: Finance for Females endeavors to empower women by offering a secure, comfortable environment that fosters an investment concentrated education for all majors along with a mentorship-based membership program.
108121.description_html:
Finance for Females & Friends strives to empower women by offering a secure, comfortable environment that fosters an investment concentrated education for all majors along with a mentorship-based membership program. Additionally, through our own standards of excellence, our organization strives to uphold the Virginia Tech motto of “Ut Prosim.”

 

Meetings: 

Weekly Monday meetings from 6:00-7:30pm in NBC 270. Subject to change.

Ensure you subscribe to our newsletter and social media platforms for updates (Instagram: @vtfinanceforfemales).

73110.name: Financial Planning Association at Virginia Tech
73110.summary: Interested in the profession of financial planning? Look no further! The FPA Student Chapter at Virginia Tech is an organization of over 75 students passionately pursuing an education about the profession's options beyond the normal classroom setting.
73110.description_html: The FPA Student Chapter at Virginia Tech is an entirely student-run chapter of the Financial Planning Association. Founded in 2011 by a small group of financial planning students, the organization has grown rapidly, boosting membership to over 100 students! The chapter facilitates professional speakers, Q&A sessions, networking opportunities, internship and career insight, as well as community outreach.

344881.name: FinTech Club at Virginia Tech
344881.summary: The FinTech Club at Virginia Tech connects students from all majors passionate about the FinTech industry and quantitative trading with professionals through professional trips, speaker events, and hands-on research projects.
344881.description_html:
FinTech Club at Virginia Tech is a student organization dedicated to promoting and connecting students who are passionate about the FinTech industry, quantitative trading, and financial markets. The club welcomes students from all majors and academic years, connecting them with industry professionals and providing hands-on projects. No major or year restrictions.

We offer a unique blend of professional and technical opportunities, including:
Professional Trips: Network with alumni and industry leaders on our annual "Hokies on Wall Street" trip to New York City.
Technical Pods: Gain hands-on experience by tackling real-world quantitative research projects in small teams.
Events: Attend speaker sessions, career workshops, and social events like our popular Poker Nights.

If you are interested in joining the club, contact shlokr@vt.edu, keyan@vt.edu, or varunsb@vt.edu for more information.​

362491.name: Firewatch at Virginia Tech
362491.summary: Interested in tracking fire alarms on campus? You've come to the right place!
362491.description_html:
Welcome to Firewatch at Virginia Tech! We are an organization dedicated to tracking residence hall fire alarms and promoting fire safety on campus. We also occasionally host events both online through our Discord and in-person. Membership is open to anyone--you don't have to live in a dorm to join and have a good time!

If you have a fire alarm you'd like to report, or would just like to connect with other members of the community, feel free to join our Discord:

https://discord.gg/e9Kbsy2jSK

161800.name: First Generation at Virginia Tech
161800.summary: VTf1rst is for individuals who are or were the first in their family to attend a bachelor's degree granting institution. Open to Undergrads, Grad Students and Faculty who identify as first-generation college students or whomever is interested.
161800.description_html:
Changing generations one person at a time.

VTf1rst is a student-led organization for individuals who are or were the first in their family to attend a bachelor’s degree–granting institution. Our club provides a welcoming and safe space where first-generation students can connect, share experiences, and build community. We host social events and gatherings that encourage friendship, support, and celebration of the first-generation college experience. VTf1rst is open to anyone who wants to embrace and uplift first-generation students, making it a space where everyone can feel included and supported.

292406.name: First-Generation Student Success
292406.summary: To advance first-generation student success through partnerships that contribute to academic success, leadership development, and through services that build community, increase student engagement and promote retention.
292406.description_html:
First-Generation Student Support collaborates with various departments on campus to provide programming and several events throughout the academic year for first-generation students. The purpose of these events is to:

  • Raise awareness about the needs and experiences of first-generation college students
  • Connect first-generation college students with one another and with faculty and staff with the goal of building community.
  • Create an environment for first-generation students that welcomes diverse ideas and cultures that promote lifelong learning, instill values and cultivates a strong academic identity.

338520.name: First-Year Leadership Experience
338520.summary: Guided by the Aspirations for Student Learning, FLEX supports new students by facilitating connections, supporting self-efficacy, and providing opportunities for reflection and growth.
338520.description_html:
FLEX is a year-long leadership development program designed to assist first-year students in self-understanding, leadership, and involvement at Virginia Tech.

Development within the FLEX program is fostered through understanding and committing to the competencies of the Virginia Tech Aspirations for Student Learning. After a year of weekly meetings and events, FLEXers end their first-year at Virginia Tech with developed leadership skills, a greater understanding of self, of others, and of their community. FLEX presents an opportunity for first-year students to develop a close family-like connection with peers, friends, mentors, and associated Faculty members of Virginia Tech.

Watch this video to hear from past FLEXers: FLEX Video

69019.name: Fish and Wildlife Graduate Student Association
69019.summary: We serve the graduate students of the Department of Fish and Wildlife Conservation at Virginia Tech.
69019.description_html: The mission of the Fish and Wildlife Graduate Student Association (hereafter FIWGSA) is to serve the graduate students of the Department of Fish and Wildlife Conservation by 1) acting as an intermediary between graduate students and faculty/staff, 2) orienting new students and providing them with graduate mentors, and 3) fostering an inclusive and supportive community among graduate students through professional development, networking, and social opportunities.

72885.name: Fly Fishing Club at Virginia Tech
72885.summary: Fly fishing activities (trips, fly tying, films, ect.) Teaching beginners the basics of fly casting and tying flies. All levels of experience are welcome. Loner equipment is available.
72885.description_html: We are a group of people who love to fly fish, whether it's for trout, bass, panfish, etc. We try to organize fly fishing trips with groups of club members as well as fly tying and fly casting clinics. We have meetings every other week.

69685.name: Food Animal Practitioner's Club
69685.summary: As an official student organization at Virginia Tech our goal is to expose veterinary students interested in food animal medicine to extracurricular learning experiences. We host guest speakers, wet labs and the occasional off campus field trip!
69685.description_html: Veterinary Student Organization focused on food animal medicine including bovine, small ruminants, swine, poultry and camelids. We offer hands on experience with all species previously listed as well as hold educational rounds, meetings and seminars. Additionally, we strive to serve our community and offer social events for students to socialize and enjoy their veterinary school experience.

352413.name: Food Matters
352413.summary: Food Matters explores and celebrates all aspects of food studies. We get together to eat, cook, garden, forage, learn about food cultures and food politics, and think about how food matters in our world!
352413.description_html:
Food Matters explores and celebrates all aspects of food studies. We get together to eat, cook, garden, forage, learn about food cultures and food politics, and think about how food matters in our world!

Food Matters is a club formed in association with the Food Studies Program here at Virginia Tech, which is an interdisciplinary area that helps situate food issues in social and historical contexts. The program draws on the expertise of faculty from fields such as history, sociology, political science, philosophy, gender studies, literature, folklore studies, geography, education, Africana studies, American Indian Studies, and more. The Food Studies program also has a forthcoming pathways minor that connects to the activities in Food Matters.

97440.name: Food Science Club
97440.summary: Our mission is to encourage fellowship between students interested in Food Science by participating in service events, industry-driven and academic competitions, professional networking opportunities, and food-related social events.
97440.description_html:
The Food Science Club at Virginia Tech is a non-profit student organization dedicated to promoting the field of Food Science and Technology through education and service.

Food Science and Technology is the application of disciplines such as microbiology, chemistry, engineering, and sensory science to safely and efficiently process, preserve, package, distribute, and utilize food products. Food science is an exciting interdisciplinary field that offers successful careers in research and development, product innovation, quality assurance, food process engineering, sensory science, teaching, etc.

414617.name: Food Security and Nutrition Club
414617.summary: Promoting preventive health by tackling food insecurity, educating on nutrition, and connecting communities to vital resources.
414617.description_html: We equip future physicians to integrate food security and nutrition into patient care through education, advocacy, and community engagement, promoting preventive health and informed dietary choices.

369814.name: Forecasting Club at Virginia Tech
