369814.summary: Together, the club meets to analyze different weather models and outputs to practice forecasting real-world situations, further preparing meteorology students and weather buffs for post-grad life.
369814.description_html: The Forecasting Club at Virginia Tech is a student organization with the goal of enhancing the forecasting skills of VT students. To do this, we host seminars, mentorships, guest speakers, weekly forecast practices through the WxChallenge or through our club, and social events.

352683.name: Forestry Graduate Student Association at Virginia Tech
352683.summary: FGSA is a collective of graduate students from the Forest Resources and Environmental Conservation Department in the College of Natural Resources at Virginia Tech.
352683.description_html: The purpose of this organization is to have a welcoming place for graduate students in our department. We work as a group to address issues that graduate students may face and present new ideas on how we can make a difference in the department. We serve as a bridge between graduate students and faculty in our department as well as have representatives at the GPSS (Graduate and Professional Student Senate). We also run fundraisers and hold social events for our members.

420449.name: Formula 1 Club at Virginia Tech
420449.summary: The Formula 1 Club at Virginia Tech is a forum for motorsports fans to discuss and watch Formula 1 (F1) and related motorsports.
420449.description_html: The Formula 1 Club at Virginia Tech is a forum for motorsports fans to discuss and watch Formula 1 and related motorsports. We host watch parties, trivia nights and more! If you would be interested in joining, our Discord is linked below.

81850.name: Formula SAE
81850.summary: Our mission is to conceive, design, and fabricate two high-performance formula-style racecars to win an annual international competition sponsored by the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE).
81850.description_html:
What is FSAE?

Competition Objective:

The Formula SAE competition is for Society of Automotive Engineers' student-members to conceive, design, fabricate, and compete with small formula-style racing cars. A group of dedicated students work over two years to design and build hands on. The finished cars are entered into the FSAE competition against approximately 130 other vehicles from college and university teams worldwide. 

The competition serves as an enduring experience for all team members involved, as well as an opportunity to work in a dedicated hands-on environment.

Vehicle Design Objectives:
For the purpose of this competition, the students are to assume that a manufacturing firm has engaged them to produce a prototype car for evaluation as a production item. The intended sales market is the nonprofessional weekend autocross racer.  The challenge to the design team is to design and fabricate a prototype car that best meets the goals and intents. Each design will be compared and judged with other competing designs to determine the best overall car.

Judging Categories:
The cars are judged in a series of static and dynamic events including: technical inspection, cost, presentation, and engineering design, solo performance trials, and high performance track endurance. These events are scored to determine how well the car performs. In each event, the manufacturing firm has specified minimum acceptable performance levels that are reflected in the scoring equations. The following points are possible:

Dynamic Events Static Events
Acceleration - 100 points Presentation - 75 points
Skid-pad - 75 points Engineering Design - 150 points
Autocross - 125 points Cost Analysis - 100 points
Fuel Economy - 100 points  
Endurance Track - 275 points TOTAL SCORING - 1000 points

 

Virginia Tech Mechanical Engineering Department
ATTN: Formula SAE
131 Durham Hall
Blacksburg, VA 24061-0238

Phone: (540) 231-5459

414621.name: Fralin Free Clinic at VTCSOM
414621.summary: The mission of the club is to build a relationship between the Fralin Free Clinic and VTCSOM and create a volunteer program for medical students.
414621.description_html: The club aims to create a relationship between Fralin Free Clinic and VTCSOM while allowing the medical students to serve a vulnerable population and practice their clinical skills under the guidance of attendings.

60794.name: Fraternity and Sorority Life
60794.summary: The fraternity and sorority community currently emcompasses approximately 5,400+ students, which represents just about 19 percent of the undergraduate population; hence, fraternity and sorority life is incredibly dynamic at Virginia Tech!
60794.description_html:
Fraternity and Sorority Life supports and engages members of the fraternity and sorority community by promoting lifelong learning, empowering personal growth, inspiring intellectual development, cultivating leadership, and encouraging philanthropy and service, all through the shared values of brotherhood and sisterhood. If you are interested in learning more about the Fraternity & Sorority Life community, please complete the following interest form.

 

Promoting Lifelong Learning

As students and alumni/ae members in the interfraternal community learn about themselves through multiple contexts, their curiosity develops through a myriad of opportunities in which to support them as scholars, leaders, mentors, and engaged citizens of a global community.

 

Empowering Personal Growth

The interfraternal community will engage in opportunities, which propel the aspects of strengths and learning life skills in order for lifetime members to deepen an awareness of self and others.

 

Inspiring Intellectual Development

Members will embrace scholastic achievement and intellectual development as cornerstones of the interfraternal experience and value aspects such as integrity, civility, and honor through all living and learning environments.

 

Cultivating Leadership

The fraternity and sorority community will experience innovative and inspiring leadership development opportunities which will serve as catalysts for courageous leadership.

 

Encouraging Philanthropy and Service

Members of the interfraternal community will be mindful of global citizenship and embrace servant leadership as a way of life, honoring the University’s motto, Ut Prosim.

 

Shared Values of Brotherhood and Sisterhood

Through the development of community and connectedness, membership inspires momentum for living our values for our entire lifetime.

69378.name: French Club at Virginia Tech
69378.summary: Join us for weekly conversations in French with students and native speakers to practice your French listening and conversation skills. All levels of French are welcome!
69378.description_html:
We like to meet weekly for about an hour to converse in French with speakers and learners of all levels. We also have French cooking parties, hikes, and movie and paint nights, and more!

If you are interested, please join the group me here: https://groupme.com/join_group/105580030/BAzJeF5l

68681.name: Friends of Israel at Virginia Tech
68681.summary: Friends of Israel’s mission is to educate Virginia Tech students about every aspect of Israel and to celebrate its accomplishments in technology, sciences, mathematics, and the arts, while hosting fun events.
68681.description_html: Friends of Israel at Virginia Tech’s mission is to educate Virginia Tech students about every aspect of Israel and to celebrate its accomplishments in technology, sciences, mathematics, and the arts. The organization also works to provide fun and educational programming through bi-weekly events and bring guest speakers to campus.

420450.name: Friends of the Museum
420450.summary: We are a club dedicated to the growth and support of the Museum of Geoscience. We will host a variety of outreach events, both in and outside the museum to get more people engaged in the world of geosciences. All are welcome!
420450.description_html: We are a club dedicated to the growth and support of the Museum of Geoscience and our geoscience department as a whole. We will host a variety of outreach events both in and outside of the museum so we can get more people engaged in the world of geosciences. We organize events on museum curation and the involvement of arts in science to promote science communication. We also take club field trips to local museums and schools to learn more about their collections as well as to learn how we can improve our own. We hold all these events and more with the singular purpose of making the museum the best version of itself that it could possibly be to serve as a tool for education and science-communication. We welcome all, whether you are well versed in the world of geoscience or are just eager to learn!

344341.name: Fungus United at Virginia Tech
344341.summary: Fungus United is a club dedicated to creating an atmosphere that fosters and encourages fungi education and activities.
344341.description_html: Fungus United aims to bring the love of mycology to the Hokies! This club allows those interested in the world of fungi to gain a hands-on approach to the subject through forays, classes, art, grow labs, presentations, movies, and more. We accept all levels of interest and hope to cultivate a love of fungi through our club!

69688.name: Fusion Dance Team at Virginia Tech
69688.summary: Fusion Dance Team is a group of dancers brought together by our love of dance. Team members choreograph and choose to perform dances in Contemporary, Hip-Hop, Ballet, Jazz, Modern, Heels, and Tap.
69688.description_html:
Fusion Dance Team at Virginia Tech is a student-run dance team brought together by a love for dance. Our name encompasses our passion for the many styles of dance that we perform. Team members choose to choreograph and perform dances in Contemporary, Jazz, Modern, Hip-Hop, Heels, and Tap for our showcases each semester.

 

We have two major performances at the end of the fall and spring semesters and various small performances at events such as Gobblerfest, Relay for Life, Homecoming, etc. 

 

Along with our performances, we also have various social events throughout the year such as date parties, hikes, movie nights, picnics, photoshoots, and socials with other club organizations. FDT is more than just a dance team; it's a place for finding your best friends!!

 

Please come check us out on:

Instagram: @fdt.vt

TikTok: @vtfusiondanceteam

Youtube: @fusiondanceteamvirginiatech1607

163908.name: Future Medical Professionals
163908.summary: The goal of this organization is to provide members with information about careers and opportunities in the medical field and any other health field. In addition, this organization will fundraise for various organizations and causes.
163908.description_html: Meetings consist of learning information about careers in the medical field. Benefits to club members include hearing directly from medical professionals as well as receiving information about taking standardized tests and applying to programs.

66553.name: G.E.R.M.A.N. Club
66553.summary: The German Club is the oldest non-greek fraternal organization at Virginia Tech. It was founded in 1892 to provide a social outlet for the student body.
66553.description_html:
The motto of the German Club, Leadership for Service through Fellowship, describes the focus of the club. One of the club's primary goals is service to the University and local communities. Members of the club dedicate hundreds of man-hours annually for service projects such as holiday parties for under-privileged children, Special Olympics, the Christmas Store, and campus and community clean-ups. Devotion to Virginia Tech and leadership development become natural consequences of German Club membership. Our members are active in leadership positions in academic societies, the Corps of Cadets, the student body and government, residence halls, and many other aspects of student life. Founded as a social organization, the German Club continues to promote fellowship with socials with sororities, club parties, and the traditional Midwinter's Dance.

 

The German Club Ritual

The German Club Ritual is a document that describes the meaning behind each of these letters and defines the obligations of the German Club and its members.  This document is the backbone to the German Club's membership decision making process.

 

The letters that spell GERMAN mean infinitely more than mere symbols of the alphabet to the German Club and to each German Club member. G-E-R-M-A-N signify attributes that are pillars of strength. Upon them is built the German Club. You must not only know them; you must live them, exemplify them. It is your definite obligation, your positive duty, so long as you are a German Club member to strengthen these six pillars. They are:

G stands for Gentleman. Be first of all a gentleman at all times. The true German Club man bespeaks the manners, culture and good breeding that mark the true gentleman. See to it that your own conduct rather than other men's words should praise you. Good manners and good morals go hand in hand, and gentlemanly conduct is everywhere a passport to the high regard of worthy people. In flaming words shines the German doctrine: When dignity is lost, and honor dies, the man is dead.

E stands for Earnestness. The German Club man is earnest in his efforts, diligent in the duties of membership. Work earnestly always for the good of the German Club. If you have great talents, earnest work will improve them; if but moderate abilities, earnest industry will supply their deficiencies. Nothing is denied to well-directed labor and earnest work; nothing is ever to be attained without them.

R stands for Reputation and Responsibility. The two are inseparably linked, one with the other. The Reputation of the German Club is a glorious heritage bequeathed by those German Club men who have gone before you. This proud and honorable Reputation comes to you as a vibrant challenge out of the past and into the present to summon from this moment forward the very best that is within you. With you we now share the mantle of Responsibility to guard and to uphold this Reputation. The high Reputation of the German Club is your Responsibility, not alone to keep but also to enrich by your words and your deeds.

M stands for Manhood. In all that the word implies, be a Man. Do the manly things. Do what your Manhood bids that you do, from none but self expect applause. It is not what you have but what you are that expresses your worth as a Man. The German Club expects you always to be a Man. It expects you to love truth, hate wrong, and respect others as you do yourself.  Never forget this truth, namely: One cannot always be a hero, but one can always be a Man.

A stands for Aim.  The German Club has a definite Aim.  We dedicate ourselves, by earnest work and unflagging zeal, to provide dances that are of the highest credit to our Club and to our Alma Mater.  Through the loyalty of us all to our Club and through unbreakable bonds of brotherly love, we seek to promote good fellowship among us.  The enrichment of our own lives and the enrichment of our Alma Mater must forever be our Aim, our common goal.  See to it that our social functions are chastened by culture and dignity.  Make certain that our good fellowship continues firm and constant.  Remember always that the only way to have a friend is to be one.

N stands for Name.  The good Name of the German Club, as of yourself, must be a priceless treasure for you to guard forever.  Do your part to assure that the German Club not only possesses a good Name, but deserves one.  Never forget that a good Name is the greatest gift that we of the Club can leave to the German Club men of tomorrow.  Build this Name upon Honor and Hospitality.  Upon Honor because without Honor, which means fair-dealing, truth, and integrity, the German Club cannot fulfill its worthy mission.  With Honor there is power.  Upon Hospitality because the German Club always has been and will be the host, and graciousness to our guests is our duty and obligation.  And you must not only enhance this good Name of the German Club, but also guard it always.  It is, alas, all too true that a good Name is the result of many actions and lost by one.

382501.name: Galatasaray's Lions at Virginia Tech
382501.summary: 🦁 Welcome to GALA at VT, the first-ever soccer team fan organization at Virginia Tech! ⚽️ Join us for game watch parties, soccer games and tournaments, and more. Follow our social media to stay in the loop and be part of the firsts! 📣
382501.description_html:
🦁 Welcome to GALA at VT, the first-ever soccer team fan organization at Virginia Tech! ⚽️ Like Galatasaray, known as the team of “the mosts and the firsts,” we’re here to make history.

For those unfamiliar, Galatasaray, founded in 1905, stands as Turkey’s most successful club, with the most Turkish Super Lig titles, Turkish Cups, and Turkish Super Cups. Our remarkable triumph in the UEFA Europa League and victory in the UEFA Super Cup further underscore our achievements. We have consistently been a prominent contender in the UEFA Champions League, more than many other successful, well known, European teams, solidifying our presence on the European football stage.

Join us for game watch parties, soccer games and tournaments, and more. Follow our social media to stay in the loop and be part of the firsts! 📣 #Galatasaray #HokieLions

76304.name: Game Development Club at Virginia Tech
76304.summary: We are the Virginia Tech hotspot for all things video game development! If you're curious about game artwork, design, programming, music, stories, or just chatting about what you think makes games great, this is the place for you!
76304.description_html:
The Game Development Club at Virginia Tech is a club centered around everything that goes into video game design. We are multi-faceted and welcome artists, programmers, writers, musicians, and anyone else creative or enthusiastic about game making. All skill levels are welcome! From people who have never even considered what might go into making a game, to people who have made games on their own already, there is something here for everyone. Our club offers a space to learn together, work together, and hang out together centered around something we are all passionate about: video games!

 

Meetings: Tuesdays 6:30pm - 8:00pm in Newman Library 4th floor, Game Studio

Join the official VTGDC Discord server to chat with us and stay up to date with announcements and events: https://discord.gg/GhPmxHg9Gv

Here is our Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/vt.game.dev?utm_source=ig_web_button_share_sheet&igsh=ZDNlZDc0MzIxNw==

67239.name: Gamma Delta Sigma
67239.summary: An independent social sorority that was started at Virginia Tech in 2008. We support the Boys and Girls Club of SWVA through our philanthropy Bracket Power every spring.
67239.description_html:
We are an independent social sorority founded at Virginia Tech in 2008. Our sisters live by the motto, "Strength Through Sisterhood" by consistently uplifting and supporting each other. We currently support The Boys and Girls Club of SWVA through our philanthropy Bracket Power every spring.

https://linktr.ee/vtgammadeltasigma

The Fall 2025 rush interest form is now live!

https://forms.office.com/r/KbdijdyGv0

66054.name: Gamma Phi Beta Sorority
66054.summary: A proud member of the Panhellenic community, Gamma Phi Beta promotes lifelong commitment, intellectual and personal growth, and service to humanity. We build confident women of character who celebrate sisterhood and make a difference in the world.
66054.description_html:
Gamma Phi Beta International Sorority was founded in 1874 at Syracuse University in New York. Headquartered in Centennial, Colorado, the Sorority has chartered 172 collegiate chapters and more than 175 alumnae groups across the United States and Canada. The Eta Epsilon chapter at Virginia Tech was chartered on April 30th 2011, and is proud to help carry the tradition of excellence in the Greek community. Membership within our sorority brings women together who share our four core values of Love, Labor, Learning, and Loyalty. With more than 175,000 members worldwide, we invite you to learn more about everything our Sorority has to offer!

Our Mission: We build confident women of character who celebrate sisterhood and make a difference in the world around us.

Our Vision: To inspire the highest type of womanhood

Our Guiding Principles:
- We promote lifelong commitment, intellectual and personal growth, and service to humanity.
- We perpetuate our heritage as we commit to the growth of our sorority.
- We foster enduring friendships.
- We advocate ethical behavior, respect, authenticity, accountability, and integrity.
- We aspire to excellence in all that we do.

Open Motto: Founded Upon a Rock

413621.name: Gamma Theta Upsilon
413621.summary: Gamma Theta Upsilon is an international geographical honor society that produces leaders in geography. The Eta Zeta chapter here at Virginia Tech focuses on engaging and supporting our members academically and professionally.
413621.description_html: Gamma Theta Upsilon is an international geographical honor society that produces the next generation of leaders in geography. The purpose of our society is to further professional interest, strengthen our knowledge through outside experiences, advance the status of geography as a cultural and practical discipline, and to encourage and connect students to research opportunities. Our chapter is the Eta Zeta chapter and we primarily focus on supporting our members to lead both in and outside of the classroom. We also seek to serve our campus and community through tutoring and environmental volunteering.

357894.name: GenerationOne
357894.summary: The GenerationOne Living-Learning Community at Virginia Tech is a place where you can share the unique triumphs and challenges of navigating college life as a first-gen student with others!
357894.description_html: This organization is only open to students in the Generation Living-Learning Community. Interested in learning more? Check out our website: https://llp.vt.edu/llc/generationone.html

347791.name: Geography Club at Virginia tech
347791.summary: Geography Club at Virginia Tech is a community filled with fun, social meetings, academic support, and professional development opportunities surrounding a common major, minor, or interest in geography.
347791.description_html: Geography Club at Virginia Tech is a community filled with fun, social meetings, academic support, and professional development opportunities surrounding a common major, minor, or interest in geography. We build and sustain good communal relationships with professors and advisors within Geography. We support each other in fun and academic ways such as group study hours, course request and add/drop sessions, and helping students reach out to professors and instructors for professional relationships. In a social aspect, we embark on fun geography based activities such as geo-caching, hiking, technological games/activities (i.e. geo-guesser), and environment-based service events. We are excited to promote and dive into all interests of geography, since they span vast areas of study.

403398.name: GeoGuessr Club
403398.summary: The GeoGuessr Club's mission is to bring together students who share a passion for geography, exploration, and problem-solving in a fun and engaging way. Our club will host regular tournaments and teach members how to improve their gameplay. Open to all!
403398.description_html:
The GeoGuessr Club's mission is to bring together students who share a passion for geography, exploration, and problem-solving in a fun and engaging way. We aim to foster a sense of community through friendly competition, collaboration, and the challenge of using real-world geographic knowledge and deduction skills. Our club will host regular tournaments to spark excitement and competition, and we will also offer resources and strategies to help members improve their gameplay. Ultimately, we hope to create an inclusive space where students can enhance their geography skills, develop teamwork, and build strategic thinking, while encouraging curiosity about different cultures and regions.

Join our discord here: https://discord.gg/vdWaXmxCUa

65789.name: Geology Club
65789.summary: A club catering to Hokies in the geosciences or those interested in geology. Geology Club organizes mineral and fossil collecting trips, socials, movie nights, and other fun and engaging activities for those interested in geology at any skill level.
65789.description_html: A club catering to Hokies in the geosciences or those interested in geology. Geology Club organizes mineral and fossil collecting trips, socials, movie nights, and other fun and engaging activities for those looking to make strong friendships that last a lifetime while gaining a greater appreciation for geology and this planet we all inhabit. Whether you're a geosciences pro or this is your first time being introduced to geology, all are welcome.

344705.name: Geosciences Student Research Symposium
344705.summary: The GSRS committee works to organize and run a two-day long conference, held in the Spring, to highlight the diverse research performed by both grad and undergrad students within the Department of Geosciences at VT. We are entirely student led.
344705.description_html:
Geosciences Student Research Symposium (GSRS) is a long-standing tradition in the Department of Geosciences at Virginia Tech. This event spans two days of student research presentations, including both graduate and undergraduate students. GSRS provides students a platform to communicate their research across the far-reaching disciplines of our department. This promotes student growth as scientists in a collegial environment.

 

GSRS is entirely student-led. Fundraising and logistics are organized by a committee of graduate students. In addition to developing communication skills, event preparation fosters leadership, mentorship, and team-building experiences. 

 

Now in its fifth year, the pre-GSRS Workshop Series provides tutorials, led by graduate student and faculty volunteers, on how to navigate professional conferences. Topics range from abstract writing to poster formatting. All students are encouraged to attend, especially undergraduates tackling a presentation for the first time. The pre-GSRS Workshop Series delivers skills to our students that they can apply to GSRS and carry with them for years to come.

 

GSRS closes with the ever-popular banquet on Friday evening. This gathering celebrates another successful GSRS. Here, awards are presented to outstanding student presenters. We invite and encourage all who can attend to join us for this annual rendezvous of alumni, faculty, students, and friends of Geosciences.

160438.name: Geotechnical Student Organization
160438.summary: An organization comprised of graduate students in the Geotechnical Engineering Program of the Via Civil and Environmental Engineering Department.
160438.description_html: An organization comprised of graduate students in the Geotechnical Engineering Program of the Via Civil and Environmental Engineering Department. The goal of the GSO is to create professional connections and promote professional development. In addition, the GSO aims to outreach to surrounding communities on the importance of Geotechnical engineering, and to promote camaraderie amongst its members and other organizations.

417196.name: Geriatrics, Palliative Care and Hospice Club
417196.summary: The goal of the Geriatrics and Palliative Care club is twofold: to provide exposure to careers in geriatrics, palliative, and hospice care, as well as to provide a space where students can discuss the processes of aging and death.
417196.description_html: The goal of the Geriatrics and Palliative Care club is twofold: to provide exposure to careers in geriatrics, palliative, and hospice care, as well as to provide a space where students can discuss the processes of aging and death.

72795.name: German Culture Club
72795.summary: German Culture Club is an organization that focuses on celebrating German Culture, food, music, and fostering an environment for those interested in German to practice the language and culture. All language levels are welcome at events!
72795.description_html: German Culture Club is an organization that focuses on celebrating German Culture, food, music, and fostering an environment for those interested in German to practice the language and culture. We typically hold an event every month during the academic year. Students, professors, and community members regularly attend. Past events include International Café Hour, (hosted with the Cranwell International Center), International Street Fair, Oktoberfest, holiday celebrations, Karneval, and much more! We always host a table at Gobblerfest.

369966.name: Ghanaian Graduate Students' Association at Virginia Tech
369966.summary: We provide a bridge connecting current Ghanaian VT graduate students with incoming students from Ghana, easing the process of integrating into the VT community. We offer a supportive community to existing (Ghanaian) graduate students.
369966.description_html: Many of the graduate students spend around 5 years in VT essentially making it a home away from their homes. Over the past couple of years, there is a growing influx of Ghanaian Graduate students attracted by VT. We seek to create a visible and vibrant Ghanaian community that creates a space for the typical graduate student to share experiences and provide support. We also seek to collaborate with other associations to promote and educate on rich Ghanaian culture.

420465.name: Girls on the Run at Virginia Tech
420465.summary: Girls on the Run at Virginia Tech brings students together to move, connect, and recharge while building confidence and community. Through walks and runs on the Huckleberry Trail, we create an inclusive space for balance and well-being.
420465.description_html: Girls on the Run at Virginia Tech is a campus organization dedicated to connection, movement, and well-being. Our goal is to provide an inclusive space where anyone can join group walks or runs along the Huckleberry Trail in a fun and supportive environment. Each meeting offers a chance to unwind, meet new people, and focus on personal growth through physical activity and community. Whether you are new to running or simply looking for a casual way to move and make friends, everyone is welcome.

369994.name: Girls Who Code at Virginia Tech
369994.summary: A chapter of the national Girls Who Code nonprofit, dedicated to forming a female-empowered community of students who are interested in anything computer, coding, or technology related. Open to ALL students, regardless of gender identity or major.
369994.description_html:
Girls Who Code at Virginia Tech is a group of students and professors across majors who are interested in coding, computer literacy, or technology. We are a chapter of the national Girls Who Code College Loops program, which is dedicated to increasing retention and recruitment of female-identifying students into STEM degrees. 

We offer:

  • Regular community-building events- find others who are interested in computing!
  • Professional Development- portfolios, website, interview prep
  • Trainings- both asynchronous and in-person
  • Guest speakers
  • National resources via GWC’s website

 

We meet 5:30-6:30 pm on Wednesdays in Lavery Hall room 340!

183613.name: GitHub Organizaiton
183613.summary: The GitHub Organization was first started in the beginning of January, 2017. We promote using GitHub.
183613.description_html:
The GitHub Organization was first started in the beginning of January, 2017. Undoubtedly, this ‘GitHub Organization’ idea is still very young and has a long way to go. In addition to providing a centralized code sharing location, we eventually plan to hold Git/GitHub Workshops, have one-on-one educational office hour sessions, invite guest speakers from the industry to talk about Git, and much more.

At it’s core, the VT GitHub Organization is meant to facilitate collaboration between Virginia Tech programming projects as well as increase the general profile of VT’s CS endeavours. We want students, faculty, and staff to share their on-going projects through the GitHub Organization, whether they be research projects, hobby projects, or anything in-between.

More information about how this organization got started can be found here.

294049.name: Give at Virginia Tech
294049.summary: GIVE is a sustainably minded volunteering organization. We love to support our community through food drives, clean ups, and care package distributions.
294049.description_html: Give at Virginia Tech connects Hokies to local communities through service and goodwill. We provide easy access to community service events in Blacksburg and the New River Valley while also allowing you to meet like minded individuals.

403399.name: Giving Innovative Futures with Technology
403399.summary: Giving Innovative Futures with Technology (GIFT) is an organization that finds and hosts community service projects that require technical solutions for the Virginia Tech and Blacksburg community.
403399.description_html:
Giving Innovative Futures with Technology (GIFT) is an interdisciplinary organization that finds and host community service projects that require technical solutions for the Virginia Tech and Blacksburg community.  

We aim to bridge the gap between students wanting to gain more technical experience while also assisting the local community. We welcome all majors and backgrounds, especially for management roles, though we focus on having technical expertise.

369830.name: Global Dental Brigades at Virginia Tech
369830.summary: A student-led program under the larger nonprofit organization, Global Brigades. A big component of our chapter is to take a week long trip abroad to work with local dental professionals to provide sustainable dental treatment to communities in need.
369830.description_html: Global Dental Brigades at Virginia Tech is a chapter under the larger nonprofit organization, Global Brigades. Our dental brigades chapter is led by Virginia Tech students who will take a week long trip to a country abroad to provide free sustainable dental treatment to underserved communities. Students will work with dental professionals and local staff abroad to empower communities who would otherwise have little to no access to dental care. Our mission is to educate and become better leaders in whatever path we take in the future. May 2026 we will be volunteering in Panama.

159633.name: Global Education Office
159633.summary: The Global Education Office supports the development of Virginia Tech students into globally competent citizens through study abroad and other international experiences. The office also connects faculty and students to their peers abroad.
159633.description_html: The Global Education Office is the unit on campus that helps students and faculty with study abroad and international experiences.

262928.name: Global Engineering Ambassadors
262928.summary: The Global Engineering Ambassadors are a selective group of enthusiastic, dedicated and motivated undergraduate and graduate engineering students who support of global experiences and initiatives for VT engineering students.
262928.description_html:
The Global Engineering Ambassadors are a selective group of enthusiastic, dedicated and motivated undergraduate and graduate engineering students who help the Global Engineering office (GEER) with its outreach and marketing activities in support of global experiences and initiatives for Virginia Tech’s engineering students. Ambassadors will help with those efforts by volunteering for approximately 10 hours of support every semester. Some activities would include:

  • Running an information booth at the Global Education Fair in the fall semester and the Global Education Resource Fair in the spring semester
  • Giving presentations for Galileo and Hypatia groups
  • Presenting to engineering classes on global opportunities

414618.name: Global Health Club
414618.summary: Mission of Global Health Club is to provide learning avenues and tangible engagement opportunities that cultivate deeper understanding for current challenges and issues within the global health field.
414618.description_html: Our vision is two fold: - Cultivate and strengthen local community- based interest for global health through resources, networking, education, and engagement initiatives. - Establish a network that allows VTCSOM students to develop cultural competency skills and experiences through education and engagement opportunities with our global partnership sites.

72857.name: Global Medical Brigades at Virginia Tech
72857.summary: Global Brigades is the largest, student-led, nonprofit health and sustainable development organization focused on a holistic model of local empowerment partnering with Panama, Honduras, Ghana, Greece, and Guatemala.
72857.description_html: Global Medical Brigades @ Virginia Tech is a program under the umbrella organization, Global Brigades. As part of a medical brigade, our students work with licensed professionals to provide accessible medical care to under-served communities. Our work is primarily focused on communities in Honduras, Panama, Nicaragua, Ghana, Greece, and Guatemala. Global Brigades is unique in that it empowers locals to sustain personal healthcare practices long after our brigade. Our mission is to educate and inspire future health professionals.

362527.name: Global Medical Missions Alliance
362527.summary: We are an organization striving to promote the message of Jesus' healing and love within the medical field. Our goal is to equip students interested in pursuing a career in the medical field for missions globally and locally.
362527.description_html:
Our Vision Statement: H.E.A.L.

Help churches to connect and partner in medical mission work.

Empower the next generation of healthcare professionals to live out missional life through mentoring, training, supporting, and mission opportunities.

Awaken mission-minded healthcare professionals to fulfill the great commission.

Link healthcare professionals with mission partners for mobilization.

414622.name: Global Surgery Student Alliance
414622.summary: Vision: Sustainable and accessible surgical, obstetric, and anesthesia care worldwide. ​ Mission: To educate, inspire, and unite students through engagement and mentorship in global surgery, including anesthesia & OB/Gyn.
414622.description_html: Mission: To educate, inspire, and unite students through engagement and mentorship in global surgery, including anesthesia & OB/Gyn. ​ Goals: To create awareness about and to advocate for global surgery To educate students about global surgery and sustainable interventions To advance research in global surgery through student involvement To connect students who are interested in global surgery across the country and world To facilitate communication and mentorship between students and current global surgeons, OB/Gyns, and anesthesiologists. To foster the development of the next generation of global surgeons, OB/Gyns, and anesthesiologists GSSA is the national student-run global surgery working group for the U.S., affiliated with InciSioN (the International Student Surgical Network). We believe that students are a valuable resource for the advancement of global surgery. We also believe that being unified in our efforts will help further our initiatives and can also facilitate more collaboration amongst overall global surgery efforts, both now and in the future. By exposing students to the field early on, we also hope to help them build their surgical careers with global surgery in mind. Ultimately, many students are willing and able to make significant contributions to global surgery, and we hope to be a resource that facilitates those efforts.

96965.name: Glossolalia: The Literary Festival at Virginia Tech
96965.summary: Glossolalia is an organization that acknowledges written creativity among all disciplines. The organization works to plan an annual literary festival every spring, in which students are chosen to read their work alongside published authors.
96965.description_html:
Glossolalia is an organization that acknowledges written creativity among all disciplines. The organization works to plan an annual literary festival every spring, in which students are chosen to read their work alongside published authors. 

The festival is a collaborative effort of students who are passionate about unearthing and showcasing the talent of writers in the community. Our mission is to empower young writers at Virginia Tech. 

Members of Glossolalia plan and host on- and off-campus open mics and writing workshops to promote our spring festival. Additionally, we encourage all students to submit their work for a chance to showcase their talent in a safe place.

379907.name: Gobble Rockets at Virginia Tech
379907.summary: An on-campus engineering organization dedicated to teaching skills in design, manufacturing, assembly, and testing to passionate students with a desire to learn. Our main focus as an organization is high-powered rocketry.
379907.description_html:
At the start of each school year, we take in dedicated students who are new to Virginia Tech who want to get experience in a design team. Our mission is to teach the skills necessary to succeed academically and in future design teams. High-powered rocketry is our vessel to achieve this mission. We do this through a combination of competition-based subteams (three teams of around 10) with integrated mentorship and a shared love of rockets! Each year, we compete in the Battle of the Rockets!

Each of our three teams takes on one of the competitions within Battle of the Rockets. Check the link below to learn more!

https://www.rocketbattle.org/competition.html

GRAVT also hosts a research and development (R&D) division for tackling broader and harder engineering challenges. Our current project is a rocket-tracking camera; utilizing aspects of machine learning (computer vision), system dynamics, and iterative-based design to fulfill goals within the project.

GRAVT R&D is open to any student who's already spent time at VT while garnering a passion for research and testing. It's notably a "level-up" from the Battle of the Rockets teams in terms of time investment, report writing, and base knowledge.

294050.name: GobbleCraft
294050.summary: We are a Minecraft club. We have our own server. We're open to all who are willing, so hop on and build with us!
294050.description_html:
We are a community of Minecraft enthusiasts at Virginia Tech. We welcome players of all skill-levels to build with us.

We currently run three servers. We have two survival worlds, OG and Seasonal. We also have a single creative world.

OG is our original survival world, and we plan to never reset it. Whatever you build now will still remain years into the future, like a living time capsule. Explore builds made by previous students, and leave your mark on the future.


Seasonal is our yearly survival world. This server resets every fall semester, and will offer a world download afterwards. If a more episodic style of survival suits you, this is the perfect match for you.

Our creative world is a single superflat world that may periodically reset.

We usually aim for a meeting once or twice a month. Our server is online 24/7 (aside from maintenance), so play whenever you have time! 

If you don't have a Discord account, please make one! You will need one to keep up-to-date on announcements, meeting information, and to join the world.

Our server's IP: gobblecraft.mcserver.us
Discord link: https://discord.gg/5Dw242J

420451.name: Gobbler Racing at Virginia Tech
420451.summary: Gobbler Racing proudly competes in the Collegiate Racing Series — an organization dedicated to educating and training students across all fields within motorsports. To then race competitively against colleges around the US. No experience is required.
420451.description_html: Gobbler Racing at Virginia Tech proudly competes in the Collegiate Racing Series (CRS) — a national organization dedicated to educating and training students across all fields within motorsports. To then race competitively against colleges around the US.  Our mission is to make motorsport education and experience accessible to everyone, empowering students to gain real-world skills in their chosen discipline. These are the roles available: Drivers, Race Strategists, Race Mechanics, Pit Crew Members, Social Media & Marketing Managers, and Business Managers. No prior experience is required.

349424.name: GobblerConnect Function Test
349424.summary: Organization Created to complete GobblerConnect Testing. This is not a real organization and was only created for background functionality.
349424.description_html: Organization Created to complete GobblerConnect Testing. This is not a real organization and was only created for background functionality.

421290.name: Good Grief
421290.summary: A student-led community dedicated to providing support, reflection, and connection for those navigating grief.
421290.description_html: Our mission is to support students in their journey through grief by offering a space for reflection, connection, and understanding. We seek to honor the memory of loved ones, empower each other in the healing process, and remind our community that no one has to grieve alone.

305225.name: Google Developer Student Clubs at Virginia Tech
305225.summary: Google Developer Group at Virginia Tech (GDG @ VT) is a new student organization supported by Google Developers, dedicated to empowering students who are passionate about technology, innovation, and community.
305225.description_html:
The Google Developer Group at Virginia Tech (GDG @ VT) is a new student organization supported by Google Developers, dedicated to empowering students who are passionate about technology, innovation, and community.

As a member, you’ll get the chance to:

  • Learn and grow through hands-on workshops in technologies like JavaScript, React, Node.js, Python, Flutter, Firebase, and Google Cloud Platform.
  • Take part in mini hackathons, coding challenges, and peer-to-peer learning sessions to sharpen your technical and problem-solving skills.
  • Connect with Google developers and industry professionals through talks, mentorships, and community events. This year, GDG @ VT will also participate in the Google Solution Challenge, where you get to compete against different GDG chapters all across the globe.

We’re currently welcoming new members and recruiting core team officers who want to help lead events, manage projects, and grow our community of developers and creators.

👉 Join our Discord: https://discord.gg/jMzsbQrXcj

📸 Follow us on Instagram: Instagram

💼 Connect on LinkedIn: Linkedin

63152.name: Graduate and Professional Student Senate
63152.summary: We represent 7,000+ grad students to the university and beyond, advocate for graduate student needs and concerns, and provide social opportunities and small grants to the graduate student community.
63152.description_html:
Purpose of the Graduate and Professional Student Senate

 

The Graduate and Professional Student Senate (GPSS) is the governing body of approximately 7000 professional and graduate students across multiple campuses. The GPSS represents students' concerns and serves as their liaison with the University Administration. GPSS members also serve on a variety of University commissions and committees. In addition, the GPSS administers a grant program to directly promote research and educational efforts of its members. The GPSS strongly promotes graduate student community across departments by providing social events to encourage graduate students to come together. Every year the GPSS governing board and delegate body work to improve campus life, scholarly development, and graduate community by creating and implementing goals based on the issues and concerns of graduate students on campus.

103984.name: Graduate Arts Council
103984.summary: The Graduate Arts Council is a group of students dedicated to exploring, supporting, and expanding the arts in and around Virginia Tech.
103984.description_html:
The Graduate Arts Council is a group of students dedicated to exploring, supporting, and expanding the arts in and around Virginia Tech.

The Council provides opportunities for graduate and professional students to connect and network across all programs at Virginia Tech, as well as assistance and support for projects that foster artistic expression, creative research, and community dialogue.

365374.name: Graduate Asian, Pacific Islander, Desi American Association at Virginia Tech
365374.summary: GAPIDA is committed to addressing the needs and interests of APIDA graduate and professional students by fostering a space to support inclusion and collaboration while our members are learning, teaching, and researching at Virginia Tech.
365374.description_html: GAPIDA is committed to addressing the needs and interests of APIDA graduate and professional students by fostering a space to support inclusion and collaboration while our members are learning, teaching, and researching at Virginia Tech. GAPIDA strives to provide critical resources to ensure the academic, professional, and personal success of our members by developing a powerful network of APIDA scholars who can diversify and enrich the larger community in the spirit of Ut Prosim.

369991.name: Graduate Engineering Alliance
369991.summary: The Graduate Engineering Alliance (GEA) connects engineering affiliated grad students through professional, social, and service opportunities. We support incoming grad students, engineering affiliated GSOs and we advocate for grad students.
369991.description_html: Graduate Engineering Alliance (GEA) strives to build a community for graduate engineering students at Virginia Tech. Its major goals are supporting academic, professional, and social development. In particular, it is explicitly interested in providing a means for inter-departmental socialization. Additionally, GEA is able to provide representation and a means to connect for graduate students in departments that don't have a graduate student organization.

158280.name: Graduate Engineering Mechanics Society
158280.summary: GEMS exists to promote community and collaboration around topics in Engineering Mechanics, primarily for students pursuing a degree or conducting research in the Engineering Mechanics program.
158280.description_html:
The Graduate Engineering Mechanics Society exists to promote community and collaboration around topics in Engineering Mechanics, primarily for students pursuing a degree or conducting research in the Engineering Mechanics graduate program. It will accomplish this by holding social, outreach, and professional development events for its members throughout the year.

The organization will also provide a formalized means of communication between the faculty and the students. Students with any issues or concerns can have GEMS speak to the faculty of the program on their behalf.

This organization also intends to work with the Society of Biomedical Engineering and Sciences to promote collaboration between the two graduate programs in the Department of Biomedical Engineering and Mechanics.

403400.name: Graduate Game Group
403400.summary: The Graduate Game Group, or GGG, is a table-top gaming club, geared towards graduate students, as a way to be creative and form community outside of our departments! This club focuses on table-top and role-playing games as a way to save space for fun.
403400.description_html:
The Graduate Game Group, or GGG, is a tabletop gaming club, geared towards graduate students, as a way to be creative and form a community outside of our departments! This club focuses on tabletop and role-playing games as a way to save space for fun and relaxation. Weekly meetings on Mondays and Wednesdays (6:00pm - 8:00pm). Email an officer for other information!

Join our Discord for all events and updates: https://discord.gg/mYq8Fm2QbC

70187.name: Graduate Honor System
70187.summary: The Graduate Honor Code establishes a standard of academic integrity. The code demands a firm adherence to a set of values and is founded on the concept of honesty with respect to the intellectual efforts of oneself and others.
70187.description_html:
The Graduate Honor Code establishes a standard of academic integrity. As such, this code demands a firm adherence to a set of values. In particular, the code is founded on the concept of honesty with respect to the intellectual efforts of oneself and others. Compliance with the Graduate Honor Code requires that all graduate students exercise honesty and ethical behavior in all their academic pursuits at Virginia Tech, whether these undertakings pertain to study, course work, research, extension, or teaching.

It is recognized that graduate students have very diverse cultural backgrounds. In light of this, the term ethical behavior is defined as conforming to accepted professional standards of conduct, such as codes of ethics used by professional societies in the United States to regulate the manner in which their professions are practiced. The knowledge and practice of ethical behavior shall be the full responsibility of the student. Graduate students may, however, consult with their major professors, department heads, International Graduate Student Services, or the Graduate School for further information on what is expected of them.

More specifically, all graduate students, while being affiliated with Virginia Tech, shall abide by the standards established by Virginia Tech, as these are described in the GHS Constitution. Graduate students, in accepting admission, indicate their willingness to subscribe to and be governed by the Graduate Honor Code and acknowledge the right of the University to establish policies and procedures and to take disciplinary action (including suspension or expulsion) when such action is warranted. Ignorance shall be no excuse for actions which violate the integrity of the academic community.

The fundamental beliefs underlying and reflected in the Graduate Honor Code are that (1) to trust in a person is a positive force in making a person worthy of trust, (2) to study, perform research, and teach in an environment that is free from the inconveniences and injustices caused by any form of intellectual dishonesty is a right of every graduate student, and (3) to live by an Honor System, which places a positive emphasis on honesty as a means of protecting this right, is consistent with, and a contribution to, the University's quest for truth.

The Graduate Honor System was established to implement the Graduate Honor Code, and its functions shall be:

  1. To promote honesty and ethical behavior in all academic pursuits, including, but not limited to, study, research, teaching, and extension.
  2. To disseminate information concerning the Graduate Honor System to all new graduate students, faculty, and other interested parties.
  3. To investigate all suspected violations of the Graduate Honor Code in an impartial, thorough, and unbiased manner.
  4. To try all cases involving academic infractions of the Graduate Honor Code brought before the System.
  5. To assure that the rights of all involved parties are protected and assure due process in all proceedings.

77872.name: Graduate Physics Student Society
77872.summary: The Graduate Physics Student Society (GPSS) is a society of graduate students that organizes students' scientific gathering and graduate student seminar.
77872.description_html:
The objective of the Graduate Physics Student Society (GPSS) is to create a community of graduate students by promoting and organizing academic and social events.

The academic events would include qualifying/preliminary exam preparation and conference/seminar talk rehearsals, providing a way for graduate students of all years to collaborate with one another.

The social events include, but are not limited to, annual potlucks, movie nights, and outdoor excursions (ex. hiking).

123128.name: Graduate School
123128.summary: The Graduate School Office of Recruitment and Diversity (VT ORDI) offers services to prospective and current students that enhance the climate and diversity of the campus.

106302.name: Graduate Student Assembly - Aerospace and Ocean Engineering
106302.summary: A socio-academic organization aimed at improving the graduate student experience at the department of Aerospace and Ocean engineering.
106302.description_html: The GSA-AOE is a student organization catering to the graduate students of the aerospace and ocean engineering department. The GSA-AOE is motivated to serve the graduate community within the department by providing access and information about the available resources and opportunities. The student organization is also dedicated to promoting an inclusive and close-knit community as we conduct several socials and semi-formal socio-academic opportunities for professional development.

352401.name: Graduate Student Association at Department of Agricultural and Applied Economics
352401.summary: GSA at AAEC serves the needs of graduate students and represent their interests. We organize various social activities to connect students with faculty. We also conduct departmental seminars to help students present and share their research work.
352401.description_html:
GSA at AAEC is a non-profit, non-political organization formed by Graduate Students at the Department of Agricultural and Applied Economics of Virginia Tech with following objectives:

1. Act as liaison between the department authorities and the student body.

2. Conduct departmental seminars to help students present and share their research work.

3. Organize different social and sports events to connect students with faculty.

4. Act as liaison between the AAEC students and the Graduate Student General Assembly

71282.name: Graduate Urban Affairs and Planning Association
71282.summary: The Graduate Urban Affairs and Planning Association (GUAPA) provides a creative and professional environment for graduate students to collaborate with peers, faculty, other departments, and industry professionals.
71282.description_html:
The Graduate Urban Affairs and Planning Association (GUAPA) provides a creative and professional environment for graduate students to collaborate with peers, faculty, other departments, and industry professionals.

GUAPA provides the resources and support necessary for members to achieve their academic and professional goals while at Virginia Tech. This organization harnesses student engagement at the graduate level through regional and national conference participation (such as the APA Conference and City Works Expo), monthly guest speaker lectures, academic research development, as well as social and professional networking opportunities.

235242.name: Graduate Women in Chemistry
235242.summary: Our group aims to provide a community of support and professional development resources for graduate women studying chemistry at Virginia Tech.
235242.description_html: The Graduate Women in Chemistry is an organization focusing on women studying chemistry and related fields at Virginia Tech. Our main goal is to give our members an opportunity to meet each other and develop a network for both professional and after-work activities. We also organize professional development workshops.

75726.name: Graduate–Undergraduate Mentorship Program
75726.summary:
Are you an undergrad who is considering going to grad school, but aren't yet sure? Join our program to see what grad life is REALLY like BEFORE you apply!

Are you a grad student who wants to mentor undergraduates considering grad school? Join us!
75726.description_html:
GUMP, sponsored by the Graduate Student Assembly, pairs undergraduates with graduate students so that they can see graduate life first-hand before deciding to apply for graduate school. The program receives applications for both graduate mentors and undergraduate mentees in the Fall semester of every year. Participation requires a few hours' commitment each week for about two months during the Spring semester, during which time undergraduates "shadow" their graduate mentors in whatever activities they are interested in observing (research, grad classes, lab work, etc.).

To apply...

Graduate students who want to become mentors, go to: https://survey.vt.edu/survey/entry.jsp?id=1349808492884

Undergraduate students who want to become mentees, go to: https://survey.vt.edu/survey/entry.jsp?id=1349807879163

For more information, email: gump@vt.edu

We hope to see you in the Spring!

327232.name: Greek Cru at Virginia Tech
327232.summary: Seeking to equip men and women to leave a lasting spiritual legacy for Christ in their fraternity or sorority.
327232.description_html: Are you a new or returning member of a fraternity or sorority? Are you seeking a Christian community or interested in spiritual discussions? Greek Cru is a safe community to explore the Christian faith for members of Greek Life at Virginia Tech. All Greek-affiliated councils are welcome (social, professional, service, international, etc.)!

414623.name: Group on Women in Medicine and Science
414623.summary: The Group on Women in Medicine and Science (GWIMS) is an AAMC accredited affinity group that includes faculty, medical schools, and teaching hospitals.
414623.description_html: The GWIMS mission states “The Group on Women in Medicine and Science (GWIMS) advances the full and successful participation and inclusion of women within academic medicine by addressing gender equity, recruitment and retention, awards and recognition, and career advancement.” The VTC School of Medicine Chapter focuses on providing a space for promotion of dialogue surrounding what it means to be a woman in medicine, supporting the health of our community, and creating networking opportunities for members based on the Roanoke Campus.

294051.name: Guitar Club
294051.summary: Have you ever wanted to learn to play the guitar or meet other guitarists? Come check out guitar club! Here, you'll find friendly guitarists that are ready to teach or share what they know and jam together.
294051.description_html:
Guitar Club is a beginner friendly environment where any student who wants to learn to play the guitar or meet others who play the guitar can join and make new friends. There are no requirements for membership, no dues, no required attendance, no minimum skill level (beginners welcome), and there is no maximum membership number. You can bring whatever guitar you like and even whatever instrument you like.

Fall 2025 Meeting Times:

Thursdays from 5-7pm, unless otherwise stated. Join Discord for weekly room details and updates!

https://discord.gg/55uXN4CDUj

413622.name: H.E.I.F.E.R.S. at Virginia Tech
413622.summary: H.E.I.F.E.R.S. at Virginia Tech provides hands-on experience in calf care, grooming, and showmanship. The club prepares members for livestock competitions and ag careers while promoting responsibility, confidence, and a passion for agriculture.
413622.description_html: H.E.I.F.E.R.S. at Virginia Tech is dedicated to providing members with a comprehensive, hands-on education in the care, training, and presentation of show calves for fairs and competitions. Our mission is to empower students with the skills and knowledge necessary to excel in livestock showmanship and to prepare them for future careers in the agricultural industry. Through engaging, practical experiences, members will learn essential techniques in calf care, feeding, grooming, and training. We foster a supportive, collaborative environment that encourages personal growth, responsibility, and a passion for agriculture. Ultimately, our goal is to develop confident, capable individuals ready to succeed in the show ring and beyond.

69152.name: Habitat for Humanity at Virginia Tech
69152.summary: Our organization seeks to get the student body interacting in the local community by way of participating in Habitat house builds, as well as other volunteer opportunities. We are affiliated with Habitat for Humanity of the New River Valley
69152.description_html:
Habitat for Humanity at Virginia Tech works closely with the New River Valley affiliate to help members of our community who are struggling financially. We also coordinate and plan Shack-A-Thon, which has helped us raise over $50000 toward our mission in four years.

Link to join the groupme: https://groupme.com/join_group/91813087/PmpLneKj

135375.name: Hang Gliding and Paragliding Club at Virginia Tech
135375.summary: Imagine yourself with a glider on your back dashing down a 30ft hill, grinning ear to ear, and getting airborne for the first time! Join a passionate group excited to fly and eager to get YOU in the air. Unpowered free-flight awaits!
135375.description_html:
Connect with us on Instagram and Facebook for updates on gatherings and happenings - we don't use Gobbler Connect!

Instagram: @hangglidingclubatvt

Click here!

Grab your glider, dash off a 30ft hill, all smiles. Prepare for pure fun with our enthusiastic crew, amped to take flight with you. Get ready for an adrenaline rush!

Our mission? To spark in you the same thrill we get from the most exhilarating sport there is. With help from volunteer instructors, beginners start with flat-ground runs with the glider, then gradually ascend the hill. If you master it, envision the future you, jogging off a mountain slope, glider seamlessly lifting you into the sky. Catch us at Gobblerfest and join our Facebook group for involvement opportunities (link above)!

Our dues are 40 for 1 semester or 70 for 1 year.

Check out our spring break trip to OBX!

Video

369975.name: Harmony: Delight in Dancing
369975.summary: Harmony is a non-audition-based dance group where members can enjoy dancing, teaching dance, and exploring a variety of styles without pressure. We offer open classes in a variety of styles for a wide range of experience and skill levels.
369975.description_html:
Harmony is a non-audition-based dance organization focused on building community where members can enjoy dancing, teaching dance, and exploring a variety of styles without pressure. We hope to help our members improve their skills while trying new things and making friends. Because we value participation, we also aim to foster the confidence for any of our members to try being a teacher and a leader within the group.

 

We hold open classes in many areas such as ballet, jazz, contemporary, and more along with technique and conditioning classes to continue developing the skill sets of our members in addition to giving them an enjoyable de-stressing and physical exercise opportunity.

 

Please feel free to reach out at any time to the contacts listed below or click here to fill out an interest form if you are interested in attending an open class or joining Harmony!

349690.name: Harper Hall Community
349690.summary: Residents and Friends of Harper Hall

420452.name: Harvesting Hope
420452.summary: Harvesting Hope is committed to empowering smallholder farmers and strengthening food systems locally and globally. Inspired by our work with smallholder farmers in South Africa, we recognize the challenges many farmers face in accessing ag. resources.
420452.description_html: Harvesting Hope brings together students who are passionate about improving food and agricultural systems both in their communities and around the world. There are many small farmers in South Africa, and around the world facing similar challenges who could benefit from the skills, knowledge, and resources we have access to as students. Higher education provides us with valuable knowledge and experiences that can be shared to empower others, particularly in the areas of agriculture, food security, and sustainable practices.

414624.name: Healing Through Harmony
414624.summary: Healing through Harmony is a group of musicians of diverse musical backgrounds. Through engaging group activities, creative musical expression, and supportive interactions, we aim to provide an opportunity for individuals to explore their emotions, conne
414624.description_html: Our goal is to harness the therapeutic power of music to promote emotional, mental, and physical well-being within the greater Roanoke community. Our club is dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for patients in hospitals and residents in assisted living facilities, fostering a sense of belonging, and encouraging personal growth through the universal language of music.

114736.name: Health Education and Awareness Team
114736.summary: HEAT is a group of students trained by the health educators at Schiffert Health Center to deliver fun, interactive, and educational health and wellness programs to students throughout the campus community.
114736.description_html:
HEAT’s mission is to develop an effective peer network within the campus environment that promotes, supports, and encourages healthy living for all students. The program seeks to make students more aware of the consequences of unhealthy behaviors by providing educational life-skills training with the most up-to-date information about healthy life-style choices.

HEAT members do public health outreach events and workshops about safer sexual behaviors, contraception, healthy eating choices, sleep, skin cancer prevention, tobacco-use prevention, cold and flu awareness, among others. All of our events address issues that will make the campus community healthier, safer, and more enjoyable. We also sponsor events like the Tobacco-Free Hokies T-Shirt Campaign and Wrap that Package Week.

HEAT is a student development program sponsored by Schiffert Health Center and is registered through the Leadership and Student Organization Program as a University Student Life Program.

408576.name: Heart Club
408576.summary: Heart Club is a pre-health club that wants to spread awareness about cardiovascular disease and promote healthy habits such as diet and exercise. We hope to fundraise money for the American Heart Association
408576.description_html: Heart Club aims to provide students interested in the heart and heart related careers. We hope to provide guest speakers such as cardiologists and Cardiovascular researchers for our members to explore possible careers. We also hope to be a driving force in the fight against cardiovascular disease by working with Virginia Tech Dining to put up more heart healthy flyers and facts and promote healthier diets and exercise. We also aim for our members to practice what they preach so each semester our organization will host a physical activity for one of our meetings.

70550.name: Help Save The Next Girl at Virginia Tech
70550.summary: We are inspired. We are motivated. We are united. We are students who believe that complacency in response to violence is not an answer. We are committed to do whatever it takes, for as long as it takes, to Help Save The Next Girl.
70550.description_html: We are Hokies who believe that complacency in response to violence is not an answer; we are on a mission to make an impact on the culture in which we live to Help Save The Next Girl. We were founded on February 1, 2012 as the first student branch of the national campaign, Help Save The Next Girl, started by the parents of Morgan Harrington; a VT student who was abducted and murdered in October 2009. Morgan's story, as a student of Virginia Tech, is now our story, and because her voice has been forcibly silenced, we speak out. We are determined to show that we, as part of the Hokie Nation, exemplify a beautiful, vibrant, safe community full of solutions. We are inspired. We are united. We are motivated, and thus we are committed to do whatever it takes, for as long as it takes, to Help Save The Next Girl.

69901.name: Hermandad de Sigma Iota Alpha, Inc.
69901.summary: As Hermanas of Hermandad de Sigma Iota Alpha Inc.,our mission is to uphold the goals set forth by our thirteen founding mothers.We pledge to formalize,cultivate, and foster bonds amongst each other as sisters and abide by respect,trust,and communication.
69901.description_html: Hermandad de Sigma Iota Alpha Incorporada is the only non-exclusive Latina-based sorority at Virginia Tech . Our goals are to constantly expand awareness of the Latino and our diverse cultures by creating cultural, educational, and social events. We also promote sisterhood and leadership, and serve as models of excellence in academics and achievements among women.

61139.name: Hill and Veil
61139.summary: The Middle Eastern Dance Association at Virginia Tech
61139.description_html: Hill and Veil is the Middle Eastern Dance Association at Virginia Tech.  We are also commonly known as the Belly Dance Club. We perform at a variety of local venues across Blacksburg throughout the year, including Melody Hookah Lounge.  Our organization is open to anyone in the Blacksburg and Virginia Tech Community. We teach free beginner belly dance classes every Wednesday at 6:30 at Squires 116. We also offer Intermediate and Advanced level involvement, but auditions are required.  See our website for more details.

357889.name: Hillcrest Honors
357889.summary: Hillcrest Honors LLC within Hillcrest Hall is both multi-generational and transdisciplinary, a place where you can share your interests with other passionate and ambitious honors students working in diverse areas across the university.
357889.description_html:
This group is for Hillcrest Hall residents. Some events may be open to the public and will be advertised as such.

Hillcrest Honors strives to cultivate open mindedness, resilience, and creativity in a multi-generational, academically-focused environment. The hall is home to Honors and non-Honors students who wish to live and learn the Honors experience together. Residents value the relationships they are able to cultivate with each other and Honors faculty and staff. Hillcrest Honors residents are encouraged through leadership roles in the community and engagement with in-house programming to be responsible, fun-loving courageous leaders capable of fostering positive, impactful change in communities both large and small.

89946.name: Hillcrest Honors Community
89946.summary: A gathering space for the residents of the Hillcrest Honors Community.
89946.description_html: A gathering space for the residents of the Hillcrest Honors Community.

67861.name: Hillel at Virginia Tech
67861.summary: This is the GobblerConnect page for Hillel at Virginia Tech, the largest Jewish organization at VT! To sign up for upcoming events, visit https://engage.hillel.org/landing/VT and https://www.hillelatvirginiatech.org/ for more information.
67861.description_html: Thank you for visiting Hillel at Virginia Tech's GobblerConnect page! Click "Join" to become a member of our GroupMe. For upcoming events, please visit our website, https://engage.hillel.org/landing/VT and Instagram, @hillelatvirginiatech

305226.name: Hindu YUVA at Virginia Tech
305226.summary: Diverse philosophies coexist in a single framework of Hinduism. Our organization will create opportunities for members of the Virginia Tech community to understand this coexistence and practice Hindu Dharma, or the Hindu way of life.
305226.description_html: The mission of The Virginia Tech Hindu YUVA organization is to bring together both Hindu and non-Hindu students to raise awareness about Hinduism. As one of the largest and oldest religions in the world, we believe it is necessary that there be an organization on campus to represent the interests of the Hindu community present here. We hope to create a comfortable atmosphere where students can come and celebrate their culture. We hope to achieve these goals by having team-building games, yoga and meditation, lively debates, and presentations at our weekly meetings. All in all, we want to build a small Hindu community within Virginia Tech so that students can come and discover a home away from home.

382505.name: History Club at Virginia Tech
382505.summary: The History Club at Virginia Tech is a club centered around History. For History majors, minors, and non-majors - all history enthusiasts are welcome!
382505.description_html: The History Club at Virginia Tech is intended to create a space in the Virginia Tech community for History Majors and people interested in history to meet and discuss topics in History in both academic, personal and research fields. The club seeks to inspire historical and critical thinking about past events and their significance as well as interpretations of these events in both the past and the present with both majors and non-majors.

70357.name: History Graduate Student Association
70357.summary: The History Graduate Student Association at Virginia Tech exists to promote communication among students and faculty as well as venues through which the study of history can reach the university and public at large.
70357.description_html: The History Graduate Student Association at Virginia Tech exists to promote communication among students and faculty and venues through which the study of history can reach the university and public at large. Members are given the opportunity to form a sense of community while gaining practical experience in planning and coordinating academic conferences and taking on additional responsibilities in a higher education setting. Annually, the HGSA plans and coordinates the Brian Bertoti Innovative Perspectives in History Graduate Conference.

414625.name: History of Medicine Club
414625.summary: A group aimed at piquing student curiosity through explorations of medical history.
414625.description_html: As students learn about modern medical science, curiosity naturally turns to the humble origins of our practice. Our club’s mission is to cultivate a profound appreciation for the rich tapestry of medical history, weaving together the narratives of breakthroughs, challenges, and the relentless pursuit of knowledge that have shaped the healthcare landscape. Through engaging discussions and thought provoking guest lecturers, our aim is to kindle a curiosity that goes beyond the surface, inspiring a richer understanding of the historical context that forms the foundation for the medical advancements we enjoy today. We strive to bridge the past with the present, ensuring that the lessons learned from our medical heritage empower us to contribute meaningfully to the future of healthcare.

344548.name: Hoge Hall
344548.summary: Residents and Friends of Hoge Hall
344548.description_html: Welcome to the Hoge Hall Community Page, where you will be able to connect with fellow residents and find opportunities to get involved in the building through social and other programs hosted by the 20 Hoge RAs.

67294.name: Hokie Activities Board
67294.summary: Entertaining Hokies since 1969. The Hokie Activities Board's mission is to provide quality educational and social entertainment that represents the diverse culture of Virginia Tech's students and community.
67294.description_html:
