<center>The purpose of the Hokie Activities Board (HAB) is to provide quality educational and social entertainment that represents the diverse culture of Virginia Tech's students and its community. In addition, the Hokie Activities Board enhances the Virginia
 Tech students' out-of-classroom experience through leadership and volunteer opportunities.</center>

69022.name: Hokie Ambassadors
69022.summary:
Leading Virginia Tech forward by walking backward!
Hokie Ambassadors is an organization of passionate and dedicated students who love their school and volunteer their time to provide campus tours for prospective new students and their families.
69022.description_html:
Hokie Ambassadors is an organization of students responsible for providing campus tours to prospective students and parents. We are housed in Undergraduate Admissions and work alongside their efforts to facilitate recruiting new students and enhancing the visitor experience.

If interested contact us at vtharecruitment@gmail.com

144228.name: Hokie Passport Services
144228.summary: Hokie Passport Services provides the official identification card that permits authorized access to university services and facilities, manages student dining accounts in university dining halls and maintains individual debit accounts for use in various

344344.name: Hokie Talk
344344.summary: We are a podcast at Virginia Tech! We talk to professors and students about their expertise and experiences that are most relevant to college students. Many students don't know what most professors at VT even do! So, Hokie Talk provides a brief glance.
344344.description_html:
Hokie Talk is a completely student run podcast at Virginia Tech. Professors and students are interviewed about their expertise, opinions, and stories!

 

Most students will go their four years at Virginia Tech not knowing what most professors at Virginia Tech actually do, which we seek to change given how close and accessible they are. Hokie Talk seeks spread their knowledge to the Virginia Tech community. 

 

And many students who have previously been interviewed have had interesting and inspiring life stories and project they've liked to share, however there is no requirement for a student to be a guest.  

 

Membership Inquiries: Email hokietalk@outlook.com!

Interested in being a guest? You can fill out this easy form :)

Hokie Talk Guest Form

 

Please contact us if interested or if you have any questions / concerns!

118288.name: Hokie Wellness
118288.summary: The mission of Hokie Wellness is to foster a healthier Virginia Tech community by providing prevention services, education, outreach, and resources to employees and students.
118288.description_html:
Hokie Wellness strives to educate and empower every Hokie to take an active and engaging day-to-day approach to their wellness in order to enjoy a long, healthful, and purpose-filled life. We offer a variety of health & wellness services in every format: one-on-one health consultations, group format workshops, and campus outreach & events. We cover topics that are important in college: sleep, mental health, body image, sexual health, substance safety, financial wellness, digital well-being, and more!

Check out our services now: hokiewellness.vt.edu

139405.name: Hokies Abroad
139405.summary:
Hokies Abroad is a study abroad organization that offers three 6 credit courses through Virginia Tech. These courses include:
1. Antarctica, December 15th-30th 2016
2. New Zealand, December 26th, 2016
3. New Zealand & Australia May 26th-June 21st

369836.name: Home Design at Virginia Tech
369836.summary: Home Design at Virginia Tech allows RED students to network, learn about new software and steps to certification and licensure post graduation. We also aim to take trips to homes and businesses we learn about in depth in class, and more.
369836.description_html:
In Home Design at Virginia Tech, we strive to create an organization for students to learn more about the residential interior design industry. Our goal is to establish a community where students can meet one another, network with professionals in the field, and learn software such as AutoCAD, SketchUp, and Revit. Additionally, we provide resources on how to become certified and/or licensed in the field. We also aim to visit companies, manufacturers, and industry shows discussed in class, such as KBIS and Fallingwater.

GroupMe Link: https://groupme.com/join_group/96160145/hHjK781D

420453.name: Honor of Kings Club at Virginia Tech
420453.summary: A student gaming community for players of Honor of Kings at Virginia Tech. We focus on teamwork, strategy, and friendly competition through regular gaming sessions and tournaments.
420453.description_html: Honor of Kings of Virginia Tech is a student-led organization that brings together players who enjoy Honor of Kings. Our club focuses on creating a fun and inclusive gaming community, promoting teamwork and strategy, and hosting regular gaming sessions and tournaments. Whether you are a casual player or a competitive gamer, you are welcome to join and connect with others who share the same passion.

65463.name: Honors Residential College RAs
65463.summary: The Resident Advisor staff of the Honors Residential College at East Ambler Johnston Hall. The RA model the residential college life and serve as resources for their peers within the HRC.

73560.name: Honors Residential Commons
73560.summary: Honors Residential Commons at East Ambler Johnston Hall
73560.description_html: The Honors Residential Commons is a community of faculty, staff, and students who share a deep intellectual curiosity. This program offers freshman through senior–level university honors students and graduate students an interdisciplinary opportunity to capitalize on the rich history and tradition of Virginia Tech while living and learning with faculty and students in a unique and intentional environment. The HRC is led by a live–in faculty principal and supported by over thirty faculty, staff, and community members.

382675.name: Hope to Walk at Virginia Tech
382675.summary: We will design low-cost prosthetic legs and develop prosthetic training programs to train international communities to help themselves through the Hope to Walk foundation.
382675.description_html: Hope To Walk at Virginia Tech will represent Hope To Walk working to give students local and global community service opportunities. We will raise awareness and funds to support amputees all over the world.

69690.name: Horticulture Club at Virginia Tech
69690.summary: The Horticulture Club strives to promote horticulture through fellowship, education, and development. All students are welcome to the club, all you need is an interest in plants!
69690.description_html:
The Horticulture Club Mission is...

  • To foster, promote, and encourage closer professional and social relationships between the faculty, students, and horticulture community.
  • To present current developments in horticulture, and to educate students on these changes in trends.
  • To develop contacts and friendships within the horticulture community.
  • To promote horticultural interest within Virginia Tech, the community, and the Commonwealth of Virginia.

152291.name: Hospitality and Tourism Management Department
152291.summary: The Department of Hospitality and Tourism Management within the Pamplin College of Business.

62902.name: Hospitality Management Association
62902.summary: The Hospitality Management Association offers students the opportunity for hands-on experience, networking, educational travel, and a competitive advantage in hospitality in an effort to ensure readiness and future success in the industry.
62902.description_html:
The purpose of the Hospitality Management Association (HMA) is to acquaint its members with the basic concepts, practices, and philosophies of the hospitality industry. Student members receive hands-on experience in developing skills in these areas for the future in hospitality. HMA gathers twice a month with general membership meetings to update members about organization events, opportunities, and often feature guest speakers.

HMA participates in HTM Advisory Board Dinners, the HMA Silent Auction Fundraiser, the HTM Destinations Career Fair, and various hospitality trade shows and travel.  HMA also holds social restaurant meetings, and participates in Relay For Life and the Big Event. We offer 7 Officer Leadership Positions that give you an exposure to a deeper level of involvement. Our Director of Tourism, for example, plans and executes a networking trip each semester for our dedicated members. In past years we have traveled to Charleston, Charlotte, Atlanta, Cincinnati, and many other destinations!

62925.name: Housing & Residence Life
62925.description_html:
Creating environments where students come to live,

live to learn, and leave to change the world.

The Mission of Housing & Residence Life at Virginia Tech is to provide inclusive communities that engage students in exceptional living and learning experiences within safe, clean, and well-maintained environments that foster a sense of belonging.

90497.name: HRL Student Staff
90497.summary: This page is for the Resident Advisors, House Supervisors, and Graduate Fellows serving Housing & Residence Life.

145757.name: Human Development
145757.summary: The Department of Human Development and Family Science at Virginia Tech

387560.name: Human Development and Family Science Student Association at Virginia Tech
387560.summary: The HDFSSA is a student-led organization focused on connecting HDFS students with opportunities to lead, build community, and support academic success.
387560.description_html: The HDFSSA is a student-led organization focused on connecting HDFS students with opportunities to gain leadership experience, build community, and support academic success. In keeping with the Virginia Tech Principles of Community, we are committed to maintaining inclusivity, assisted by our affiliation with HDFS department leadership. All HDFS students will have the opportunity to voice needs, concerns, and suggestions for HDFSSA activities and leadership. The HDFSSA will provide the HDFS student body with social and professional development activities to enhance their educational experience at Virginia Tech.

127089.name: Human Development Graduate Student Association at Virginia Tech
127089.summary: The purpose of this organization is to enhance the professional, academic, and social well being of graduate students in the Human Development program at Virginia Tech.
127089.description_html: The Human Development Graduate Student Association provides advocacy for the graduate students in our department. Our mission is to empower students, improve department conditions, and provide a space for graduate students' voices to be heard. We do so by enhancing the professional, academic, and social well being of graduate students within the department.

63169.name: Human Factors and Ergonomic Society: Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
63169.summary: The Society's mission is to promote the discovery and exchange of knowledge concerning the characteristics of human beings that are applicable to the design of systems and devices of all kinds.
63169.description_html: The Virginia Tech chapter of the Human Factors and Ergonomics Society (HFES) was founded in 1999. Overall, HFES was founded in 1957 and has 22 technical groups and numerous local and student chapters and continues to grow and develop. At large, the society's mission is to promote the discovery and exchange of knowledge concerning the characteristics of human beings that apply to the design of systems and devices of all kinds. The goal is to promote serious consideration of knowledge about assigning appropriate functions for humans and machines, whether people serve as operators, maintainers, or users in the system. Furthermore, it advocates the systematic use of such knowledge to achieve compatibility in designing interactive systems of people, machines, and environments to ensure their effectiveness, safety, and ease of performance.

79587.name: Human Nutrition, Foods, and Exercise Graduate Student Association
79587.summary: An organization for graduate students in HNFE.
79587.description_html: A graduate student organization run by students with the purpose of connecting individuals across academic disciplines within HNFE and providing a forum for addressing concerns/interests of HNFE graduate students.

63165.name: Human Powered Submarine at Virginia Tech
63165.summary: The Human Powered Submarine Team at Virginia Tech is an engineering design team comprised of and run by students. We work to design, build, test, and race a fully flooded submarine at our biennial competition, the International Submarine Races.
63165.description_html:
The Human Powered Submarine (HPS) Team at Virginia Tech is one of many student-run engineering design teams that are the pride of Virginia Tech's College of Engineering. The mission of our team is to design, build, test, and race a fully flooded submarine at our biennial competition, the International Submarine Races. As implied by the team's name, the submarine is propelled solely by the power generated by its human pilot.

Our project requires diverse knowledge and understanding of various engineering and liberal arts skills in order for it to be completed. On top of these skills, teamwork is also crucial in order for us to be successful at the International Submarine Races.

Some of the primary topics we apply in our design process include hydrodynamics, electronics, machining, use of composites, CAD, and structural analysis. Participation on the team allows students the opportunity to apply concepts learned in the classroom to a physical project. It also allows members to experience the complete design process from the concept of a design to planning to building the final submarine. Most importantly, it gives students the opportunity to work on an awesome project and experience the thrill of the International Submarine Races.

414626.name: Humanism in Medicine Club
414626.summary: Medicine is about being of service to others. With all the advancements that benefit our field, we must always remember to put the patient first.
414626.description_html: Our mission includes seeing people as people, empowering and advocating for others, and being a part of someone's journey, not just their illness. We organize blood drives, food & toy drives, and service projects and volunteer opportunities.

171068.name: Humanity First
171068.description_html: Humanity First focuses on long-term projects around healthcare, education, vocational training, water and orphans. It was previously registered as a charity in 1994 and has since then expanded its scope of operations to disaster relief and sustainable development projects and initiatives around the whole world. Humanity First is registered in over 40 countries across 6 continents and are working on projects spanning 46 countries. The dedicated volunteers of Humanity First are the forces behind good work and serve those in need.

421291.name: Humanoid Robotics @ Virginia Tech
421291.summary: To work on the development of open-source bipedal robotics at the collegiate level. The ultimate goal is to become the first collegiate team with a walking six foot tall bipedal robot capable of object manipulation, vision, and movement.

72574.name: Hybrid Electric Vehicle Team at Virginia Tech
72574.summary: HEVT is participating in EcoCAR EV Challenge, a four-year engineering design competition sponsored by the US Department of Energy, GM, and MathWorks. Students will be designing and integrating advanced vehicle technology into a 2023 Cadillac Lyriq.
72574.description_html:
The Hybrid Electric Vehicle Team (HEVT) participates in the EcoCAR EV Challenge, a 4-year university design competition sponsored by General Motors, MathWorks, and the U.S. Department of Energy.

Each team in the EcoCAR EV Challenge is given a 2023 Cadillac LYRIQ and tasked with redesigning its electric powertrain, advanced propulsion systems, and connected and automated vehicle technology. Additionally, the vehicle must be consumer appealing, energy efficient, and high performing.


HEVT is divided into 6 different sub-teams: Systems Design and Integration (SDI), Propulsion Controls and Modeling (PCM), Connected and Automated Vehicles (CAV), Project Management (PM), Mobility Challenge (MC), and Communications (COMM). The first three are technical sub-teams, taking in Engineers from any discipline from Mechanical, Electrical, Computer, Computer Science, or other STEM related majors such as CMDA. The last three are non-technical sub-teams, taking in students from any major such as Communications, Psychology, Engineering, Marketing, and more. There is a role for everyone, regardless of major, on HEVT!

This design team helps develop the next generation of innovators, leaders, and engineers of the future! This team is home to numerous professional opportunities such as engineering senior design, internship and job networking, and interdisciplinary team collaboration.

To learn more, we are best contacted through our social media pages or email hevt@vt.edu. We are located in the Ware Lab across from Kelly Hall/Turners. To learn more, please visit our linktree: https://linktr.ee/hybridelectricvehicleteam

414627.name: HyperTech
414627.summary:
HyperTech is a pioneering student-run incubator aimed at medical and graduate students who are passionate about merging medicine with innovation. Our mission is to gather patient needs from the Roanoke community, form interdisciplinary teams to define
 th
414627.description_html: HyperTech is a pioneering student-run incubator aimed at medical and graduate students who are passionate about merging medicine with innovation. Our mission is to gather patient needs from the Roanoke community, form interdisciplinary teams to define the “patient need,” and craft impactful solutions, mirroring the dynamic of national start-up incubators. This club is perfect for those who want to: Learn more about innovation and translational research, become a member of a design team and help assess a “patient need” in our community, develop and showcase skills in opportunity assessment, project management and business planning in a real-world context.

157927.name: IEEE Power Electronics Society (PELS) Student Branch Chapter at Virginia Tech
157927.summary: For over 25 years, the IEEE Power Electronics Society (PELS) has facilitated and guided the development and innovation in power electronics technology. Today, PELS has approximately 88 Chapters and 46 Student Branches all around the globe.
157927.description_html: Interested in power electronics? Join the IEEE Power Electronics Society (PELS) Student Branch Chapter at Virginia Tech to share your passion for this exciting and every-growing field with others! This is a great opportunity to expand your network, find out about the vast applications and careers in power electronics, and to learn about the cutting-edge research.

360600.name: If You're Reading This
360600.summary: A mental health resource that hosts letters of support from students, faculty, and alumni.
360600.description_html: Mental health is, and has been, on the decline for quite some time. With social media, school, and the endless negative factors on mental health, it is more important than ever to slow this trend.  Stepping up to get help is nearly impossible for people who are in need. Because of a negative stigma associated with mental health, they feel embarrassed or invalid. Creating a free and accessible form of help is necessary. IfYourAreReadingThis is an online resource that allows students to read and relate to letters written by students and faculty at Virginia Tech and many more colleges around the country. It is a no-commitment necessary resource that could be a stepping stone for students who are thinking about reaching out for help. School is a huge factor that contributes to anxiety, depression, and even suicidal thoughts but we want to contribute to the slow of these things as much as possible. IfYouAreReadingThis will be a therapeutic resource for those wanting to express themselves in the form of a letter and for those looking for a story to read and relate with. Insta: @ifyourereadingthisvt

406279.name: Imaginarium Studio
406279.summary: A space for Student Leaders to be creative and for residents to attend creative programs.
406279.description_html:
The Imaginarium Studio (IMAG), located in Payne Hall 111, is a creative and supportive space designed specifically for Residential Well-being (RWB) staff and all residents. It's a hub where imagination, community and well-being intersect. 

Hours are 5:00p-10:00p Sundays-Thursdays.

74508.name: IMPACT Peer Education and Prevention Team
74508.summary: The goal of this group is to create an effective peer network that promotes positive alcohol choices by students and works to change the campus and community environment and culture
74508.description_html:
Mission Statement: To foster an environment conducive to learning by educating members of the Virginia Tech and Blacksburg community, and changing the university and community environment to create a positive alcohol culture that eliminates alcohol abuse and decreases alcohol-related negative outcomes.

Vision Statement: We envision a campus and community social environment free from alcohol abuse and related negative outcomes, where alcohol consumption is a positive experience for our peers, the Blacksburg community, and ourselves.

Values Statement: As IMPACT peer educators we embrace and support the following:

  • Showing empathy and respect for others is an essential component of all interactions;
  • The consumption of alcohol should reduce harms to self and others and reflect the spirit of “Party Positive”; and
  • Knowledge of alcohol and its effects, and applicable laws and university policies, is essential for making positive, low-risk, and healthy decisions concerning alcohol.

The IMPACT team is committed to:

  • Reducing alcohol-related negative outcomes and creating a healthier and safer social environment free from abusive drinking and its negative side-effects.
  • Educating fellow students through outreach and prevention programs, classroom presentations, and media campaigns.
  • Collecting data on alcohol and alcohol-related issues.
  • Advocating environmental change in the VT and Blacksburg community.

Members of the IMPACT Peer Education Team will:

  • Develop and implement educational programs that address alcohol use and abuse at Virginia. This includes educating VT students about standard drinks, blood alcohol level, tolerance, and high risk drinking.
  • Develop and implement a drinking and driving awareness campaign.
  • Develop and implement three Party Positive media campaigns per semester.
  • Plan and assist with alternative social activities on the Virginia tech campus (i.e., Deet’s Place).
  • Assist with the collection of data on Virginia Tech students using surveys, interviews, focus groups and other methods to provide valuable information to the Virginia Tech campus and Blacksburg community.

357885.name: Impact.
357885.summary: The Impact Living-Learning Community is a community of people – from all majors and all years – who come together to explore using data analytics to solve some of life’s most challenging and important problems.
357885.description_html: The Impact Living Learning Community (LLC) offers students from any major or any year a chance to expand their knowledge of data analytics in a collaborative environment. Members live together in the same residential hall, engaging in both academic and social events. Through a one-credit foundational course (taken your first semester in Impact) introducing foundational concepts on data analytics and networking opportunities throughout the year with Virginia Tech alumni, professors, and industry professionals, students will tackle data challenges and build valuable connections and knowledge while living in Impact. We welcome students who want to expand their data analytics skills and knowledge, network with data analytics faculty and professionals, work in multidisciplinary teams to solve problems using data, engage in community events, and learn leadership skills. Students will emerge as effective leaders who can make an impact through data-informed decisions.

72423.name: Improv at Virginia Tech
72423.summary: A student-run improv club for any students that wish to try out the art form. We host additional, open improv practices and put on two shows at the end of each semester. Instagram: vt.improv
72423.description_html:
Want to join a rapidly expanding Comedy Group? Improv at Virginia Tech is the right place for you! We are a tight knit group who gather weekly to perform scenes and and games all centered around improv. We have practices on Monday and Wednesday from 7-9. We perform at least twice a semester in a variety of venues, previously we have performed in GLC, the Milk Parlor, and Colonial Hall. 

Interested in joining? We have auditions each semester, please follow and message our Instagram at vt.improv

360599.name: Inclusion & Belonging
360599.summary: Inclusion & Belonging facilitates a productive and sustainable way for students to engage in learning and discussions about the differences that divide us.
360599.description_html:
At Virginia Tech, we believe that the collaboration of cultures, ideas, and different perspectives is a university asset that brings forth greater creativity, innovation, and learning. Student Affairs supports access and success for all Virginia Tech students by engaging them in programs, conversations, and experiences that develop cultural competency, foster inclusion, build bridges of understanding, and teach effective advocacy. We help students become courageous leaders who serve as change agents and make the world more humane and just.

Inclusion & Belonging was established in 2021 as an initiative of the Vice President for Student Affairs. Led by Chief Inclusion & Belonging Officer Anthony Scott, its goals are to help students and the Virginia Tech community strengthen listening skills, increase empathy, facilitate healthy relationships, and foster a sense of belonging for all students.

Inclusion & Belonging programs allow students to develop meaningful relationships, build competencies and skills, recognize and value the diversity that is present within the Hokie Nation, and learn to live the Principles of Community. We make the Virginia Tech journey one that prepares students for academic achievement, personal growth, and lifelong fulfillment.

160598.name: InclusiveVT
160598.summary: InclusiveVT is the institutional and individual commitment to Ut Prosim (that I may serve) in the spirit of community, diversity, and excellence.
160598.description_html: InclusiveVT is the institutional and individual commitment to Ut Prosim (that I may serve) in the spirit of community, diversity, and excellence. Several groups lead InclusiveVT, including the Virginia Tech Office for Inclusion and Diversity, the President's InclusiveVT Executive Council, InclusiveVT representatives, diversity committees, the AdvanceVT/InclusiveVT team made up of senior VT faculty, and the InclusiveVT External Advisory Board.

62960.name: Indian Students Association
62960.summary: The Indian Students Association (ISA) showcases Indian culture and organizes events where Indian students
62960.description_html:
The Indian Students Association (ISA) is a platform to celebrate the rich culture and heritage of India and to help incoming students with the transition to the American way of life. ISA forms the largest international community on the Virginia Tech campus, with over 800 active members, students and families included. We are a strictly non-profit and non-political organization.

ISA’s portfolio of social events celebrates the diverse cultural fabric, and the rich legacy of music, dance, and literature of the Indian subcontinent. We organize celebrations of myriad Indian festivals, including Diwali, Dandiya-Raas, Holi, Independence Day, and Republic Day. These festivals provide a forum for highlighting talented artists in the community. We spread awareness about everything from regional foods to pervasive social issues in India, with volunteer activities such as Aruna Run, International Cafe Hours, and exhibits at the International Street Fair. The first-ever Aruna Run at Virginia Tech raised around $6000 for combating the sexual exploitation of women in rural India.

Simultaneously ISA is a network of educational, social, and professional mentoring and support for students from India. We support students in a variety of ways; from the very beginning of their time at VT, we host live chat sessions to answer their questions, offer them pick-ups from the airport, help them get started with banking and healthcare services, and suggest off-campus housings. More importantly, we help them connect with fellow students in the community and expand their network of friendly faces in Blacksburg.

69173.name: Industrial and Systems Engineering Ambassadors
69173.summary: The mission of the ISE Ambassador program is to provide student volunteers with opportunities for leadership and service to the Grado Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering through community outreach and recruiting the future of ISE.
69173.description_html: The ISE Ambassador program serves primarily as a recruiting and outreach organization for the Grado Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering. It's led and run by students and oversees the following main areas: recruitment, alumni relations, community outreach, student feedback on the curriculum, and event planning.

362528.name: Industrial and Systems Engineering Graduate Student Council
362528.summary: Our organization aims to strengthen the sense of community among our graduate student body across the various ISE disciplines through social, academic, and professional events, and to serve as an effective communication liaison for our graduate students.
362528.description_html: Our organization aims to strengthen the sense of community and camaraderie among the Industrial and Systems Engineering graduate student body across the various ISE disciplines through social, academic, and professional events, and to provide a representative group that can serve as a liaison between our graduate students and the department administration, other campus organizations, and the university as a whole.

357884.name: Innovate
357884.summary:
Live. Learn. Lead.

Innovate is a Virgina Tech Living-Learning Community focused on Entrepreneurship, located in the Creativity and Innovation District (CID).

158273.name: InnovationSpace
158273.summary: The InnovationSpace is a digital multimedia and learning technologies lab. We offer multimedia resources to all faculty, students, and Hokie community members as a service of Virginia Tech, engaging over 10,000 students and 700 faculty annually.

352415.name: Innovative Agriculture Club
352415.summary: Our organization strives to support and pioneer undergraduate engagement in sustainable farming techniques that are quickly becoming more common. We want to teach students to grow their own food, become self-reliant, and provide a path to the industry.
352415.description_html: The Innovative Agriculture Club is a group of sustainable and self-reliant people from all walks of life. We want to educate our communities on how urban farming techniques can allow you to live a more sustainable, self-reliant, and happier life. Just as well we educate and research how conventional farming can be modified to be more ecologically symbiotic. We are focusing currently on hydroponics, aquaponics, permaculture, precision agriculture, agroforestry, and more. If there is a topic that you would like to research and educate on we want to support you! IAC hopes to provide all the resources needed to those with a passion to change the food system.

374011.name: Inspirefly at Virginia Tech
374011.summary: inspireFly is a 1U Cube-Sat Design Team. We are responsible for designing and building a small satellite that will be launched into space. We are currently working on a design that will be launched mid-Spring of 2025.
374011.description_html:
inspireFly is a Cube-Satellite Design team. Our current project will be launched September 2025. Once in orbit, we will make contact with our satellite and relay images to our ground station. Once the mission is completed, we will begin a new project. inspireFly is actively in the process of designing our next satellite. 

inspireFly accepts all majors, years, and skill levels. Applications are open at the start of both the Fall and Spring semesters. 

Contact Gracie Plourde at gracieplourde@vt.edu to be put onto inspireFly's mailing list to receive information about applications.

73454.name: Institute for Operations Research and the Management Science Student Chapter
73454.summary: The INFORMS student chapter at Virginia Tech aims to stimulate interest in the fields of Operations Research, Manufacturing Systems and Processes, and Management Sciences, as well as to provide professional development opportunities for students in ISE.
73454.description_html:
The INFORMS student chapter at Virginia Tech aims to stimulate interest in the fields of Operations Research, Manufacturing Systems and Processes, and Management Sciences, as well as to provide professional development opportunities for students in ISE and other related programs at Virginia Tech. The student chapter seeks to be a platform for students and faculty to get familiar with research and industry professionals.


Our chapter organizes weekly seminars with speakers from Virginia Tech, other universities, and industry. Presentations cover a wide range of topics including manufacturing processes and systems, quality control, management systems, operations research, and data analytics. The meetings are held weekly on Friday from 10:00 to 11:00 A.M. at room 260, Durham Hall.

74509.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
74509.summary: The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) is the primary professional society of the electrical engineering profession. It has more than 330,000 members worldwide; including 52,000 student members.
74509.description_html:
The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) at Virginia Tech student branch is composed of students from the Virginia Tech Computer Science (CS) and Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) Department. We aim to create a strong community within the department and help ECE and CS students develop professionally, academically, and socially! We have devoted our energies towards bringing hands-on, practical experiences to engineering students throughout the campus, as well as creating opportunities for the students to interact with industry professionals and students interested in related fields. Throughout the year, our chapter will have regular meetings, employer events, technology related activities, social events, and more! Everyone is welcome!

Join our Discord to get the most up-to-date announcements regarding company info sessions, networking opportunities, and club events!

69023.name: Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers
69023.summary: IISE is an international, nonprofit association that provides leadership for the application, education, training, research, and development of industrial and systems engineering.
69023.description_html:
The Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers is the world's largest professional society dedicated solely to the support of the industrial and systems engineering profession and individuals involved with improving quality and productivity. Founded in 1948, IISE is an international, nonprofit association that provides leadership for the application, education, training, research, and development of industrial and systems engineering. We offer several social and professional events, as well as training and certification courses.

 

How to join?

70339.name: Institute of Transportation Engineers at Virginia Tech
70339.summary: ITE at Virginia Tech is a student chapter that connects students with professionals in the field of transportation engineering and planning. We offer networking events, technical workshops, and social opportunities.
70339.description_html:
The Institute of Transportation Engineers (ITE) is a professional organization that brings together students, educators, and professionals to advance the practice of transportation engineering and planning. ITE provides opportunities for networking, technical learning, professional development, and hands-on experience through events, guest speakers, technical projects, and competitions. The Virginia Tech ITE Chapter's main purpose is to connect students with industry professionals and help prepare future transportation leaders.

 

While ITE primarily exists to provide a space for those in civil engineering on a transportation related path, we welcome anybody interested in learning about the field who may want to attend a networking or technical event that we would host. Our organization is no commitment, come to whatever events may interest you. We look forward to meeting you this upcoming semester! 

 

Interest Form and Email Sign-Up: https://forms.gle/hCf43DxvnVBYCBUm6

137205.name: Interfaces of Global Change Graduate Student Organization
137205.summary: Graduate Student Organization affiliated with the Interfaces of Global Change Interdisciplinary Graduate Education Program at Virginia Tech
137205.description_html: The Interfaces of Global Change (IGC) Graduate Student Organization (GSO) aims to help graduate students better communicate their research to different stakeholders, promote interdisciplinary research, and foster community among IGC Fellows. The IGC GSO hosts and participates in science education outreach programs, local environmental outreach events, and Fellow-specific events focused on professional development, DEI initiatives, and community building. This organization is associated with the Interfaces of Global Change Interdisciplinary Graduate Education Program, one of several Interdisciplinary Graduate Education Programs. It is also the graduate student arm of VT's Global Change Center.

357476.name: Interfaith Initiative
357476.summary: The Interfaith Initiative educates about religious pluralism, celebrates differences, and advocates for the belonging of students from all religious, secular, and spiritual backgrounds.
357476.description_html: The Interfaith Initiative educates students and faculty about religious pluralism, celebrates differences, and advocates for the belonging of students from all religious, secular, and spiritual backgrounds.

66554.name: Interfraternity Council
66554.summary: The Interfraternity Council at Virginia Tech is a student organization working in association with the Fraternity and Sorority Life office to govern and develop our community of 31 inter/national fraternities.
66554.description_html:
The Interfraternity Council (IFC) at Virginia Tech is a student organization working in association with the Fraternity and Sorority Life Office to govern and develop our community of 32 national fraternities.  We aim to engage, lead, learn, inspire, and serve through a collective effort between all IFC fraternities.

The chapters within the IFC are:

Alpha Epsilon Pi

Alpha Gamma Rho

Alpha Sigma Phi

Alpha Tau Omega

Beta Theta Pi

Beta Upsilon Chi

Delta Chi

Delta Lambda Phi

Delta Sigma Phi

Delta Upsilon

Kappa Alpha Order

Kappa Delta Rho

Lambda Chi Alpha

Phi Delta Theta

Phi Gamma Delta

Phi Kappa Psi

Phi Kappa Sigma

Phi Kappa Tau

Phi Sigma Kappa

Pi Kappa Alpha

Sigma Alpha Epsilon

Sigma Nu

Sigma Phi Delta

Sigma Phi Epsilon

Sigma Tau Gamma

Tau Kappa Epsilon

Theta Chi

Theta Delta Chi

Theta Xi

Triangle

Zeta Beta Tau

Zeta Psi

 

To keep up to date with everything IFC, follow us on Instagram at @vt.ifc!

69197.name: Interior Designers for Education and Sustainability
69197.summary: IDEAS provides skill-building opportunities and cultivates relationships between students and professionals to assist with the transition to the workforce and promote success and growth in the Interior Design program.
69197.description_html:
Interior Designers for Education and Sustainability is a highly involved student-run organization that brings professional skills directly into our students' lives. From weekly designer visits, group trips to major cities, and professional and personal development workshops to help interior design students, and other similar majors, to grow confidently in their craft.

IDEAS has strong ties with many professionals and encourages members to join ASID and IIDA fir further opportunities and affiliation upon graduation.

414628.name: Internal Medicine Interest Group
414628.summary: IMIG is a student led organization within VTCSOM to enhance the students' understanding of internal medicine and to connect medical students with internal medicine physicians.
414628.description_html: To enhance the student body's understanding of the field of Internal Medicine and to facilitate interaction between medical students and internal medicine physicians.

370013.name: International Aerospace Students Association
370013.summary: To create awareness among international aerospace students community regarding internships, jobs, scholarships and fellowships opportunities.
370013.description_html:
The International Aerospace Students Association at Virginia Tech aims to support and represent international students studying aerospace engineering. The organization works to provide information about opportunities and challenges in the aerospace industry and to advocate for issues affecting international students in this field. 

Annually, US universities see a huge influx of international students and a significant number of talented graduates leave.Nonetheless, the challenges faced by international members in Aerospace Engineering often go unaddressed. For example, careers fairs for aerospace students usually do not have a single company/organization that would be willing to hire international students. IASA would work with university and department officials to talk to industry partners and bring in more job opportunities for foreign students. Through IASA, the aim is to tackle these issues and support the international Aerospace community through available resources. The organization is in the process of working towards such small and big issues as well as expanding to form a cohesive network for knowledge flow.

IASA is planning to address these issues in following ways

1. IASA plans to conduct seminars and information sessions for international students. We would require the ability to reserve space as well as have adequate funding to organize such events on campus.
2. IASA would also need to talk to industry partners as well as university officials for helping with career fairs as well as engaging with professional organizations from other universities. Here RSO status of IASA will bolsters the credibility of the association and makes it easier to execute these tasks.
3. We eventually want to get the organization registered with AIAA for larger impact in the long run. Being a university RSO with student representatives from the university will be the first step towards that process.

236616.name: International Archive of Women in Architecture
236616.summary: The IAWA serves the purpose of documenting the history of women's contributions to the built environment and to engage students and community members to play an active role in sharing stories of architects represented in the special collections archive.
236616.description_html:
The International Archive of Women in Architecture (IAWA) serves the purpose of documenting the history of women's contributions to the built environment by collecting, preserving, and providing access to the records of women's architectural organizations and the professional papers of women architects, landscape architects, designers, architectural historians and critics, and urban planners. This allows us to develop a culture within our community that acknowledges and values the dedication of these women and their legacy.

The IAWA aims to create awareness by bringing light to these underrepresented architects. The IAWA also encourages its members to play an active role in research through archiving and advocates for them to disseminate their knowledge to the public by creating open conversations.  We hope to inspire our members to cultivate their own leadership and continue to raise awareness beyond student life.

327233.name: International Council on Systems Engineering at Virginia Tech
327233.summary: INCOSE@VT strives to offer educational, networking, and career-development platforms to enrich the field of systems engineering and foster the application of systems approaches in problem-solving.
327233.description_html:
Systems engineers are responsible for system concept, architecture, design of the system, assessment of risk, verification and validation of systems, and management of complexity. Systems engineering is the discipline that provides the tools, techniques, methods, knowledge, standards, principles, and concepts that enable them to succeed. Innovative and effective systems engineering is inevitably linked to the development of systems that successfully achieves mission success.
The International Council on Systems Engineering (INCOSE) at Virginia Tech aids to provide its members with the resources to develop and disseminate the interdisciplinary principles and practices that enable the realization of successful systems. With members from various disciplines, INCOSE@VT promotes collaboration, knowledge exchange, and the development of best practices in systems engineering. Our mission is to provide educational, networking, and career-development opportunities to its members in order to grow the global community of systems engineers and systems approaches to challenges with Artificial Intelligence. The interlink between AI and SE will be the focus for 2023-24. This Student Division of INCOSE is supported by the INCOSE Washington Metro Area (WMA) Chapter. (https://www.incosewma.org/)

69722.name: International Relations Organization at Virginia Tech
69722.summary: The IRO@VT is a student-run think tank that seeks to provide a platform for networking, researching, learning, and simulating the resolution of world conflicts through the lens of diplomacy, international law, military means, and socio-economic change.
69722.description_html:
Meetings: Lavery Hall (same building as Turner's) room 340, Thursdays at 7 p.m.

The IRO@VT is a student-run think tank that seeks to provide a platform for networking, researching, learning, and simulating the resolution of world conflicts through the lens of diplomacy, military means, and socio-economic change. By working in an interdisciplinary setting we can better prepare ourselves for careers as future leaders.

IRO@VT has open membership for any major, we encourage anyone with interests in the following to sign up:

Diplomacy, Peacekeeping, Foreign Aid, Military History & Tactics, Strategic Studies, National Security, Foreign Policy & Affairs, Leadership, International Law & Business.

Membership requirements: show up and pay dues ($10/semester, $15/year)

100634.name: International Society for Pharmaceutical Engineering, Inc. at Virginia Tech
100634.summary: To grow the interest in pharmaceutical engineering at Virginia Tech.
100634.description_html: International Society for Pharmaceutical Engineering, Inc. at Virginia Tech is a professional society welcome to students of all levels, faculty, and interested non-students. The goal of International Society for Pharmaceutical Engineering, Inc. at Virginia Tech is to grow the interest in pharmaceutical engineering at Virginia Tech. ISPE, Inc. invites guests from industry to speak to students about careers in the pharmaceutical engineering field.

72137.name: International Society of Explosives Engineers at Virginia Tech
72137.summary: The ISEE @ VT is a group within the mining and minerals engineering department that is dedicated to promoting the safety, security and the controlled use of explosives in mining, quarrying, and construction.
72137.description_html: The ISEE at Virginia Tech is a group within the mining and minerals engineering department that is dedicated to promoting the safety, security and the controlled use of explosives in mining, quarrying, construction, manufacturing, demolition, aerospace, forestry, avalanche control, art, automotive, special effects, exploration, seismology, agriculture, law enforcement, and many other peaceful uses of explosives. This society improves student knowledge of the explosives and there use in mining and construction and allows student networking within the explosives industry. Additionally, we strive to develop students professionally, by exposing them to industry professionals

66417.name: InterVarsity Christian Fellowship
66417.summary: IV@VT is a student-led Christian campus ministry with the goal to know God and make Him known on all corners of campus.
66417.description_html:
Due to the transforming grace of the Gospel, we strive to be a united and multi-ethnic community seeking to know God and make Him known on all corners of campus. We hope to see this vision brought about on our campus by engaging students through discipleship, small groups, and large group worship.

Small Groups: We desire our small groups to be mini-communities that allow our students to connect with one another and deepen their friendships while allowing them to have an open environment to ask questions and explore their relationship with Jesus. We have men's, women's, and co-ed groups that meet weekly for Bible study and to spend time together. Any and all are welcome to come, regardless of faith.

IV (Large Group Worship): InterVarsity meets together on campus on Wednesday at 7:00 pm for a time of community, worship, prayer, and teaching.

Community Events: We want to create community-oriented, invitational events to allow for meaningful connections, shared experiences, and opportunities to cuild community together in a welcoming space.

You can expect hiking, tubing, worship nights, game nights and more!

67217.name: InterVarsity Graduate Christian Fellowship
67217.summary: Christian fellowship, bible study, integration of faith and work
67217.description_html: InterVarsity Graduate Christian Fellowship is a diverse, welcoming, student-led community that explores how Christian faith informs our academic and professional work. We gather regularly for Bible study, shared meals, and mutual encouragement through the ups and downs of graduate school.

414630.name: Interventional Radiology Specialty Interest Group
414630.summary: Dedicated to advancing medical student education on Interventional Radiology, fostering mentorship, hands-on learning, and career exploration in IR
414630.description_html: Our Interventional Radiology (IR) Interest Group aims to educate and inspire medical students about the field of IR through hands-on workshops, mentorship, and research. We strive to foster interest, research, and career development in minimally invasive image-guided procedures, bridging innovation with patient care

387552.name: Iota Delta Rho Interdisciplinary Honor Society at Virginia Tech
387552.summary: Iota Delta Rho (IDR) is Virginia Tech's first interdisciplinary research honor society and was established by graduate students in 2011. It is the mission of this organization to promote and recognize interdisciplinary research locally and globally.
387552.description_html:
Our vision is one of an Interdisciplinary Research Future within academia. We want to see the university become a more tightly knit, intermingled community– an academic family of people helping each other with their insights in order to achieve great goals.

In order to achieve such an ambitious goal, we are:

1) Increasing the awareness of Interdisciplinary Research both in Virginia Tech and beyond,

2) Facilitating communication among researchers from different disciplines,

3) Promoting IDR research and recognizing IDR researchers, and as a result

4) Helping to increase the number of IDR funded projects.

70620.name: Iranian Society at Virginia Tech
70620.summary: ISVT is a nonpolitical, nonreligious, nonprofit, cultural organization at Virginia Tech. This organization serves the Iranian students at VT and holds social and cultural events aiming to introduce and promote Persian Culture amongst the VT Community.
70620.description_html: A collective of Iranian students at Virginia Tech.

137018.name: Irish Dancing at Virginia Tech
137018.summary: A student run Irish Dance club for people who are passionate about Irish Dancing and want to have fun. All levels of experience welcome.
137018.description_html: An organization that gives students the opportunity to continue Irish dancing while in college.

239080.name: iScholars Program
239080.summary: Getting students workforce ready and resilient for careers of the future
239080.description_html: The iScholars program offers interdisciplinary experiential learning opportunities for Virginia Tech undergraduates that prepare them for professional life after graduation in ways that traditional academics do not. iScholars offers students admitted to the program professional development bootcamps, virtual career fairs with partner companies, 1 credit courses designed to prepare them for working in industry, as well as mini-capstone courses where sophomores and juniors execute consulting projects for our partner companies. The program is designed to equip students with the knowledge, skills, and confidence needed to find their own internships and excel in their internships and career regardless of their discipline.

352417.name: ISTVS Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
352417.summary: The ISTVS Student Chapter at Virginia Tech is a student chapter affiliated with the International Society for Terrain Vehicle Systems. The objective of the organization is the creation of a common platform for students interested in off-road mobility.
352417.description_html: The mission of the student organization would be to create a common umbrella for students already involved or potentially interested in the field of off-road mobility to connect with each other. Off-road mobility is a specialized interest topic, especially for military, construction and mining industries, and motorsports. There are students across various disciplines (like Mechanical Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Construction Engineering, Mining Engineering, etc.) who would be interested in such an effort. The International Society of Terrain Vehicle Systems (ISTVS) is an organization that works to advance the knowledge in terrain-vehicle systems for improvements in engineering practice and for innovation'. The RSO plans to conduct regular students' meetings discussing relevant research and activities to further their interests in off-road mobility. The student organization plans to conduct seminars and activities involving established researchers and professionals. This would provide a platform for the students to network as well as gain perspectives about the work conducted in industrial and academic settings.

408577.name: Jain Student Association at Virginia Tech
408577.summary: Welcome to Jain Student Association! We hope to create a comfort space for those who already practice and want to practice and learn more about Jainism. We hope to embrace our Jain values at Virginia tech and build meaningful relationships.
408577.description_html: Jainism is an Indian religion that stems back thousands of years that focuses on non-violence and has a staunch commitment to vegetarianism, however, today it has become more of a way of life for those that practice it. At Virginia Tech, we have established the Jain Student Association as a welcoming community for students who embrace Jain values, offering a space where they can connect, share traditions, and build meaningful relationships with others who follow the same beliefs.

68836.name: Japanese Media Club
68836.summary: An organization dedicated to watching and discussing anime and other forms of Japanese media.
68836.description_html: Each week the club gets together to watch and discuss anime, all you have to do to join is show up. Information about meetings can be found in our discord server. https://discord.gg/wxc6dvSxZQ.

365266.name: Jewish Graduate Student Association at Virginia Tech
365266.summary: The mission of this organization is to bring Jewish graduate students together within a safe, and diverse environment. Our org will allow graduate students to celebrate Jewish holidays, events, and the culture together with a similar age cohort.
365266.description_html:
The mission and purpose of this organization are to bring Jewish graduate students together. Jewish graduate students are looking for a community within Virginia Tech in addition to a network of social and professional connections. Our organization will allow graduate students to celebrate Jewish holidays, attend events, and celebrate Jewish culture together with peers of a similar age cohort. There are other similarly principled, cultural graduate associations that we would like to partner with to host events and share our unique heritages.
Accordingly, we want to provide a safe and inclusive community for all graduate students to feel welcome in participating in our events so that we may raise awareness about cultural diversity. This organization aims to attract all graduate students that want to learn more about diversity, cultures, and inclusivity from the perspective of Judaism. The Jewish Graduate Student Association will also work on outreach programs to promote our values of diversity, inclusion, and social justice within the graduate community.
Note: JGSA at VT is governed by its approved constitution and bylaws dated on Jan 30 2023. For any questions please do not hesitate to contact us.

414631.name: Jewish Medical Student Association
414631.summary: We are a group for and by Jewish medical students, residents, and faculty at VTCSOM. We focus on forming and facilitating a Jewish community here while empowering each other as medical students, residents, and faculty members.
414631.description_html: The Jewish Medical Student Association fosters community, cultural awareness, and ethical growth among Jewish medical students. We promote education, mentorship, and service while celebrating Jewish identity and values in medicine.

61045.name: Jewish Student Union of Virginia Tech
61045.summary: JSU serves as an umbrella organization for the Jewish student organizations on campus. JSU's mission includes serving as an advocate/liaison between Jewish students, administration and the campus community.
61045.description_html: The Jewish Student Union (JSU) aims to serve and support Jewish students and organizations such as Hillel, Chabad, Hokies for Israel, Peer Network Engagement Interns, Alpha Epsilon Pi Fraternity, and Zeta Beta Tau Fraternity, while providing external programming to educate the at-large Virginia Tech community on Judaism, our values, and our culture as we seek to end anti-semitism and advocate for all people. We are committed to an inclusive and pluralistic vision for our community.

349689.name: Johnson Hall Community
349689.summary: Residents and Friends of Johnson Hall
349689.description_html: Johnson Hall is an all-female-identifying hall that allows residents to foster close-knit relationships and build a strong community.  In our building, you will find that our kitchen and restrooms are newly renovated. For those eager to try our top dining, we are located next to Hokie Grill which houses Chick - Fil - A and Dunkin’ Donuts. Come join us in Johnson!

362595.name: Jordanian Student Association
362595.summary: The Jordanian Student Association's goal is to unite Jordanian students and allow non-Jordanian students to learn more about Jordanian culture.
362595.description_html:
The Jordanian student association's goal is to unite Jordanian students and allow non-Jordanian students to learn more about Jordanian culture. This will foster a support network for all Jordanian students and promotes Jordanian culture through social and community event.

This association will bring the students together, connect them with other students, help them acclimate to university life, introduce our culture and extend our goodwill to other fellow students.

Jordanian student association will be open to all backgrounds and cultures; we want to create a family where everyone feels comfortable expressing themselves, introducing their culture, and being themselves without fear of criticism or rejected

374059.name: Jugger at Virginia Tech
374059.summary: An organization for introducing the niche, co-ed sport of Jugger to VT. Games are short, high action, and fast-paced, requiring the use of teamwork and strategy. Feel free to join us on the Drill Field any Sunday at noon to try it out!
374059.description_html: Jugger at Virginia Tech is an organization for introducing the niche, co-ed sport of Jugger to Virginia Tech. Games are short, high action, and fast-paced, requiring the use of teamwork and strategy. Teams of 5 face off on a small field in an attempt to get the ball to the opposing team's goal. Only one person on each team can touch the ball, the Qwik, while the other 4 players support their qwik through the use of foam-padded weapons. No prior experience is required or expected, all are welcome. Feel free to join us on the Drill Field any Sunday at noon to try it out!

347792.name: Juggling and Flow Arts Club
347792.summary: We aim to share object manipulation arts (juggling, poi, yoyoing, kendama, etc.) with the Virginia Tech community. ALL are welcome, NO equipment or experience required -- come to learn, chill, and have fun!
347792.description_html:
Juggling is daunting -- we're here to help!

We're a friendly community that supports learning and performing with skill toys. Practices include juggling, poi, yo-yo, kendama, diabolo, staff, and more. There is no commitment, dues, or experience required. Join us to impress your friends and have a good time!

To get connected, please log in and see the Additional Information section, or contact us at jugglingvt@gmail.com!

90584.name: Junoon
90584.summary: Junoon is Virginia Tech’s first competitive fusion dance team. Junoon exhibits a modern perspective on Indian traditions fused with popular American dance styles. Junoon performs all year round at various cultural and community events and competitions.
90584.description_html: Junoon is Virginia Tech’s premiere award-winning competitive fusion dance team. Junoon exhibits a modern perspective on Indian traditions fused with popular American dance styles. Junoon performs all year round at various cultural and community events and competitions nationwide.

403401.name: Just For Kicks
403401.summary: Hey, we're a soccer club that plays pick-up games, usually on the drillfield or rec fields depending on the weather! The only requirement for joining is to be respectful, and include everyone no matter how good they are at soccer.

68594.name: Juxtaposition A Cappella
68594.summary: Virginia Tech's Premiere All-Male A Cappella Group
68594.description_html:
Juxtaposition is a student-run a cappella group with broad goals of performance throughout the Virginia Tech community. Our group defines our sound through a multitude of unique arrangements of contemporary hits all the way back to the '60s. We passionately pursue live performance opportunities, while also focusing much of our efforts towards recording albums of our newest material.

Juxta has been around since 1994, making it the longest established a cappella group at Virginia Tech. Mark Cirnigliaro created the group and adopted the name Juxtaposition. Since the group's creation, members of Juxta have performed around VT's campus as well as beyond Blacksburg.

369972.name: Kaizen Technology Club
369972.summary: Kaizen Technology Club is a student organization dedicated to educating the Virginia Tech community about the latest emerging technologies and their impact on our everyday lives.
369972.description_html:
Mission Statement - "Our mission is to educate and engage the college community on the impact and potential of emerging technologies, fostering discussions and ideas on how to integrate them into our everyday lives for a better future."

Vision Statement - "Our vision is to empower Virginia Tech students with the knowledge and understanding of next-generation technologies, enabling them to become leaders in their field and to drive innovation for a better future through technology education."

Organization Description - Kaizen is a club dedicated to providing technology education to Virginia Tech students, with a focus on emerging technologies and their impact on our everyday lives. We aim to create a platform for discussions and ideas on how to integrate these technologies into society for a better future. Our events include "Tech Talk with Industry Professionals", where we invite experts to speak and share their experiences with students, "AI Hackathon" where students can work together to develop new and innovative projects using artificial intelligence, "Chat-GPT Music Battles" where members can compete against each other to create the best music with the help of Chat-GPT, "Tech Movie Night" where members can watch and discuss films that explore technology and its impact on society, "Tech Debate" where students can discuss and argue different perspectives on emerging technologies and their impact on society, "Tech Workshop" where students can learn about different technologies and how to use them, "Tech Game Night" where members can play games that involve technology, "Tech Innovation Challenge" where students can submit their innovative ideas using technology and the best will be awarded a prize.

183081.name: Kala
183081.summary: Performing arts group promoting and showcasing talents in South Asian music and Western music
183081.description_html:
Kala (pronounced Kalā) is a student-run music group at Virginia Tech that celebrates both South Asian and Western musical traditions. From Indian classical (Hindustani & Carnatic) to Western classical and contemporary styles, we blend cultures through performance, collaboration, and learning. We also partner with SPIC-MACAY to host touring artists from India and introduce the beauty of Indian music theory.

🎶 Whether you're a performer, learner, or music lover, Kala welcomes you! Come join a vibrant, diverse community of musicians and enthusiasts.

69240.name: Kappa Alpha Order
69240.summary: Founded in 1865 in Lexington, VA, Kappa Alpha Order has long been the moral compass for the modern gentleman. Our motto, "Dieu et les Dames" (French for "God and the Ladies"), is that by which all gentlemen of KA live their lives. Excellence is our aim
69240.description_html:
Why Join KA?

KA traces its beginning to 1865, when four men at Washington College, in Lexington, Va., decided to bind their friendship by a “mutual pledge of faith and loyalty.”

Our founders sought to create an organization rooted in the highest ideals of the time. Those same traits of honor, chivalry, and gentility have remained timeless throughout the ages and are the core of Kappa Alpha.

Emulating chivalric ideals and genteel ethics, KA translates these timeless philosophies into the mainstream of American colleges and universities. These gentlemanly traits are the hallmark for men who have chosen our unique lifestyle.

The philosophy of the Order is that the acquisition of knowledge and the development of character are the great goals of life. Through fellowship and brotherhood, KA seeks to teach young men to be leaders; to be brave, self reliant, and to continually strive to better themselves.

 

Values of the Kappa Alpha Order

1) REVERENCE

God and the Ladies

Our motto is “Dieu et Les Dames” (God and the ladies) and reminds each of us that there is a Higher Being in our lives.  Just as our founders were in 1865, we are called together to demonstrate our Reverence for God and to cultivate our moral faculties.

 

2) GENTILITY

Chivalry and Respect for all

The second part of our motto reminds us that the Age of Chivalry idealized woman and honored her.  The modern gentleman continues this practice of Gentility, showing respect and humility to all that he encounters on his campus, in his family, in his community, and in his career.

 

3) KNOWLEDGE

Continuous Lifelong Learning

The mind is immortal, and we are called upon to seek Knowledge and develop our character throughout our lives.  Our quest for this lifelong learning is manifested in our academic success, our career achievements, and the positive impact we have on our communities.

 

4) LEADERSHIP

Development of Character

We are leaders among men.  We demonstrate this Leadership by setting the proper example of the modern gentleman and by serving mankind in whatever manner we are called.  We demonstrate courage and perseverance as we both lead and follow.

 

5) BROTHERHOOD

Faithful unto death

We are bound to each other—for life.  We befriend and assist our brothers, especially in times of need.  We are Brothers faithful unto death.

 

6) EXCELLENCE

Always aiming higher

Our aim is Onward and Upward, and it is in this direction that we continually strive.  Through hard work and dedication, we endeavor to achieve this Excellence in all that undertake, with a vision of making the world a better place.

420454.name: Kappa Alpha Pi
420454.description_html:
Kappa Alpha Pi Pre-Law and Government is a gender-inclusive professional Fraternity that exists nationally to foster a brotherhood for undergraduate students interested in law and government. Our brotherhood is open to all undergraduate focuses of study. Chapters are devoted to developing students professionally and academically to be leaders in the world that follows graduation.

Interest Form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdkfMerBbuFWcbo_UxiSPmbkU8KvuGKEPCj6bCMGGB2NqQryw/viewform?usp=header

69178.name: Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Incorporated
69178.summary: The Theta Psi Chapter of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. has been a community-building organization at VT since 1977. We are an organization dedicated to academic achievement, service, and leadership. "Achievement in every field of human endeavor".
69178.description_html:
Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Incorporated was founded on the night of January 5th, 1911 in Bloomington, Indiana at Indiana University. It was initially chartered and incorporated as Kappa Alpha Nu on May 15, 1911 making it the first NPHC organization to be incorporated. The name was later changed to Kappa Alpha Psi on April 15, 1915 by a proclamation by the Grand Polemarch, Elder Watson Diggs. Thus making Kappa Alpha Psi a Greek letter organization in every sense of the designation.

The fraternity's fundamental purpose is ACHIEVEMENT in every field of human endeavor. Early in this century, African-American students were actively dissuaded from attending college. Formidable obstacles were erected to prevent the few who were enrolled from assimilating into co-curricular campus life. This ostracism characterized Indiana University in 1911, thus causing Elder W. Diggs, Byron K. Armstrong, and eight other black students to form Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, which remains the only Greek letter organization with its 1st Chapter on the University's campus.

Objectives of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. are as follows:

1. To unite college men of culture, patriotism, and honor in a bond of fraternity.

2. To encourage honorable ACHIEVEMENT in every field of human endeavor.

3. To promote spiritual, social, intellectual, and moral welfare of its members.

4. To assist in the aims and purposes of colleges and universities.

5. To inspire service in the public interest.

167438.name: Kappa Alpha Theta
167438.summary: Kappa Alpha Theta is a member of the Panhellenic Community at Virginia Tech.
167438.description_html: Kappa Alpha Theta is a member of the Panhellenic Community at Virginia Tech. Our chapter enjoys participating in other organization's philanthropies, supporting our own philanthropy CASA, focusing on our academics and growing our sisterhood.

69184.name: Kappa Delta
69184.summary: The Epsilon Pi chapter of Kappa Delta is proud to be an active part of campus and the Greek community at Virginia Tech. We are one of the most engaged Greek organizations on campus and of Kappa Delta chapters nationwide.
69184.description_html: Kappa Delta Sorority is committed to providing opportunities and experiences that build confidence and inspire women to action. With more than 250,000 members, Kappa Delta offers lifelong support for leadership development, personal growth, academic success and community service, all in the context of true friendship.

92394.name: Kappa Delta Pi
92394.summary: The mission of Kappa Delta Pi is to sustain an honored community of diverse educators by promoting excellence and advancing scholarship, leadership, and service.
92394.description_html: From its inception, Kappa Delta Pi has been dedicated to scholarship and excellence. Yet, this 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization is more than an honor society. Through its programs, services, and products, Kappa Delta Pi supports and enhances the professional growth and teaching practices of its member educators throughout the phases and levels of their teaching careers. This support is essential to inaugurating and retaining the best and brightest professionals in the field of education.

347796.name: Kappa Delta Rho at Virginia Tech
347796.summary: We strive to develop educated gentlemen of character who promote human dignity, positive relationships among men, and moral excellence. Our Latin motto Honor Super Omnia (Honor Above All Things) is exemplified by our members' behavior.
347796.description_html:
Kappa Delta Rho was founded on May 17, 1905 at Middlebury College in Middlebury, VT. Since then we have grown to 25,000+ initiated members and have 37 active chapters across the country. These individuals have accepted the challenge of Kappa Delta Rho to strive to place Honor Above All Things in their daily lives by:

  • Embracing the principles and spirit of the Kappa Delta Rho Gentleman, treating all those they encounter with dignity and respect;
  • Working diligently in the pursuit of their education, understanding that they are students first and that the quest for knowledge is an endeavor which lasts a lifetime;
  • Meeting all of their obligations to the Fraternity in a timely manner, as to ensure that they are doing their share and they are not a burden to their brothers;
  • Engaging in the service of mankind, not for the praise or recognition that such service may bring, but because it is the right thing to do;
  • Serving as their brother’s keeper, holding one another accountable for their actions; and
  • Supporting their Alma mater, that she may regard Kappa Delta Rho as a partner in the development of her students.

72136.name: Kappa Kappa Gamma
72136.summary: Kappa Kappa Gamma is proud to be a member of Virginia Tech's Panhellenic Community. Our sisters strive to live out our organization's values of leadership, scholarship, and friendship.
72136.description_html: Kappa Kappa Gamma is an organization of women, which seeks for every member throughout her life bonds of friendship, mutual support, opportunities for self-growth, respect for intellectual development, and an understanding of and an allegiance to positive ethical principles.

400645.name: Kappa Theta Pi
400645.summary: Kappa Theta Pi is a leading technology-focused professional fraternity, aiming to cultivate a broader appreciation for technology by organizing professional development events, private recruiter events, and exciting brotherhood bonding activities.
400645.description_html: Kappa Theta Pi is the nation's premier technology-centric professional fraternity, with the Alpha chapter located at the University of Michigan. There are around 20 chapters of this fraternity existing and thriving nationwide. The mission of Kappa Theta Pi, or KTP for short, is to foster a love for technology in a broader sense than any given existing computer science club or organization by holding professional development events, social networking events, technical advancement events, and private recruiter events; we would also participate in traditional Greek life events like new member traditions, brotherhood bonding events, and social events with other fraternities. In a nutshell, our chapter values diversity, with brothers contributing unique experiences and excelling as student leaders. We celebrate our diverse brotherhood, welcoming all united by a passion for technology.

72340.name: Kendo Club at Virginia Tech
72340.summary: Check out our Instagram (@kendoclubatvirginiatech), join our Discord (https://discord.gg/9KEv8RuCYJ), or contact us at kendoclubatvirginiatech@gmail.com for more information about the club or kendo in general.
72340.description_html:
The Kendo Club at Virginia Tech trains in the Japanese martial art of Kendo, "The Way of the Sword." Members are not required to have prior experience or their own personal kendo equipment. We do not have a meeting schedule at this time, but we will update this page and our Instagram as soon as one is confirmed.

Please check out our Instagram (@kendoclubatvirginiatech), Discord (https://discord.gg/9KEv8RuCYJ), or contact us at kendoclubatvirginiatech@gmail.com for more information about the club or kendo in general.

379996.name: Kidney Disease Screening and Awareness Program at Virginia Tech
379996.summary: KDSAP focuses on student career development and community outreach. Working alongside physicians, we provide kidney screenings and education to underserved communities and offer programs for student growth, including mentorship and clinical experience.

70359.name: Kodokan Aikido
70359.summary: Aikido is a non-competitive Japanese martial art focused on channeling opposing energy safely and efficiently. Join us to learn good responses to any situation, body awareness, and intuitiveness in a unique way. Curious? Contact us!
70359.description_html:
Aikido is known as the art of peace, and students of Aikido work to achieve physical and mental balance through meditation, individual exercises and partner practice. We welcome all fitness levels. Aikido is practiced all over the country and the world. Our club observes the traditional forms of practice and Japanese etiquette. Members can have their skills evaluated through our parent dojo - Kodokan Aikido based in Okazaki, Japan. This allows members of our club to join the international organization (Aikikai Foundation) and transfer membership after graduation.

Want to chat with us? Join our Discord server!

https://discord.gg/Tw27zw78xN

Class Information

Dues: $40.00 /month

 

New Members

First month: FREE
