Aikido uniform (dogi) required ($45); aikido uniforms take up to two (2) weeks to arrive. We highly recommend ordering your dogi during your trial month. 

 

When: Saturdays, 2:00 p.m. - 4:00 p.m. 

No martial arts experience necessary. Saturday classes are tailored for beginners.

 

Where: Luther Memorial Lutheran Church Fellowship Hall

600 Prices Fork Road Blacksburg VA 24060

 

Parking:  We recommend using the lower lot which has ample parking. Access the lower lot by turning right from Prices Fork Road (westbound, i.e, going towards US-460). Those walking from campus can find the building by crossing Prices Fork behind Goodwin Hall.

67218.name: Korean American Student Association
67218.summary: KASA aims to unite students under the core values of Korean culture, including devotion, family, and respect. Our organization strives to achieve this mission through programs that promote social networking and cultural exchange.
67218.description_html: JOIN US! KASA is a great place to meet students and friends who share interests in the Korean culture. You do not have to be Korean to join nor do you require any knowledge of the culture itself. This club serves as a purpose to provide awareness of the rich culture, history, and food that Korea has to offer.

70496.name: Korean Student Association
70496.summary: We are an organization that fosters new and incoming Korean students with the existing Korean community. As an organization, we not only facilitate social networking but also promote activities that pertain to social endeavors.
70496.description_html:
What is KSA?

 

KSA (Korean Student Association) is currently run by about 200 Korean students attending Virginia Tech. As an organization, we help incoming students that they can adapt well to VT life.



Activities

(1) We help newly enrolled Korean students and visiting professors in Virginia Tech.

  • Providing transportation from Roanoke Airport to Blacksburg.
  • Providing information on accommodation and living infrastructure.
  • Providing information on official college enrollment activities.

 

(2) We hold regular meetings to promote friendship between new and old students, visiting professors, and professors working at Virginia Tech and all families.

 

(3) We select topics that are beneficial to members and local residents and hold regular seminars with invited instructors on campus or outside.

 

(4) We participate in the International Students Festival, promote friendship with Korean students and foreign students, and introduce Korean culture to many countries around the world.

 

How to be a KSA member?


Please check out our website (http://www.vtksa.org), our Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/vtksa/ our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/groups/vtksa/), or contact us at ksa@vt.edu

102694.name: Korean-American Scientists and Engineers Association (KSEA) - Southern VA chapter
102694.summary: Professional organization which promotes science, cooperation between the U.S. and Korea, and a career network for Korean-American scientists
102694.description_html:
The organization objectives are to

  • Promote the application of science and technology for the general welfare of society
  • Foster international cooperation, especially between the U.S. and Korea
  • Help Korean-American Scientists and Engineers develop their full career potential

336615.name: La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Incorporated
336615.summary: La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Inc. primarily seeks to take a leadership role in meeting the needs of the Latino community through academic achievement, cultural awareness, community service, and promotion of the Latino Culture.
336615.description_html:
La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Inc. primarily seeks to take a leadership role in meeting the needs of the Latino community through academic achievement, cultural awareness, community service, and promotion of the Latino Culture.

Since its inception in 1982, La Unidad Latina has remained on the vanguard of political and community empowerment by developing influential leaders that strive to exert knowledge and power to their peers in order to attain mutual success. We commit ourselves to academic excellence, leadership development, and cultural enlightenment, enhanced by a diverse cognizant membership. La Hermandad strives to preserve and promote an inclusive intellectual environment for its members, in addition to the general community.

408579.name: Laboratory Animal Science
408579.summary: The Laboratory Animal Science Club focuses specifically on introducing veterinary students to laboratory animal medicine and welfare while ensuring ethical standards in scientific studies.
408579.description_html:
The mission of the Laboratory Animal Science Club is to introduce veterinary students to the specialized field of laboratory animal medicine and welfare. We are dedicated to educating future veterinarians about the proper care, handling, and veterinary procedures for research animals, fostering a deeper understanding of their role in advancing science and ensuring ethical standards in research.

The Laboratory Animal Science Club is dedicated to introducing veterinary students to laboratory animal medicine and welfare. It emphasizes the care, handling, and ethical treatment of animals used in research. This field requires specialized knowledge in regulatory compliance, disease prevention, and humane treatment within research settings. The club helps students understand the role of laboratory animals in scientific advancements and prepares them for careers in laboratory animal medicine, regulatory oversight, or biomedical research.

76866.name: Lambda Chi Alpha
76866.summary: Lambda Chi Alpha at Virginia Tech, Sigma-Lambda Chapter. Lambda Chi Alpha is driven to equip future ideal men in today's society, fostering innovation and respect for all through the teachings of our core values to be applied to your everyday life.
76866.description_html: "At Lambda Chi Alpha, our mission is simple. We inspire and equip men to lead an ethical life of growth, service and leadership. Lambda Chi Alpha envisions a world where the ideal man pursues a life of respect and inclusion for all. A world where we support and encourage one another. And a world where every Brother models and embraces our values: loyalty, duty, respect, service and stewardship, honor, integrity and personal courage."

294053.name: Lambda Iota Mu
294053.summary: The Alpha Chapter of Lambda Iota Mu is a gender-inclusive service fraternity at Virginia Tech. We focus on growing our brothers' passion for environmental conservation through service and community engagement!
294053.description_html: Lambda Iota Mu is a gender inclusive conservation service fraternity that works with the community to support our local ecosystems and educate the public. We have members from every college at Virginia Tech. Together we work on a variety of short- and long-term service projects, including community gardening, campus trash pickups, wetland restorations, trail maintenance, STEM outreach, and more! As long as you are passionate about conservation, we encourage you to rush! All prospective members are required to participate in a formal recruitment process, which takes place early in Spring Semester. Feel free to check out our Instagram or send us an email if you are curious about who we are!

67277.name: Lambda Phi Epsilon
67277.summary: Lambda Phi Epsillon seeks to guide men on a lifelong discovery of authenticity and personal growth. As an organization, we aim for a world where Lambda men live authentic, fulfilling lives and contribute through the pursuit of their noble purpose.
67277.description_html:
Lambda Phi Epsilon was founded on February 25, 1981 by a group of nineteen dedicated men led by principal founder Mr. Craig Ishigo. Hoping to transcend the traditional boundaries of national origins, the founders aimed to create an organization that would set new standards of excellence within the Asian American community, develop leaders within each of the member’s respective community, and bridge the gaps between those communities.

MISSION

To guide men on a lifelong discovery of authenticity and personal growth.

VISION

A world where Lambda men live authentic, fulfilling lives and contribute through the pursuit of their noble purpose.

CORE VALUES

Authenticity: willingness to show our true selves to the world, despite the pressures and expectations that are placed on us by society.

Courageous Leadership: acting with integrity, especially in times of adversity, in the pursuit of a more humane and just world.

Cultural Heritage: ever changing values, ideas, and experiences of a people, transcending generations.

Love: care and respect for ourselves, our brothers, and our world.

Wisdom: pursuit of understanding and its positive application towards our lives and the world.

69187.name: Latin American and Iberian Graduate Students Association
69187.summary: LAIGSA (Latin American and Iberian Graduate Students Association) represents 22 countries from South America, Latin America, the Caribbean, and Europe.
69187.description_html: LAIGSA is an organization of graduate students at Virginia Tech. Its mission is the diffusion of Latin American and Iberian culture by promoting cultural and recreational activities, cultural exchange, and mutual support. LAIGSA provides a space for graduate students at Virginia Tech that are interested in Latin American and Iberian Culture meet and share their experience. LAIGSA is registered officially as a student organization at Virginia Tech and has the direct support of a faculty member who acts as an advisor. LAIGSA is governed by a committee formed by a president, vice-president, treasurer, secretary, event officer, and a communications and social media officer. The committee is elected once a year during the late spring / early Summer season.

65790.name: Latin Link
65790.summary: Latin Link was founded in 2001 and is the largest social LatinX organization at Virginia Tech. We promote Hispanic heritage through cultural, educational and social activities while uniting students and faculty of all backgrounds.
65790.description_html:
Latin Link was founded in 2001 and is the largest social LatinX organization at Virginia Tech. We promote Hispanic heritage through cultural, educational and social activities while uniting students and faculty of all backgrounds.

Facebook Group: (Follow Us) www.facebook.com/groups/VTLatinLink/

Facebook Page: (Like Us) www.facebook.com/VTLatinLink

Instagram: (Follow Us): https://www.instagram.com/vtlatinlink/ 

Join our Listserv (Email): https://forms.gle/HpJqFyYKu1aGjNgv5 

Website (More Information): https://sites.google.com/vt.edu/latinlink

For more information on joining or collaborating with Latin Link, please contact Diana Sevilla-Pastora: dianasevilla@vt.edu or vtlatinlink@gmail.com

65702.name: Latino Association of Student Organizations
65702.summary: LASO is the umbrella organization encompassing all the Latino student organizations at VT. Sponsors events and programs promoting Latinx culture. LASO also addresses, supports, and promotes issues and concerns of the Latinx community.
65702.description_html:
The Latino Association of Student Organizations is the umbrella organization encompassing all the Latinx student organizations at Virginia Tech.

LASO sponsors large venue entertainment and educational programs focused on Latinx culture that unites the Latinx organizations, community, and promotes awareness and knowledge to the general campus community.

We also address, support, and promote the issues and concerns of the Latinx community and the Latinx students. The Latinx community is growing at Virginia Tech and LASO takes pride in making the Latinx voice heard at Virginia Tech.

By coordinating events with its constituents, LASO ensures that the Latino community's presence is felt on campus.

414632.name: Latino Medical Student Association
414632.summary: The Latino Medical Student Association (LMSA) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization founded to represent, support, educate, and unify medical trainees, especially those who identify as Hispanic or Latina/o/x.
414632.description_html: The goal of our chapter is to attend the LMSA annual national meeting and discuss how to bring more latino representation to the VTC community.

403402.name: Latino Medical Student Association Pre-Health Latina/o/x Undergraduate Society at Virginia Tech
403402.summary: LMSA PLUS is a vibrant community of pre-health Latino and non-Latino students passionate about advocacy and outreach. Join us to build leadership, cultural competency, and teamwork and connect, grow, and make an impact on health equity!
403402.description_html:
Our LMSA chapter aims to strengthen the pipeline for Latinx students pursuing pre-health careers, providing both professional and personal growth opportunities. Members gain access to a network of mentors and professionals across various health fields, offering career advice, shadowing opportunities, and collaboration. Through mentorship programs, students receive guidance on their path to health professions, while LMSA’s commitment to cultural competency enhances understanding of Latino communities' health needs.

Members benefit from educational resources like workshops, seminars, and leadership training. Community service and advocacy work build relationships with local populations and support policies that uplift Latinx pre-health students. With a focus on professional development in areas like leadership, teamwork, and public speaking, LMSA creates a supportive, collaborative environment where members can grow, connect with peers, and make a meaningful impact in healthcare.

382618.name: Latinx Veterinary Medicine Association, VMCVM Chapter
382618.summary: LVMA is a student chapter whose mission is to empower Latinx/Hispanic professionals in veterinary medicine and support the Latinx/Hispanic veterinarians. Our goal is to create an inclusive and welcoming space for Latinx individuals at VMCVM.
382618.description_html: LVMA is a student chapter of Latinx Veterinary Medical Association whose mission is to empower Latinx/Hispanic professionals in veterinary medicine and support the next generation of Latinx/Hispanic veterinarians. Our student chapter's goal is to create a familia within VMCVM that is inclusive to Latinx students but also includes allies that would love to celebrate our culture and accomplishments with us! We believe professional development, outreach, mentorship, and scholarship are essential in creating a space for Latinx professionals and clients within the veterinary medicine community.

72242.name: Latter-Day Saints Student Association
72242.summary: We are the student body for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints. Join us as we study the life of Jesus Christ, His Gospel, and His Atonement!
72242.description_html: We are an organization focused on learning about Christ, His Atonement, and His teachings. We have in-person classes Wednesday at 10:30 am and 7:00 pm with this semester focusing on what our faith means in today's world. The evening meeting is on Zoom as well, reach out if you would like the link. Classes are generally an hour long and consist of a few guided questions and lots of open discussion. Join us Monday nights at 7pm as well for various games and activities throughout the semester.

357891.name: Lavender House
357891.summary: The Lavender House Living-Learning Community is a home of and for LGBTQ+ students and allies who want to learn about LGBTQ+ lived experiences as they are shaped by intersecting and marginalized identities.

357641.name: Leadership and Social Change Residential College
357641.summary: The mission of the Leadership and Social Change Residential College is to offer students a theoretical foundation combined with the practical knowledge and skills necessary to lead in a complex global environment.
357641.description_html:
In our community, there are multiple opportunities to get involved including traditions, college council, and Lead 17! 

https://youtu.be/RWIvexnPQc8

68595.name: Leadership, Excellence, and Academics in Pamplin College of Business
68595.summary: LEAP is a freshman transitional program for incoming students entering Pamplin College of Business. LEAP originated as a 2-week summer program with 40 members who dedicate their time to serving the community and learning more about what VT has to offer.

391594.name: League of Legends Club
391594.summary: League of Legends Club is a club that is focused on the team-based Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) game, League of Legends. This club serves as a space for members to talk about all things League-related and meet new people.
391594.description_html:
Discord
^Majority of Communication/Event Announcements will be through Discord
Linktree

Community Involvement:
The League of Legends club serves as a hub for all things related to League of Legends as well as a space for people to socialize and make friends. Throughout the year, we host a multitude of League of Legends-based events such as weekly 10 mans (with every other one being in-person), but we also host other non-league related events such as Game Night, Cascades Hike, and D2 Runs. In addition to these events, we will also host things such as TFT, Arena, and Summoner's Rift Tourney commonly known as Gobbler Gauntlet(GG)

Membership Costs:
To keep the club running and pay for events, we have semester dues of $6 or a yearly due cost of $10. Freshmen and Transfers do not have to pay for dues if it's their first semester here at Tech (Not first semester in the club) so they can experience all our events listed below.

Events that happen throughout the year:
Monthly Meetings(Pizza + Customs)
Weekly 10-man Customs/In-houses
Gobbler Gauntlet
Cascades Hikes
D2 Runs
Board Game Nights
Study Nights
5v5 ARAM Tournament Arena/TFT Tournaments

What is Gobbler Gauntlet?
Gobbler Gauntlet or GG, is a VT - Community tournament held over the course of the semester where captains will draft teams of 5 to compete on Summoner's Rift with the hopes of winning prizes such as RP or cash. This is a FOR FUN tournament based around meeting new people and getting to know the community better. People of all skill levels are accepted so anybody who wants to play is encouraged to join.

Competitive/Tryouts:
Tryouts for our competitive League of Legends Teams (A and if enough interest, a B team) will be held at the start of every Fall Semester! We will be hosting the tryouts in custom 5v5s and will be selecting the best players for our team. That means we are looking for players with a high rating,(preferably Masters+) who work well in a team-based setting. While the tournaments the team will be participating in this year are unknown, we have historically participated in a variety of tournaments. In the past, our players have won several thousands of dollars in scholarship from this tournament. If you are interested in joining or trying out, join our discord server and grab the #tryout role to stay up to date! Here is the page where you can track our competitive accomplishments: https://lol.fandom.com/wiki/Virginia_Polytechnic_Institute_and_State_University

Officer Positions: The League of Legends Club is interested in training officers in a variety of roles such as Public Relations, Treasurer, and Events Coordinators. Additionally, we are looking for a new coach to assist the competitive team.

Current Officer Roster:
President/Treasurer: @Brandon | Bixzy
Alumni Advisors: @saywho. @alphamystogan @Uninam

If you have any questions or want to reach out feel free to ask @Brandon | Bixzy for anything regarding the League of Legends Club

96127.name: LEAP Advisory Board
96127.summary: A transitional program for incoming freshmen in the Pamplin College of Business.

294054.name: LEGO User Group at Virginia Tech
294054.summary: Lego Club is a community where a love for Lego is fostered. We host weekly build nights giving people an opportunity to build, create, and connect. Whether you come with friends, or in hopes of meeting other Lego lovers, we would love for you to join!
294054.description_html: Lego Club at Virginia Tech promotes a community where people can come together and build with Lego. We have an assortment of bulk bricks, but also sets and minifigures! We meet 5:30 to 7:30 every Wednesday, check out our Instagram for a post on the meeting location. Our meetings typically consist of build nights, but we partake in other activities too, such as hikes, movie nights, and collabs with other clubs. Come join us!

388730.name: Leukemia Lymphoma Society at Virginia Tech
388730.summary: We are a student led group on campus that raises funds and awareness for the non-profit cancer organization, The Leukemia and Lymphoma Society.
388730.description_html:
The purpose of The Leukemia Lymphoma Society at Virginia Tech shall be:
1 . To provide a means for students at Virginia Tech to meet and fulfill the mission of LLS.

- The official mission of our national affiliate, The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) is “to cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin’s disease and myeloma, and improve the quality of life of patients and their families.”

2. To provide a forum for discussion, education, awareness, funding, and support of our shared interest in making an impact in the fight against blood cancer.

3. To provide a place to participate in various interactions such as; service, advocacy efforts, education, fundraising and facilitate events tailored to our organizational interests.

294055.name: Lightsaber Club at Virginia Tech
294055.summary: We are a club based around learning how to design and build lightsabers through art and engineering!
294055.description_html:
We are a club based around learning how to design and build lightsabers through art and engineering! Our sabers are 3D printed and metal with various levels of electronics. We are also a Star Wars fan club, obviously. Our meetings include workshops, discussion, and design. We use techniques such as CAD, 3D Printing, spray-painting, and soldering to create lightsabers!

We have an official LCVT Discord server: https://discord.gg/VpxPmzmsxG
Please join for more info and faster responses to your questions!

352419.name: Line Dancing Club at Virginia Tech
352419.summary: A fun club for people interested in, or already experienced in, line dancing. We teach line dances bi-weekly and take trips to local places to line dance together.
352419.description_html: We are a club where people of all music interests can come together and learn dances for different genres of music. We dance to many genres such as pop, hip-hop, country, etc. We currently attend events once a week but there is no mandatory events. We strive to work with our community to bring a line dancing location closer to campus so that we won't have to travel so far.

96300.name: Linking Lives: Creating Sustainable Social Change
96300.summary: The Linking Lives Club was created to support the VT Fall and Spring Lugano Study Abroad Programs. Members are past program study abroad students or students who are interested in studying abroad and service learning in the future.
96300.description_html:
The club holds monthly info sessions for both Fall and Spring Lugano programs for students to learn more about the study abroad and service learning experiences. The club also hosts fundraisers and works on grant projects to help support our partner schools and nonprofits/NGOs in Rwanda, Africa.  

 

Check out our website www.linkinglives.org to learn more about the study abroad programs!

 

Rwanda Experimental Learning (November 2023)

85749.name: Living-Learning Communities
85749.summary: This site is dedicated to the development and maintenance of, as well as communication among, living-learning communities at Virginia Tech.
85749.description_html: Members of this site include any faculty, staff, and students dedicated to living-learning communities (LLCs) at Virginia Tech.  All members should share photos, ideas, accomplishments, events, and any other LLC-related items they wish to share.

64628.name: Love Of God Our Strength
64628.description_html: LOGOS is composed of the Virginia Tech students and people from Blacksburg community, with the majority of the Korean speakers, that share life together in Christ. We have a regular meeting on Fridays for the worship of God and a variety of activities. Our desire is loving God and loving neighbors. We expect to God to heal, transform, and use us to influence our community with his love.

69190.name: Lutheran Campus Ministry
69190.summary: Because God loves us and calls us to love, we welcome and invite others to engage and grow in faith. Through discipleship and active service in our community, we are able to intentionally deepen our relationships with God and one another.
69190.description_html: We're a community of students who gather each week to share a meal, build friendships, and grow in faith. We meet every Tuesday at 5:30 pm for dinner and participate in fun activities with lunch every Sunday after church! Everyone is welcome-- come as you are and join us as we explore God's word and live in Christ's love.

62843.name: Lutheran Outreach at Virginia Tech
62843.summary: A campus ministry of the Lutheran Church Missouri Synod that provides on-campus worship service, Bible study, fellowship and opportunities for service. To find out more, click on our website and Facebook links.
62843.description_html: LOVT gathers in War Memorial Chapel on Sundays at 2:30pm for Bible study and 3:30pm for Divine Service. Other Bible studies and devotions are offered throughout the week. Contact us for more information!

400646.name: MachWorks at Virginia Tech
400646.summary: MachWorks is a design team at Virginia Tech working to design, build, and fly an autonomous, high-speed, jet-powered UAV.
400646.description_html:
Our current project is ICARUS, designed for 220mph with a wingspan of 82 inches and a weighing 28 pounds. We cover a wide range of tasks including aircraft design, OML optimization, custom component design, wind tunnel testing, CFD modeling, jet engine testing, sensor design, dynamic modeling, advanced control systems, communications, composite manufacturing, and more. We have a range of projects including an afterburner, engine test stand, 3D printed flying wing, custom fuel tank, capacitive fuel probes, and a custom parachute recovery system.

We have a couple core objectives:

-Give student hands-on engineering experience and responsibility for their own components

-Ensure all members are critical to their projects

-Give students the support to learn new software and skills for their future careers

157694.name: Magic: The Gathering Club at Virginia Tech
157694.summary: The Magic: the Gathering Club at Virginia Tech is designed as a safe space to assist both new players and veterans who are interested in playing Magic: the Gathering, as well as a community for players to find a home within.
157694.description_html:
The Magic: the Gathering Club at Virginia Tech is designed as a safe space to assist both new players and veterans who are interested in playing Magic: the Gathering, as well as a community for players to find a home within. We run a variety of events throughout the school year, and can also direct you towards players and events for whatever format you are interested in.

You can find us at the Fun-n-Games Hobby Shop in Blacksburg (Address listed below) or at our discord: https://discord.gg/HpmHXc84sM

349806.name: Main Campbell Hall Community
349806.summary: Residents and Friends of Main Campbell Hall

349809.name: Main Eggleston Hall Community
349809.summary: Residents and Friends of Main Egg

79922.name: Malaysian Student Association
79922.summary: A student-driven organization connects Malaysian students at Virginia Tech and those interested in the Malaysian heritage while promoting and creating awareness of Malaysian culture in the community.
79922.description_html:
The Malaysian Student Assocation (MASA) is an organization at Virginia Tech that aims to connect and gather Malaysian students or those interested in Malaysian culture.

We gather at least once a month, and we would normally organize a potluck on these meetings which we call "makan-makan". Those interested are welcome to join us. The best way to try all sorts of Malaysian food, desserts and drinks. 

Furthermore, we are always open to talk if you have questions about Malaysia. It doesn't matter if you're travelling there or just curious, we are happy to help out wherever we can.

114836.name: Management Society
114836.summary: Creating the future, one leader at a time. Open to all undergraduate majors, the Management Society aims to relate management to everyday life in your career and develop your leadership skills to enable success in all aspects of life.
114836.description_html:
The Management Society provides great educational, social, and networking opportunities; from Marketing to Finance, Engineering to Service professions, EVERYONE will practice management at some point in their careers.

Our mission is to develop the leaders of the future through examples of real-world management not found in a textbook or taught in a classroom lecture. We do so by developing leadership skills through meeting executives and managers, workshops, community service events, and exploring potential career paths.  Also, we allow our members to connect, network and develop business-related skills with Pamplin faculty, alumni, and other students.

 

JOINING:

Email anna03@vt.edu for more information on joining our organization

RECRUITERS/COMPANIES: Email anna03@vt.edu & eduggal2005@vt.edu if you are interested in presenting to our organization

362596.name: Mantra Meditation at Virginia Tech
362596.summary: Mantra meditation is a popular form of mediation known to increase focus and compassion on oneself. University life is tough and oftentimes lonely. We aim to give our members a platform to destress, understand more about themselves and the world.
362596.description_html:
We have all heard of meditation, but how long can we make the effects of any kind of meditation last in our lives? Comes to the rescue is an ancient yet simple kind of meditation known as manta meditation!

The main goals of this interest group include providing recreation, stress management tips and character development through the activity of mantra mediation, song, dance and philosophy. The most distinguishing characteristic of this organization is that it discusses/debates proper scientific explanation and reasoning of spirituality and its origins.

The group would also meet regularly to read literature from the ancient texts of the world like the Bhagavad Gita, Shrimad Bhagavatam, etc. to further enhance the effects of the meditation on their daily lives and help find their purpose in the world.

This group varies in its offerings from any other group as follows:

  1. It stimulates discussion so that individual can understand and answer tough questions of life about themselves, the universe and the purpose and relationship within the Universe.
  2. It gives a platform to discuss karma related queries like “Why do bad things happen to good people?”
  3. It discusses practical ways in which the effects of meditation can be lasted forever and be used transform internal consciousness.

387555.name: MarioKart Club at Virginia Tech
387555.summary: A nice place for people to play some casual MarioKart together!
387555.description_html:
This club is for people of any kind to come and play MarioKart together! We are strictly casual here, so no time trials, and you are not required to bring anything (although if you DO have anything to bring, it wouldn't hurt, so feel free!). This way, you can come and play regardless of your skill or access to controllers or setups. You are only required to bring yourself, and friend if you can, and prepare for high-speed fun!

To join our discord, click on the little world icon!

413623.name: Marvel Rivals at Virginia Tech
413623.summary: We are a casual gaming community dedicated to all things Marvel Rivals. Whether you’re here to squad up, join tournaments, or just hang out with fellow Marvel fans, everyone’s welcome regardless of skill level. Suit up, squad up, and have fun!
413623.description_html:
Marvel Rivals at Virginia Tech is a casual gaming community where students come together to play, compete, and connect over Marvel Rivals. Whether you’re here to squad up, join tournaments, or just hang out with fellow Marvel fans, everyone’s welcome regardless of skill level. Suit up, squad up, and have fun!

Join our Discord! There we post all announcements, events, meeting details, and ways to get involved throughout the semester.

63353.name: Materials Engineering Professional Society
63353.summary: MEPS stands for Materials Engineering Professional Society; it is an organization for both undergraduates and graduates interested in Materials Science and Engineering.
63353.description_html:
MEPS stands for Materials Engineering Professional Society; it is an organization for both undergraduates and graduates.  MEPS gives students a unique experience that many other departments do not offer.  Some of these experiences include:

  • Tours and exposure to laboratories and materials industries around the area such as Oakridge National Lab, Corning, NASA, and more;
  • A chance to participate in conferences throughout the year such as MS&T, AFS Metal Casting Congress, and the Annual TMS meeting.
  • Notifications about important dates and opportunities related to MSE (Scholarships!);
  • MSE tailgates and other social events such as gaming nights;
  • Participate in Engineers-Week and several STEM outreach activities;
  • and many more opportunities to meet fellow classmates, professors, and alumni.

356352.name: Math Club
356352.summary: We a group of students enthusiastic about problem solving. While the primary interest is in the domain of math, we also look at other fields of science. We welcome those with little math experience to avid math enthusiasts. Meetings are every other week.
356352.description_html:
We are an academic group focused on problem solving in a wide range of areas from economics, physics, biology, etc. using ideas from math. Although this sounds intimidating we welcome those with any amount of math experience for we structure our meetings to build from the ground up, so everyone from every background can learn something. Pizza and soda is provided at the start of each meeting, where we usually have speakers talk about their field of interest. For the math focused individuals, we will also be preparing for and attending some collegiate math competitions. If you are interested in joining or simply looking around, we primarily use Discord to communicate, which can be found below:
https://discord.gg/Xf3PdJ7aav

This semester we will be attempting email communications, so make sure to apply to the organization to receive notifications!

Meeting dates and times can be found on our website below!

420455.name: Mathematics Directed Reading Program at Virginia Tech
420455.summary: Directed Reading Programs (DRPs) are mathematics mentorship programs, pairing undergraduate students with grad student mentors for a semester-long reading project.
420455.description_html: Directed Reading Programs (DRPs) are mathematics mentorship programs, pairing undergraduate students with grad student mentors for a semester-long reading project.  Typically run by graduate students with minimal faculty oversight, these allow undergrads the opportunity to learn mathematics outside of the classroom and graduate students the opportunity to mentor one-on-one.

369995.name: Mathematics Graduate Student Organization
369995.summary: The Mathematics GSO primarily serves to 1. Advocate on behalf of mathematics graduate students at Virginia Tech, 2. Serve as a liaison between students and department faculty/administration, 3. Promote well-being and community among the student body.
369995.description_html:
The Mathematics GSO primarily serves to
1. Advocate on behalf of mathematics graduate students at Virginia Tech,
2. Serve as a liaison between students and department faculty/administration,
3. Promote well-being and community among the student body.

391584.name: Maybe Calisthenics
391584.summary: We aim to create a casual environment where people who are interested in or already invested in calisthenics can come together and help one another grow as well as meet others who share a similar interest.
391584.description_html:
Calisthenics is, in its simplest form, bodyweight exercise. It can be as simple as you want it, whether your goal is to do 1 push up or 50, we are happy to help your or just be there alongside you.

We are a casual environment where anyone who is interested in or already invested in calisthenics can come together and help one another grow as well as meet others who share a similar interest.

 

Feel free to join our community Discord server for active updates and any questions you have, or just to get to know members. This is where the majority of our announcements and conversing will be.

 

https://discord.gg/95S6qtBcDW

 

Currently meeting: Friday and Sunday at 5:00pm - fitness park outside Prichard Hall or War Memorial Hall

413624.name: Mechanical Contractors Association at Virginia Tech
413624.summary: MCA at Virginia Tech aims to encourage and educate students on becoming involved in the construction industry, mechanical contracting in specific.
413624.description_html: The Mechanical Contractors Association at Virginia Tech (MCA) aims to encourage and educate students on becoming involved in the construction industry, mechanical contracting in specific. By providing networking opportunities, a yearly field trip, and educational events, students are able to learn about mechanical contracting in a way they cannot otherwise do at Virginia Tech. As a chapter of an otherwise broader organization, the Mechanical Contractors Association of America, students are given the opportunity to attend conferences and participate in a national competition team. This competition takes place over the fall semester, and results are shared at a conference each spring. This allows for interested students to learn in a realistic way about mechanical contracting, and what their careers may look like after graduation in the industry.

102141.name: Mechanical Engineering Graduate Student Council
102141.summary: We seek to fulfill two purposes: To increase and strengthen the community of graduate students in the Mechanical Engineering department through social and academic events and to serve as an intermediary between students and administration.
102141.description_html:
This organization exists to fulfill two purposes: To increase and strengthen the community within the Mechanical Engineering graduate students through social and academic events and to provide a representative body that will serve as an intermediary between the students and the department administration.

If you are a graduate student in the Mechanical Engineering department and would like to learn more about MEGSC, please reach out to us via our primary contact.

 

Find more details at: https://megsc.me.vt.edu/

414649.name: Medical Student Grand Rounds
414649.summary: MSGR provides a platform for medical students to share share their work, enhance presentation skills, and foster collaboration in medicine.
414649.description_html: MSGR empowers students to present clinical, research, and health policy topics through engaging talks. It fosters professional development, knowledge exchange, and student-driven discussions.

73580.name: Men's Club Basketball at Virginia Tech
73580.summary: The Men's Club Basketball Team at Virginia Tech plays in various tournaments throughout the year against other schools' club teams, and occasionally plays against post graduate schools. We also practice a few times a week during the season.
73580.description_html:
We are a competitive club basketball team. As a roster of roughly 25 students (selective membership through tryouts), we participate in various club basketball tournaments throughout the year. These tournaments are mostly in states along the east coast. Over the past few years, tournament locations have included JMU, UMD, NC State, University of Delaware, UNC, etc. We also occasionally play against postgraduate and basketball prep schools in the Hahn Hurst Basketball Practice Center. Opponents we have played against include Hargrave Military Academy, Fishburne Military Academy, Davidson Community College, and Charis Prep School. Many of these teams have players that contain future NCAA Division I, II, and III players. We will also be doing fundraisers to raise money for the season and may occasionally have social events with other club teams or sororities here at Virginia Tech. For clarification, we are a Registered Student Organization (RSO) under Virginia Tech. An RSO is defined as “a voluntary association of Virginia Tech students that has no direct relationship to the university but upon completion of registration documents are entitled to certain privileges to include operating, meeting, advertising, and participating in activities on the Virginia Tech campus.” This means that we are not a “VT Sports Club”, also classified as a University Student Life Program (USLP), meaning that we are not under the Department of Virginia Tech Recreational Sports. We are not entitled to get funding from the Department of Sport Clubs, and therefore, we must budget and manage ourselves appropriately without their help and request funding from the RSO Budget Board. However, despite not being an official Club Sport, we are a fully functional and competitive club basketball team playing against other university club teams. 

For all information please view our Instagram page. https://www.instagram.com/clubballvt/?igshid=OGQ5ZDc2ODk2ZA%3D%3D

357892.name: Meraki
357892.summary: In the Meraki Living-Learning Community (LLC), students will be encouraged to put their passion, creativity, and soul into finding themselves through well-being.
357892.description_html:
Meraki: A Living Learning Community at Virginia Tech

In the Meraki Living-Learning Community (LLC), students will be encouraged to put their passion, creativity, and soul into finding themselves through well-being. No matter your starting point, we want you to join us on your well-being journey. In this positive and supportive environment, students will determine what it means for them to be well, explore the six dimensions of well-being, and develop lifelong skills to make Meraki more than just a saying but rather a lifestyle. By engaging with faculty, alumni, and campus resources, there will be a variety of experiences offered for students to continue to evolve their own understanding of well-being. We hope that students will embrace what they learn during their time in Meraki and share it with those in their networks, the communities, and beyond.

69371.name: Meteorology Club at Virginia Tech
69371.summary: The Blue Ridge Chapter of the AMS and NWA is how we get involved in anything and everything related to field of meteorology.
69371.description_html: The Blue Ridge Chapter of the AMS and NWA is designed to help students interested in the field of meteorology. Whether it be from a career or hobby standpoint, if you like weather, join us!

71235.name: Microbiology Club at Virginia Tech
71235.summary: We are an academic student organization that focuses on Microbiology. We provide members with information on how to become involved in Undergraduate Research and succeed in classes at Virginia Tech, and participation opportunities in community outreach.
71235.description_html: We are an academic student organization that focuses on Microbiology. We are open to all Virginia Tech students regardless of major. We provide members with information on how to obtain undergraduate research, jobs, and internship opportunities. Guest speakers are invited to come to our meetings to help our members learn about the wide range of topics in Microbiology and how to get involved. We organize and participate in Microbiology-related outreach events on and off campus, where we help teach students and the public about the importance of Microbiology.

327235.name: Middle Eastern North African Student Association
327235.summary: The purpose of the Middle Eastern North African Student Association at Virginia Tech is to promote a greater understanding of the Arab and North African cultures, languages, and customs among students, faculty, and community members at Virginia Tech
327235.description_html: The purpose of the Middle Eastern North African Student Association at Virginia Tech is to celebrate and infuse the knowledge of arab and north african culture, history, language and customs to circulate pride and patriotism in members of MENA descent and create a greater understanding of the culture among students, employees, and community members at Virginia Tech, regardless of their backgrounds. We aim to raise awareness, hold charity events to assist with humanitarian aid, and partner with donation programs pertinent to the Arab and Middle Eastern world and Arab/Middle Eastern Americans today.

403404.name: Midshipman Penafiel Workout Club
403404.description_html: The MPWC is a group that was started in an NROTC department in order to have a group that could engage in more events outside of Corps and ROTC functions. At this point, the organization serves as a great way for people, both in and outside of NROTC to come together and socialize in a relaxed environment, helping to build trust and camaraderie for all involved. This is primarily done through weekly movie nights, where we can get together and bond over a shared interest in film and storytelling.

349700.name: Miles Hall Community
349700.summary: Residents and Friends of Miles Hall
349700.description_html: Miles is an all-male identifying dorm located on the far corner on Washington and Kent Street and oversees the President’s Quad. Miles has a strong sense of community and often is quieter because of its location and respectful community. Miles has a newly renovated kitchen, laundry room, and gender inclusive restroom. Miles community is a safe space for any person and represents many different identities. Miles has a record of fun programs that vary from free food, games, outside activities, and is catered to the community that resides in the building.

414650.name: Military Medicine Interest Group
414650.summary: VTCSOM MMIG educates, supports, and connects future military physicians, fostering teamwork, advocacy, and readiness in military medicine.
414650.description_html: VTCSOM MMIG equips future military physicians with knowledge, support, and hands-on experience. We foster teamwork, mentorship, and advocacy through education, training, and community engagement, empowering members to excel in both medicine and military service.

69940.name: Minorities in Agriculture, Natural Resources and Related Sciences
69940.summary: MANRRS is a national organization dedicated to the inclusion, achievement, and advancement of all people in the agricultural, natural resources, and related sciences.
69940.description_html:
Minorities in Agriculture, Natural Resources, and Related Sciences (MANRRS) at Virginia Tech is a part of the national MANRRS organization. We are dedicated to inclusion, achievement, and advancement of ALL people in agriculture, natural resources, and related sciences. Our main goal is to promote professional growth and leadership skills in these sectors while providing a safe atmosphere to learn and connect.  

We meet monthly! All are welcome to join!

70364.name: Minority Association of Pre-Health Students
70364.summary: MAPS works to assist minority students in their goal to become successful in a health related career through various activities such as workshops and "Mini-Med School" field trips.
70364.description_html:
MAPS is an organization dedicated to assisting students who are striving for a health related career in medicine, nursing, PA, dentistry, veterinary, and much more! MAPS also helps to facilitate opportunities such as focused workshops (resume/CV, personal statement etc.), "Mini-Med School" field trips, and a variety of guest speakers. 

Social Media: MAPS Instagram

Website: SNMA - MAPS

65761.name: Mixed Emotions A Cappella
65761.summary: Mixed Emotions, or MEMO, was founded in 1996 and is both the second-oldest a cappella group and the premier co-ed a cappella group at Virginia Tech.
65761.description_html:
Mixed Emotions was founded in 1996 and is both the second-oldest a cappella group and the premier co-ed a cappella group at Virginia Tech. Mixed Emotions has 14 talented members who come together to perform self-arranged songs. The group showcases its music at a concert each fall and spring semester and can also be heard at many charity fundraisers, local festivals, and Greek Life events throughout the academic year. Mixed Emotions's dynamic and ever-changing repertoire often includes genres such as pop, oldies, R&B, classic rock, and country.


What Exactly is A Cappella?!

It means WE make the music: no instruments, no accompaniments; just background singing, vocal percussion, and soloists.


Auditions for the group are held at the beginning of the fall and spring semesters. Each audition typically involves singing scales, performing a chorus and verse of any song one wishes to prepare, and additional exercises that allow us to gauge ability in areas such as pitch matching, harmonizing, or beat-boxing.

70679.name: Mixed Martial Arts Club at Virginia Tech
70679.summary: The Mixed Martial Arts Club at VT welcomes everyone at any level of experience to be a part of our community. Our primary focuses are No-Gi Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, Thai Kickboxing, and Boxing.
70679.description_html:
Hi there!

 

We are a student-led martial arts organization that welcomes all who wish to be part of our community. We focus on learning martial arts while having the benefit of a flexible schedule. Our club instructs and practices No Gi Jiu-Jitsu, Muay Thai, and Boxing.

Though we are a non-profit organization and do not claim to be experts, we host a number of members who have extensive experience in our listed fields and are always open to those who may wish to share their experiences with us. On top of our regular training schedule, we also make an effort to provide opportunities for members who would like a deeper understanding of martial arts such as bringing in reputable guest instructors and participating in regional tournaments. The leadership strives hard to foster a safe and fun environment where toxic behavior and harassment will not be tolerated.

 

Fall 2025 Schedule (Rec Sports Field House, 510 Beamer Way) 

Monday: Muay Thai // 6-8PM

Tuesday: No-Gi Jiu-Jitsu// 6-8PM

Wednesday: Boxing // 6-8PM

Thursday: No-Gi Jiu-Jitsu // 6-8PM

Friday: Open Mat // 6-8PM

 

New + Returning Members

New Members will need to fill out a waiver and pay dues.

Interested and new members are asked to bring a printed and signed waiver to their first practice. No waiver, no participation! 

Waiver can be found below in "Documents"

 

 

Please follow us on Instagram (@HokieFightClub) to stay updated on the latest club announcements!

157695.name: Model United Nations at Virginia Tech
157695.summary: The Model United Nations team at Virginia Tech. We participate in competitive intercollegiate debate through parliamentary procedures, immersive team building activities, and fostering dialogue on world affairs.
157695.description_html:
Welcome to the GobblerConnect page for the competitive Model United Nations travel team! We participate in competitive debate through parliamentary procedures, immersive team building activities, and fostering dialogue on world affairs. If you are interested in international policy and debate, fun and dynamic activities or merely puns about countries, feel free to sign up! We continuously strive for an inclusive environment, and feature a vibrant community of students from many different interests, fields of study, and backgrounds. We meet every Monday from 7:30-9:00 pm in the Data and Decisions Building Room 180. If you are interested or have any questions please feel free to reach out to the club or one of our President, VP, Treasurer, or training chair, Katy Colucci, Christain, Colin Larkin, or Sarah Sass!

Emails:

Katy: ktcolucci@vt.edu

Christian: christianh05@vt.edu 

Colin: larkinc@vt.edu

Sarah: sarahs04@vt.edu

408580.name: Mongolian American Youth Association
408580.summary: MAYA welcomes everyone who is excited about Mongolia’s rich culture, heritage, and cuisine. You don't need to be Mongolian or speak the language—just bring your curiosity and join us in celebrating this fascinating culture!

362514.name: Moped Club at Virginia Tech
362514.summary: The Moped Club at Virginia Tech exists to bring together moped owners, enthusiasts, and anyone else interested in mopeds.
362514.description_html:
The Moped Club at Virginia Tech is a group of people who own or are otherwise interested in Mopeds. Whether you are into riding, fixing, upgrading, or anything else related to mopeds this is the club for you.

 

All are welcome! No moped required!

 

Typically we hold meetings twice month. Times and locations will be announced in our Discord Server: https://discord.gg/fxhVz8FAxA

382676.name: Morgan's Message
382676.summary: Morgan's Message works towards eliminating the stigma surrounding student-athlete mental health. We provide a safe space for athletes to discuss their struggles and empower them along the way.
382676.description_html: Morgan's Message strives to eliminate the stigma surrounding mental health within the student-athlete community and equalize the treatment of physical and mental health in athletics. We aim to expand the dialogue on mental health by normalizing conversations, empowering those who suffer in silence, and supporting those who feel alone.

420456.name: Moroccan American Student Association
420456.summary: Our goal is to create a space for everyone to come together to learn more about Moroccan culture through a variety of social events on and off campus. Events can include cooking Moroccan dishes together, having social night, and creating new friendships.

72824.name: Motorcycle Club at Virginia Tech
72824.summary: MCVT is an organization that brings together the motorcycle community within Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, and beyond.
72824.description_html:
Motorcycle Club at Virginia Tech is a group of people who enjoy anything and everything motorcycle related; including riding, discussing, restoring and maintaining bikes. Every make, model, and style of bike is welcome and we encourage those interested in riding to join.

We have many traditions, such as going to CCVT's Thursday Night Meets, annual trips to the Tail of the Dragon, semesterly track weekends at NCBIKE, and more.  These are all great ways to get to know people and sharpen your riding skills. 

We host numerous events, including parking lot days, track days, bike nights, socal events, meets, and group rides. Find out about these by joining our Instagram (@moto_vt), Discord (Under contact info website), Facebook Group, or by talking to other motorcyclists on campus. Everyone is welcome, just come and join the fun!

357895.name: Mozaiko
357895.summary: In Mozaiko, we bring the world to your residence. Located in Harper Hall, international students live together in a diverse community where they learn about each other’s culture, immerse themselves in language practice, and prepare for a lifetime.
357895.description_html:
Mozaiko is a program of the Cranwell International Center, and is a collaborative venture that includes support from the College of Liberal Arts and Human Science, Pamplin College of Business and a number of departments across campus with interest in engaging with students in the intercultural experience.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rYW3kjtPJ-M

140427.name: Mu Alpha Chapter of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc.
140427.summary: Founded in 1913 by 22 illustrious women, Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. is a private, non-profit organization whose purpose is to provide assistance and support through established programs in local communities throughout the world.
140427.description_html: The Mu Alpha Chapter of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. was chartered on April 12, 1975. Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. is a private, non-profit organization whose purpose is to provide assistance and support through established programs in local communities throughout the world. Founded on January 13, 1913 by twenty-two collegiate women at Howard University, the Sorority is currently a sisterhood of more than 200,000 predominately Black college-educated women. This includes over 900 chapters located in the United States, England, Japan (Tokyo and Okinawa), Germany, the Virgin Islands, Bermuda, the Bahamas, and the Republic of Korea. The major programs of the sorority are based upon the organization’s Five Point Programmatic Thrust: Economic Development, Physical and Mental Health, Educational Development, Political Awareness and Involvement, and International Awareness and Involvement.

391585.name: Mu Epsilon Delta
391585.summary: Mu Epsilon Delta is a national co-ed, pre-health professional fraternity whose mission is to prepare members to succeed in pre-health careers through the development of brotherhood, service, and leadership.
391585.description_html:
The Theta Chapter of Mu Epsilon Delta was founded on July 3rd, 2024, at Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University by a dedicated group of six founding members. This chapter proudly holds the distinction of being the first co-ed chapter within the United Councils for Fraternities and Sororities under the VT Fraternity and Sorority Life (FSL) community.

 

Our members have been actively involved in a wide array of brotherhood and service events, demonstrating our commitment to fostering a supportive and engaged community within the Montgomery County region. We have organized numerous activities designed to strengthen our bonds and provide meaningful contributions to our community.

 

Our chapter have also established valuable partnerships with both national and local organizations, including the Gift of Life, the Virginia College of Osteopathic Medicine (VCOM), the Pre-PA Platform, and others. These collaborations have enriched our chapter’s activities and expanded our impact, allowing us to participate in and support various initiatives that align with our mission and values.

 

Our Three Pillars:

 

Brotherhood

The sense of brotherhood in Mu Epsilon Delta is founded on collaboration, respect, and encouragement, which together create a supportive environment where students pursuing healthcare careers can excel. The connections within MEΔ cultivate a cohesive and dynamic community focused on advancing in the healthcare field. This collaborative network not only enhances members' experiences but also strengthens their readiness for future roles in healthcare.

 

Service

Mu Epsilon Delta is committed to community service, actively creating diverse volunteering opportunities for its members. By organizing service projects, philanthropy events, and collaborating with local & national organizations, MEΔ provides meaningful ways for members to contribute to their communities. These activities not only benefit those served but also offer members practical experiences that deepen their understanding of the broader impact of healthcare.

 

Leadership

In Mu Epsilon Delta, leadership is a fundamental value that influences our organization. We believe that cultivating strong leadership skills is crucial for both personal growth and professional success, particularly in the healthcare field. As a newly established chapter at Virginia Tech, we recognize the unique opportunity we have to build a strong foundation for leadership within our organization. We are dedicated to offering our members numerous avenues to step into leadership roles.

72244.name: Mu Sigma Rho
72244.description_html: Mu Sigma Rho is the National Statistics Honors Society. Its purpose is to promote and encourage scholarly activity in statistics and recognize worthwhile achievement among staff and students in academic and nonacademic institutions.

362493.name: Mucking Team
362493.summary: The Mucking Team/Mine Competition Team competes in old-fashioned mining events to remember those we've lost in the mining industry and to keep traditional mining methods alive.
362493.description_html: The Intercollegiate Mining Games were held for the first time in 1978 to commemorate 91 miners who lost their lives in a mine disaster at the Sunshine Mine in Kellogg, ID. The mine competition team competes against other colleges in the Intercollegiate Mining Games to commemorate those lost. We participate in seven old-fashioned mining events: swede saw, gold panning, mucking, track stand, hand-steel, surveying, and jackleg drilling.

414651.name: Musculoskeletal Education and Research Center
414651.summary: To bring together providers and researchers within the Department of Orthopaedic Surgery and introduce medical students to research through real-world applications.
414651.description_html: To guide medical students interested in orthopedic research with mentorship, project development, research support, presentation, and constructive feedback from surgeons and researchers in the field of Orthopaedics.

382610.name: Music Production at Virginia Tech
382610.summary: Want to become the next Metro Booming? Music production at Virginia Tech seeks to not only bring in experienced music producers but newbies who want to learn the basics of production. No experience or music theory knowledge required or needed.
382610.description_html: The music production club is designed to not only teach beginners the basics of music production but give current artists a platform for collaboration and expression. The club meetings consist of learning new skills, and collaboration projects

137014.name: Muslim Student Association
137014.summary: We believe in helping individuals strengthen their connection with Islam and fostering a community based on Islamic principles.
137014.description_html: We are committed to nurturing a Muslim community for college students. Our members often seek an environment where acceptance and spiritual support are paramount. At MSA, they discover a sense of home, brotherhood/sisterhood, and form lifelong friendships. They contribute to the community and connect with others from diverse backgrounds. Here, they encounter peers devoted to Islam and strive to uphold the deen. They acquire knowledge, develop habits, and gain an understanding of cultural differences. By interacting with fellow Muslims, they become more mindful of their actions and advocate for their Muslim brothers and sisters. We provide numerous opportunities and resources for Muslims to deepen their connection with Islam independently. This enhances their bond with the faith and helps sustain Islam.

414652.name: NAACP Chapter at VTCSOM
414652.summary: Our mission as a chapter at VTCSOM is to expose the VTCSOM medical students to the diverse patient population of Roanoke and bring opportunities to participate in the NAACP Roanoke and other local branches.
414652.description_html: “Our mission is to achieve equity, political rights, and social inclusion by advancing policies and practices that expand human and civil rights, eliminate discrimination, and accelerate the well-being, education, and economic security of Black people and all persons of color. “

90585.name: NABA Inc
90585.summary: NABA, Inc. is a membership association that bridges the opportunity gap for Black Business Leaders in accounting, finance, and all other business majors. Our organization is meant to help connect people with their future professions.
90585.description_html: This organization is united through membership for accountants, finance, and other business-related majors. We are seeking students that are committed to professional and academic excellence and possess a sense of professional and civic responsibility. Our goal is to assist all, but with a root focus on those within the African American community by connecting them with their desired business profession.

72576.name: Nanoscience Student Society
72576.summary: The Nanoscience Student Society provides a space for interdisciplinary discussion, research, and outreach for everything nanoscience related.
72576.description_html: The Nanoscience and Nanomedicine Club brings together a diverse community of students passionate about exploring the cutting edge of nanotechnology. Our goal is to foster interdisciplinary connection—whether you're studying physics, chemistry, engineering, biology, or medicine, there's a place for you here. Nanoscience is a deeply collaborative field that spans many disciplines, and no one can master it all alone. This club provides a space for students to learn from one another, share ideas, and discuss how their unique knowledge can contribute to the future of nanotechnology. Whether you're in the Nanoscience program or simply curious about its applications, you'll find opportunities for conversation, collaboration, and innovation.

413625.name: Nasha at Virginia Tech
413625.summary: Nasha is a South Asian fusion a cappella team at Virginia Tech that blends South Asian and Western music. We aim to perform, compete, and build a strong musical community that celebrates culture and creativity through vocal harmony.
413625.description_html:
"Nasha" refers to the overwhelming feeling of being emotionally captivated. It's an intoxicating feeling created through passion , and in this case, music.

 

We aim to blend the richness of South Asian cultural heritage with raw, powerful vocals, creating music that unites communities. By weaving together classical ragas, contemporary melodies, and pop influences, in an a cappella style, we celebrate identity, culture, and community.

100473.name: National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
100473.summary: We're a branch of the NAACP Youth & College Division whose main focus is to develop ourselves into future leaders while raising awareness about how minorities are affected by economic development, education, health, juvenile justice, & voter empowerment.
100473.description_html:
Want to join NAACP at Virginia Tech? Click linktr.ee/NAACP_VT !

We have a Couple of links in there that will get you started to becoming a member of our org. They are as follows:

- VOTER REGISTRATION LINK: If you are not registered to vote please use our personalized link to register. It takes all of 3 minutes to do

-#REPVA Vote Team Volunteer Interest: To become a member this is the form you must fill out. This is crucial to keep up with the amount of members we have. 

-#RepVa Dream Team: This is a GroupMe that connects you to state-wide members who are on an initiative to get voters registered. If politics is your motive, this is a great connect.  

-NAACP at Virginia Tech GBM Groupme: Join this GroupMe after you have filled out the Volunteer interest form!!!! This is solely the General Body members for NAACP at VT. 

-NAACP at Virginia Tech GobblerConnect: This is the link to our gobbler connect page. just in case at any point, you need any information on NAACP at Virginia Tech, but what better way than to just become a member anyways, right?!

-Instagram & Twitter: Follow us on social media to keep up with us on the latest information and events we have going on.

408581.name: National Association of Minority Contractors (NAMC) Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
408581.summary: The NAMC is a prominent organization dedicated to advocating for and supporting minority contractors in the construction industry. NAMC aims to improve access to opportunities, provide resources for professional growth, and promote equitable practices.

224821.name: National Deer Association At Virginia Tech
224821.summary: The National Deer Association at Virginia Tech advocates for good land stewardship, maintenance of healthy deer populations, and involvement in the cultural pastime of sustainable hunting.
224821.description_html: The National Deer Association at Virginia Tech works to help improve the quality of deer hunting and secure a sustainable future for wild deer.

109340.name: National Organization of Minority Architecture Students at VT
109340.summary: Create diversity within the design professions by promoting the excellence, community engagement, and professional development of its members.
109340.description_html:
The National Organization of Minority Architecture Students is a student-run organization whose focus is on inclusivity and diversity in the school of architecture. NOMAS hosts events to bring its students together with students out of their intended field. It helps prepare students by hosting receptions, meetings, and going to conferences. NOMAS also brings in minority speakers to have discussions within the student body through its partnership with NOMA. 

 

For more information on how to join please see our Linktree: https://linktr.ee/nomas_vt

69707.name: National Pan-Hellenic Council
69707.summary: The National Pan-Hellenic Council promotes interaction through forums, meetings and other mediums for the exchange of information and engages in cooperative programming and initiatives through various activities and functions through its 9 constituents.
69707.description_html:
The National Pan-Hellenic Council, Incorporated (NPHC) is currently composed of nine (9) International Greek letter Sororities and Fraternities: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc., Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc., Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc., Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc., Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc., Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc., Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Inc., Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc. and Iota Phi Theta Fraternity, Inc. NPHC promotes interaction through forums, meetings and other mediums for the exchange of information and engages in cooperative programming and initiatives through various activities and functions.

On May 10, 1930, on the campus of Howard University, in Washington DC, the National Pan-Hellenic Council was formed as a permanent organization with the following charter members: Omega Psi Phi and Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternities, and Alpha Kappa Alpha, Delta Sigma Theta and Zeta Phi Beta Sororities. In 1931, Alpha Phi Alpha and Phi Beta Sigma Fraternities joined the Council. Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority joined in 1937 and Iota Phi Theta Fraternity completed the list of member organizations in 1997.

The stated purpose and mission of the organization in 1930 was “Unanimity of thought and action as far as possible in the conduct of Greek letter collegiate fraternities and sororities, and to consider problems of mutual interest to its member organizations.” Early in 1937, the organization was incorporated under the laws of the State of Illinois and became known as “The National Pan-Hellenic Council, Incorporated.”

68877.name: National Society of Black Engineers
68877.summary: The mission of the National Society of Black Engineers is to increase the number of culturally responsible Black Engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally and positively impact the community.
68877.description_html:
The goal of NSBE is to help black engineers excel academically, succeed professionally through tailored professional development, and positively impact the community through pre-collegiate programs and technical outreach.

With more than 30,000 members, The National Society of Black Engineers is one of the largest student-managed organizations in the country. NSBE is comprised of more than 310 chapters on college and university campuses, 70 Alumni Extension chapters nationwide, and 99 Pre-College chapters. These chapters are geographically divided into six regions. Virginia Tech's NSBE chapter resides in Region 2 within the O-zone, along with other eastern coast collegiate chapters.

Visit Virginia Tech's NSBE chapter website: nsbevt.com

 

Visit the National NSBE Website: www.nsbe.org

388729.name: National Society of Black Women in Medicine
388729.summary: The National Society of Black Women in Medicine at Virginia Tech is a multidisciplinary organization that works to increase the recruitment and retention of students pursuing broad careers in medicine.
388729.description_html: The National Society of Black Women in Medicine is a multidisciplinary organization dedicated to enhancing the recruitment and retention of pre-medical students pursuing diverse career paths in medicine. Our chapter focuses on fostering a supportive community, providing exposure and resources, and promoting the holistic development of pre-medical students at Virginia Tech. Our resources encompass undergraduate research opportunities, community service initiatives, participation in national conferences, medical networking prospects, and the establishment of a robust support system for pre-medical students. By achieving these goals, we aim to contribute to diversifying the healthcare field and equipping pre-medical students with the necessary tools for success in medicine.

70366.name: Native at Virginia Tech
70366.summary: Native at VT is a student organization that serves as a means for the Virginia Tech community to be involved in Native American and Indigenous Culture.
70366.description_html: Native at VT is dedicated to advancing the visibility of American Indians and other Indigenous peoples on campus, as well as raising an awareness of the issues that confront these diverse populations.  Anyone is welcome to join this organization.

175672.name: Natural History Collections Club
175672.summary: This organization works closely with the natural history collections, such as fossils, insects, and animal specimens on campus and around the Blacksburg area, helping to maintain them and create student and local residents' interest in these resources.
175672.description_html: If you love natural history and museums, and have ever fawned over a beautifully taxidermized mouse or a properly preserved herbarium type specimen, this is the place for you! If you haven’t done these things, but love all things nature and are simply interested in learning more about collections and how they work, this is also the place for you! Several natural history collections exist around our wonderful campus in the fields of botany, entomology, geology, and vertebrate biology. In the Natural History Collections Club, we get to work closely with some of these collections, and get to know their curators. Our curators have a lot to do, so it’s our job to help them out. This could include organizing, adding specimens, preparing specimens, raising money to expand our collections, scouting out new additions for our collections, and much more. We will also act as support and advertisers for our collections. Many students don’t realize we have these wonderful resources on campus, so it’s our job to spread the word and get people excited and interested about them.

67114.name: Naturally Sharp
67114.summary: Naturally Sharp is Virginia Tech's best-dressed a cappella group. Since 2002, Natty has been vibing, rocking the stage, and giving amazing on-stage entertainment. This includes a concert each semester, performances at NASCAR, and local performances.
67114.description_html: Naturally Sharp is a student-run a cappella group that exists to share fun vocal performances, inventive interpretations of diverse music, and our signature spiffy style since our founding in 2002. We regularly perform throughout the fall and spring semesters, culminating in a huge concert at the end of each semester. We also maintain a regular cycle for recording and publishing our music on all major streaming platforms. Whether singing for a fundraiser, leading the National Anthem at NASCAR, or performing at our concert, we always strive to sound great and have fun while doing it!

294058.name: Naval Special Operations Preparatory Team
294058.summary: NSPT is an organization focused on preparing students for challenging military training they may face in the future. It prepares them mentally and physically, by drawing on resources such as retired Military personnel and D1 athletes.
294058.description_html: NSPT is an organization focused on preparing students for challenging military training they may face in the future. This program is open to all students who can meet the physical requirements.  The mission of the Naval Special Operations Preparatory Team (NSPT) is to mentally, morally, and physically prepare Virginia Tech students for success in United States Military Special Operations selection courses while reflecting the values of Honor, Brotherhood, Service, Sacrifice, Leadership, Loyalty, Duty, and Ut Prosim.

144142.name: Nazun at Virginia Tech
144142.summary: Mazun (formerly Challah for Hunger) brings people together to bake and sell challah in an effort to raise money and awareness for social justice causes. Our local partner organization is Micah's Backpack
144142.description_html: 1 in 7 people are food insecure. The purpose of Nazun, (formerly Challah for Hunger) is to bring awareness to this issue and bake and sell challah to raise money for different food pantries for the hungry.

69841.name: Nepalese Student Association
69841.summary: Nepalese Student Association (NSA) aims to spread Nepali culture throughout Virginia Tech and the surrounding community.
69841.description_html:
Nepalese Student Association (NSA) at Virginia Tech was established in 2004 as a social and cultural organization. The main goal of this organization is to unify members of Nepalese community at Virginia Tech and also educate others about Nepali culture.

The NSA consists of more than 150 members including students and families who participate in various socio-cultural events each year displaying rich and diverse culture and heritage of Nepal.

In addition to that, NSA members are proud Hokies who continually strive to accomplish the charge of Virginia Tech motto “Ut Prosim (That I May Serve)” by participating in various volunteer services each year.

335181.name: Network of Enlightened Women at Virginia Tech
335181.summary: NeW is a national community of independent thinking women from all sectors and backgrounds, passionate about empowering all women and spreading conservative leaning ideals.
335181.description_html:
The Network of Enlightened Women educates, equips, and empowers women to be principled leaders for a free society.

Educate – NeW educates women on campus and early in their careers on the principles of freedom and opportunity by hosting speakers, holding debates, and providing intellectual resources. In its education work, NeW serves as a thought leader, promoting independent thinking and providing intellectual diversity on college campuses and in public discussions on women, policy, and culture.

Equip – NeW trains pro-liberty women to serve as leaders through campus sessions, national conferences, leadership retreats, and professional development programs.
