Empower – NeW cultivates a vibrant community of women through campus chapters, professional chapters, and our online presence that emboldens participants to confidently advocate for pro-liberty ideas in their schools, workplaces, homes, and communities. NeW also connects program participants with career-advancing professional opportunities.

414653.name: Neurology, Neuroscience, and Neurosurgery Student Interest Group
414653.summary: We provide opportunities for medical students to learn about neurology, neuroscience, and neurosurgery.
414653.description_html: We provide opportunities for medical students to learn about neurology, neuroscience, and neurosurgery, as well as network with current physicians through didactic lectures, panels, SIM Center events, cadaver labs, journal clubs, and grand rounds.

103985.name: Neuroscience Club
103985.summary: We are a student-led academic organization that allows students to explore the interdisciplinary field of Neuroscience. Meetings involve guest speaker lectures, outreach opportunities, social events, workshops, and more.
103985.description_html:
We are a student-led academic organization that allows students to explore the interdisciplinary field of Neuroscience. We invite guest speakers to present at club meetings and we participate in service events and volunteer opportunities. We also aim to build a community within the School of Neuroscience by creating opportunities for student interactions as well as getting to know the professors. 

Meetings for 2025-2026 academic year will be once a week in the evening. Time and Meeting place TBD.

235244.name: Neuroscience Postdoctoral and Graduate Student Association
235244.summary: The purpose of Neuroscience Postdoctoral and Graduate Student Association (NPGA) at Virginia Tech is to facilitate professional and scientific development for postdoctoral associates and graduate students at Virginia Tech.
235244.description_html: The purpose of Neuroscience Postdoctoral and Graduate Student Association (NPGA) at Virginia Tech is to create opportunities for students and postdoctoral associates to engage in professional and scientific development at Virginia Tech. This is accomplished through regular advocacy on trainees’ behalf to the Neuroscience department and through organization of professional and social events that meet the needs and interests of trainees.

420457.name: NeuroTech Club at Virginia Tech
420457.summary: NeuroTech Club at Virginia Tech is a student-led organization exploring advances in neurotechnologies such as BCIs. We bring together students interested in neuroscience, engineering, and computing to collaborate on projects and share knowledge.

349671.name: New Hall West
349671.summary: Residents and Friends of New Hall West

62815.name: New Life Christian Fellowship
62815.summary: NLCF is an interdenominational community with a vision to invest in spiritual growth, invite others to follow Jesus, and inspire each other to change the world. We have Sunday worship services, mission trips, and small groups weekly.
62815.description_html: New Life Christian Fellowship (NLCF) is an interdenominational church with two congregations: a student congregation and a community congregation (New Life). Our vision is to believe, become, and bless. We carry this out with Sunday worship gatherings, Engage Groups (our version of small groups), missions, and more. Browse our website for more about who we are and what we do and feel free to send us an email (info@nlcf.net) with any questions! Like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram, TikTok, Snapchat, and Twitter to keep up-to-date with what’s happening at NLCF!

70701.name: New Student and Family Programs
70701.summary: New Student and Family Programs welcomes all new Hokies and their families to Virginia Tech and is responsible for helping in the transition to college life.
70701.description_html: Mission: New Student and Family Programs creates transitional opportunities to prepare new students and their families for academic and co-curricular experiences at Virginia Tech through cultivating an environment that embraces learning, diversity, inclusion, and welcoming of all new Hokies.

349711.name: Newman Hall Community
349711.summary: Residents and Friends of Newman Hall

305227.name: Nikkei Student Union
305227.summary: 日系学生会 (Nikkei Student Union) is an organization whose purpose is to foster a strong community by connecting Japanese and American culture, identity, and ideas.
305227.description_html:
The meaning of 日系 (Nikkei) is Japanese lineage. In the context of our student union, that means that we as an organization strive to create strong community bonds between the Japanese and American cultures shared by our members.

As an organization, we host various events. Events include sports events, hiking trips, potlucks, movie nights, bonfires, holiday celebrations and more! Community input is valuable to us, so if there are events that our members would like to see happen, we will make them happen.

Membership is open to people of any background. 
Please use this link to join our GroupMe! https://groupme.com/join_group/56545648/iLjdlPx4

Dues are $10 for the semester for returning members, $12 for brand new members. After September 30th, the dues will increase to $20 regardless of prior membership status.

420458.name: Ninja Warrior Club at Virginia Tech
420458.summary: We are a club dedicated to spreading the sport of "ninja", derived from the popular television show "American Ninja Warrior", to Virginia Tech. Our goal's to provide both recreational and competitive opportunities for our members to experience the sport.
420458.description_html: Ninja Warrior Club at Virginia Tech (NWCVT) is a recreational and competitive club that provides opportunities for all collegiate students to enter the world of "ninja", a sport derived from the popular reality television show "American Ninja Warrior". Our members have many options to choose from, ranging from casual participation to competing in competitions held throughout the United States to competing in intramural competitions hosted by our leads.

400648.name: No Empty Seats at Virginia Tech
400648.summary: We believe in making mental health fun and inclusive to all, ensuring that everyone around us feels welcome and safe to talk about mental health. The mission of No Empty States is to break the stigma behind mental illness.
400648.description_html: The Mission of No Empty Seats, Inc. is to break the stigma behind mental illness and encourage showing unconditional love to friends and family. We invest in nationally-recognized suicide prevention charities and share stories revealing the unspoken prevalence of depression and anxiety. Our goal is to emphasize the tragic effects of suicide, with partnered initiatives and projects spreading genuine compassion and acts of kindness.

119054.name: No Hokie Left Behind
119054.summary:
Student led organization that raises safety awareness and invents solutions to community problems. No Hokie Left Behind endorses the maroon and orange stripe in all VT students.
Go with friends. Stay with friends. Leave with friends.

420459.name: Nodule Ocean Mining and Design
420459.summary: The Virginia Tech Ocean Mining and Design Team (NOMAD) develops sustainable technologies for extracting polymetallic nodules from the ocean floor, providing students hands-on experience in marine engineering, design, and environmental innovation.
420459.description_html: The Virginia Tech Ocean Mining and Design Team (NOMAD) is a student-led engineering organization dedicated to developing sustainable technologies for the extraction of polymetallic nodules from the ocean floor. The team combines expertise from mechanical, chemical, materials, and environmental engineering to design innovative systems that support responsible ocean resource utilization. Through hands-on projects, research, and collaboration, NOMAD provides students with real-world experience in marine engineering, sustainability, and interdisciplinary design.

380053.name: Nordic Club
380053.summary: The Nordic Club is an organization that connects Danish, Finnish, Icelandic, Norwegian and Swedish students at Virginia Tech, as well as helps educate the campus about Nordic cultures and languages.
380053.description_html:
The Nordic Club is a student run organization that connects Virginia Tech students of Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, Finish, and Icelandic origin/heritage. This club was founded in Fall 2022 and aims to create a Nordic presence and community on campus. The Nordic Club serves as a support system for Nordic Hokies, as well as creates a space to celebrate and share Nordic language, holidays, traditions, culture, and food with other Nordic students. In addition to this, the Nordic Club hopes to educate the campus about Nordic cultures and languages.

Don't hesitate to reach out with any questions!

Instagram: @vtnordicclub

420460.name: Northstar Ministry at Virginia Tech
420460.summary: Northstar Church exists to make disciples of Jesus who model intimacy, humility, and obedience, using our influence to share the gospel on campus and in the community. We seek to equip students to not just go to church, but to be the church.
420460.description_html:
Northstar Church’s mission is to make disciples of Jesus Christ who model intimacy, humility, and obedience, using our influence to share the gospel. At Northstar, we emphasize that living out our faith is not just about going to church, but being the church.

Our college ministry is about integrating students into the multi-generational church body for their growth (discipleship, mentoring by older believers), service and involvement (having tangible ways to be connected to causes they care about), and their future involvement in the local church. In addition to including students in Sunday services, Northstar College Ministry provides one-on-one discipleship opportunities, small group Bible studies, Young Adult Worship opportunities for undergraduates and graduate students, and many social events such as community meals, finals week study hours, and connections with church members to help facilitate spiritual, relational, and emotional growth.

294059.name: Nu Rho Psi at Virginia Tech
294059.summary: Nu Rho Psi is the national honor society in neuroscience and is focused on promoting and encouraging excellence in neuroscience.
294059.description_html: Virginia Tech is home to the Gamma Chapter of Nu Rho Psi, the National Honor Society in Neuroscience. The chapter at VT was founded in 2018. Membership is obtained through academic and scholastic achievements of neuroscience majors who have completed three undergraduate semesters and nine college credits of 'NEUR' coursework. All potential members must apply to join - inquiries regarding eligibility can be directed to Dr. Kristin Phillips, kfpill@vt.edu.

69032.name: Nursing Club
69032.summary: The Nursing Club at Virginia Tech was formed to create awareness of the diverse opportunities in nursing and to provide a networking opportunity for Virginia Tech students interested in nursing!
69032.description_html:
The Nursing Club at Virginia Tech was formed to create awareness of the diverse opportunities in nursing and to provide a networking opportunity for Virginia Tech students interested in nursing!  

At each bi-weekly meeting, we discuss various career opportunities in the field of nursing, discuss post-Virginia Tech degree programs and prerequisite requirements, and have special guest speakers! 

Previous speakers include: Austin Stajduhar (Assistant Dean for Admission and Financial Aid for University of Virginia), Kelsey Szymanski and Frances Dunn (Shenandoah University), Jennifer Sawyer (Undergraduate Recruitment and Admissions Coordinator for George Mason University), Sarah Wambe (Director of Admissions for Radford University Carilion), Alex Fisher (Program Promotion and Pre-Admission Specialist for Virginia Commonwealth University), Mindy Galvan (George Washington University), Laura Yoder (Eastern Mennonite University), Brandon LeBlanc (Johns Hopkins University), Cynthia Mihalchick (Clemson University), and Rhonda Whaling (Lewis Gale Montgomery Hospital Volunteer Coordinator).


All Virginia Tech students are eligible to join the Nursing Club regardless of major, GPA, etc. The only requirement is an interest in nursing or healthcare!

68600.name: O'Shaghnessy and Johnson Community
68600.summary: Housing and Residence Life, for the community of O'Shag and Johnson

349704.name: Oak Lane Community
349704.summary: Residents and friends of Oak Lane

414655.name: Obstetrics and Gynecology Interest Group
414655.summary: An interest group for students interested in OBGYN. We provide opportunities to learn more about the OBYGN field and connect with physicians.
414655.description_html: Our objectives are for medical students to gain an understanding of what is involved in a career as an Ob/Gyn, promote clinical skills in women’s health, raise awareness of gender differences in health issues, and increase women’s health advocacy.

101737.name: Occupational Therapy Club
101737.summary: OT Club prepares students for a future in Occupational Therapy.
101737.description_html: OT Club prepares members for both occupational therapy graduate school as well as a career in the field! We aim to provide information about various settings, specializations, and the graduate school application process. There are many opportunities such as application workshops, networking with fellow future OT's, graduate school information sessions, OT guest speakers, as well as fun service and social events. OT Club is helpful for students at all points in their undergraduate career, especially with the opportunity to join our mentor program! To learn more, use the contact information below!

379207.name: Office for Civil Rights Compliance and Prevention Education
379207.summary: The Office for Civil Rights Compliance and Prevention Education (CRCPE) promotes a learning and working environment free from harassment and discrimination for employees and students.
379207.description_html: The Office for Civil Rights Compliance and Prevention Education (CRCPE) promotes a learning and working environment free from harassment and discrimination for employees and students. We strengthen the university’s core institutional values of equitable practices through civility, compliance and education while mitigating risks.

358124.name: Office of Living Learning Programs
358124.description_html:
Living Learning Programs is the umbrella term used to describe both the residential colleges, and living learning communities at Virginia Tech. Our Living-Learning Programs provide students with the opportunity to thrive both in and out of the classroom in a learning environment that becomes home. Students can make the most of their Virginia Tech experience by joining a Living-Learning Program.

 

Residential Colleges

Residential Colleges transform learning by focusing on the interdisciplinary connections between students. Students get the benefits of a liberal arts education within the context of a global land-grant university. Led by live-in Faculty Principals, residential colleges welcome students from any major and year — and create a culture in which both tradition and innovation are celebrated.

 

Our Residential Colleges:

  • Honors Residential Commons
  • Leadership and Social Change Residential College
  • Residential College at West Ambler Johnston

Living-Learning Communities

Living-Learning Communities (LLCs) are niche communities where you can live with students around a particular theme, like arts or well-being, or live with students in a similar population group, such as engineering or first-generation students. Each LLC is led by Program Directors, who are engaged in the life of their communities. 

 

Our Living-Learning Communities:

  • Aurora - Interfaith
  • Corps of Cadets
  • Galileo and Hypatia - Engineering
  • GenerationOne - First-Gen Students
  • Hillcrest - Honors
  • Impact - Data Analytics
  • Innovate - Entrepreneurship
  • Lavender House - LGBTQ+ Studies
  • Meraki - Well-Being
  • Mozaiko - Languages and Global Learning
  • Orion - Sciences
  • Rhizome - Exploring Global Challenges
  • Studio 72 - Arts and Creativity
  • Thrive - Personal Growth
  • Transfer Experience - Transfer Students
  • Ujima - Culture and Identity
  • VIA - Major Exploration

404831.name: Office of Sexual Violence Prevention & Education
404831.summary: Throughout the year, SVPE leads trainings and workshops; collaborates on awareness events; and works with other students and organizations to customize prevention education around consent, healthy relationships, active intervention, prevention and more!
404831.description_html: Throughout the year, SVPE leads trainings and workshops; collaborates on awareness events; and works with other students and organizations to customize prevention education around consent, healthy relationships, active intervention, prevention and more!

139239.name: Office of Summer & Winter
139239.summary: The Office of Special Sessions provides three unique academic opportunities to accelerate a student’s path to graduation.  These include Summer Sessions, Summer Academy, and Winter Session.

96149.name: Office of Sustainability
96149.description_html:
The Office of Sustainability works to educate the Virginia Tech community about how to live a more sustainable and low-impact lifestyle through behavior change and an understanding of the impacts one’s personal actions can have on a global scale. The office works with the understanding that even the smallest behavior changes can create a more sustainable world.

The Office of Sustainability acts as a central hub to connect the many sustainability champions and efforts taking place all across campus. Creating positive change requires the input and cooperation of the entire university community. The office routinely coordinates with other departments to bring about sustainable change.

192459.name: Office of Undergraduate Academic Integrity
192459.summary: The purpose of the Office of Undergraduate Academic Integrity is to support the campus in its efforts of promoting the highest standards of integrity and honor for students.
192459.description_html:
The Office of Undergraduate Academic Integrity is poised to help students become successful through their academics and leadership involvement. The Office seeks to foster an environment that promotes fairness, personal responsibility, and integrity.

The University firmly believes that promoting academic integrity involves much more than adjudicating cases of alleged academic dishonesty. It also requires an institutional wide effort to promote academic integrity through preventive programming, as well as providing students with remediation steps to deter future academic dishonesty violations. Hence, the Office of Undergraduate Academic Integrity leads the University’s efforts to promote integrity both inside and outside of the classroom through education and accountability.

The purpose of the Office of Undergraduate Academic Integrity is to support the campus in its efforts of promoting the highest standards of integrity and honor for students.

The Office of Undergraduate Academic Integrity is passionate about making a positive impact in the lives of students.  We truly believe that instilling the values associated with academic integrity is vital to higher education and society. We welcome opportunities to speak with faculty members, classes, student organizations, parents, and individuals about academic integrity.

239960.name: Office of Undergraduate Research
239960.summary: The mission of the Office of Undergraduate Research (OUR) is to support Virginia Tech students and faculty in creating, managing, funding, and finding undergraduate research opportunities.
239960.description_html:
The mission of the Office of Undergraduate Research (OUR) is to support Virginia Tech students and faculty in creating, managing, funding, and finding undergraduate research opportunities. 

 

For Students

The Office of Undergraduate Research serves to help students get involved with undergraduate research at Virginia Tech. The OUR accomplishes this by promoting existing research opportunities, helping to connect students to faculty mentors, and providing funding opportunities for students to get paid to perform research.  

 

For Faculty

The Office of Undergraduate Research supports faculty in mentoring, funding, and expanding opportunities for undergraduate research. We provide guest lectures upon request, funding for pilot undergraduate research programs, and promotion for existing research opportunities.

 

Undergraduate research, scholarship, and creative inquiry are fundamentally pedagogical approaches to teaching and learning. With an emphasis on process, the Council on Undergraduate Research (CUR) defines undergraduate research as: "a mentored investigation or creative inquiry conducted by undergraduates that seeks to make a scholarly or artistic contribution to knowledge." (CUR, 2021)

140051.name: Olé at Virginia Tech
140051.summary: Group dedicated to learning the art of Flamenco and other Spanish dance.
140051.description_html:
Olé at VT is a group of students dedicated to studying the art and performance of Flamenco dance, as well as other types of Spanish dance. We meet at least once weekly to dance, and we also perform various times throughout the semester including a large final performance at the end of every semester. We are open to all students and non-students. We welcome anyone and everyone, regardless of experience with dance, Spanish culture, or language!

Please follow us on our Facebook Page : Olé at VT

69346.name: Omega Chi Epsilon
69346.summary: The Society of Omega Chi Epsilon promotes high scholarship, encourages original investigation in chemical engineering, and recognizes the valuable traits of integrity, leadership, and character.
69346.description_html:
Omega Chi Epsilon, the national Chemical Engineering Honors Society, promotes high scholarship, encourages original investigation in chemical engineering, and recognizes the valuable traits of leadership, integrity, and character.

Membership Requirements: 3.6 overall GPA for students with junior credit standing, or 3.4 overall GPA for students with senior credit standing. Initiations are held in both the fall and spring semesters.

147404.name: Omega Phi Alpha
147404.summary: Omega Phi Alpha is a national service sorority centered around friendship, leadership, and service. We participate in service projects in six different categories, including at Virginia Tech and in the local community, and also focus on sisterhood.
147404.description_html: Omega Phi Alpha is a national service sorority with hundreds of collegiate members who actively serve their communities. Through the various chapters at over 30 universities across the United States, OPhiA sisters strive to further the sorority’s principles of friendship, leadership, and service. As alumnae, sisters can become lifelong, service-minded leaders. We pride ourselves on partnering with other organizations to be able to better serve the community that gives so much to us. We focus mainly on service, but sisterhood and friendship also play a significant role in our daily activities. If you are looking for a place to call home, consider joining Omega Phi Alpha! We have recruitment in both the fall and spring semesters, and we love to have like-minded individuals join our sisterhood!

69034.name: Operation Smile Club at VT
69034.summary: A club dedicated to helping Operation Smile reach its goal of providing safe surgery to children in need of cleft lip and cleft palate surgeries, and creating awareness of this problem to the Virginia Tech campus.
69034.description_html: This organization allows students at Virginia Tech or in the local area to learn more about Operation Smile and its mission to provide surgery and help for children with cleft palates and lips. We will raise money through fundraising events, collecting donations, and maintaining a fundraising page. We will also coordinate and plan specific events such as supply drives, as well as other on-campus fundraisers to help raise money and medical (dental) supplies to send abroad with the doctors that are traveling to perform these surgeries. This club will be the link between the Operation Smile organization in Virginia Beach and Virginia Tech, and will be the source of information for Operation Smile to the students at Virginia Tech.

391586.name: Ophthalmology Club at the Virginia-Maryland College of Veterinary Medicine
391586.summary: The organization was created to foster veterinary student engagement and interest in the field of veterinary ophthalmology and provide opportunities for experience with common ophthalmic conditions and treatment modalities of both large and small animals

414656.name: Ophthalmology Student Interest Group
414656.summary: The Ophthalmology Student Interest Group fosters interest in ophthalmology through education, mentorship, research, and community service initiatives.
414656.description_html: The Ophthalmology Student Interest Group fosters interest in eye care by providing opportunities for education, mentorship, research, and community service. We aim to enhance student engagement through journal clubs, clinical experiences, and outreach programs.

158479.name: Orbital Launch Vehicle Team at Virginia Tech
158479.summary: We are an engineering design team committed to becoming the first collegiate rocketry team to build and launch an orbital launch vehicle.
158479.description_html: Founded in 2015, we are a group of dedicated Virginia Tech students with the long-term goal of becoming the first collegiate organization to deliver an object into Low Earth Orbit. Utilizing a student run organization, engaged faculty, and supportive industry personnel, OLVT hopes to reduce the cost of academic payloads while developing competent and experienced problem solvers among its members. Members of OLVT learn basic and advanced concepts of rocketry and receive their own Tripoli Level 1 High Powered Rocketry Certification. Fresh recruits and veteran members are given real design responsibility and build experience on launch vehicles that continue to push the edge of what's possible at a collegiate level. Currently, OLVT is focused on leveraging an iterative system engineering process to design, fund, manufacture, and fly a variety of launch vehicles to test and verify technology for an eventual space-shot attempt with Hokie 0.75. Hokie 0.75 will be a two-stage sounding rocket capable of reaching beyond the Karman Line to an altitude greater than 100km. The team operates within the Aerospace Engineering Design Lab at Virginia Tech and flies out of multiple well-known local and national launch locations.

118326.name: Order of the Gavel
118326.summary: The Order of the Gavel (an honorary leadership organization) was founded in 1984 and today, membership encompasses twenty-eight undergraduate and graduate student members representing major student organizations at Virginia Tech.
118326.description_html:
Order of the Gavel Purpose

  • To promote student leadership development during and after the university life of its members;
  • To promote the intellectual and personal growth of its members and general student body;
  • To work with students, faculty, staff, and alumni to develop internal and external relationships that promote positive leadership development;
  • To assist in the development of student leadership programs and opportunities through the Leadership Education Collaborative and the Division of Student Affairs; and
  • To serve in an advisory capacity to the vice president for student affairs.

History of The Order of the Gavel

The Order of the Gavel was founded in 1984 by Sandra Sullivan, Ph.D., former vice president for student affairs. Sullivan believed that the division and university should recognize the important contribution of the leaders of major student organizations by creating a special honor society. There were originally thirteen student organizations installed as charter members. The order was founded as an undergraduate honor society, but as time passed and the influence of graduate student organizations grew, there was a groundswell of support to include graduate organizations. These were added in mid-1990. In the fall of 2013, under the leadership of the vice president for student affairs, Patricia A. Perillo, Ph.D., the Order of the Gavel once again revisited the constitution and bylaws regarding organizational membership. Today, there are twenty-eight undergraduate and graduate student members representing major student organizations at Virginia Tech.

357890.name: Orion
357890.summary: As a community of curious thinkers, we pursue science to serve humanity and the earth that we inhabit. We work to better the lives of our peers, support each other, and collaborate for a common goal.
357890.description_html:
From the biological and life sciences to the quantitative and physical sciences, we are grounded in the stuff of stars. We look to the future and reach for the stars to see just how far we can go. We look towards Orion.

 

Orion helps students develop professional skills integral to the practice of science! Through shared courses, peer mentoring, mixers with alumni and professors, citizen science projects, service learning through science outreach, and fun study breaks, Orion students have easy access to academic support, professional development, and a close-knit community. Students apply as incoming first-years and have the option to stay multiple years by applying for leadership roles that focus on serving and mentoring younger students.

 

Located in New Residence Hall East, Orion is an academic and co-curricular program supported through the College of Science. Orion includes over 250 first to fifth year students from 35+ science majors. We aim to foster a small community of students who have a shared learning experience and a sense of belonging at a large university. We are committed to supporting retention in STEM at Virginia Tech.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dl_UGgHMOxg&feature=youtu.be

365363.name: Orthodox Christian Campus Ministries chapter at Virginia Tech
365363.summary: Our aim for the Orthodox Christian Campus Ministry at Virginia Tech is to provide a communal space to welcome all people to learn about the unique Christian faith and for Coptics to gather and further their faith as well.
365363.description_html:
The Orthodox Christian Campus Ministry at Virginia Tech is a student led organization dedicated to foster a faith centered community for students of all backgrounds. Our mission is to grow spiritually through prayer, fellowship, service, and education of the unique Coptic Orthodox Church. We hold weekly meetings which includes bible studies, guest speakers, discussions, and service events. We aim to build lasting friendships, serve, and share the Good News with others around campus! 

All are welcome to join us in exploring faith, culture, and community!

69377.name: Orthodox Christian Fellowship
69377.summary: Orthodox Christian Fellowship transforms the lives of college students by guiding them along the path to Jesus Christ through His Church, cultivating a campus community of worship, witness, service, fellowship, and education.
69377.description_html:
• Welcome to the OCF chapter at Virginia Tech! We are a small but friendly group of students who enjoy fellowship, discussions, and supporting each other in our spiritual lives. We welcome all new VT students (Orthodox or not!) to attend our meetings and events.

  • Our goal is to encourage and live out the Orthodox Christian life by connecting Orthodox students and the local community and parish life. We host bi-weekly meetings to discuss spiritual topics and have fellowship. OCF carpools to Divine Liturgy at Holy Trinity in Roanoke on Sundays and for feasts and special services. We also host social events including hikes, meals at local restaurants, and celebrations for Christmas and Pascha. Please feel free to contact us through email or instagram dm to join our groupme!

414657.name: Orthopedic Surgery Interest Group
414657.summary: This organization is for medical students interested in a career in orthopedic surgery.
414657.description_html: To increase medical student exposure to the field of orthopedic surgery and to foster relationships with VTCSOM and Carilion Orthopedic Surgery faculty.

414658.name: Otolaryngology-HNS Interest Group
414658.summary: The Otolaryngology-HNS Interest Group connects medical students with resources, events, and learning opportunities within the specialty.
414658.description_html: The Otolaryngology-HNS Interest Group strives to introduce medical students to the field of otolaryngology by cultivating interest and expanding knowledge through valuable resources, engaging educational events, hands-on experiences, and networking opportunities to enhance exploration and career development in the specialty.

67278.name: Outdoor Club at Virginia Tech
67278.summary: Get outside, explore new areas, meet new people, learn new things, and volunteer to maintain the Appalachian trail. Join us and have an adventure! Visit our main page at https://ocvt.club/
67278.description_html:
WE RUN ALL OF OUR EVENTS AND PARTICIPATION THROUGH OUR WEBSITE:


https://ocvt.club


The Outdoor Club at Virginia Tech (OCVT) is a diverse group of outdoor enthusiasts comprised of undergraduate, and graduate students and other members of the Blacksburg community. The goal of the club is to get our members outside and active both physically and socially. OCVT strives to spread knowledge of the local area, to teach safe and responsible outdoor practices, to volunteer time to keep our section of the Appalachian Trail maintained and most importantly to have fun while doing it.


HOW TO JOIN OCVT

OCVT is open 24/365; it's never too late to join, and while dues are appreciated, they aren't required.

To join or for more information, please visit our main page at https://ocvt.club (OCVT does not manage membership in gobbler connect, please do not request membership).


CONTACTING US:

Please use this contact for all inquiries.

President: president.ocvt@gmail.com


SOCIAL MEDIA

Want to stay in touch? Get the latest updates? Follow us on our social media!

Instagram: Click here

Facebook: Click here

420461.name: Overland Club at Virginia Tech
420461.summary: Overland Club is an organization to bring together overlanders, rock-crawlers, and nature lovers to create a fun community. We do overlanding trips, camping trips, and wheeling trips. We also do more relaxed, social events with free food and good company
420461.description_html: The Overland Club at Virginia Tech is a student-led organization dedicated to fostering adventure, community, and exploration beyond the pavement. Our mission is to bring together students who share a passion for the outdoors. Whether that’s overlanding, camping, off-roading, or simply spending time in nature. We organize a variety of events throughout the year, including group overland trips, weekend camping excursions, trail rides, and local meetups. Many of our events feature free food, and hands-on workshops that teach skills like trip planning, vehicle recovery, and responsible outdoor recreation. Beyond organized trips, the club serves as a community hub for Virginia Tech students who want to connect with others who share an adventurous spirit. Members can network to plan their own group trips, exchange gear recommendations, and learn about new destinations across Virginia and beyond. Our goal is to make adventure accessible to everyone, whether you drive a fully built 4x4, a stock SUV, or simply love exploring as a passenger. No experience is required, and all Hokies are welcome to join!

69835.name: Packaging Systems and Design Club at Virginia Tech
69835.summary: Mission: To foster professional development and ensure growth among Virginia Tech's Packaging Students. Our vision is to prepare our members with the skills necessary to be independent, knowledgeable, and successful packaging professionals.
69835.description_html:
Vision Statement:

Our vision is to prepare our members with the skills necessary to be independent, knowledgeable, and successful packaging professionals.

84314.name: Page by Page
84314.summary: Page by Page is a book club at Virginia Tech. If you enjoy reading or want to start, check us out!
84314.description_html:
Our club meets once every two weeks to discuss the books we pick out. At the end of each meeting, everyone can give book recommendations and we vote on what we're going to read next.

 

We all have different tastes in books, so come regardless of the genre you enjoy. You also do not have to read the book prior to attending, but there could be spoilers!

 

On top of our normal meetings, we will also do movie nights and bookstore visits. We'd love to have you as a part of our club!

62828.name: Paintball Club at Virginia Tech
62828.summary: PBVT is committed to fostering, developing, and introducing the student population to competitive college paintball, striving to cultivate a competitive, tight-knit team environment that empowers our players to learn, grow, and excel.
62828.description_html:
Our paintball club is committed to fostering, developing, and introducing the student population to competitive college paintball. From recreational paintball to X-ball, our mission is to introduce Virginia Tech students to the exhilarating world of paintball and ignite a passion for the sport. We strive to cultivate a competitive, tight-knit team environment that empowers our players to learn, grow, and excel in paintball.

We play paintball at Wolf's Ridge Paintball in Riner, VA, every weekend and would love for you to join us! The field provides everything you need to start, so come motivated, excited, and ready to paintball!

If you are interested in playing competitively for Virginia Tech, join our x-ball team! We play speedball every weekend and would love to see you tryout!

Check out our website vtclubpaintball.org to learn more!

70368.name: Pakistani Student Alliance
70368.summary: The Pakistani Student Alliance at Virginia Tech was formed in the early 1990's. PAKSA represents the Islamic Republic of Pakistan and its culture throughout the Virginia Tech community.
70368.description_html:
The Pakistani Student Alliance at Virginia Tech was formed in the 1990s. PAKSA represents the Islamic Republic of Pakistan and its culture throughout the Virginia Tech community.
            The mission of PAKSA is to help and assist current Pakistani students in achieving their academic objectives and bring them together. To do this, we organize and facilitate social, community and cultural events that help students participate at Virginia Tech. PAKSA also aims to foster harmony within the Pakistani community as well as with all other communities and organizations at Virginia Tech by not only extending the hand of friendship but also by bringing about awareness of our beautiful country Pakistan and its culture throughout the campus. We dedicate our time not only to host cultural events but also to give back to the community and make a difference in the world.
            So, whether you are from Pakistan, have parents from Pakistan, or just want to learn more about Pakistani culture and have fun, PAKSA is the right organization for you.

 

PAKSA is sponsored by Numerade.

413626.name: Pakistani Students & Professionals Association at Virginia Tech
413626.summary: PakSPA at VT is a welcoming community for Pakistani students and professionals, supporting growth, connection, and cultural empowerment.
413626.description_html:
Pakistani Students & Professionals Association at Virginia Tech (PakSPA at VT) is a welcoming community for Pakistani students, faculty, staff, healthcare experts and professionals, connected to Virginia Tech and Carilion. We're here to support each other whether it’s navigating college life, growing in our careers, celebrating our culture, or making a difference in the community. PakSPA brings people together to share experiences, build lasting connections, and create opportunities to learn, lead, and thrive both on
campus and beyond.

400476.name: Pamplin College of Business
400476.summary: The college offers undergraduate and graduate programs in accounting and information systems, business information technology, finance, hospitality and tourism management, management, marketing, and real estate. The college’s degree programs, except for
400476.description_html: The college offers undergraduate and graduate programs in accounting and information systems, business information technology, finance, hospitality and tourism management, management, marketing, and real estate. The college’s degree programs, except for the master of information technology, are accredited by AACSB International — the Association to  Advance Collegiate Schools of Business International. Pamplin and the College of Engineering jointly deliver the master of information technology program.

74259.name: Pamplin Leadership Development Team
74259.summary: The Pamplin Leadership Development Team is primarily responsible for planning & executing the annual Pamplin Student Leadership Conference. The team provides VT students with a chance to develop their leadership skills and network with industry leaders.
74259.description_html: The Pamplin Leadership Development Team (PLDT) is comprised of 23 students in 5 committees (Corporate Relations, Finance, Hospitality, Education/Outreach, Public Relations & Materials) and one faculty advisor. PLDT works every year to organize and coordinate the Pamplin Student Leadership Conference. We aim to bring together the strongest academic minds and best personalities to interact with industry leaders and learn from their experience as professionals in their respective fields. As a team, we also seek to enhance team members’ leadership skills, teamwork, and individual work. We are dedicated to leadership education and experience on our campus as well as within our team. We do this by offering professional development workshops to our members and to the Virginia Tech student body. In addition to organizing the Pamplin Student Leadership Conference, PLDT members participate in events every year that give back to the Blacksburg and Virginia Tech Community, such as professional development educational opportunities in local high schools.

67854.name: Panhellenic Council
67854.summary: The Panhellenic Council is the governing body of the thirteen NPC chapters at Virginia Tech. It is comprised of twenty-one officers and thirteen delegates representing each chapter.
67854.description_html:
The Panhellenic Council is made up of twenty-one officers and one delegate from each of the thirteen sorority chapters. Through a committee structure, the Panhellenic Council is able to effectively organize and assist in events of mutual concern to all sorority women. Panhellenic helps to oversee events such as Homecoming, the Fraternity and Sorority Life Awards, Standards of Excellence, and Sorority Recruitment, as well as the changing and updating of the Panhellenic Constitution and Bylaws.


Once a year, Virginia Tech's Panhellenic Council attends the Association of Fraternal Leadership and Values, during which members are able to share ideas and attend sessions with speakers who are passionate about the affairs of women in Greek life. In past years our Panhellenic Council has won awards recognizing our excellence in recruitment, risk management, public relations, diversity, and community service. We have also won awards for having the highest Greek women's grade point average in the region.


Panhellenic Council is an excellent way for the women of Virginia Tech's NPC sororities to get involved on campus. Delegates are the voting members of their chapters on all community-wide issues. Elected and appointed officers are able to head up different programs and work with women from all chapters to plan activities of mutual concern and interest to all sororities.  Panhellenic Council gives women unique opportunities to work with many officials on campus and throughout the Blacksburg community. Panhellenic Council gives women the chance to be involved, not just in their individual chapter but also in the entire community, and most importantly offers unbiased support to all thirteen sororities on our campus.

238334.name: Partners of Montgomery County Animal Shelter at Virginia Tech
238334.summary: This club works with the Montgomery Country Animal Shelter by volunteering to help care for animals in need. We aim to encourage involvement with our local animal shelter, promote interest in animal welfare, and help students work with companion animals.
238334.description_html:
PMCAS works with the Montgomery County Animal Care and Adoption Center by volunteering to help care for animals in need. We aim to encourage involvement with our local animal shelter, promote interest in animal welfare, and help students work with companion animals.

Our club will meet approximately every other week to discuss fundraising goals, overall expectations for the club, and news about the animals at the shelter. There will be opportunities for members to come to the shelter in groups to work together, which is organized through a carpool system. We also hold fundraising events to raise money for the shelter, such as through campus-wide donations and restaurant fundraisers.

If you love hanging out with dogs and cats and want to meet other people to do that with, please don't hesitate to reach out! We look forward to hearing from you.

if you are interested feel free to join the GroupMe to stay up to date with meeting times and events!

https://groupme.com/join_group/100537079/cnMY5WDr

349721.name: Payne Hall Community
349721.summary: Residents and Friends of Payne Hall

374030.name: Peacework at Virginia Tech
374030.summary: The student-led chapter actively engages in initiatives and campaigns to discover innovative solutions aimed at promoting social change and addressing global challenges. Our focus is on sustainable, community-led, and culturally appropriate solutions.
374030.description_html: As a student-led chapter of the greater organization of Peacework, we focus on culturally appropriate and community-led initiatives for sustainable global change. Through volunteer projects, fundraisers, and awareness campaigns, we aim to create positive change and advocate for a more peaceful and just society. Through this organization, students are empowered to apply their unique and personal knowledge and skills for innovative solutions to global challenges and ultimately empower people to support self-determination, ensure social justice, and expand economic opportunity.

376028.name: Pearson East and West
376028.summary: Pearson East and West Residence Halls at Virginia Tech (Civilian Population)

349709.name: Pearson Hall East
349709.summary: Residents and Friends of Pearson Hall East

349708.name: Pearson Hall West Community
349708.summary: Residents and Friends of Pearson West

349706.name: Peddrew Yates Hall Community
349706.summary: Residents and Friends of Peddrew Yates

414663.name: Pediatric Interest Group
414663.summary: A student-led group fostering interest in pediatrics through interdisciplinary education, networking, and community outreach.
414663.description_html: We aim to nurture interest in pediatric medicine through professional development, career exploration, and volunteer opportunities while serving the local community and advocating for children's health, safety, and well-being.

347296.name: PENSA at Virginia Tech
347296.summary: PENSA (Pentecost Students and Associates) at Virginia Tech exists to serve the needs of members of The Church of Pentecost and other Pentecostals who are students, graduates, and professionals. The organization fosters fellowship within the VT community.
347296.description_html: Our main mission is to have an organization that allows students to come together and worship, pray, and learn about our heavenly father; while at the same town creating a space for students to come and learn about Christianity in a safe space. We will also be coming together to go to events/host events of our interest. This organization will allow many friendships to be hopefully created, a safe space to learn, and an organization with the purpose to spread the gospel accordingly within the community. PENSA operates under the following goals and objectives: To win souls for Christ Go ye into the world and preach the gospel to every creature, he that believes and is baptized shall be saved. (Mark 16:15-16). Provide opportunities among students and alumni for spiritual edification and encourage deeper commitment to God's work. Help members identify and develop the ministries and leadership potentials in COP. Organize programs to meet the needs of students, recent graduates, and associates in the colleges and high schools such as conferences, workshops, seminars, and career fairs. Provide the flow of information and interaction between the group, ministries within the Church, and other institutions towards fellowship and spirituality. edification. Provide the opportunity for students and associates to live their faith and continue in their commitment at home and on campus.

356354.name: Period at Virginia Tech
356354.summary: As a chapter, we "work to advance PERIOD’s mission of eradicating period poverty and stigma by creating action plans that employ our three pillars of service, education, and advocacy" within the New River Valley community and internationally.
356354.description_html:
PERIOD. The Menstrual Movement

As a chapter, we "work to advance PERIOD’s mission of eradicating period poverty and stigma by creating action plans that employ our three pillars of service, education, and advocacy" within the New River Valley community and internationally.

What we do

Our general body meetings are every other week, Major Williams Hall Room 334 5:15-6:15 PM. We have a variety of fun activities as well as discussions and education.

Once a semester we host a packing party, which is a big event where we take all the donations that semester and with the help of members and volunteers, pack them in bags to be donated to various places in need.

Follow our Instagram for the latest info on GBMs, packing parties, and upcoming events. As well as a showcase of past events, and highlights

Intagram - @period.vtech

Venmo - @periodvt

121290.name: Persatuan Mahasiswa Indonesia di AS at Virginia Tech
121290.summary: Indonesian Student Association (PERMIAS) is a nationwide organization focusing on linking fellow Indonesians and promoting Indonesian culture in the U.S. We actively serve Indonesian students and newcomers as they transition to life at Virginia Tech.
121290.description_html:
PERMIAS a nationwide organization that aims to support Indonesian students as they pursue their dreams in the U.S. Our chapter, PERMIAS at Virginia Tech, works to strengthen our community and help upcoming students with their transition to life at Virginia Tech both socially and academically. Improving awareness and promoting the rich Indonesian culture in the U.S. through various on-campus cultural events is also part of our mission. You DO NOT have to be an Indonesian to join. Our door is open to anyone who would like a piece of Indonesia - our home - in life.

 

 

Want to learn more? checkout the links below.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/permiasvt/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4hIO9gW8IfQ

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bEzaosuvzMQ

62892.name: Perspective Gallery
62892.summary: The Perspective Gallery, on the second floor of Squires Student Center on the Virginia Tech campus, is free and open to the public. For more information on the Perspective Gallery, call 540-231-4053.

420462.name: Peruanos at Virginia Tech
420462.summary: Peruanos at VT is committed to illuminating Peruvian culture, heritage, and traditions through food, community, and shared experiences. We strive to connect Peruvians on campus, create a supportive space for Latinos, and build a home away from home.
420462.description_html: Peruanos at VT is committed to illuminating Peruvian culture, heritage, and traditions through food, community, and shared experiences.

69904.name: Phi Alpha Delta Pre Law Fraternity
69904.summary: Phi Alpha Delta is a co-ed fraternity for anyone interested in pursuing a legal career. We host speakers, conduct workshops and law admission panels. We also provide a social venue for anyone who is interested in the law or the legal profession.
69904.description_html:
Phi Alpha Delta is an international legal society. For those
considering the possibility of a future career in the field of law,
this pre-law chapter of VT's pre-law chapter of PAD offers numerous
resources for its members. We host speakers who share information
regarding the LSAT, what law school is really like, the life of
different types of lawyers, and many other areas of interest. VT's pre-law chapter of PAD also sponsors an annual law panel in which various law schools
send representatives to share information about different aspects of
law school and the legal profession. Additionally, we arrange visits
to law schools, provide opportunities for community service, and create opportunities for networking.

65697.name: Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc
65697.summary: On May 15, 1980 the charter line, better known as "The Magnificent Seven" were initiated on the campus of Virginia Tech, creating the Mu Nu chapter on July 26, 1980.
65697.description_html:
Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity was founded at Howard University in Washington, D.C., January 9, 1914, by three young African-American male students. The Founders, Honorable A. Langston Taylor, Honorable Leonard F. Morse, and Honorable Charles I. Brown, wanted to organize a Greek letter fraternity that would truly exemplify the ideals of brotherhood, scholarship, and service.

The Founders deeply wished to create an organization that viewed itself as “a part of” the general community rather than “apart from” the general community. They believed that each potential member should be judged by his own merits, rather than his family background or affluence...without regard to race, nationality, skin tone or texture of hair. They desired for their fraternity to exist as part of an even greater brotherhood which would be devoted to the “inclusive we” rather than the “exclusive we”.

On May 15, 1980 the charter line, better known as "The Magnificent Seven" were initiated on the campus of Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, more commonly known as Virginia Tech. The charter members, sought to incorporate the rich tradition of pride and excellence of Sigma at Virginia Tech; and hence, the Mu Nu chapter was chartered on July 26, 1980.

75428.name: Phi Delta Theta Fraternity
75428.summary: To foster the growth of young men in the spirit of Phi Delta Theta and Virginia Tech, establishing in them a fine standard of sound values: Friendship, Sound Learning, Moral Rectitude, and “Ut Prosim.”
75428.description_html: Phi Delta Theta was organized with three principle objectives: The cultivation of friendship among its members, the acquirement individually of a degree of mental culture, and the attainment personally of a high standard of morality.

382674.name: Phi Epsilon Kappa- Iota Chapter
382674.summary: The Phi Epsilon Kappa Fraternity is a national, professional, honorary fraternity for individuals engaged in or pursuing careers in kinesiology-related fields such as health, physical education, recreation, dance, human performance, exercise science, etc
382674.description_html: Phi Epsilon Kappa at Virginia Tech aims to bring students together with similar interests and values. Phi Epsilon Kappa works to create a community to help students grow professionally, develop and further contribute to certain interests, and to meet others. We strive to grow a community of likeminded students and create a resource for those pursuing health related careers, applying to graduate school programs, etc.

69031.name: Phi Gamma Delta (FIJI) - Rho Alpha Chapter
69031.summary: Founded at Jefferson College in 1848, Phi Gamma Delta is a men's social fraternity based on the ideals of friendship, knowledge, morality, service, and excellence.
69031.description_html: Founded at Jefferson College in 1848, the International Fraternity of Phi Gamma Delta now extends across North America with over 120 active chapters. The Rho Alpha chapter here at Virginia Tech has been active since 1972.

408584.name: Phi Gamma Nu at Virginia Tech
408584.summary: Phi Gamma Nu (PGN) is a co-ed, professional business fraternity that is open to all majors! With 20+ organizations nationwide, we hope to bring PGN's opportunities to Virginia Tech and continue fostering growth!
408584.description_html: PGN is committed to creating the leaders of tomorrow with a welcoming and diverse community. We focus on personal and professional development and providing a seamless transition into the business world for our brothers. We are dedicated to fostering well-rounded leaders who enhance the lives of those around them.

152650.name: Phi Kappa Psi
152650.summary: Phi Kappa Psi has been a member of the intercollegiate fraternity community since 2016. New members will be given the opportunity to build a new legacy and engage in leadership positions earlier than most other organizations.
152650.description_html: The Phi Kappa Psi Fraternity engages men of integrity, further develops their intellect and enhances community involvement. With a legacy built on acceptance and trust, each brother realizes his highest potential through a lifelong experience of service and excellence. For more information about how you can be part of this new experience, contact our corresponding secretary Jack Olowiany ojack@vt.edu

383624.name: Phi Kappa Sigma
383624.summary: Phi Kappa Sigma is more than a club to join during college; it is an invaluable learning experience, a philosophy for living and a life-long commitment
383624.description_html: Phi Kappa Sigma International Fraternity offers a unique addition to your college experience, providing leadership opportunities, professional development, friends for life, and so much more.

68106.name: Phi Kappa Tau
68106.summary: The Epsilon Chi chapter of Phi Kappa Tau at Virginia Tech is a fraternity associated with the Interfraternity Council (IFC) and greater Hokie community. We participate in social and philanthropic events while emphasizing true brotherhood above all else.
68106.description_html: The Epsilon Chi chapter of Phi Kappa Tau at Virginia Tech was chartered on February 17th, 1999 and has been a member of the Interfraternity Council and larger Hokie community ever since.  We currently live in the Oak Lane community with other fraternal and sororietal organizations and take pride in our ideals of brotherhood, scholastic achievement, philanthropic service, social excellence, and fraternal pride.  Like most fraternal organizations we recruit new members at the beginning of both fall and spring semesters, and are always looking for those intersted in becoming fraternity gentlemen, and furthermore Phi Kappa Tau gentlemen.  We are an outgoing, fun loving, and competitive group of young men that continue to push the boundaries of what our chapter can do.  Our philanthropic cause benefits SeriousFun Children's Network; a string of camps started by actor and Phi Tau alum Paul Newman for children fighting life-threatening illnesses. From formals in Tennessee and South Carolina, to study hours and scholarship opportunities, brotherhood BBQs and alumni tailgates for football games; Phi Kappa Tau truly believes in a brotherhood that extends beyond the college years.

61037.name: Phi Sigma Kappa
61037.summary: Phi Sigma Kappa is a lifelong brotherhood dedicated to the betterment of the individual, the university community, and our world. It was started at Virginia Tech as a local chapter and became an official chapter of Phi Sigma Kappa in 1972.
61037.description_html: Our Brotherhood is focused on the promotion of brotherhood, the stimulation of scholarship, and the development of character. We support Special Olympics in the New River Valley area and will raise nearly $100,000 in the 2024-2025 School year.

65763.name: Phi Sigma Pi National Honor Fraternity - Alpha Rho Chapter
65763.summary: Phi Sigma Pi is a National Gender-Inclusive Honor Fraternity built upon a foundational tripod of Scholarship, Leadership, and Fellowship. Membership is open to all undergraduate students with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0.
65763.description_html:
If you're looking for an organization that celebrates uniqueness, inspires leadership, motivates you to make a difference and honors academic excellence, then Phi Sigma Pi is for you.

Phi Sigma Pi takes the best attributes from an Honor Society, a Service Fraternity and a Social Fraternity and blends them into one organization different from all others. We invite students who are bright, enthusiastic and overwhelmingly awesome, to work collaboratively to honor and achieve our Tripod of ideals: Scholarship, Leadership and Fellowship.

294063.name: Phi Tau Sigma
294063.summary: Our mission is to honor and elevate the accomplishments of students in food science and technology. Members will have the opportunity to be recognized for their achievements and contributions within the program and food industry.
294063.description_html:
Mission: Our mission is to honor and elevate the accomplishments of students in food science and technology. Members will have the opportunity to be recognized for their achievements and contributions within the program and food industry.

 

Membership: Members of the Virginia Tech Chapter must have their membership approved by Phi Tau Sigma. For more information about the nomination process, please visit: http://www.phitausigma.org/student-membership/

138575.name: Philologia
138575.summary: Philologia is the undergraduate research journal for Virginia Tech's College of Liberal Arts and Human Sciences. The journal publishes work done by CLAHS students, and student editors on the Philologia board review to accept/reject and edit submissions.

62956.name: Philosophy Club at Virginia Tech
62956.summary: The Philosophy Club at Virginia Tech is the biggest on-campus philosophy-related organization and is open to all students.
62956.description_html:
The Philosophy Club at Virginia Tech is a student-run organization that aims to connect students with philosophy-related majors or minors with bi-weekly events. The members of the Philosophy Club believe in the importance of wisdom. They believe in challenging assumptions and leaving nothing unquestioned: ignorance may be blissful, but it is not fulfilling. They desire to recognize their own ignorance and to do everything they can to overcome it. Realizing that recognizing one's own ignorance can be difficult for many reasons, we gather together to help each other overcome it and take the necessary steps to be that much wiser.

 

The club is closely associated with the Department of Philosophy at Virginia Tech and is recognized by the American Philosophical Association Directory of Undergraduate Philosophy Clubs.

 

Join our GroupMe for real-time updates about club meetings: https://groupme.com/join_group/107675213/7XnYEf9N

225889.name: Philosophy, Politics, and Economics Club at Virginia Tech
225889.summary: The PPE club aims to foster an environment of civil dialogue centering around interdisciplinary topics while promoting the PPE Program and supporting the community values of Virginia Tech.
225889.description_html: The Philosophy, Politics, and Economics (PPE) Club at Virginia Tech discusses comprehensive solutions to complex decision-making problems, trying to find solutions that are not only economically sound, but also socially, ethically, and politically informed. The club incorporates dialogue among faculty, students, and the public, fostering a community of inclusion.  In all of its efforts, the PPE Club is guided by principles of integrity, curiosity, and respect in subjects related to Philosophy, Politics, and Economics.

414665.name: Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Special Interest Group
414665.summary: Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Special Interest Group
414665.description_html: Increase awareness for PM&R as a specialty and field, educate students on the scope of physiatry, and create opportunities for learning, networking, and collaboration.

72332.name: Physical Therapy Club
72332.summary: The PT Club is a great resource for anyone interested in a career in physical therapy. Our members get to hear from numerous guest speakers from DPT programs and receive information on all areas of the process leading up to acceptance to graduate school.
72332.description_html: The Physical Therapy Club is an excellent resource for anyone considering applying to physical therapy school. Our meetings typically feature guest speakers from Doctor of Physical Therapy programs. We also hold meetings to provide general information on the application process, shadowing opportunities, GRE preparation, and courses required to pursue this career. Our aim this year is to develop a social community where members can support one another in their journeys to DPT school and eventually as Doctors of Physical Therapy. We will be hosting social events, hear from DPT programs, and workshops to improve resumes, GRE scores, and application essays.

420463.name: Physics Infused Vision for Onward Thinking
420463.summary: PIVOT specializes in applying fundamental physics across a broad spectrum of fields. We are competing in innovation competitions that allow us to utilize a strong physics base and creativity to nationalize/globalize, solutions to problems we see.
420463.description_html:
The name Physics Infused Vision for Onward Thinking is very descriptive of the organization that is PIVOT. Our driving passion is applying foundational physics concepts as a base to develop impactful solutions to global challenges. 

We are an interdisciplinary team that competes in innovation competitions that nationalize, or even globalize, the pioneering solutions we develop. These competitions allow for true creativity and we believe that this fact not only encourages but requires team members of all skill levels and experience. If you are interested in solving problems from the mindset of a physicist and the application skills of an engineer then PIVOT is the place for you.

We have many more positions and responsibilities than simply being a team member working on projects, so any major is encouraged to reach out if you are intrigued by our mission!

118508.name: Pi Alpha Alpha
118508.summary: The VT student chapter of PAA exists to recognize outstanding students of public administration through induction into the PAA global honor society. See http://pialphaalpha.org/for eligibility requirements.
118508.description_html: Pi Alpha Alpha is the Global Honor Society for Public Affairs and Administration. The purpose of Pi Alpha Alpha is to encourage and recognize outstanding scholarship and accomplishment in public affairs and administration. Its objectives, such as fostering integrity, professionalism, and effective performance, promote the advancement of quality in the education and practice of the art and science of public affairs and administration. PAA membership identifies those with the highest performance levels in educational programs preparing them for public service careers.

79808.name: Pi Alpha Xi
79808.summary: The Kappa Chapter of the National Honor Society for Horticulture - Pi Alpha Xi.
79808.description_html:
Pi Alpha Xi, founded in 1923, is the national honor society for horticulture. Its mission is to promote high scholarship, fellowship, professional leadership, and the enrichment of human life through plants. The organization was originally established to unify students, educators, and professional horticulturists. The Kappa Chapter at Virginia Tech of Pi Alpha Xi was established in 1968 as the tenth chapter in the U.S. and has initiated over 800 members. 

We currently accept rising juniors and seniors (with one semester left after inductions) in the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, or students minoring in Environmental Horticulture. We have inductions in November and April for new members. This is a lifetime membership, and it's nationally recognized!

63281.name: Pi Beta Phi
63281.summary: Pi Phi is one of the thirteen amazing Panhellenic sororities at VT. We are so proud of our amazing, tight knit sisterhood and strive to raise awareness for our philanthropy, Read Lead Achieve.
63281.description_html:
Pi Beta Phi is a fraternity for women that values friendship, sisterhood, and philanthropic service to others. We raise money for Read Lead Achieve, which supports literacy and scholarships/educational grants for students across the country. 

As one of the many sororities here at Tech, Pi Phi strives to enhance Greek Life and the experiences that come with the many opportunities offered through Pi Phi and other Greek organizations.  

Pi Phi is more than a sorority, it's a family at Virginia Tech.

69036.name: Pi Kappa Alpha - Epsilon Chapter
69036.summary: Pi Kappa Alpha, Epsilon chapter, is dedicated to developing men of integrity, intellect, and high moral character and to fostering a truly lifelong fraternal experience. We are gentlemen's, greek, social fraternity.
69036.description_html:
Pi Kappa Alpha was the first fraternity to be established at Virginia Tech. The Epsilon Chapter was founded on November 11, 1873, making Pi Kappa Alpha the oldest student organization on campus. Although secret organizations were outlawed at Virginia Tech shortly after our chartering—remaining banned until the 1970s—Epsilon Chapter persevered and reemerged stronger than ever.

Today, the Epsilon Chapter continues to be one of the premier men’s social organizations at Virginia Tech. Our membership is composed of campus leaders, varsity and intramural athletes, scholastic achievers, Honors students, and above all, gentlemen. Our active member cumulative GPA consistently ranks among the highest for all fraternities, and we are proud to be leaders in recruitment and new member retention.

As part of a vast international brotherhood, our chapter is connected to a global network of alumni spanning industries such as business, law, medicine, government, and technology. This network provides invaluable mentorship, career opportunities, and lifelong support. Through international conventions, leadership summits, and Pike University educational programs, our members gain access to elite training and resources that help us lead with purpose and excellence.

Pi Kappa Alpha’s enduring reputation for cultivating leadership, academic achievement, and community service is a point of pride for our chapter, and we are honored to contribute to and uphold this powerful legacy.

67864.name: Pi Sigma Epsilon - Delta Epsilon Chapter
67864.summary: OPEN TO ALL MAJORS! PSE is the only national co-ed professional fraternity in the fields of sales, marketing, & management. Join us to gain professional skills and lifelong connections!
67864.description_html:
Please contact Haley Wulff at pisigmaepsilonvt@gmail.com if you have any questions or are interested in joining!

 

Pi Sigma Epsilon (PSE) is a gender-inclusive, professional fraternity open to all majors. With over 50 chapters nationwide, our chapter has over 100 members and is hoping to continue to grow! 

PSE is committed to making a positive impact on our careers, campus, and members, and overall creating a welcoming environment for everyone around us. We strive to uphold our members to the highest standard in professionalism and service, while dedicating ourselves to helping our members grow into strong leaders.

105009.name: Pickleball Club at Virginia Tech
105009.summary: Pickleball Club at Virginia Tech is an organization dedicated to providing students the opportunity to compete, play, and learn pickleball.
105009.description_html:
Pickleball Club at Virginia Tech is a student organization that hosts recreational and competitive pickleball play. Gameplay will be held at the Washington Street Pickleball Courts. Practice times vary based on Team level (Competitive Team or Recreational Team). We welcome all new and current players!

We will be relaying information and signup sheets on our GroupMe.

Join Here:

Pickleball Club at Virginia Tech GroupMe

160969.name: Pipeline Project at Virginia Tech
160969.summary: Our mission is to connect graduating students with alumni in order to provide a personal mentor in the same career field to help them thrive in beginning their career and find comfort in their new location with a supportive community post-graduation.
160969.description_html: The Pipeline Project at Virginia Tech aims to connect students with the career and post-graduate world to help them as they explore and prepare for their future careers. Through our mentorship program, resume and networking events, and creating connections with alumni, undergraduate students will have resources and a supportive community. All students are encouraged to join to find resources that cater to their needs whether it is finding a job, resume help, networking, preparing for moving to a new city, and more.

404542.name: Planned Parenthood Generation Action at Virginia Tech
404542.summary: Planned Parenthood Generation Action is a network of activists at Virginia Tech who advocate for reproductive freedom and sexual health, in order to create lasting change in our community.
404542.description_html:
As Planned Parenthood Generation Action, our mission is to ensure that young people are at the center of the reproductive rights movement.

PPGA's key priorities are inclusivity, abortion stigma, trans and LGBTQ+ inclusion, elections, and movement/power building. <3

 

ALL ARE WELCOME.

 

For more information, contact any of our executive board members or follow us on Instagram @PPGAatVT!

President: Rachel Rugumayo (rachelrugumayo@vt.edu)

Treasurer: Madison McDonald (mcdonaldmr@vt.edu)

Secretary: Anneli Sample (anneli@vt.edu)

Publicity Chair: Heather Haupt (heatherh03@vt.edu)

Outreach Coordinator: Evelyn Bolling (evelynb0725@vt.edu)

414666.name: Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery Interest Group
414666.summary: Allows students interested in a career within plastic and reconstructive surgery to connect and gain relevant experience. This group allows students to connect with one another and provides resources for further exploration of this medical specialty
414666.description_html: PRS is a creative specialty that deals with the repair, reconstruction, or replacement of physical defects of form or function of the human body. Plastic surgeons treat a variety of problems from congenital issues to trauma to cancer reconstruction, while offering several fellowship options: craniofacial, hand, microsurgery, pediatric, burn, and aesthetic/breast. The PRSIG provides opportunities for students interest in PRS to gain experience in this interesting field.

414667.name: Point of Care Ultrasound Interest Group
414667.summary: Provide hands-on training, workshops, and mentorship to help students develop essential POCUS skills applicable across various medical specialties.
414667.description_html: Our mission is to advance medical student proficiency in bedside ultrasound through hands-on training, workshops, and mentorship for rapid diagnosis and clinical decision-making in their future clinical practice regardless of specialty.

64336.name: PokéTech
64336.shortName: The Pokémon League at Virginia Tech
64336.summary: We are an RSO gathering players in the New River Valley and at Virginia Tech for competitive and casual play of the Pokémon video and card games, as well as other Pokémon-related activities.
64336.description_html:
We are a club at Virginia Tech gathering players in the New River Valley and at Virginia Tech for competitive and casual play of the Pokemon video and card games, as well as other Pokemon-related activities. All are welcome to our events, competitions, and discussions we have every week.

 

We normally meet on Saturday nights, from 6 to 9pm in Squires Student Center, room 342.  During the quarantine (including this fall and spring semester), you can join us on our Discord server (https://discord.gg/ckJxrbTywQ) where we will hold all of our meetings on Saturday nights, 6pm-9pm!  All are welcome to join us for Pokemon battles and other activities!

71491.name: Political Science Club
71491.summary: The Political Science Club is a non-partisan student organization dedicated to good-faith debate and discussion of current events. We uphold the democratic principles of our republic and welcome students of all backgrounds. Open to all majors!
71491.description_html: The Political Science Club at Virginia Tech is dedicated to facilitating civil discourse on key issues facing our nation and the world at large. The purpose of the club is both social and educational. While discussing current political and world events, we bring students from across campus together to cultivate new ideas about how we can make a difference. Our club is dedicated to the tenets of good, democratic debate. With the exception of disrespect and bigotry, all viewpoints are welcome for discussion and debate. We also aim to connect members with resources that enable them to get involved politically. As this is a barrier for many, we aim to facilitate a better understanding of the options available for those motivated to take action. We welcome all majors!

65698.name: Polo Club at Virginia Tech
65698.summary: The mission of the Polo Club at Virginia Tech is to provide training and playing opportunities for students at the university. We will strive to bring awareness of this exciting equestrian discipline to fellow students and faculty.
65698.description_html:
The Polo Club at Virginia Tech was founded in 2011 as a group of students with an interest in polo, and has grown to host two traveling teams, maintain a string of 12-15 ponies, and spread the sport throughout Southwest Virginia. Our teams compete up and down the east coast, also competing on the national level through the United States Polo Association.

In addition to playing and practice time, we also host fundraisers, social events, inter-club tournaments, and clinics to further develop playing skills, increase community engagement and club visibility, and promote team unification.

As a Registered Student Organization with Virginia Tech, we are 100% student run, maintaining our string of ponies in Blacksburg through member dues, fundraisers, and generous donations from the community. The Polo Club hopes to become nationally competitive, while spreading the joys of polo throughout the New River Valley.

73932.name: Poultry Club at Virginia Tech
73932.summary: Our purpose as a club is to help bridge the gap for Virginia Tech students, the poultry industry and the community through industry interaction, internships, research and community involvement. If you are interested please let us know!
