420466.description_html: The Semiconductor Student Allianceregistered student organization dedicated to building awareness and engagement in the semiconductor industry. We are to all majors, including but not limited to ECE, ME, ChemE, MSE, CS, and ISE.

68679.name: Sensations A Cappella
68679.summary: Sensations is an all-women a cappella group founded in 2003. We enjoy performing on the Virginia Tech campus, for the Blacksburg community, as well as traveling for gigs, competitions, and socials!
68679.description_html:
Sensations is an all-women a cappella group founded in 2003 at Virginia Tech. Sensations is as much as a sisterhood as it is an organization. We pride ourselves on being student-led by members of all backgrounds, experiences, and interests. We believe in supporting each other through our six core values: love, respect, friendship, authenticity, growth, and creativity. 

We sing a variety of genres and perform one large, themed concert each semester, as well as perform at numerous events across our campus and Blacksburg. We also enjoy recording our music as well! You can find our latest album, Midnight Cravings, on all streaming services! 

Aside from making music, you can find us going on bonding retreats, organizing date functions, and having social events with groups across Virginia Tech and other universities!

Please DM us on Instagram with any questions @vtsensations!

We perform fall and spring concerts and are available for other performances. Please contact us if you are interested in having us perform at your event!

Contact us at sensations.virginiatech@gmail.com or clairer22@vt.edu!

126404.name: Service Without Borders
126404.summary: Service Without Borders is a trans-disciplinary, student-led organization whose mission is to share the spirit of Virginia Tech’s motto, Ut Prosim, locally and globally by partnering with communities in need through cross-cultural exchanges.
126404.description_html:
Link to sign up for notifications of events, updates, and announcements:
https://forms.gle/syPDLwbWZaFSazhQ9
 
 
Service Without Borders (SWB) is a trans-disciplinary, student-led organization whose mission is to share the spirit of Virginia Tech’s motto, Ut Prosim, locally and globally by partnering with communities in need through cross-cultural exchanges. SWB projects engage students in real-world design, project management, construction, marketing, fundraising, and cultural experiences that focus on sustainable development for community partners. Currently, we have two international projects, Nepal and Tanzania.
 
Nepal
In January 2016, a group of Virginia Tech students and professors traveled to Nepal to assess the earthquake damage in the culturally Tibetan community of Dhumba. In partnership with the Dhumba village leaders, the SWB team decided that rehabilitation of the village irrigation system would have the greatest effect on agricultural productivity and livelihoods in the community. In June of 2016, another group of Virginia Tech students and professors traveled to the community of Dhumba to work alongside the community to implement an agricultural irrigation system. Most recently, we sent a group in 2023 to finish the irrigation ditch.
 
Tanzania
Our Tanzania project seeks to provide Maasai youth in the Engaruka area of Tanzania with a quality primary school education in English. The Maasai ethnic group is largely illiterate and the poorest in Tanzania in terms of economic and educational attainment. Maasai girls are typically sold by their fathers for cows and are married at puberty. If they are enrolled in school, they are protected from marriage. The Maasai are particularly disadvantaged because they only speak Ma, while the national languages are Swahili and English. The school we are helping build will be taught in English to enable students to pass the national secondary school exams, which are administered in English. Currently, very few Maasai students pass the exam because of their poor English skills. The new school will also have a dormitory for students from villages that are beyond walking distance. In 2017, SWB helped the community and a local contractor build the 1st phase of the school. The school, “The Engaruka English Medium Primary School”, opened in January 2018. Our partners on this project are the Tanzanian Engaruka Community Initiative Organization and the US Maasai Education Foundation. During the 2017-2018 school year, the Tanzania team worked to raise enough money to fund a photovaltaic system to supply electricity for the school's dining hall. Due to heavy rains, we were not able to install the PV system during our summer trip. Instead, SWB was able to assist in the construction of guest housing, an on-site brick kiln, and general maintenance to help sustainably grow the school. In 2019, students traveled to construct a playground, and in 2022 they traveled to implement a computer lab. This past summer of 2023, students raised money for a computer lab expansion, a playground expansion, and to plant native fruit trees on the school grounds.
 
Local
Service Without Borders is involved with projects in and around the Blacksburg community. Some of our local opportunities include:
  • Newport Community Center
  • Glean Team
  • Habitat for Humanity Builds/ReStore
  • Trail CleanUps
  • Montgomery County Christmas Store
  • The Big Event
  • Hokie Half Marathon
 Join us as we continue sharing the Hokie spirit!

75724.name: Services for Students with Disabilities
75724.summary:
DSA Department - Services for Students with Disabilities (SSD)

SSD coordinates a variety of services to assist students with disabilities at Virginia Tech.
75724.description_html:
Virginia Tech Services for Students with Disabilities (SSD) office

We help the university and students work through challenges a student with a disability may experience while participating in University activities. SSD authorizes reasonable accommodations and provides academic coaching to eligible students who are connected with SSD. Reasonable accommodations are modifications or assistance to University activities. The academic coach works with students with disabilities to create individualized plans to work on their academic goals.

144813.name: Shidae at Virginia Tech
144813.summary: Shidae at Virginia Tech is a creative dance crew that focuses on presenting Korean-Pop dance music in new, invigorating methods both on and offstage.
144813.description_html: Shidae at Virginia Tech is a creative dance crew that focuses on presenting Korean-Pop dance music in new, invigorating methods both on and offstage.  Our mission is to promote the awareness of Korean culture and the global phenomenon of the Hallyu wave through the use of musicality and performance. Our vision is to engage Asian-American and non-Asian-American students alike in dance performances, while also exposing Korean culture in an exciting manner for those unfamiliar.

413629.name: Shorts at Virginia Tech
413629.summary: Shorts at Virginia Tech is Virginia Tech’s first student-led short-form media studio, built to empower creators and build community through content.
413629.description_html:
Shorts at Virginia Tech is Virginia Tech’s first student-led short-form media studio, built to empower creators and build community through content. In a time when content creation is one of the fastest-growing industries, VT Shorts gives students the tools, structure, and support to create and share powerful stories without burning out. We’re solving 3 problems. Time constraints, limited equipment and spaces, and platform gaps. Time constraints by offering a flexible production cycle. Offering a diverse range of media equipment and studio spaces through the Calhoun Honors Discovery Program to make content creation more accessible. We plan on distributing content across TikTok, Instagram, YouTube Shorts, and Pinterest, to help students reach wider audiences.

 

VT Shorts is more than a studio. It’s a community. We host weekly workshops (with free food), offer collaborative planning spaces, and are building partnerships with local businesses to connect creators to real-world opportunities.

Whether you're interested in directing, filming, editing, acting, or just being part of the creative energy on campus, VT Shorts is your place to start.

We’re here to make content, culture, and careers and it all starts with your story.

344692.name: Shredquarters at Virginia Tech
344692.summary: Welcome all! We are Shredquarters at Virginia Tech, a skate club. We are open to new and experienced skaters. Even if you don't skateboard or longboard we include scooters, roller skates, or anything on wheels. Please come and shred with us!
344692.description_html:
We are a skate club primarily focusing on skateboarding and longboarding but we are open to accepting anything on wheels. We are an inclusive, social, and community-oriented club. We just want to have a good time shredding. 

Membership Dues: $15 (includes free competitions for an entire school year & a discounted club t-shirt).

If you did not pay dues, each competition is $10 and club t-shirt is full price.

369821.name: SIAM Student Chapter
369821.summary: Officially sponsored by the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics, our chapter provides a platform for students in math-related disciplines to share their research, learn from others, and network with renowned professionals.
369821.description_html:
SIAM stands for the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics. Incorporated in 1952, SIAM aimed to convey useful mathematical knowledge to professionals so that theory could be implemented in practical settings. Today, SIAM is widely recognized as the foremost global academic society for industrial and applied mathematics. One of the many things SIAM does is sponsor student chapters, such as ours. In fact, we are the second oldest SIAM student chapter in the world. Our mission is to

  1. Increase collaboration between researchers in computational settings
  1. Gain exposure to cutting edge research in applied mathematics
  1. Provide excellent professional development opportunities to members of the chapter
  1. Foster relationships with esteemed researchers, innovators, and industry leaders

We host speakers, attend conferences, sponsor workshops, and more. If you'd like to learn more, visit our website! www.vtsiam.com

70370.name: Sigma Alpha Epsilon
70370.summary: Sigma Alpha Epsilon is the largest Greek-letter social college fraternity in the country. We have lived up to our National creed as "The True Gentleman" since our founding in 1856.
70370.description_html:
The Virginia Zeta chapter of SAE at Virginia Tech is one of the newest fraternities on campus allowing huge potential for leadership opportunities and growth. 

Welcome to the Virginia Zeta chapter of Sigma Alpha Epsilon at Virginia Tech. Starting out as the local fraternity, Delta Pi Zeta, our chapter gained its SAE Charter in 1975. We focus on living up to the expectations of the True Gentleman, while enjoying all college has to offer with our brothers. From club sports, community service groups, and Athletic Trainers, our men are involved in numerous activities on and off campus and strive to show our community what being an SAE means.

In coordination with the New River Valley Sleep in Heavenly Peace organization we help raise roughly $10,000 as well as built beds for dozens of children in the area surrounding.  

Sigma Alpha Epsilon is the largest fraternity in the nation with over 246 chapters, over 11,900 active undergraduates, and 304,000 brothers initiated. Becoming a brother of SAE is a way to take your college experience to the next level and challenge your leadership, social, and academic skills. We encourage you to see for yourself what being an SAE is all about.

68109.name: Sigma Alpha Sorority
68109.summary: Sigma Alpha is a professional agricultural sorority that promotes scholarship, leadership, service and fellowship among its members.
68109.description_html:
Founded in January 1992, the Pi Chapter of Sigma Alpha Sorority has welcomed more than 600 members who share a passion for agriculture, leadership, and service. Our sisterhood is rooted in the values of scholarship, fellowship, leadership, and service, and we are committed to cultivating strong women who make a lasting impact in their communities and professions.

Our members actively serve the Southwest Virginia community through initiatives that support local farmers, Feeding America–Southwest Virginia, and Agriculture in the Classroom. Each semester, we participate in food drives, classroom outreach, and community events that promote agriculture and food security throughout the region. In addition to our own service projects, our sisters are engaged across campus—participating in events such as The Big Event, intramural sports, and a variety of other student organizations.

Joining Sigma Alpha Sorority means becoming part of a nationwide network of women who are passionate about agriculture, committed to service, and eager to grow as leaders. Whether you’re seeking lifelong friendships, opportunities to give back, or personal and professional growth, Sigma Alpha offers a home where you can thrive.

68919.name: Sigma Delta Pi
68919.description_html:
We are a group of Hokie Hispanohablantes. We are dedicated to service within the Department of Foreign Languages and Literatures as well as the surrounding community.  We involve ourselves in everything Spanish and Spanish related.

One must be enrolled in or already have taken SPAN 3304.

Must have an overall GPA of 3.0 on a scale of 4.0

Must have a GPA of 3.2 on a scale of 4.0 in all Spanish courses.

69030.name: Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Incorporated
69030.summary: Due to five phenomenal women, the Kappa Psi chapter has been on this campus since 1985. Through public service, leadership development, and education of the youth, Sigma women strive to better themselves and the community.
69030.description_html: Founded on November 12, 1922 in Indianapolis, Indiana at Butler University by seven school teachers, Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority Inc. continues to be steadfastly committed to the tenets of excellence in Scholarship, Sisterhood and Service. Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority Inc. has a proud legacy of providing positive and proactive community leadership and support when and wherever needed as indicated by the sorority's international slogan, "Greater Service, Greater Progress."

136147.name: Sigma Gamma Tau National Aerospace Honor Society
136147.summary: The student chapter of Sigma Gamma Tau at Virginia Tech acts to recognize students in the field of Aeronautics and Astronautics who have, through scholarship, integrity, and outstanding achievement, been a credit to their profession.
136147.description_html:
Sigma Gamma Tau is the honor society for Aerospace Engineering. It seeks to identify and recognize achievement and excellence in the Aerospace field. Sigma Gamma Tau's collegiate chapters elect annually to membership those students, alumni, and professionals who, by conscientious attention to their studies or professional duties, uphold this high standard for the betterment of their profession.

The objectives of Sigma Gamma Tau, as stated in the preamble of the Society's national constitution, are: "to recognize and honor those individuals in the field of Aeronautics and Astronautics who have, through scholarship, integrity, and outstanding achievement, been a credit to their profession. The society seeks to foster a high standard of ethics and professional practice and create a spirit of loyalty and fellowship, particularly among students of Aerospace Engineering."

69713.name: Sigma Kappa Sorority
69713.summary: Sigma Kappa is a Greek social organization dedicated to helping women strengthen the four values of friendship, personal growth, service, and loyalty.
69713.description_html:
Consistent with our Founders’ thoughts in 1874, our primary purpose is to create an environment for our members in which lasting friendships and our values of sisterhood emanate all aspects of our organization. We encourage an atmosphere which will foster high ideals of friendship among college women, promote their educational and cultural interests, create in them a true sense of social responsibility and develop in them high qualities of character.

Sigma Kappa is more than just a collegiate experience; it is a lifetime of commitment, support, and opportunity awaiting you. It marks the beginning of a relationship that will last for a lifetime.

Our chapter of Epsilon Chi was founded May 21, 1972, in Blacksburg, Virginia. We've come a long way from 1871, when Mary Caffrey Low became the first woman to be admitted to Colby, and later on went to found the first Sigma Kappa chapter at Colby College in 1874. Back then, chapter membership was limited to only 25 women; however, today we are so lucky to have over 200 amazing women in our Epsilon Chi sisterhood!

118510.name: Sigma Lambda Alpha
118510.summary: Landscape Architecture Honors Fraternity Students are eligible to join through academic excellence within the major of Landscape Architecture. SLA hosts events with ASLAVT (American Society of Landscape Architects at Virginia Tech)
118510.description_html: Sigma Lambda Alpha is a Landscape Architecture Honors Fraternity that strives to encourage, recognize, and reward academic excellence in preparation for members' professional careers. Sigma Lambda Alpha hosts events with VTASLA (American Society of Landscape Architects) promoting student, faculty, and professional engagement.

75832.name: Sigma Nu
75832.summary: Sigma Nu Fraternity was founded in 1869 at Virginia Military Institute on the principles of Love, Honor, and Truth. Through these values, Sigma Nu at Virginia Tech has produced outstanding men since being chartered in 1971.
75832.description_html: Sigma Nu at Virginia Tech has produced outstanding men since being chartered in 1971. We have a beautiful chapter house just seconds from campus, right behind Chipotle and Hokie House in Downtown Blacksburg. We pride ourselves on being a tight-knit brotherhood that contributes to the betterment of the community and Virginia Tech.

135007.name: Sigma Omega Upsilon
135007.summary: Sigma Omega Upsilon is a co-ed international business fraternity, open to all majors, that strives to create a network on a global scale in which to interact and achieve.
135007.description_html:
We are a co-ed international business fraternity, open to all majors, that strives to create a network on a global scale in which to interact and achieve. 

 

Our mission is to promote personal development through various activities within professional, social, and cultural scopes. As a brotherhood of exemplary leaders, we encourage each member to pursue their own passions while preparing to lead the world economically, politically, and socially through our global experience, comprehensive education, and social diplomacy.

Our vision is to promote a global community through education and appreciation of cultures and traditions around the world. We believe that the world of tomorrow will benefit from the recognition and acceptance of differences today. 

 

Come join the brotherhood today! Feel free to reach out to us via email with any questions!

souatvt.org

69918.name: Sigma Phi Delta
69918.summary: Sigma Phi Delta is a social and professional engineering fraternal organization on the campus of Virginia Tech.
69918.description_html:
Sigma Phi Delta is a social fraternity made up of primarily engineers. We pride ourselves on being men who get it done in the classroom, live a values-based life, and have a great time. Our brothers are leaders on this campus in and outside of the fraternity. We are an ever evolving and growing group, and want to follow our brothers passions in service and socially. We work hard and we play hard. If you're interested in learning more about our group, what makes us unique, and how to get involved please reach out. We would love to get to know you more. 

 

Link to Spring 2025 Interest Form:

tinyurl.com/2025SpringRush

128648.name: Sigma Phi Epsilon - Virginia Kappa
128648.summary: Sigma Phi Epsilon (SigEp) is one of the largest social fraternities in the country. Fueled by a passion for becoming 'the Balanced Man,' our brothers seek our Sound Mind and Sound Body, while upholding our values of Virtue, Diligence, and Brotherly Love.
128648.description_html:
Around 15,000 SigEp undergraduates are on 228 college campuses each year. They are among the more than 315,000 lifetime brothers who have joined since 1901.

SigEp was founded with the Cardinal Principles of Virtue, Diligence and Brotherly Love. Our mission is “Building Balanced Men,” which is achieved through a commitment to Sound Mind and Sound Body.

Please visit our chapter's website here, and check out our social media profiles @vtsigep on Instagram and Twitter. Please contact the Vice President of Recruitment if you are interested in joining.

63031.name: Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority Inc.
63031.summary: Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority, Inc. is a multicultural Greek Organization that provides a means to success and support for womxn, particularly womxn of color. We aim to foster an environment for SYZterhood, community service, and professional development.
63031.description_html:
The fundamental goal of Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority is to promote awareness of the cultures of each of our individual SYZters. Our sorority addresses this issue through leadership, outreach, individual, community interaction, and most importantly the bonds of SYZterhood. ΣΨΖ also promotes development among its members, the students and the faculty at each of the campuses we represent.

In order to achieve this goal, we partake in political, social, educational, and cultural activities. Each effort improves our environment and instills within our SYZters' experiences that will follow them long after they've graduated. Through a network of like-minded yet highly individualistic womxn, the sorority lends structure and support to sorors that share this Sigma vision. We believe the strength of our foundation derives from the unity of SYZterhood, one that was proudly established over ten years ago.

In addition, we work in collaboration with other Greek and non-Greek organizations to provide services for the local communities and the community at large. It is through our various participation in these cultural events, educational workshops, and philanthropic support that we are able to make a difference. Nationally, regionally and individually, we strive to embody the ideals of Sigma Psi Zeta.

70371.name: Sigma Tau Gamma
70371.summary: Virginia Tech Epsilon Upsilon chapter of Sigma Tau Gamma. Founded in the Spring of 2011 and Charter on October 20, 2013.
70371.description_html:
The Epsilon Upsilon Chapter of Sigma Tau Gamma Fraternity at Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University is the 140th chartered chapter of the national fraternity. Founded in 1920 by seventeen veterans of World War I at the University of Central Missouri, Sigma Tau Gamma endeavors to bind men together in a fraternal brotherhood based on our six principles:

  • Brotherhood, to enhance the worth of belonging;
  • Learning, to afford the environment for learning;
  • Leadership, to develop good leaders for America;
  • Excellence, to strive for superior performance;
  • Citizenship, to serve Fraternity, college, and country; and
  • Integrity, to perfect a structure of honor.

Our national organization is a member of the North-American Interfraternity Conference, and our chapter is a member of the Virginia Tech Interfraternity Council. Our chapter participates in the Interfraternity Council recruitment period every fall and spring semester. Our national new member education program is The Path of Principles, and our national philanthropy is the Special Olympics. To learn more about the Epsilon Upsilon Chapter of Sigma Tau Gamma Fraternity, check our Facebook and Twitter profiles for upcoming events.

63282.name: Silhouette Literary and Art Magazine
63282.summary: Interested in an exciting experience in the field of creative publishing? Apply to become a staff contributor to Silhouette Literary & Art Magazine, the premier forum for the creative poetry, prose, art, and photography of students. Check it out!
63282.description_html:
*If you would like to be involved in Silhouette Literary and Art Magazine, please e-mail me at slmcmahon02@vt.edu. We rarely use GobblerConnect to get in touch with potential members. 

Thank you! -Silhouette Team 

 

Silhouette is the award-winning literary and art magazine of EMCVT, an independent company associated with Virginia Tech. The magazine is completely student-run. Student staff come from all backgrounds and majors. Released in print once per semester, Silhouette provides a forum for creative work by the undergraduate and graduate students at Virginia Tech including – but not limited to – poetry, prose, artwork and photography.

Silhouette devotes itself to promoting the arts in and around the Virginia Tech community. Through Open Mic Benefits, concerts and other events, Silhouette provides a place for Virginia Tech students and community members to express themselves through the arts.

Silhouette is also devoted to providing Virginia Tech students with real-world experience in all aspects of magazine development, design, and production.

408588.name: Silver Wings at Virginia Tech
408588.summary: Silver Wings (SW) is a national, co-ed, professional organization dedicated to creating proactive, knowledgeable, and effective civic leaders through community service and education about national defense.
408588.description_html: Silver Wings partners with the Air Force Association(AFA) and has three main objectives: professional development, personal development, and civic awareness.

139627.name: Site and  Infrastructure Development
139627.summary: SID is primarily responsible for the administration, compliance and enforcement of stormwater programs for Virginia Tech.

420467.name: Sky's Clear
420467.summary: We are a group of like-minded, passionate individuals who are collaborating to construct a large-scale ultralight vehicle with the capability to carry and be driven by a single individual.

72109.name: Slackers
72109.summary: Promote the sport of slackline. Develop and exercise physical and mental fitness.
72109.description_html:
Our mission is to help promote and support the sport of slacklining on Virginia Tech's campus and within the community of Blacksburg. 

Through weekly slacklining times, we hope to develop and exercise both physical and mental fitness, communicate safe and sustainable slacklining practices, and build community.

Link to join the GroupMe https://groupme.com/join_group/61418319/UuSKPRhM

90576.name: Slusher Hall
90576.summary: Slusher Hall is an on-campus residence hall home to 630 hokies!
90576.description_html:
As a predominantly first-year residence hall, the Slusher staff strives to provide opportunities for transition, development, and building community. Welcome to our home! We uphold the mission of Housing and Residence Life:

The Mission of Housing & Residence Life at Virginia Tech is to provide inclusive communities that engage students in exceptional living and learning experiences within safe, clean, and well-maintained environments that foster a sense of belonging.

What do we like to do?

We love to take advantage of our volleyball beach and spend time there, while other friends making s'mores! 

On any week day, you can find us socializing in our famous lounge, tree lounge. While on the weekends, you can find us playing the pool or ping pong. 

Our famous programs:

- Finals Week Sugar Rush

- Friendsgiving

- Cinnamon Rolls with the RLROs

- Lots of video games and a lot more!

408589.name: Small Animal Medicine Club
408589.summary: The Small Animal Medicine Club (SAMC) at Virginia Tech fosters a community for students passionate about small animal care. SAMC offers unique hands-on experiences, guest speakers, and community service projects to promote learning and animal welfare.
408589.description_html:
The Small Animal Medicine Club (SAMC) at Virginia Tech is a student-led organization dedicated to providing opportunities for students to engage with small animal medicine through hands-on experiences, community service opportunities, and community-based events. Currently being the only small animal-orientated club for Virginia Tech graduates, SAMC welcomes students from all majors and career paths who have a shared passion for companion animals and their well-being.

 

SAMC offers a variety of unique experiences, including workshops, guest speakers, and volunteer work, to help members gain partial skills and expand their knowledge in the field of small animal care. Every member will have the chance to learn from veterinary professionals, participate in skill-building activities, and contribute a meaningful impact to the animal welfare initiatives in the local community. The club also serves as a networking platform, connecting students with many resources to supper their career goals in veterinary medicine and related fields.

 

Whether students are aspiring veterinarians, interested in animal care careers, or simply passionate about small animals, SAMC provides a welcoming and inclusive environment to explore interests of all kinds. Through education, service, and collaboration, the club aims to strengthen the human-animal bid while empowering fellow students to make a meaningful impact on small animal welfare both on campus and beyond. 

“Animals are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.” – Roger Caras

69249.name: SNAME/ASNE at Virginia Tech
69249.summary: This is the Virginia Tech student section the Society of Naval Architects and Marine Engineers (SNAME) and the American Society of Naval Engineers (ASNE). All engineering disciplines are welcome to join.
69249.description_html:
SNAME was organized in 1893, to advance the art, science, and practice of naval architecture, shipbuilding and marine engineering. For over a century members have included commercial and governmental practitioners, students, and educators of naval architecture, shipbuilding, and marine and ocean engineering.

SNAME encourages the exchange and recording of information, sponsors applied research, offers career guidance, supports education, and enhances the professional status and integrity of its membership.

The Society of Naval Architects and Marine Engineers (SNAME) Virginia Tech Student Section offers many benefits for students. These benefits include:

-Discounted textbooks
-Networking opportunities
-Company and guest presentations
-Resume book

The societies of SNAME and ASNE, the international and national organizations respectively, bring together students and engineers from around the country and globe to share ideas and technical insights to disperse to industries and universities alike. For students it is a great way to build connections within Virginia Tech as well as create links to other universities.

68055.name: Snow Club at Virginia Tech
68055.summary: We are THE ski/snowboard club at Virginia Tech. We provide members with a variety of events throughout the school year, including the opportunity to travel to Snowshoe, WV during the spring semester. For more info click the "Read More" link
68055.description_html: DO NOT REQUEST TO JOIN GOBBLER CONNECT. The Snow Club at VT is the best club on campus. We are passionate about snowboarding/skiing and the culture surrounding it. We do multiple trips to Snowshoe, WV during the spring semester and have an optional "Big Trip" during Winter Break. In addition to the trips, we hold other social events in the Blacksburg area throughout the entire school year. Lastly, we have a freestyle team if you are interested in taking your riding to the next level. Membership dues are $100 for the whole year to be paid during our weekly meetings, which will start in the Fall 2025 semester after GobblerFest. We are not accepting new members this moment, please fill out this form to join the waitlist.

352414.name: Society for Ecological Restoration Student Association at Virginia Tech
352414.summary: Student Association of the Society for Ecological Restoration at Virginia Tech.
352414.description_html: Association of Virginia Tech students interested in all aspects of Ecological Restoration. Membership in SER-VT includes at no cost membership in the professional organization Society for Ecological Restoration (SER) www.ser.org. Members create restoration plans, participate in panels, attend SER and other restoration-related panels and assist in local restoration efforts.

63158.name: Society for Human Resource Management
63158.summary: SHRM at Virginia Tech is a student-led organization dedicated to preparing future HR professionals through bi-weekly meetings, networking with industry experts, and career development opportunities.
63158.description_html: SHRM at Virginia Tech is a professional business organization dedicated to preparing students for successful careers in human resources. We connect our members with industry professionals who share valuable insights and real-world experiences, helping students build confidence and clarity before entering the HR field. Our bi-weekly meetings are low commitment and designed to fit into a busy student schedule while still offering valuable growth opportunities. Throughout the semester, we host various events including HR panels, recruitment sessions, resume reviews, interview workshops, and socials to foster professional development and community. One of our most popular events is our Pizza and Paint Night—a fun, interactive evening where members can relax, get creative, and connect with one another in a casual setting.

369945.name: Society for the Advancement of Chicanos/Hispanics and Native Americans in Science at Virginia Tech
369945.summary: An organization that aims to further the success of Chicano/Hispanic and Native American students in obtaining advanced degrees, careers, leadership positions, and equality in the STEM field. We foster an inclusive and truly diverse community in STEM.
369945.description_html:
SACNAS is an inclusive organization dedicated to fostering
success of Chicanos/Hispanics and Native Americans, from
college students to professionals, in attaining advanced
degrees, careers, and positions of leadership in STEM.

294069.name: Society of American Foresters at Virginia Tech
294069.summary: We are a professional development and networking association for aspiring professionals in natural resources. We are an affiliate of the Blue Ridge, Appalachian, and National Society of American Foresters.
294069.description_html: We are a professional development and networking association for aspiring professionals in natural resources. We are an affiliate of the Blue Ridge Regional and National Society of American Foresters. Volunteering and social events are priorities, as well as inviting speakers and hosting professional development workshops.

80684.name: Society of American Military Engineers
80684.summary: The Society of American Military Engineers serves to unite students with a potential interest in national security by developing a community that provides professional development, engineering-based learning, and volunteer opportunities.
80684.description_html:
The national chapter of Society of American Military Engineers (SAME) aims to lead collaboration in support of our national security priorities through advancing three strategic goals: Drive Partnerships, Deliver Solutions, and Develop People. More information about the national chapter can be found at https://www.same.org/ . 

 

At the Virginia Tech chapter, we abide by these same three principles. We do this by providing members with opportunities to volunteer within the greater Blacksburg community, attend professional development events, network with professionals in military and non-military fields, among many other things. Our purpose at Virginia Tech is to unite students with a potential interest military service, work as a military contractor, or work within the US government. While many of our opportunities are guided towards engineering, there are opportunities for people interested in any field. Society of American Military Engineers is open to anyone interested in joining. Our organization thrives on diversity of interests and requires every type of person to operate at the highest capacity!

68110.name: Society of Anthropomorphics
68110.summary: The Society of Anthropomorphs was founded in 2001 to provide a safe place for people who identify with the furry community, have friends who are members of the furry community, or just people who are curious to gather. Anyone is free to hang out.
68110.description_html:
Hey there!

We're SOAP, the Society of Anthropomorphics at Virginia Tech. We were founded in 2001 by a group of people interested in the anthropomorphic fandom.

Our purpose is to provide a safe and comfortable social environment for fans of anthropomorphic art and culture; "furries", as they are often colloquially called. However, we also generally have a "non-furry" showing at our meetings, thanks to the community and interconnectedness provided by college. Everyone is welcome at SOAP as long as they're a friend to the furry fandom in some way, shape, or form!

We also host events around the New River Area! Our events include hiking, camping, picnics, parties, and more!

Our meetings take place on Fridays at 7 pm.

Currently, we have around 40 active members who attend in-person events, and over 100 active members who participate online. We don't use GobblerConnect to manage our roster, but if you send us an email, we'll be sure to get back to you!

For more information about our organization, check out our social media pages! Twitter (@VT_Soap), Instagram (@vt_soap), or our BlueSky(vtsoap.bsky.social). Also, whether you're an incoming student or a current Hokie, feel free to email us at hokiefurs@gmail.com if you're interested in joining our Discord! You can also DM jakii, geegbui, lilyflowa, or amalgathefox on Discord.

69246.name: Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers
69246.summary: The Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers (SASE) was founded to help Asian heritage scientific and engineering students achieve their full potential through professional development opportunities, company workshops, and social events.
69246.description_html:
SASE is dedicated to the advancement of Asian heritage scientists and engineers in education and employment so that they can achieve their full career potential. 

 

Through social events and professional development workshops with various companies, SASE encourages members to form lasting friendships, experience professional and personal growth, and contribute to our community. SASE also offers a mentorship program, service opportunities, and scholarships!

SASE’s mission is to:

     - Prepare scientists and engineers of Asian heritage for success in the global business world.

     - Celebrate diversity on campuses and in the workplace.

     - Provide opportunities for members to make contributions to their local communities.

     - Help members network and meet new people.


SASE is open to students of all genders, majors, and ethnic backgrounds. Everyone is welcome! If you want to develop both professionally and socially, this is the student organization for you!

Contact vtsase@gmail.com for more information.

369943.name: Society of Automotive Engineers at Virginia Tech
369943.summary: Society of Automotives Engineers (SAE) at Virginia Tech is an internationally recognized student chapter. Our main goal is to connect engineers who have an interest in automotive engineering through events, lectures, and professional networking.
369943.description_html: Students at Virginia Tech brought SAE International Blacksburg in 2022 with the goal of connecting students and professionals passionate about Automotive Engineering. The chapter invites experts, schedules events, and works with design teams to introduce young engineers to the automotive industry.

68926.name: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
68926.summary: SHPE is a student organization that helps our members grow both academically professionally. We offer community involvement, professional development workshops, and attend conferences each year to provide job and networking opportunities for our members.
68926.description_html:
Website: https://www.shpevt.org/

Mission
SHPE changes lives by empowering the Hispanic community to realize their fullest potential and impacts the world through STEM awareness, access, support and development.

Vision
SHPE's vision is a world where Hispanics are highly valued and influential as the leading innovators, scientists, mathematicians and engineers.

Conferences

National Conference.- Your choice from a list of quality workshops that will help in strengthening your leadership, academic, career and personal goals. They also prepare members for the career expo. Executive lunches available most days, giving members an opportunity to network with other students and company representatives. The biggest event at the SHPE Conference is the Career Expo. More than 300 of the nation's top employers attend and are looking to employ YOU.

68111.name: Society Of Indian Americans
68111.summary: SIA is a governing and programming body which consists of students who have an interest in the Indian and South Asian culture and in meeting other students who share the same interest. SIA also strives to promote the South Asian culture on campus.
68111.description_html: SIA is the largest Indian Community at Virginia Tech with over 2,000 members. A social network formed by the many volunteers and members. The association works to provide a substantial identity for the Indian Culture at Virginia Tech. Alongside our cultural representation, the society also hosts an annual cultural show, other cultural events, intramurals, socials, and community service gatherings in a mission to make its members feel at home and united.

167640.name: Society of Petroleum Engineers Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
167640.summary: This student chapter is linked to the international Society of Petroleum Engineering. Our mission is to provide opportunities for students to enhance their technical and professional development in oil and gas industry.
167640.description_html:
Society of Petroleum Engineers student chapter at Virginia Tech was established in March 2017. The purpose of this chapter is to further the mission and vision of the Society by providing regular meetings for the discussion of subjects relating to the oil and gas industry. This chapter is a connection between academia and oil and gas industry and can organize technical guest lectures, field visits, seminars and workshops.

Society of Petroleum Engineers (SPE) was incorporated in 1985 as an international individual-member organization. The society serves managers, engineers, scientists and other professionals in the upstream segment of the oil and gas industry. SPE student chapter has a mission to provide student and faculty members at Virginia Tech with oil and gas related activities, which help them to gain and spread knowledge in this field; and to support development of their technical expertise. The Chapter’s vision is “to enable the students to have a fair share of industrial exposure during their studies at the Petroleum institute and becoming one of the outstanding students chapters in the world”.

166434.name: Society of Plastics Engineers Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
166434.summary: The objective of the Virginia Tech Society of Plastics Engineers Student Chapter is to foster collaboration and promote career advancement among students interested in any field related to plastics/polymers.
166434.description_html:
The objective of the Virginia Tech Society of Plastics Engineers Student Chapter is to foster collaboration and promote career advancement among students interested in any field related to plastics/polymers. The curriculum includes but is not limited to:

Industrial Polymer Processing

Additive Manufacturing

Biodegradable plastics

Polymer Science and Engineering

We regularly attend STEM outreach events at schools across the New River Valley, and have recently participated in: 2025 STEM Night Christiansburg Elementary, 2025 STEM Night Belview Elementary. Additionally, we partner with the Environmental & Water Resource Initiative (EWRI) club to have a stream cleanup at the Duck Pond each semester. We also have various opportunties for industry connections. Specifically in the past year we toured SGS Polymer Solutions in Christiansburg, VA, and had Dr. Jennifer Lalli. Finally, we spread news from SPE about scholarships and events that are of interest to undergraduate and graduate students.

69254.name: Society of Professional Journalists at Virginia Tech
69254.summary: Society of Professional Journalists at Virginia Tech is an organization that acknowledges the importance of America's press freedoms and encourages thought-provoking dialogue pertaining to media ethics.
69254.description_html:
The Society of Professional Journalists at Virginia Tech continually emphasizes quality collegiate journalism and orchestrates educational events that will be beneficial for its members. In addition, we strive to maintain exceptional ethical standards.

These are Virginia Tech students that find passion in strong, factual-based and honest journalism, and bond over many facets of the media industry. This group values a strong moral compass and works toward bettering the community through seeking work in field of journalism or learning from leaders for a better understanding of its role as the fourth estate.

63266.name: Society of Women Engineers at Virginia Tech
63266.summary: Our Mission: Empower women to achieve their full potential in careers as engineers and leaders, expand the image of the engineering profession as a positive force in improving the quality of life, and demonstrate the value of diversity and inclusion.
63266.description_html:
The Virginia Tech Section of the Society of Women Engineers (SWE@VT) aims to support women in engineering throughout their undergraduate and graduate education. SWE at VT contributes to the campus, the community, and its members through weekly professional development, social and outreach activities. Our purpose is to create a network of women engineers throughout Virginia Tech and throughout industry / academia while demonstrating the value of diversity with STEM. SWE also offers professional, social, service, scholarship, and conference opportunities for our members. 

We host biweekly General Body Meetings (GBMs) on Mondays from 7:00PM-8:30PM. Check out our website and our Instagram for more detailed information about what we do, who our leaders are, and how to get involved! 

Website: https://www.vtswe.org/ 

Instagram: @swe_vt

238889.name: Society of Women in Aviation and Space Exploration
238889.summary: This organization promotes women of all majors to pursue their passion in aviation and space exploration. We provide opportunities to network with industry leaders, outreach to local students, and get involved in different projects around the school.
238889.description_html: This organization promotes women of all majors to pursue their passion for aviation and space exploration. To encourage students to interact with the industry, there are panels and speaker events to connect with leaders, as well as workshops to polish off resume and interview skills. Opportunities to get involved in projects and engineering design teams within Virginia Tech are presented. We are open to all majors & genders.

135377.name: Sociology Graduate Student Organization
135377.summary: This organization is for the graduate students currently enrolled in the Sociology Department.
135377.description_html: The Sociology Graduate Student Organization fosters a sense of community and professional development among sociology graduate students. Additionally, it facilitates communication between graduate students and faculty.  The organization provides an outlet to express student interests, project proposals, and concerns which can then be formally relayed to appropriate parties.

70621.name: Soil Judging at Virginia Tech
70621.summary: Soil Judging at Virginia Tech was founded to foster academic, social, and job skill development through field trips, hands-on experience, research, and intercollegiate competitions.
70621.description_html: Soil Judging is used for many agricultural and engineering purposes. By understanding the geography and topography of an area alongside knowledge of soil formation, we can describe, interpret, and classify soils. Comprehension of soil properties can help us manage land and know how to best utilize it.

344690.name: SolarCar at Virginia Tech
344690.summary: SolarCar at Virginia Tech is a student-run design team that competes in the American Solar Challenge organization. The competition requires teams to design, build, and test a solar-powered vehicle for an 8-day race across the U.S. spanning ~1500 miles.
344690.description_html:
Who Are We?

SolarCar at Virginia Tech is a student-run design team that competes in the American Solar Challenge organization. The competition requires teams to design, build, and test a human-driven solar-powered vehicle for an 8-day endurance race across the U.S. spanning 1500-2000 miles.

 

Team Organization

The team compromises of students from many disciplines including Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, and Business, all working towards designing and building a fully solar-powered vehicle. Students get to work on the design and manufacturing of the chassis, suspension, braking, steering, battery pack, BMS, and solar array systems.

 

Who Can Join?

Anyone, regardless of major or year, is encouraged to apply to our team! We are especially looking for dedicated students who are passionate about renewable energy, vehicle design, and those who want to  learn and contribute to the project.

 

Team History

Fall 2021 - Hyperloop transitions to form the first SolarCar Team, but it turned out Eashan Gupta, a transfer student from GMU who was on the GMU SolarCar team, had started one just one week before. They decide to merge to start what is now SolarCar at VT. The organization mainly existed on Discord, and the team went through stages of recruitment to build the team up. Most of the early progress was organizational rather than technical.

Spring 2022 - The team was divided into subteams, began meeting in person every week, and went to GobblerFair to help recruit more members. SolarCar at Virginia Tech's name was officially established, a lab space was obtained in Randolph Hall, initial sponsorships were gained, and we became affiliated with the ECE department. It was a huge semester of growth for the organization.

Fall 2022 - SolarCar at VT became an Interdisciplinary Capstone (IDC) Project and 12 Seniors joined the team. With the efforts from Spring 2022 and the new Senior Design group, they began designing critical systems, obtaining funding, ordering parts, and moving towards our first Minimum Viable Product, the Sun Gobbler.

Spring 2023 - After the majority of the designs for the first vehicle iteration were completed in Fall 2022, most of the vehicle was manufactured and assembled this semester. Minimal testing was completed, however, and the team decided to wait another year to compete in the American Solar Challenge.

Fall 2023 - A group of new Senior Design students led the team in preparing the vehicle for competition. This semester, improved designs were made in order to optimize the car's performance and reliability. Simultaneously, underclassmen students began the concept generation process for the next iteration vehicle. Extensive research was conducted to determine initial high-level designs.

Spring 2024 - Testing was conducted at the VTTI Smart Roads to ensure system reliability and regulation compliance. The finalized designs from last semester were manufactured and assembled on the car, and the vehicle was rigorously testing at the VTTI Smart Roads to ensure compliance with the regulations. The team prepared to attend the Formula Sun Grand Prix (FSGP) race in July.

FSGP 2024 - The team competed for their first time alongside 30+ other SolarCar teams at the FSGP race in Bowling Green, Kentucky. After passing Scrutineering, a rigorous inspection process, the team completed 163 miles on the NCM Motorsports track. This total earned us 12th of 24 Single Occupancy Vehicles (SOV). The team gained invaluable knowledge and experience from attending the competition.

Fall 2025 - The Sun Gobbler will continue to be tested to it's limits at VTTI to identify areas of improvement, as well as collecting data that will be used to optimize our race strategy. In parallel, the team will begin the design process for our second iteration vehicle. We'll take the collective knowledge and experience that we've gained with the Sun Gobbler and apply it to our second vehicle to maximize its potential.

420468.name: Somali Student Union at Virginia Tech
420468.summary: The Somali Student Union at Virginia Tech fosters a sense of community among Somali students and creates an inclusive environment for all. Our mission is to celebrate Somali culture, educate others about our traditions and history.
420468.description_html: The Somali Student Union at Virginia Tech (SSU) aims to bring Somali students together while also creating an inclusive space for everyone on campus. Our mission is to celebrate Somali culture, educate others about our traditions and history, and to raise awareness on current issues affecting Somalia. We hope to be able to build a community and to give students a place to connect, learn, and grow together.

67128.name: Soulstice A Cappella
67128.summary: Premiere All-Women A Cappella Group at Virginia Tech.
67128.description_html:
Founded in 1998, Soulstice is Virginia Tech's Premiere All-Women A Cappella group. We enjoy performing on the Virginia Tech campus and for the Blacksburg community. We hold two of our very own performances each year, our Fall and Spring concerts. We have been recognized by Voices Only Productions in 2022 and Best of Collegiate A Cappella, BOCA, in 2023. 

Instagram: @vtsoulstice

Website: https://www.vtsoulstice.com/

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/SoulsticeVT

Check out our music on all music streaming services!

Contact us at soulsticevt@gmail.com or cjbogart5908@vt.edu

306686.name: spAAce
306686.summary: A community space for people that identify under the asexual and/or aromantic umbrella.
306686.description_html:
spAAce is a club for anyone on the asexual and/or aromantic spectrums, as well as those who are questioning or allies. We're open to all VT members; undergrads, grads, and faculty. We meet roughly once a week, and past activities include board game night, movie night, stargazing, and our yearly community zine.

We have a discord! (click here for the link!) Most of our announcements go on here, as well as socializing with other club members! If you don't use discord, we also have a mailing list, but it will only send out our monthly schedule, and will not give updates for events subject to change (such as weather-dependent stargazing), so we highly recommend joining the discord if you can! (link to mailing list here).

115121.name: Spanish Club at Virginia Tech
115121.summary: Fostering an interest in the Hispanic culture and providing an opportunity to speak Spanish in an informal setting and to learn more about the Hispanic world!
115121.description_html:
Fostering an interest in the Hispanic culture and providing an opportunity to speak Spanish in an informal setting and to learn more about the Hispanic world!

A group of students who desire to learn more about Spanish-speaking cultures & want to develop their ability to speak Spanish. We host biweekly meetings to practice our Spanish and cultural events a few times a semester!

Membership is completely free and open to all, regardless of Spanish level!

Follow us on Instagram: @spanishclub.vt

294071.name: SPAP Sketch Comedy
294071.summary: Virginia Tech's funniest* sketch comedy organization. We produce a show every semester made up of comedic sketches created entirely by undergraduate students. Come SPAP with us! (*and only)
294071.description_html:
The award-winning student organization SPAP Sketch Comedy is all about giving students the tools and opportunity to create and share their humor and art. The entire creation process is 100% student led, from the writers room to the stage.

We accept actors of all experience levels (including 0). Time commitment is low and flexible. As an actor, you will have the opportunity (but not requirement) to write, direct, or share your creative voice in other ways.

62456.name: Speakers on Leadership and Skills in an Hour
62456.summary: One hour, free, dynamic and interactive workshops for anyone on campus who wants to develop their leadership skills.  Don't just dip your toe in the "leadership pool" - come make a SPLaSH with us!!

408590.name: Spectra at Virginia Tech
408590.summary: Spectra at Virginia Tech is an organization dedicated to building community for and addressing issues specific to LGBTQIA+ mathematicians. All members of the LGBTQIA+ community who engage with math, as well as allies, are invited to join.

225414.name: Speech Language Pathology at Virginia Tech
225414.summary: This club serves as a networking support system for all students who are interested in becoming Speech-Language Pathologists.
225414.description_html: This club serves at a networking support system across all students who are interested in becoming a speech language pathologist. We research, reach out, connect, and grow towards our goals while helping one and other do the same. As a club, we have volunteered at The Virginia Special Olympics, toured graduate programs, talked to current SLP graduate students, and more!

327244.name: SPIA Student Society
327244.summary: The SPIA Student Society is a student society for students in the School of Public and International Affairs. The organization focuses on professional, academic, and social aspects of SPIA through professional development and networking opportunities.
327244.description_html: The School of Public and International Affairs (SPIA) at Virginia Tech is dedicated to solving issues at the local, national, and global levels through dedicated persistence, an insightful view on a range of matters, and a deep understanding of world issues. The SPIA Student Society brings together these ethics and the Virginia Tech motto, Ut Prosim, to serve like-minded students and the community. The mission of the society is to create a space for students to experience the wide reach of SPIA in their daily lives. The SPIA Student Society serves as a resource to undergraduate students as a space to communicate about job opportunities, promote new programs and groups, find and participate in internships, and create networks that last beyond their college experience. Additionally, members participate in community outreach initiatives where they join public forums and government-lead functions to learn more about the application of the material learned in the classroom. The SPIA Student Society strives to create a space for students with similar interests and drive to come together with a community of their peers.

64337.name: Sports Business Club
64337.summary: The club's goal is to provide students the opportunity to meet with professionals in various areas of the sports industry through a speaker series and special events.
64337.description_html: Sports Business Club brings together Virginia Tech students who are interested in pursuing a career in the sports industry. We are focused on furthering the personal and professional development of our members. We provide opportunities to meet with professionals in various areas of the sports industry through a speaker series and special events. We are open to all majors and accept memberships at any time.

413630.name: Sports Rehab and Performance Club at Virginia Tech
413630.summary: Future PTs, ATs, chiros, dietitians & more — one team, many angles. We tackle recovery, rehab, and performance from every side of athlete care as future leaders in sports medicine.
413630.description_html:
The Sports Rehab & Performance Club at Virginia Tech unites future leaders in sports medicine through a multidisciplinary approach that includes physical therapy, athletic training, chiropractic, dietetics, and more. Our mission is to explore how these disciplines work together as a team to optimize athletic performance, recovery, and injury prevention.

Through guest speakers, hands-on workshops, shadowing opportunities, and case study nights, we provide members with valuable experiences that deepen their understanding of athlete care and empower them to pursue careers that help athletes move better, recover faster, and perform at their best.

356360.name: Sri Lankan Student Association
356360.summary: We, SLSA aims to create a common platform for current and prospective Sri Lankan students and share our culture with global community at VT.
356360.description_html: Sri Lankan Student Association is a common platform for current and prospective Sri Lankan students and the key organization representing Sri Lankans at Virginia Tech. SLSA will participate international events representing Sri Lanka to share our unique and diverse culture with the global community.

420469.name: StageZero
420469.summary: StageZero is an undergraduate liquid rocketry design team. Our goal is to be the first undergraduate organization to design, fabricate, and operate a non-vehicle capable liquid rocket engine at Virginia Tech.

408591.name: Start With Hello at Virginia Tech
408591.summary: Start With Hello at Virginia Tech aims to make sure that every student at VT feels like they are welcome and included on this campus. We will educate students on the dangers of social isolation and the importance of accepting everyone.

69086.name: Statistics Club
69086.summary: Statistics Club is a community for Virginia Tech students of all majors interested in statistics and data science. We aim to broaden students' skillset through workshops, guest speakers, networking events, and presentation opportunities. All are welcome!
69086.description_html:
The Statistics (Stats) Club at Virginia Tech is an undergraduate student organization committed to fostering a community for students of any major interested in statistics and data science. We foster a collaborative environment where members can explore the exciting world of statistical analysis, data visualization, and quantitative reasoning.

Through a combination of educational workshops, guest speakers, outreach events, presentation nights, and networking opportunities with industry professionals and alumni, we strive to enhance our members' technical skillset and academic and professional development in pursuit of their goals.

Bi-monthly meeting on Mondays from 7-8pm. All majors welcome. Stay up to date with us on Instagram (@statsclubatvt)!

119093.name: Steel Bridge Team at Virginia Tech
119093.summary: As a team, we are challenged in an intercollegiate engineering competition that includes design, fabrication, and construction of a 20-ft steel bridge. The structure is assembled at competition from 3-ft prefabricated segments and carries up to 2500 lbs.
119093.description_html:
The Steel Bridge Design team is a multidisciplinary student-led extracurricular activity where students are tasked with a real-world scenario to design and construct a 1/10th scale, steel-made bridge. As a team, we take the rules and regulations released from the American Institute of Steel Construction (AISC) and American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) joint committee, and our team will draw up a number of design ideas based off of our educational experience and research. These ideas will be drawn into AutoCAD or Solidworks and analyzed using the structural analysis software of SAP 2000. We will take the results of this analysis and refine and optimize the design to obtain the best design possible within the provided constraints. The design, analysis, and optimization processes will continue until the end of the fall semester. Steel will then be ordered and each bridge member will be fabricated within the Ware Lab on the Virginia Tech campus. Our team will practice assembling the bridge in order to refine the skills needed to compete at the highest level in the annual regional and national competitions. We will compete with the goals of scoring well in the stiffness, structural efficiency, construction speed, construction economy, lightness, cost estimation, and aesthetics portions of judging.

Next year's regional competition will be held at ODU!

327208.name: Strategic Intelligence Organization at Virginia Tech
327208.summary: Organization for students interested in learning skills and professionalism for jobs and internships in the Intelligence Community.
327208.description_html: The Strategic Intelligence Organization is dedicated to providing students the ability to gain real life skills relevant for jobs in the Intelligence Community. This group acts as a resource to members providing a way to learn skills, network with professionals, and gain professional experience.

70354.name: Streetdreams at Virginia Tech
70354.summary: Streetdreams (Creative Photography) Club is a group for photography enthusiasts all over campus to come together no matter what your skill level or type of equipment.
70354.description_html:
The Streetdreams (Creative Photography) Club is a group for photography enthusiasts all over campus to come together no matter what your skill level or type of equipment.

Meet new friends with similar interests, learn about opportunities for local publication, participate in activities and field trips, and hopefully learn something new!
 
You're welcome to join at any time! Join the discord to get information on announcements and joining the email list!
 
Typical meetings include photo walks, tutorials, new techniques, and field trips. 

Email Garrett at gpost@vt.edu to find out more about the organization or to be put on the mailing list!

140996.name: Strengths Initiative
140996.summary: We want you to make the most of your time at Virginia Tech. We want you to claim your role in your own distinct way and make your unique mark on the Hokie Nation and the world. To do that, you need to understand yourself – your talents, your perspective,
140996.description_html:
Virginia Tech is the first university in the nation to offer the internationally recognized Gallup® CliftonStrengths assessment FREE to all students. It will help you learn about how you work, what you value, where you excel, and who you are becoming.

  • You can take the Gallup® CliftonStrengths assessment online by logging in with your VT username (PID) and password. Head to our website to get the link for student or faculty and staff.
  • The assessment takes about 20 minutes. It is timed and you must complete it uninterrupted.
  • If you need to take the assessment untimed for any reason or if you would like to take it in a different language, use your Virginia Tech email address to email educationhelp@gallup.com BEFORE beginning.
  • If you have questions or need assistance with taking the strengths assessment, email us at strengths@vt.edu.

134801.name: Student Advocacy
134801.summary: This department provides advocacy and support to VT students and their support networks during times of personal, academic and community crisis.

61119.name: Student Affairs
61119.summary: Student Affairs at Virginia Tech encompasses a variety of departments dedicated to providing a rich co-curricular experience and essential student services. Virtually every aspect of a student's life outside the classroom is represented through the work
61119.description_html: Student Affairs at Virginia Tech encompasses a variety of departments dedicated to providing a rich co-curricular experience and essential student services. Virtually every aspect of a student's life outside the classroom is represented through the work of Student Affairs.

69084.name: Student African American Brotherhood at Virginia Tech
69084.summary: The Student African American Brotherhood (SAAB) is a dynamic organization established specifically to assist males to excel academically, socially, culturally, professionally, and in the community through engaging programs and activities.
69084.description_html: The Student African-American Brotherhood is a dynamic organization established specifically to assist our participants to excel academically, socially, culturally, professionally, and in the community.  SAAB is comprised of male students who strive for academic excellence and make a commitment to plan and implement programs that benefit their community at large.  We encourage our participants to embrace leadership by being positive examples for each other through a strong commitment to academic achievement, brotherhood, and community service.

70373.name: Student African American Sisterhood at Virginia Tech
70373.summary: SAAS is an organization at Virginia Tech that seeks to enhance the academic success and unification of Black and Brown women across the nation regardless of age, graduation year, sorority affiliation, or background.
70373.description_html: SAAS is an organization at Virginia Tech that seeks to enhance the academic success and unification of Black and Brown women across the nation regardless of age, graduation year, sorority affiliation, or background. SAAS strives to enrich the educational experience of females through unity, academic excellence, service, and support. We strive to give the Black and Brown women of Virginia Tech a place they can come together with other girls like themselves and talk about their experiences in a welcoming environment, along with hosting fun events that encourage sister like bond.

62987.name: Student Alumni Associates of the Virginia Tech Alumni Association
62987.summary: The Student Alumni Associates (SAA) is an official affiliate of the Virginia Tech Alumni Association since 1974 and assists with various alumni programs as well as promotes the spirit of the Virginia Tech community.
62987.description_html:
In the spirit of the University motto, Ut Prosim (That I May Serve), the Student Alumni Associates of Virginia Tech (SAA) aim to bridge the gap between students and alumni. As an official affiliate of the Virginia Tech Division of Advancement and Alumni Relations, SAA facilitates the promotion of spirit and tradition among the student body and helps to develop a strong foundation of connected alumni. As a part of these efforts, SAA supports student initiatives such as Homecoming, Giving Day, Impact Week and Thank-A-Donor Day, Family Weekend, Ut Prosim Weekend, Alumni Weekend, the Hokie Bucket List, and so many more! SAA offers its members unparalleled leadership and networking opportunities, while giving them a chance to embody the organization's four pillars (Spirit, Philanthropy, Leadership, and Service) through action and word. 

SAA accepts membership applications at the beginning of each semester. To learn more about the organization and meet our spirited members, consider attending one of our semesterly Information Sessions. To stay updated, check out our website and follow us on Instagram, which are both linked below. Please note that attendance at one of the Information Sessions is mandatory for those who intend to apply.

97131.name: Student Chapter of the American Association of Equine Practitioners
97131.summary: The Student Chapter of the American Association of Equine Practitioners at Virginia Tech is an organization within the Virginia-Maryland College of Veterinary Medicine with the goal of furthering students' knowledge in the equine veterinary field.
97131.description_html: The Student Chapter of American Association of Equine Practitioners (AAEP) at the Virginia-Maryland College of Veterinary Medicine (VMCVM) is a student organization with the goal of furthering knowledge in equine veterinary medicine. The organization hosts monthly meetings, lectures, wet labs, and weekly rounds discussions in the Veterinary Teaching Hospital (VTH). This organization is open to students at VMCVM.

347787.name: Student Chapter of the American College of Veterinary Internal Medicine
347787.summary: We are a club at the veterinary school that mainly focuses on veterinary internal medicine. We do this by getting as much hands-on experience as possible.
347787.description_html: This club enhances the education of veterinary students through discussions, guest speakers, and laboratory activities involving veterinary internal medicine.

157582.name: Student Chapter of the American College of Veterinary Pathologists
157582.summary: The Pathology Club at VA-MD Vet Med offers a variety of opportunities to students interested in non-traditional fields of veterinary medicine such as diagnostic labs, industry, government, etc.
157582.description_html:
Goals of the Student Chapter of the American College of Veterinary Pathologists (SCACVP)

1. To provide students with regular access to veterinary pathology practices, through anatomical and clinical pathology practice

2. To provide students with options for learning and solidifying previous knowledge about disease

3. To provide students with opportunities for travel to national pathology conferences and further explore their interests

4. To provide students with annual scholarship opportunities

 

 

The Pathology Club, in conjunction with the American College of Veterinary Pathologists, has several ways in which students can gain experience in this career path including weekly histopathology rounds, weekly necropsy rounds, and weekend necropsy shadowing. Currently, there are no dues or attendance requirements. Only enrolled students of the Virginia-Maryland College of Veterinary Medicine, who are also in good standing with the college, may enroll in the SCACVP.

Histopathology Rounds

Every Monday at 12:00 pm, a pathologist or pathology resident presents histopathology slides from a previous case in which they were involved. Students are allowed the opportunity to view the slide along with the pathologist, and to discuss the various aspects of the case and identify specific features of the tissues presented on the slides. Students are always encouraged to ask questions and engage with the case. 

Necropsy Rounds

Every Friday at 12:30 pm and 4:00 pm, gross anatomical specimens are presented from necropsy cases received at the hospital throughout the week. Cases are discussed and lesions are identified as students get the chance to observe anatomical pathology associated with various disease processes.

Necropsy Shadowing

Club members have the opportunity to sign up for weekend necropsy shifts to "shadow a pathologist," and find out more about the exciting things that happen back in the necropsy lab. The student will be called to assist in the necropsy if a specimen becomes available. When called, the student will arrive at the necropsy room with coveralls, name tag, and boots, unless otherwise specified. It is great practice for 4th year clinics and a great hands on learning experience for all years.

It is the right of the officers to revoke a member's privileges to attend necropsy shadowing if that member repeatedly fails to show for necropsies on assigned weekends.

 

Bob and Sue Duncan Memorial 5K Race

Dr. Duncan was a beloved professor of pathology at VMCVM. Upon his passing, his family, including Dr. Sue Duncan decided to establish the Bob Duncan Memorial 5K Race. The race is held each year by the SCACVP in memory of Dr. Duncan. All proceeds from the race are donated to the Bob Duncan Memorial Scholarship, which is awarded every year to a 4th Year veterinary student who has shown sustained interest and dedication in veterinary pathology. The race was redubbed the Bob and Sue Duncan Memorial 5k in 2023, following Dr. Sue Duncan's unfortunate passing both to commemorate the years she has spent to preserve the memory of Dr. Bob Duncan, as well as to commemorate her own legacy at Virginia Tech.

362523.name: Student Chapter of the National Association for Black Veterinarians
362523.summary: SNABV is a student chapter of the National Association for Black Veterinarians. Our mission is to create a safe, inclusive, and fun environment for black people within the Veterinary field. We have mentors, educate others, and give back to the community.
362523.description_html: This organization is open to everyone! We encourage all in the veterinary field (or pursuing the veterinary field) to show up and help create an inclusive and diverse environment.

68921.name: Student Chapter of the Veterinary Emergency and Critical Care Society
68921.summary: SCVECCS aims to provide educational opportunities for veterinary students interested in veterinary emergency and critical care. To do this, we inform students of educational opportunities in and out of school and have monthly talks/meetings!
68921.description_html: Student Chapter of the Veterinary Emergency and Critical Care Society (SCVECCS) goals are to supplement the curriculum with educational opportunities specific to the field of emergency and critical care. We also strive to inform students of internship, externship, residencies, and other post-graduation opportunities in this field. At the school, we aim to have 1-2 events per month whether it be talks, activities, or wet labs.

132888.name: Student Communication Advisory Board
132888.summary: Student Affairs, comprised of 20+ departments that support the outside the classroom student experience, (see dsa.vt.edu) formed the Student Communication Advisory Board in 2014 so that we could find out the best ways to communicate with students.
132888.description_html:
The Student Communication Advisory Board [SCAB] was established by Student Affairs so that we could hear from you, our students, about how you would like to hear from us. Through this group, we bring topics that affect you, to get your thoughts how to best communicate them to students.

Students love serving on the SCAB because

  • They see real results from their impact
  • They get access to key administrators in Student Affairs
  • They make friends and influence people
  • They are fed at every meeting

The students serving on the advisory board help us effect real change in the division. You can read about it on our website, students.vt.edu/scab. 

Recruitment typically takes place beginning in late spring and continues through the summer.

60123.name: Student Engagement and Campus Life
60123.summary: Student Engagement and Campus Life, operates Squires and Johnston Student Center, the Graduate Life Center and War Memorial Chapel.  We provide services and opportunities to the university community, including a focus on students and student organization
