60123.description_html: Student Engagement and Campus Life, a unit within the Division of Student Affairs at Virginia Tech, uplifts the student experience by cultivating affirming environments, promoting holistic well-being, and providing exceptional services.

67312.name: Student Engineers' Council at Virginia Tech
67312.summary: We are devoted to serving Virginia Tech Engineering's 10,000+ students and 100+ engineering student organizations through $280k+ in annual giving and 300+ corporate partners
67312.description_html:
The Student Engineers' Council (SEC) is a student-led organization that is devoted to serving the College of Engineering. We help foster a professional and social network for students across all engineering disciplines by organizing events such as Engineering Exposition, the Leadership and Engagement Series, and E-Week which will be headlined by the third-annual Engineers' Ball this year. We also work to facilitate communication between the Dean of the College of Engineering and the student body through various outreach initiatives. Ultimately, our mission is to provide students with the tools and opportunities they need to succeed, both in and out of the classroom.
 
To receive more information about the Student Engineers' Council at Virginia Tech, join the SEC listserv.
Any "requests to join" the organization through GobblerConnect will be treated as requests to join the SEC ListServ. To receive pertinent GAM information, please contact the Director of Operations at secdoo@vt.edu.

139625.name: Student Life Council
139625.summary: The SLC is an advisory committee for Student Affairs leadership that exists to discuss student issues, provide input on campus life and projects, and offer student leadership/views to improve student life at Virginia Tech.
139625.description_html:
The Student Life Council at Virginia Tech serves as an advisory group for Student Affairs. The Student Life Council (SLC) is led by a student chair and consists of a diverse committee of up to 20 students. The SLC meets monthly to discuss relevant student issues, provide input on emerging projects important to campus life, and offer counsel related to policy, practice, and the aspirations for student learning. In addition, since Student Affairs co-chairs the Virginia Tech/Town of Blacksburg “Town-Gown” committee with the Blacksburg Deputy Town Manager, SLC members participate in monthly Town-Gown Meetings as part of their membership on the SLC.

In consultation with the student chair, the Dean of Students appoints council members for an academic year (May to May). The Council meets once monthly; on selected Thursday afternoons from 5:00-7:30 pm for dinner and discussion from 5:00 - 6:30 pm  prior to attending a monthly Town-Gown meeting from 6:30-7:30. Since the primary purpose of the Student Life Council is advisory, there is minimal time commitment beyond the required meetings described above. Council members, however, will be frequently informed of optional activities where student input is needed.

Students interested in serving on the 2024-2025 Student Life Council should submit an application via GobblerConnect. Applications will be open from 8 am on Monday, April 8 to 11:59 PM on Wednesday, April 17

Students must be in good standing with Virginia Tech and the application involves a check of academic and conduct standing. Interested students must have a robust interest in strengthening campus life at Virginia Tech, and commit to being available during the times outlined above for a period between August 2024 and May 2025. Questions about the Student Life Council can be directed to our student chair Ashlyn O'Neill at ashlynoneill@vt.edu

414674.name: Student National Medical Association at VTCSOM
414674.summary: The official VTCSOM chapter of SNMA.
414674.description_html: SNMA is committed to supporting current and future underrepresented minority medical students, addressing the needs of underserved communities and increasing the number of clinically excellent and culturally competent and socially conscious physicians.

62817.name: Student Nutrition and Dietetics Association
62817.summary: Our mission is to provide students interested in nutrition and the dietetics profession with a community to engage in events and activities around campus and the community that will broaden personal experience and opportunities in the field of nutrition.
62817.description_html: We volunteer our expertise to help in a wide variety of campus and community outreach opportunities.  Members participate in nutrition booths that have been previously held on several different "on campus" sites. Aside from volunteer opportunities around campus and in the community, members enjoy getting together for potlucks and other social activities!  We like to keep things fun for everyone involved! We are a fun food-loving group of people and are always open to new ideas for our club to excel and grow beyond the success we have already had!

323555.name: Student Opportunities and Achievement Resources
323555.summary: A holistic support program dedicated to welcoming and retaining underrepresented minority students at Virginia Tech and promoting their success through campus collaborations.

92247.name: Student Virginia Education Association
92247.summary: SVEA is a professional pre-service teacher organization.
92247.description_html:
We at Virginia Tech are apart the statewide SVEA, dedicated to supporting aspiring educators. We as a chapter aim to promote interest in educational careers both on campus and in local schools K-12 as well as upper education through various sponsored programs and activities including building a free little library in a local neighborhood and volunteering at our local elementary schools.Additionally, we offer future teachers a platform to connect with others, learn about the profession and gain good advice from others on the same path!

SVEA at Virginia Tech allows for many Service Learning opportunities like, Lego League with local elementary aged children, working with Teachers for Tomorrow at local High Schools, attending educational conferences, listening to inspirational speakers, and much more fun activities!

65766.name: Students for Justice in Palestine
65766.summary: Students for Justice in Palestine (SJP) is a grassroots movement of students, faculty, staff, and community members dedicated to advancing justice, equity, and human rights, for the liberation and self-determination of the Palestinian people.
65766.description_html:
Students for Justice in Palestine (SJP) is a grassroots movement of students, faculty, staff, and community members dedicated to advancing justice, equity, and human rights, for the liberation and self-determination of the Palestinian people.

SJP's strength lies is in the great diversity of its members. We welcome individuals of all ethnicities, faiths, and backgrounds to stand in solidarity with the Palestinian struggle for justice.

While SJP firmly opposes the racism and systemic discrimination embedded in the policies of the Israeli state, we equally reject all forms of hatred or discrimination based on religion, race, or ethnicity.

79633.name: Students for Life at Virginia Tech
79633.summary: Students for Life at Virginia Tech strives to support women before, during, and after pregnancy, advocating for a culture that values and respects human life at all stages.
79633.description_html:
Our organization is the Virginia Tech chapter of Students for Life of America. We focus and strive to support women during and after pregnancy and advocate for a culture where human life is valued and accepted from the very beginning in the womb. We want the best for women and their children, no matter their circumstances. 

Students for Life at Virginia Tech is engaged in numerous activities both on and off-campus, including sidewalk counseling, tabling events, fundraisers, and the March for Life. We host speakers on campus, do club meetings on apologetics, host socials, and do service projects for crisis pregnancy centers. Check out our GroupMe and social media to learn more!

327245.name: Students For Racial Justice
327245.summary: We are an organization focused on racial justice through education, reflection and action. All are welcome to join!
327245.description_html: Mission: We strive to educate ourselves on racial inequalities, systems of oppression and the forgotten history of people of color; to reflect on our own biases, positions in society and personal experiences surrounding race; and to take actions that always center people of color and the needs and wants of the affected community we are taking action for. We welcome students from all backgrounds to join in the pursuit of racial justice on Virginia Tech’s campus and across the globe.

62961.name: Students for Sensible Drug Policy
62961.summary: Students for Sensible Drug Policy is an international grassroots network of students who are concerned about the impact drug use has on our communities, but who also know that the War on Drugs is failing our generation and our society.
62961.description_html:
We are the only international network of students dedicated to ending the war on drugs.  At heart, SSDP is a grassroots organization, led by a student-run board of directors. We create change by bringing young people together and creating safe spaces for students of all political and ideological stripes to have honest conversations about drugs and drug policy. Founded in 1998, SSDP comprises thousands of members at hundreds of campuses in countries around the globe.  SSDP mobilizes and empowers young people to participate in the political process, pushing for sensible policies to achieve a safer and more just future, while fighting back against counterproductive Drug War policies, particularly those that directly harm students and youth.

 

Current campaigns include raising awareness for our recently passed medical amnesty policy on campus, working towards increasing access for a life saving drug called naloxone for people in the community, increasing peer education for drug information, and many more. Ending the drug war is a very important goal that we are constantly working towards, and we always welcome passionate students to come to meetings, have fun, share information, and help spread the word about this very important issue.

 

If you are interested in the club, please contact our main point of contact found on the home page and ask to be added to the listserv. This will keep you updated on meeting times, events, and news!

80685.name: Students for Sustainable Practice
80685.summary: Welcome! If you're interested in learning about sustainability through a personal and professional lens as well as implementing sustainability values through in-depth, community focused projects, then you're in the right place!
80685.description_html:
Students for Sustainable Practice

 

What's in a name?   We are a body of stakeholders at Virginia Tech who, first and foremost, value sustainability.  Additionally, we advocate for Virginia Tech to practice those values via student-led projects, trips, panels, etc.

 

Newly Revised Mission Statement

We, as members of Students for Sustainable Practice at Virginia Tech, will act as a liaison group between our student body and the university administration - to build awareness, contribute to our collective ongoing education, and facilitate the implementation of sustainable initiatives on our campus and in our community. Through collaboration with the students of various majors, faculty, staff, and administration, we aim to establish a more sustainable future at Virginia Tech.

As our Mission Statement touches on, we focus our energy on a three-fold approach to enacting change on Virginia Tech’s campus. First and foremost we exist as an interest group for like-minded individuals to collectively learn and discuss sustainability-related issues around the globe. We then work to take that knowledge and spread it throughout the community via tabling, educational panels, and trips to environmentally-related sites (everywhere from Mountaintop Removal Coal mining sites to top-of-the-line sustainability showcase sites like the Bristol Energy Center).

 

Enacting Change

On top of developing a close-knit group through team activities and social events, our weekly meetings typically consist of sharing environmental news, facilitating discussion about pressing issues, and working in project groups. Other events include debates, hosting lectures, and documentary screenings aimed at educating and inspiring. 

One of the main ways our club works to advance Virginia Tech’s environmental mindfulness is through “Green RFPs”. The Office of Sustainability (OS) accepts project proposals for green-focused initiatives to fund and implement on campus every November, so in the past this has been the focus of most of the work we typically engage in during the Fall semester. Spring semester typically focuses on annual events such as arbor day and earth week! Other ways Students for Sustainable Practices makes our mission known is through tabling events through the Blacksburg Farmer's Market

Let’s get to work and bring more sustainable practice to VT, continuing to be an example as a progressive and prestigious institution for universities everywhere.

387528.name: Students for the Labor Movement
387528.summary: We raise awareness about the labor movement by educating our fellow students about national and local labor unions.
387528.description_html: We provide educational opportunities for students who are interested in learning about national and local unions and the labor movement. The past few years have seen historic labor disputes, rising union membership, and increased public support. In light of this nationwide trend, we aspire to build a community that gives students the autonomy to explore and decide for themselves the roles labor unions play in everyday life and in institutions like academia, industry, and government.

69083.name: Students Helping Honduras
69083.summary: Our mission is to alleviate violence and extreme poverty in Honduras through education and youth empowerment. Every winter SHH travels to Honduras to aid in the building of a school. "You've never volunteered like this before."
69083.description_html:
Our Mission: Building a Brighter Future for Honduras

At Students Helping Honduras (SHH), we are dedicated to alleviating violence and extreme poverty in Honduras through education and youth empowerment. Our ultimate goal is to build 1,000 schools across the country to give children access to quality education.

What We Have Accomplished So Far

  • More than 80 schools built across Honduras

  • 27 SHH chapters across the United States

  • Over 10,000 volunteers making a meaningful impact

Virginia Tech Chapter Success
At Virginia Tech, we have more than 100 active members working hard to support this cause. In 2023, we set a fundraising goal of $7,000, but thanks to the support of our community, we raised $16,395.

Winter Break Service Trip to Honduras
Every winter break, SHH members embark on a life-changing, week-long trip to help build schools from the ground up. From making rebar and mixing cement to experiencing Honduran culture, food, and local traditions, this trip provides an unforgettable opportunity to serve and learn.

"You have never volunteered like this before."

Join us in making a real difference. #SHH #1000Schools #Honduras #EducationForAll

126668.name: Students of Hip Hop Legacy
126668.summary: To provide outlet opportunities for the creative mind, such as musicians, dancers, designers and artists and to educate students, faculty, and staff on the importance of hip hop and its impact on the current world.
126668.description_html:
Mission Statement:

We, as Virginia Tech students, wish to facilitate an environment that cultivates the creative mind, bringing together like-minded individuals, of all backgrounds, in order to maintain a progressive interest within the realm of hip hop and its subcultures.

 

Purposes:

  1.     To provide outlet opportunities for the creative mind, such as musicians, dancers, designers and artist.
  2.     To educate students, faculty, and staff on the importance of hip hop and its impact on the current world.
  3.   To provide entertainment that furthers the advancement of hip hop and its subculture.

161938.name: Studio 72: Living the Arts
161938.summary: Studio 72 is a living-learning community where creativity, the arts, and design come together in a residential environment. We're open to all majors and welcome diversity of experience.
161938.description_html: The artist’s most creative work is made where they can explore their art freely. At Studio 72, our philosophy is that time and space to create art is the key to tapping into that creativity. Here students come to understand the arts as essential to the human experience through exclusive access to studio space in the residence hall, arts workshops with faculty, and visiting artists on campus. This interdisciplinary, multigenerational community has a strong academic commitment to learning through the shared experience of art making in a variety of disciplines and mediums. Whether it’s performance arts, visual art, digital art, or somewhere in between, Studio 72 is a living-learning community where curiosity, innovation, imagination, and creating art are a way of life.

357880.name: Studio72
357880.summary: Studio72 is a Living-Learning Community housed in the Creativity & Innovation District Living-Learning Program that is centered around exploration of the arts.

408749.name: Study Abroad Ambassadors
408749.summary: Our mission is to inspire and empower all Virginia Tech students to participate in international experiences, such as study abroad, that cultivate the skills, knowledge, and perspectives essential for success in an interconnected world.
408749.description_html: We aim to inspire and empower all Virginia Tech students to participate in international experiences, such as study abroad, that cultivate the skills, knowledge, and perspectives essential for success in an interconnected world. Through engagement and advocacy, our Student Ambassadors promote global learning opportunities that prepare Hokies to thrive in diverse cultural and professional environments.

99181.name: Sudanese Student Organization at Virginia Tech
99181.summary: The Sudanese Student Organization serves to foster awareness, understanding, and growth of Sudanese culture on campus while bringing the Sudani-American community together at Virginia Tech.
99181.description_html: The Sudanese Student Organization (SSO) hosts a variety of events that are tailored to educating and celebrating fascinating Sudanese culture. The events range from social gatherings to informative meetings regarding Sudanese history/music/art/etc. The organization also focuses on gathering the Sudani-American community together at Virginia Tech. We believe in uplifting our members by building and maintaining relationships, something that is so crucial in ensuring a strong community.

370043.name: Suicide Awareness and Friendly Environment
370043.summary: The SAFE Club raises awareness for suicide prevention and attempts to end the stigma around suicidal feelings. The SAFE Club will raise money via the "Out Of The Darkness Walk" and participate in trainings for suicide prevention.
370043.description_html:
Goals for SAFE Club includes raising awareness for suicide prevention and creating an environment that encourages positivity and growth. As a part of the SAFE Club, you will be educated on the warnings of suicide from informative videos. You will also participate in a suicide prevention training which discusses myths and warning signs. We will participate in a number of activities including the “Out Of The Darkness Walk” hosted by the American Foundation of Suicide Prevention to raise money for suicide prevention. Overall, it will be a very healthy and positive environment.

https://afsp.org/

408916.name: Sunday Runs at Virginia Tech
408916.summary: We are a Christian Running Organization at Virginia Tech that encourages physical, mental, and spiritual fitness. We promote fellowship among a community centered on God. All are welcome regardless of running ability or religion!

344345.name: Sunset Chasers at Virginia Tech
344345.summary: Sunset Chasers is a club that provides a stress-free environment where students can bond with others while enjoying the beauty and wonder of Blacksburg's famous sunsets.
344345.description_html: Sunset Chasers offers a relaxed environment where we can take a break from our busy lives and enjoy the beauty and wonder of Blacksburg’s famous sunsets with our peers. Our weekly walks take us through trails around campus, and we will also take monthly day trips to explore the surrounding areas ending at sunset, of course! We walk at our own pace and everyone is welcome. Come out and join us as the sun sets every weekend and create new memories with other Hokies!

420470.name: Supercell Club at Virginia Tech
420470.summary: The Supercell Club at Virginia Tech is a place for students who enjoy games like Clash of Clans, Clash Royale, and Brawl Stars. Members can meet to play, share tips, and talk about new updates. The club focuses on having fun, meeting new people, and enjo
420470.description_html: Our Discord has all the information you need: https://discord.gg/cGCMstHc

69398.name: Surf Club at Virginia Tech
69398.summary: Welcome to one of the sickest clubs at Virginia Tech! The Surf Club at VT is all about bringing the surfers and any lover of the beach together. If you enjoy wave riding as much as we do, join us for weekend trips when the swell is up and contests!
69398.description_html:
We are the Surf Club at Virginia Tech. The Surf Club was created to bring the Virginia Tech surfing community together and that is what we continue to do today. Surf trips, beach clean-ups, and helping out the local Blacksburg community are objectives we aim to make a part of Surf Club. Ride the wave!

- Re-founded in 2021!

137280.name: Surgery Club VA-MD CVM
137280.summary: Surgery Club is a veterinary student club of the VA-MD CVM. The main goal of the club is to provide hands on opportunities for students as well as lectures and discussions on interesting surgical cases in order to expand our knowledge before we graduate.
137280.description_html: Surgery Club encourages students to gain hands-on experience outside of the classroom with routine surgical skills needed for everyday success in veterinary medicine. These activities include meetings from well-respected surgeons and surgical residents on clinical cases and new cutting-edge technology. The wet labs and monthly suture clinics that are offered allow students to practice intricate surgical procedure and techniques. This will build student's knowledge and dexterity, empowering students to leave school as new veterinarians with confidence.

414676.name: Surgery Student Interest Group
414676.summary: The Surgery Interest Group provides hands-on skills, networking, and tailored workshops to expand access to surgical careers and support student success.
414676.description_html: Whether you're interested in surgery, want to learn more about it, or just want to learn some hands-on skills taught by surgeons, the surgery interest group facilitates learning as well as exploration of the vast field of surgery. We gear workshops toward the ever-evolving interests of students as they move through their education by tailoring workshops toward top interests. We provide hands-on skills that allow students to excel on their rotation, shadowing, and hopefully, their career as well as help facilitate networking.

379818.name: Survivor at Virginia Tech
379818.summary: Inspired by the TV show Survivor, this club helps students expand their Survivor knowledge, analyze gameplay, and become passionate fans! Join us for weekly viewing parties and test your skills in recreated Survivor mini games. Anyone is welcome!
379818.description_html: Whether you have been watching since season one or are a new fan, Survivor at Virginia Tech welcomes you! This club is an outlet to share your love for the TV show Survivor. We host weekly “watch parties” in Pamplin 1004 Wednesday nights at 8pm, play past Survivor challenges, and have season/player rankings. Although Survivor doesn’t air every week, this club will gather to brainstorm ways Survivor at Virginia Tech can expand beyond the Blacksburg community!

115160.name: Sustainable @ VT
115160.summary: Group of students working together on campus sustainability issues.
115160.description_html: Sustainable at Virginia Tech creates a monthly newsletter updating students on environmental events on campus. This club meets on Thursdays from 5-6!

81861.name: Sustainable Dining at Virginia Tech
81861.summary: Sustainable Dining at Virginia Tech is committed to promoting a sustainable dining and food system at Virginia Tech and therefore the greater community.  Get involved, learn about where your food comes from, & how you can impact your food system daily.
81861.description_html: Sustainable Dining at Virginia Tech offers opportunities for students and community members to participate in growing food, brainstorming new ways to enhance sustainable dining initiatives at VT and to interact with your food system.

382770.name: Sustainable Fashion Society at Virginia Tech
382770.summary: The Sustainable Fashion Society aims to foster a welcoming environment for Virginia Tech students dedicated to promoting eco-conscious fashion choices and educating members about sustainability. We invite everyone (regardless) of their major to join us!
382770.description_html:
The Sustainable Fashion Society aims to foster a welcoming environment for Virginia Tech students dedicated to promoting eco-conscious fashion choices and educating  members about sustainability. We invite everyone, regardless of their major, to join us in exploring the world of sustainable fashion and inspiring change in our local community. 


The unfettered rise of fast fashion consumption has brought irreversible shifts to the environment and economy on a global scale. Through technological advancements and consumers unlimited exposure to the media, purchasing products has never been easier. With this increased availability, the growing popularity of buying unethical fast fashion has become a major concern to environmentalists around the world.

76061.name: Sustainable Land Development Club
76061.summary: A club for undergraduate Civil & Environmental Engineering students interested in sustainability as it pertains to land development design - we are the student group affiliated with the Land Development Design Institute (LDDI) here at Virginia Tech.
76061.description_html: Our organization was founded as the student body for the Land Development Design Initiative. Most of the current students involved are Civil Engineering Students that focus their studies on Land Development, however we are inclusive and are welcoming any interested students from related fields. We offer a platform for students to test their technical skills outside of class, to network with professionals, as well as to expand their understanding of current events and technologies that help us bridge the gap between the natural world and land development projects.

382621.name: Swara
382621.summary: Co-ed South Asian fusion A Cappella team.
382621.description_html: Swara is Virginia Tech's Premier Competitive South Asian Fusion A Cappella team established in 2023. We aim to bring together diverse voices to create dynamic performances that mix Bollywood, Western pop, classical styles and more! We perform at cultural events on campus, travel to competitions, perform at exhibitions at other school’s events, and hold our own showcase in the spring!

69067.name: Swim Club at Virginia Tech
69067.summary: A competitive swim club open to members of all skill levels.
69067.description_html:
We are the Swim Club at Virginia Tech, a place for students to continue the sport they love at the collegiate level.

We travel to various meets throughout the semester at different colleges and universities. Send us a message for more information and be sure to check out our Instagram (@VTSwimClub). Requesting to join the organization will not make you a member. 

If you want to join our email list for the semester, please email us at vtswimclub@gmail.com.

71371.name: Swine Club at Virginia Tech
71371.summary: We are devoted to the swine industry and seek to promote learning about all aspects of swine use and care, from production to biomedical research. We welcome anyone who has an interest in pigs and the pork industry and offer tons of hands-on experience.
71371.description_html:
The Swine Club was started in 2007 by an undergraduate student with a passion for swine. He saw the lack of a working club devoted to the swine industry and set his mind to correcting the problem. From hands-on labs to guest speakers, the Swine Club has tackled many obstacles and come together as a stronger team of students willing to try almost anything to enlighten others on the beauty of the swine industry.

We seek to promote learning about all aspects of swine use and care ranging from production to biomedical research. Like most clubs and organizations, we are actively seeking out members and encouraging participation in the club. No previous swine knowledge is required to join and there is no pledging or initiation process. Current member of Swine Club come from different backgrounds and represent all levels of swine knowledge. We welcome anyone who has an interest in pigs and the pork industry.

210076.name: Synapse at Virginia Tech
210076.summary: Synapse's mission is to connect individuals with brain injury through a peer support group and buddy program that builds deeper relationships with community members and raises awareness about brain injury.
210076.description_html:
We aim to connect individuals within the brain injury to community resources within the New River Valley. These include the Support Group and Glial Program. Additionally, we partner with Brain Injury Solutions, allowing us to connect with community members while educating the public about brain injuries. 

 

Reach out to synapsevirginiatech@gmail.com for inquiry regarding Spring 2026 new member applications.

420471.name: Tackle Hunger
420471.summary: Tackle Hunger at Virginia Tech unites students to fight against food insecurity through donation drives, awareness events, and support for local food pantries.
420471.description_html: Tackle Hunger at Virginia Tech is a student group dedicated to combating food insecurity on campus and in the surrounding community. Partnering with the national movement Tackle Hunger, it organizes donation drives, awareness events, and volunteer efforts that directly impact local food pantries. It aims to cultivate empathy, leadership, and social responsibility through empowering students to make a positive impact against hunger and champion equal access to nutrition for all.

69081.name: Tae Kwon Do Club at Virginia Tech
69081.summary: We are a club that practices the martial art of WT style Tae Kwon Do. Classes include sparring (controlled fighting), kicking, form, and self-defense, taught through traditional classes (Kukkiwon standard forms and conditioning).
69081.description_html:
Welcome to the Tae Kwon Do Club at Virginia Tech!

***This page is for officers only. If you are interested in joining our club please email Ben (sschwartz318@vt.edu) and Shoshana (shoshana@vt.edu) about joining***

We are a club that practices the martial art of WT style Taekwondo. Classes include sparring (controlled fighting), kicking, form, and self-defense through traditional classes (Kukkiwon standard forms and conditioning). Our students range from complete beginners all the way through upper-level black belts, meaning we're very inviting to newcomers of the sport while still providing the class structure for people with experience. And if you come from a non-WT background (ITF, Jhoon Rhee, TopKick, etc.) you're still more than welcome to come and practice with us!

We meet on Mondays and Thursdays. For specific dates/time questions, please contact us if you are interested in joining through our email address found below, we'll be sure to answer as soon as possible.

69917.name: Taiwanese Student Association
69917.summary: An international student organization dedicated to fostering connections, cultural exchange, and community among Taiwanese students and those interested in Taiwanese culture.
69917.description_html: International students organization for promoting Taiwanese connection. TSA is a bridge that connects the invaluable experiences of Taiwanese people living in the USA, provides a social network that aims to assist each other for a happier life in the journey of pursuing academic success as a proud Hokie.

76792.name: Tap Ensemble at Virginia Tech
76792.summary: A group of student who love to learn, teach, and perform tap dance.
76792.description_html: Tap Ensemble at Virginia Tech is a group of students who are passionate about growing their skills and artistry in tap dancing. Tap ensemble is an open, accepting environment for everyone in the community who wants to tap dance. We spread our love for tap by self choreographing and performing for the Virginia Tech community.

69915.name: Tau Beta Pi - Engineering Honors Society
69915.summary: Tau Beta Pi is the national engineering honor society for engineering students who distinguish themselves both in scholarship and exemplary character. Our mission is to develop our members' professional skills and help them network.
69915.description_html: Tau Beta Pi is the oldest engineering honor society in the country. Established in 1885 at Lehigh University, Tau Beta Pi was established to confer honor upon their Alma Mater by distinguished scholarship and exemplary character as students in engineering and to foster a spirit of liberal culture in engineering colleges. Students within the top percentages of their class are invited to join. The society plans professional development, social, and service events for members to attend for members, so they can network with others and give back to their community.

68705.name: Tau Beta Sigma National Honorary Band Service Sorority Zeta Omicron Chapter
68705.shortName: Tau Beta Sigma - Zeta Omicron Chapter
68705.summary: Zeta Omicron Chapter of Tau Beta Sigma - National Honorary Band Service Sorority.
68705.description_html: We are the Zeta Omicron Chapter of Tau Beta Sigma - National Honorary Band Service Sorority. We provide exceptional service to collegiate bands and promote equality and diversity, including empowering women in the band profession. We cultivate leadership, educational achievement, music appreciation and community development.

65887.name: Tau Kappa Epsilon
65887.summary: Tau Kappa Epsilon Fraternity was founded on 3 essential elements of true brotherhood; love, charity, and esteem. Through these founding elements, the Fraternity strives to instill each in our members to furthermore build a better man, for a better world.
65887.description_html:
On January 10, 1899,Charles Roy Atkinson, Clarence A. Mayer, James C. McNutt, Joseph L. Settles, and Owen I. Truitt met at 504 East Locust Street in Bloomington, Illinois and drew up the first constitution for a new fraternity at Illinois Wesleyan University. The purpose of the new organization was to be an "aid to college men in mental, moral and social development." The founders sought to be a different organization than the other fraternities at the time by establishing a fraternity where membership would be based on personal worth and character rather than wealth, rank, or honor.

 

Tau Kappa Epsilon Fraternity was founded on three essential elements of true brotherhood; love, charity, and esteem.  Through these founding elements, the Fraternity strives to instill each in our members to furthermore build a better man, for a better world. 

 

TKE at Virginia Tech has adopted a membership development program known as the "The Blueprint" provide to us by  our International Headquarters. The Blueprint Program is an innovative and interactive program that leads participants through their collegiate career with a structure for life-long learning. The BluePrint is a program completely devoid of Hazing that aims to help build better men for a better world! Our two main goals as an organization are to make our philanthropy cause known, St. Jude, and to help develop better men for a better world.

83196.name: Tau Sigma National Honor Society at Virginia Tech
83196.summary: Tau Sigma is an academic honor society designed specifically to recognize and promote the academic excellence and involvement of transfer students.
83196.description_html: Our mission is to recognize and promote the academic excellence and involvement of transfers students. Tau Sigma provides its members opportunities to earn scholarships, take leadership positions, and serve others in the community, all while developing friendships and becoming a more integral part of Virginia Tech!

138158.name: Teaching Robotics and Engineering
138158.summary: TRE is dedicated to mentoring students in building robots and engineering systems. NO PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE required! We address all disciplines/majors and will dedicate our time teaching basic engineering skills while building intuitive projects.
138158.description_html:
Do you want to build ROBOTS? Do you want to LEARN how to program? Do you like to BUILD in general but have limited experience with Computer Science / ECE / Mechanical Engineering? If you answered yes to one or more of these questions - then TRE is the perfect club for you! We seek to give students the skills they need to be successful in completing their projects, and even make a career change if they wish to do so. We encourage ALL majors to join us as we will teach you skills without all the homework and suffering of taking an engineering class.  Throughout the year we will teach sessions on various topics from programming a simple microcontroller to building applicable Arduino systems. The goal is that the members of the club will gain skills across a variety of disciplines and be able to use their skills in school, work, or for fun. This is a club run for its members - if you would like to learn a specific skill, come to a meeting and ask us! We will incorporate this in the syllabus for you.

Join our DISCORD server: https://discord.gg/YDjkHMcpfE

 

**PREVIOUSLY KNOWN AS TRE (Teaching Robotics and Engineering)**

327250.name: Team Tennis League at Virginia Tech
327250.summary: This is a tennis league for players of all skill levels who want the competitive atmosphere of a tennis team while being more competitive than intramural tennis.
327250.description_html: This league plays in a team tennis format similar to high school tennis, consisting of singles and doubles matches. We welcome all tennis players at any skill level.  This league is designed to be low-commitment while maintaining a competitive atmosphere.  It also allows students to meet many new people with an interest in tennis. Contact Kevin Lee (kevinL22@vt.edu) if you are interested or have any questions! Join the groupme to get further updates.

96657.name: TechHackers at Virginia Tech
96657.summary: This organization aims to provide a venue for hackers/engineers who love to develop, design and innovate. We provide a way for students to attend hackathons around the US, learn new skills, mentor students and just have fun being a super star engineer.
96657.description_html:
TechHackers is the organization team for VTHacks, Virginia Tech's annual hackathon, which is an event where students get together and try to design a project in 24-36 hours.

If you're interested in participating in the event, rather than help organizing it, checkout vthacks.com for information about when and where to register!

68879.name: TechNotes A Cappella
68879.summary: TechNotes is a mixed a cappella group that performs that various events throughout the year. The group also holds a concert at the end of each semester. TechNotes was founded in 2010.
68879.description_html:
Founded in 2010, TechNotes is a mixed a cappella group that performs at various events throughout the year. These events might be volunteer events or social events throughout campus and the Blacksburg area. Some semesters, TechNotes gets the honor and privilege of competing in various competitions with A Cappella communities at other schools and TechNotes even has music on Spotify! The main event is the TechNotes concert at the end of the year that draws in hundreds of audience members to hear their set list of songs arranged and sung by members of our group. If you are looking for the perfect combination of music and family, this is the group for you.

Instagram: @vttechnotes

TikTok: @vttechnotes

Website: http://www.technotesvt.com/

Facebook: TechNotes A Cappella

79309.name: Thai Student Association
79309.summary: TSA is a great place to meet students and friends who are intersted in Thai culture. You do not have to be Thai to join.
79309.description_html:
Who We Are

We are an organization that brings together Thais, Thai-Americans, and anyone interested in Thai culture. We also seek to promote the culture within the VT community and also help Thai students, both incoming and existing, adapt to life abroad and in college. In addition to that, we welcome anyone who is not Thai to learn more about Thai culture and Thailand through various workshops, events, and activities. We host a variety of fun activities and get-togethers as well to help bring those interested in Thai culture together to have a great time. 

 

Objectives

1. To promote understanding and friendship among members, of Virginia Tech and other college communities through intellectual, cultural, social, and athletic activities. 

2. To provide assistance in cultural and social adjustments to incoming and currently enrolled Virginia Tech students of Thai origin. 

3. To preserve and disseminate Thai culture among Virginia Tech students.

 

 

*For additional information please feel free to connect to us via our Instagram, Line, or Facebook page, or contact Oakley our president Oakley21@vt.edu

295391.name: Thank-a-Teacher Program
295391.summary: The Thank-a-Teacher program allows students, alumni, and parents to send a note of appreciation to a faculty member at Virginia Tech. Submit a Thank-a-Teacher note online today!
295391.description_html:
Do you know a teacher at Virginia Tech who:


- Encouraged you?
- Challenged you?
- Inspired you?

Want to say thanks? We can help!

Thanking a teacher is easy with the Center for Excellence in Teaching and Learning Thank-a-Teacher program. Simply fill out our online form including one or two sentences expressing your appreciation (with the option to remain anonymous), and we'll send your professor, instructor, or graduate teaching assistant a thank you note. 

 

The Thank-a-Teacher program allows students, alumni, and parents to send a note of appreciation to a faculty member at Virginia Tech.Submit your thank you note here. 

           For more information, contact Leslie Williams at lawill1@vt.edu.

413635.name: The Alexander Hamilton Society at Virginia Tech
413635.summary: AHS is a world-class, national organization platforming student- and guest speaker-led discussions on foreign policy open to all. We will face controversies head-on to help shape the next generation of American leadership with career opportunities.
413635.description_html:
The Alexander Hamilton Society (AHS) is a non-partisan, not-for-profit national organization that seeks to identify, educate, and launch young men and women into foreign policy and national security careers imbued with the Hamiltonian perspective of strong and principled American leadership in global affairs. 

The Alexander Hamilton Society at Virginia Tech upholds this mission by facilitating rigorous discussions on foreign policy, defense, human security, innovation, and more. As a student-led chapter, AHS@VT provides a platform for students to critically engage with global challenges, explore the role of American leadership in the international system, and develop a framework of global ethical leadership necessary for meaningful policy engagement. 

AHS promotes intellectual innovation by hosting speaker events and policy discussions featuring world-class scholars and practitioners from the federal government, academia, and the private sector. Additionally, AHS serves as a multidisciplinary, world-class networking hub for Virginia Tech students interested in national security careers and discourse. By fostering mentorship and career development opportunities, AHS strives to cultivate America's next generation of global ethical leaders in the relentless pursuit of intellectual curiosity.

70378.name: The Big Event at Virginia Tech
70378.summary: The Big Event promotes community engagement by organizing students to complete service projects throughout Blacksburg, Christiansburg and the New River Valley.
70378.description_html:
The Big Event at Virginia Tech is a student-run day of service that has grown into the 2nd largest event of its kind in the nation. Every spring, thousands of students, faculty, and staff come together to complete over 1,000 community service projects throughout Blacksburg, Christiansburg and the New River Valley.

Projects are completed regardless of need or socioeconomic status; instead, it is The Big Event’s goal to simply say, “Thank you." Seeded in our university’s motto of Ut Prosim (That I may serve) students and community members come together for a truly unparalleled experience.

The Big Event: “One Big Day. One Big Thanks.”

 

Join our staff by filling out the application here!

161349.name: The Bigfoot Club at Virginia Tech
161349.summary: There are thousands of sightings around the nation of a simian-like creature roaming our forests. Our goal, as amateur squatch hunters, is to hereby put this urban legend to rest by gathering evidence and finding the renowned creature known as "Bigfoot".
161349.description_html: Our organization will meet twice a month. Most of our hikes are in the afternoons, so be prepared to dress warm, bring a flashlight, wear hiking boots! If you're interested in the club, please join our discord server! https://discord.gg/AMXvcxjUB4

331061.name: The Bird Club at Virginia Tech
331061.summary: Our club aims to connect fellow student birders with each other, educate students on the identification and life history of birds, and host weekly field trips with supplemental bi-monthly bird club meetings.
331061.description_html: The Bird Club at Virginia Tech is a student organization that aims to educate students on the identification and life history of birds. Our Bird Club hosts weekly field trips to birding hotspots around Blacksburg and its surrounding areas and bi-monthly meetings that help educate students on birding, ornithology, and other related topics.

79389.name: The Business Information Technology Club at Virginia Tech
79389.summary: The BIT Club's mission is to support members in their personal and professional journeys. We host networking sessions with companies, professional development workshops, and socials! While we primarily cater to BIT students, every major is welcome.
79389.description_html: As part of our mission to increase knowledge of technology-oriented business majors, we host several career information sessions and workshops each semester. BIT Club also hosts many internal socials and gatherings throughout the year, fully embracing a half-professional and half-social organization. Members are able to refine their professional development skills, and also get to know the greater BIT and Pamplin community. We are the premier student organization at Virginia Tech for business majors and anyone interested in the technological field, and we welcome you to come to our events and find out what we’re all about! Even though we are the BIT Club at Virginia Tech, we are not limited to just BIT majors, in fact, anyone interested in this realm and wants to attend our workshops and get one-on-one contact with recruiters from companies like the Big 4 is welcome to join!

114752.name: The Center for the Arts at Virginia Tech
114752.summary: The Center for the Arts at Virginia Tech transforms lives through exploration and engagement with the arts and creative process.
114752.description_html:
The Center for the Arts at Virginia Tech brings artists from around the world to your campus door, with performances, exhibitions, and experiences designed to enhance not only your Virginia Tech experience, but the ways you see the world.

 

What We Offer

The center presents outstanding professional performances and exhibitions year round, including approximately 20 – 25 international and national touring performing artists or companies annually representing:

  • Music from world rhythms to bluegrass, jazz, vocal programs, chamber music, and leading orchestras;
  • Dance that includes American icons, European ballet, and cutting-edge contemporary choreographers;
  • Theatre that features classic stage plays, contemporary works, and new dramatic and musical projects including theatre and performance for young audiences;
  • Literary Arts that includes fiction writers, cultural critics, monologists, comedians, and spoken word artists.

The center’s visual arts galleries host 3 to 4 visual art exhibitions each year by national and international contemporary artists, local and regional artists, and experimental new technologies developed through the Institute for Creativity, Arts, and Technology.

 

Opportunities for Students

We offer special opportunities to engage with professional artists and explore the creative process, including:

  • workshops and master classes with visiting artists
  • lectures and Q&As
  • gallery tours and artist talks
  • hands-on experiences
  • community celebrations
  • student ambassador program
  • student jobs

We also value student voices and feature student talent on our stages and in our galleries.

 

Student Tickets

Student tickets for Center for the Arts performances are only $10! This offer is available for any college or university student with a school ID, as well as youth ages 18 and under.

For Broadway productions, a limited number of tickets are available to Virginia Tech students at $10—so act fast; these go quickly!

Free last minute rush seats are available to Virginia Tech students, but only if you sign up for our text notifications. Text “arts” to 833-966-1838 to enroll. Availability of rush seats vary by performance. Free rush seats will be available on a first-come, first-served basis while supplies last in the Center for the Arts box office at 190 Alumni Mall. A valid Virginia Tech ID will be required for admission.

403129.name: The Chillfield
403129.summary: The Chillfield is Student Engagement and Campus Life's mobile programming initiative.
403129.description_html: The Chillfield is Student Engagement and Campus Life's mobile programming initiative. Join us as we pop up around campus once a week. Our previous events have included Student Tailgates, Plate Smashing, corn hole tournaments, and more. Follow us on instagram @VTChillfield

224948.name: The Comedy Conglomerate at Virginia Tech
224948.summary: A physical space for comedy to exist on campus. Stand up comedy, sketch comedy, YouTube comedy, musical comedy, etc. comedy. Helping you find your funny!
224948.description_html: We are an organization dedicated to creating a comedic environment on campus. We have a focus on stand up comedy and orchestrating stand up comedy events, but we are consistently look to expand our venues as we expand our members' capabilities. Our members are active and contribute something to each meeting, performance, and the feedback process. We plan to continue our stand up efforts as well as explore other forms of comedy like: Comedy music, YouTube sketches, and cartoons.

66078.name: The Contemporary Dance Ensemble
66078.summary: CDE's repertoire consists mostly of jazz, tap, lyrical, hip-hop, modern, and contemporary. Weekly classes are offered to the public, while members of this organization rehearse and choreograph for performances to grow in our passion for dance.
66078.description_html: The Contemporary Dance Ensemble at Virginia Tech provides a place for dancers to continue to grow in their passion for dance and share their talents with the community. But most importantly, CDE provides dancers with a place to call home on campus. CDE offers two performances a year and weekly technique classes so we can continue to improve. Our performances are choreographed and performed by members of CDE so we can share not only our talents, but our artistic visions as well. In addition, we offer leadership opportunities within our organization since we are student-run, so we can continue our love for an art form while getting experience on how to effectively and successfully run an organization. Come join our family!

408750.name: The Diabetes Link at Virginia Tech
408750.summary: We are a strong support network that helps students navigate diabetes while advocating for better campus awareness.
408750.description_html: Our chapter of The Diabetes Link is intended to connect college students with and affected by type 1 diabetes in the hopes that these connections will create a support network which will enable students to fulfill their potential and limit the negative psychological and physical effects of diabetes.

347793.name: The Diggeridoos at Virginia Tech
347793.summary: We are an internationally awarded team that competes in The Not-a-Boring Competition, hosted by Elon Musk's The Boring Company. The goal: to design and build a tunnel boring machine (TBM).
347793.description_html:
We are the Diggeridoos, a design team competing in the Not-a-Boring Competition hosted by Elon Musk's The Boring Company. Our goal is to build a machine capable of digging a 100ft long, 2ft diameter tunnel. We compete against student teams from around the world in Bastrop, TX every year. 

Notable Awards:

- 2021 Fastest Launch Design Award

- 2023 National Champions

- 2024 National Champion, 2nd in the world.

- 2025 Most Innovative Team, National Champs, 2nd Overall

If you are interested in joining the team, reach out to Chris Johnston (Project Lead) or any of the other points of contact list below.

305224.name: The Fighting Game Community at Virginia Tech
305224.summary: A community dedicated to playing, teaching, and competing in Fighting Games like Guilty Gear Strive, Tekken 8, Dragon Ball FighterZ, and Street Fighter 6. Open to both casual and competitive, new and experienced players.
305224.description_html:
A community dedicated to playing, learning, and competing in Fighting Games such as Ultimate Marvel vs Capcom 3, Guilty Gear Strive, Street Fighter 6, Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising, BlazBlue: Central Fiction, and more! Welcoming to both casual and competitive, new and experienced players. 

We hold weekly meetings in New Classroom Building. The meetings alternate between double elimination brackets in two rotating games and casuals (meetings to play friendly, practice matches). We are friends with Smash Club but don't actively play Smash. If you are looking for Smash games look for the Smash Club at VT. 

If you are interested swing by a meeting and introduce yourself. If you are new to Fighting Games don't be scared, we have plenty of people willing to help you learn and improve. 

Please feel free to join our discord!

https://discord.gg/kkgt4qby7h

70381.name: The Forestry Club at Virginia Tech
70381.summary: VTFC is a group of students, primarily from the College of Natural Resources, that competes in Timbersport Competitions across the Southeast. We also sell firewood to locals in the Blacksburg area.
70381.description_html: The Forestry Club at Virginia Tech is a student-run club in the College of Natural Resources and Environment. Our main purpose is to compete in timbersports competitions, provide services to the local community, and participate in the fellowship of forestry. The services we provide to the community mostly come in the form of cutting and selling firewood, which also helps to fund the club. We are open to all majors, and there is a semester-long joining process that consists of participating in work days.

67866.name: The Highty-Tighties
67866.summary: The Virginia Tech Corps of Cadets Regimental Band.  We have been a part of the VTCC since 1892 and are an all cadet organization.
67866.description_html: Founded in 1892, the Highty Tighties are the Regimental Band of the Virginia Tech Corps of Cadets.  Consisting of all cadet members, and led by MUCS James Bean, the band plays at all home football games along with Corps functions, pep rallies and parades across the United States.

357882.name: The Honors Residential Commons
357882.summary: The Honors Residential Commons (HRC) is the first residential college at Virginia Tech, founded in 2011. We are a multi-generational, multi-disciplinary living-learning community with our own traditions and sense of belonging.
357882.description_html:
The Honors Residential Commons (HRC) is the first residential college at Virginia Tech, founded in 2011. We are a multi-generational, multi-disciplinary living-learning community with our own traditions and sense of belonging. We are comprised of more than 300 Junior Fellows (undergraduate students), several Graduate Fellows (graduate students), and more than 30 Senior Fellows (faculty and esteemed members of the New River Valley). While the HRC is student-governed, it also receives consistent leadership from a Faculty Principal (live-in tenure-track faculty member) and Program Coordinator (live-in Office of Living Learning Programs staff member).

 

We foster a supportive, yet challenging community that creates the conditions for students to pursue meaningful encounters with the wider world. The Honors Residential Commons (HRC) at East Ambler Johnston strives to engage a diverse community of students pursuing development of themselves, relationships with others, and the projection of their passions into the greater community with unwavering curiosity and a commitment to lifelong service and learning. In fellowship, all things grow.

97175.name: The Italian Club at Virginia Tech
97175.summary: The Italian Club at Virginia Tech is a community for all those who appreciate the culture and/or language of Italy. Italian students benefit especially from the club. We welcome all students who want to join!
97175.description_html:
The Italian Club at Virginia Tech is a community for all those who appreciate the culture and/or language of Italy.  Italian students benefit especially from the club.  It is an immersive experience which helps further expose Italian students to the Italian language and culture.  Club goals include creating a presence at university-wide events such as Gobblerfest, and hosting cultural events for members of the club.

We welcome all students who want to join: from watching Italian films to cooking and eating traditional Italian food, the Italian Club at Virginia Tech is a casual yet rewarding community.

356362.name: The Kurdish Student Association at Virginia Tech
356362.summary: The Kurdish Student Association educates Hokies about Kurdish culture and history, fosters unity within the Kurdish community at VT, and welcomes individuals from all backgrounds—creating a diverse and inclusive family that celebrates all cultures.
356362.description_html:
Kurds are one of the world's largest ethnic groups without their own country, spanning southeastern Turkey, northwestern Iran, northern Iraq, and northern Syria, which is also called Kurdistan, translating into “the land of the Kurds.”

 

Our organization would like to introduce you to the beauty of the Kurdish culture, history, traditions, geography, food, songs, and language with its different dialects. We would like to show the beautiful and mesmerizing views of the Kurdish regions that are filled with mountains, lakes, rivers, dams, caves, historical places, waterfalls, citadel, and temples.

 

The Kurdish Student Association at VT will hold meetings twice a month. Our activities will include watching presentations and videos about Kurdish culture and history, presenting important topics to raise awareness about problems that Kurds face, board and video games, sports activities, picnics, movie nights, scavenger hunt around the campus (with prizes!), drawing, food, discussion, cooking, and cafe events. We will also provide you with volunteering opportunities such as teaching English to ESL students.

 

People of all backgrounds and cultures are welcome to join our organization; we want to build a family where we support one another and make everyone feel comfortable expressing themselves, presenting their culture to us, and being themselves without fear of being criticized or rejected.

 

If you have any questions, please contact the president, Ariyan Koyee, at ariyankoyee@vt.edu.

69721.name: The Marching Virginians
69721.description_html:
We are The Spirit of Tech!

The Marching Virginians are the 330-member civilian marching band of Virginia Tech. You can always find us on game days in the North End Zone cheering on the Hokies and bringing life and energy into Lane Stadium. Established in 1974, The Marching Virginians are known as "The Spirit of Tech" and are dedicated to high energy performances, exciting stand tunes, and living by Virginia Tech's motto Ut Prosim "That I May Serve."

Find out more about the band history, traditions, and opportunities on our website: https://www.spiritoftech.com

114737.name: The National Society of Leadership and Success
114737.summary: NSLS is a nationally recognized, invitation-only collegiate honor society that empowers students at Virginia Tech to enhance their leadership skills and achieve career goals through mentorship, initiatives, and community service opportunities.
114737.description_html:
The National Society of Leadership and Success (NSLS) is a nationally recognized, invitation-only collegiate honor society dedicated to helping students refine their leadership skills and achieve their career goals. We provide a platform for members to engage in workshops, speaker events, and mentorship programs, equipping them with the essential skills and resources to become effective leaders in their communities and beyond. NSLS fosters an environment that celebrates varied perspectives, empowering members to grow into capable leaders. Membership also grants access to over $400,000 in scholarships and awards.

The guiding question we established to shape all the important decisions the organization makes is: "Are we helping the greatest number of people in the greatest way?" When asked how he might sum up the key thing that the Society does, founder Gary Tuerack shared, "We are dream supporters – we build leaders, support people in achieving their dreams, and better the world in the process. We get people to ask the all-important question, 'What would you do if you knew you couldn't fail?' and then help them to achieve those goals."

With 409 current members and 87 alumni in the Virginia Tech chapter, we are thrilled to welcome more individuals into our community!

If you're interested in learning more, join our interest GroupMe here: https://groupme.com/join_group/103358834/EDfUsPRD

175383.name: The Percussion Club at Virginia Tech
175383.summary: This club is designed to help strengthen community involvement in music and give students the chance to learn more about percussive arts. We aim to show Ut Prosim by serving the School of Performing Arts and percussionists throughout Virginia Tech.
175383.description_html: This club is designed to help strengthen community involvement in music and give students the chance to learn more about percussive arts. We aim to show Ut Prosim by serving the School of Performing Arts and percussionists throughout Virginia Tech. We aim to unite musicians from all backgrounds for the common attribute of loving percussion. Members are encouraged to join concert ensembles here at Virginia Tech whether it be Marching Virginians, Symphony Band, or Percussion Ensemble. The Percussion Club looks to strengthen individuals knowledge on different genres of percussion music and iconic percussion figures. For more information, please contact Adilene Morales at adilenemo2319@vt.edu for more information.

420472.name: The Playbill Society
420472.summary: The playbill society at Virginia Tech is a student led organization dedicated to celebrating the art of theater. We’re a community for students who love musicals, plays, and live performances.
420472.description_html: The playbill society at Virginia Tech is a student led organization dedicated to celebrating the art of theater. We’re a community for students who love musicals, plays, and live performances.

69265.name: The Rocky Horror Fan Club at Virginia Tech
69265.summary: A club dedicated to shadowcasting The Rocky Horror Picture Show and various other movies during the school year. Meetings: Thursdays at 8pm in McBryde 100.
69265.description_html:
Welcome to southwestern Virginia's own Rocky Horror Picture Show shadowcast! Bringing you all the decadence and deviance from the Virginia Tech campus and the surrounding area.

We enrapture, entertain, and delight you every semester with some of the best (or worst) movies you've never experienced the same way!

We're getting ready for our fall semester shows and hope that you'll JOIN US!

So come up to the lab and see what's on the slab!

391623.name: The Roost
391623.summary: The Roost is a dynamic Living-Learning Community for individuals in recovery from a substance use disorder, those exploring diverse recovery concepts, and students advocating for recovery.

420473.name: The Seekers Collective at Virginia Tech
420473.summary: A community of seekers at Virginia Tech exploring life’s purpose through open, spiritual, and thoughtful dialogue. We turn reflection into action through service, growth, and leadership. We are welcoming of all backgrounds and perspectives.
420473.description_html:
The Seekers Collective is a community of students at Virginia Tech dedicated to exploring life’s deeper questions in a safe, welcoming, and inclusive space. We are a group of seekers, curious minds, and open hearts engaged in meaningful, spiritual, and intellectual conversations about topics that shape our lives as students and members of the campus and the broader society.

Our mission is to foster dialogue that inspires personal growth, collective understanding, and positive change. We aim to create a space where thoughtful discussion transforms into action through individual reflection, service projects, and collaborative initiatives that strengthen our campus and local community.

While our conversations often draw on spiritual perspectives, we are not bound by any single belief system. We welcome seekers from all backgrounds, cultures, and worldviews who share a desire to learn, connect, and make a difference. Through open discourse and mutual respect, we strive to cultivate empathy, awareness, and leadership among our members.

Together, we seek to not only understand the meaning of life but also to live it with purpose by translating our shared reflections into tangible acts of service, compassion, and community building.

82668.name: The Society of Physics Students at Virginia Tech
82668.summary: This club is open to all majors and works to cultivate our members' interest in physics! We are the Virginia Tech chapter of the national SPS organization.
82668.description_html: Membership in the student chapter of the Society of Physics Students at Virginia Tech is open to all majors and anyone interested in physics. The chapter is actively involved in the community, traveling to schools in the region to help encourage interest in physics via an outreach program. Located in 310 Robeson Hall, the lounge serves as a meeting place and home away from home for members. Meetings are weekly and serve as times to plan for upcoming events! The VT SPS chapter is operated by the students, with an elected governing body. Positions include President, Vice President, Secretary, Treasurer, Outreach Coordinator, Webmaster, and Representatives for each class.

420474.name: The Society of Women of Color in Business
420474.summary: The Society of Women of Color in Business at Virginia Tech fosters an inclusive space for mentorship, growth, and empowerment. We uplift women of color academically and professionally while celebrating identity and building community within Pamplin

180125.name: The Source
180125.description_html:
The Source is a resource center for all student organizations (located on the first floor of Squires in Breakzone). Student organization members can take advantage of materials, like construction paper and trifold boards, and equipment, like button makers, by using our points system. We also offer limited free printing, food services items and rentals to support student organizations. See all of our resources in our Org Resource Library!

 

Together with SECL, The Source and Organization Consultants are helping to fulfill SECL’s mission. We are continuously looking for meaningful and intentional ways to enhance The Source. Our hope is to make The Source the main destination for all student organizations to find support and resources.

69044.name: The Student Success Center
69044.summary: The Student Success Center offers free academic support, such as tutoring and study skills seminars to undergraduate students at Virginia Tech. We also have programs and activities for every student's personal definition of success.
69044.description_html:
The Student Success Center supports Virginia Tech's mission to expand personal growth and opportunity, advance social and community development, provide outreach and support services to under-served populations, and improve the quality of life by providing holistic support to our undergraduate students through a network of programs and services that includes:

  • Learning Assistance Programs to help students who want to improve their academic and non-academic skills such as time management, study skills, and networking skills; and
  • Academic Excellence Programs to help students who are already academically successful further enrich their educational experiences.

The Student Success Center strives to empower students to become life-long learners and contributing members of society, and to facilitate Virginia Tech's successful achievement of an institutional climate that is supportive of student success. Contact us at studentsuccess@vt.edu or sign up for tutoring or academic coaching by visiting our website at http://www.studentsuccess.vt.edu

420475.name: The Thomistic Institute at Virginia Tech
420475.summary: Thomistic Institute chapters are on-campus, academic clubs formed and run by students to bring top-notch Christian intellectuals to their university campuses.
420475.description_html: The Thomistic Institute at Virginia Tech is an on-campus, academic club. Our mission is to bring top-notch Christian intellectuals to their university campuses. We also organize lectures, seminars, and reading groups to explore the riches of the Christian intellectual tradition. As our name suggests, we have a special focus on the philosophy and theology of Saint Thomas Aquinas and his followers.

414677.name: The VTC Gardening Club
414677.summary: The VTC Gardening Club connects plant lovers, offering plant trade, watering help, and gardening resources for beginners and experienced gardeners alike.
414677.description_html: The VTC Gardening Club brings together gardening enthusiasts to trade plants, offer advice, and support beginners. We provide watering help, volunteer within the community and local gardens, and offer planters for growing seasonal produce. We also host a winter cutting exchange.

408593.name: The Wellness Society at Virginia Tech
408593.summary: Welcome to The Wellness Society, where we are committed to redefining the college experience by establishing a culture that celebrates self-care, resilience, and holistic health!
408593.description_html: Welcome to The Wellness Society, where we are committed to redefining the college experience by establishing a culture that celebrates self-care, resilience, and holistic health. The Wellness Society takes pride in being a safe space where college students can escape from the conventional college experience, and unite to better oneself. Together, let's thrive in mind and body throughout the transformative journey of higher education. Join us in shaping a college experience that values balance and the pursuit of overall health — both mental and physical!

235273.name: The Wildlife Disease Association Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
235273.summary: The mission of the Wildlife Disease Association is to gain, share, and apply knowledge and experience relating to fish and wildlife diseases in Virginia and beyond for the purpose of public health and conservation.
235273.description_html:
We are the VT student chapter of the Wildlife Disease Association. The WDA is an internationally renowned organization and creator of the Journal of Wildlife Diseases.

The mission of The Wildlife Disease Association Student Chapter at Virginia Tech is to gain, share, and apply knowledge and experience relating to fish and wildlife diseases in Virginia and beyond for the purpose of public health, domestic animal health, and conservation. Our goal is to uphold our mission and the mission of the Wildlife Disease Association by means of having speakers, workshops, outdoor/field experiences and various events related to wildlife disease.

76582.name: The Wildlife Society, Student Chapter at Virginia Tech
76582.summary: The mission of the Student Chapter of the Wildlife Society at Virginia Tech is to promote professionalism in our membership through experience, networking, conservation awareness and education in a fun and enjoyable atmosphere.
76582.description_html:
The mission of the Student Chapter of The Wildlife Society at Virginia Tech is to promote professionalism in our membership through experience, networking, conservation awareness and education in a fun and enjoyable atmosphere. Our members develop and promote sound stewardship of wildlife resources and of the environments upon which wildlife and humans depend.

The Student Chapter of The Wildlife Society at Virginia Tech integrates the experience, knowledge, and participation of undergraduates, graduates, faculty, and wildlife professionals to provide learning opportunities and experiences for those with an appreciation and interest in wildlife.

391591.name: The Women's Law Society at Virginia Tech
391591.summary: The Women’s Law Society at Virginia Tech is to provide support for the diverse population of women passionate about the legal field by aiding in educational, professional, social, and community development and guidance.
391591.description_html: The Women's Law Society at Virginia Tech aims to provide an open and safe space for discussion and academic improvement while providing resources that prepare women of all majors and backgrounds to go to law school or other law-related careers. Meetings, that are held weekly will consist of guest speakers, workshops, and other networking opportunities in hopes of building a community outside of the club as well. Membership is determined by an interest however little or big in a future career in law.

347776.name: The Women's Network at Virginia Tech
347776.summary: The largest, most engaging collegiate women’s network nationwide – connecting women to professionals and preparing future leaders.
347776.description_html:
Go to https://www.thewomens.network/jointwn to become an official member!

Follow us on Instagram @thewomensnetwork_virginiatech for event updates. Or, keep up using our Linktree+ GroupMe: https://linktr.ee/TheWomensNetworkatVT

 

1. Networking: TWN is revolutionizing networking as we know it. We are building a community of intelligent, ambitious women, while simultaneously providing critical resources and connections to help women achieve professional success. Learn to network effectively and authentically.

 

2. Development: TWN offers professional development and leadership opportunities to gain skills and experience in networking, marketing, communications, event planning, and graphic design.

 

3. Career: TWN connects high-achieving women with internship and job opportunities. Recruiters turn to TWN to access our exceptional member talent pool.

122208.name: Theme Park Engineering and Design
122208.summary: An organization open to students who enjoy theme parks, amusement rides, and/or roller coasters. The organization offers professional opportunities and social events with others that share the same passion, regardless of major or year.
122208.description_html:
Theme Park Engineering and Design at Virginia Tech (TPED) is an organization for students interested in the theme park industry for all years and all majors. Not just the engineers, we allow all majors to join!

 

The term "interested" encompasses a huge range; TPED is open to people who may have ridden a few rides and want to learn more, people who love everything Disney, people who want to ride as many roller coasters as possible, people who have always wanted to pursue a career in the design of amusement rides and attractions, and everyone in-between. See the video below for a quick summary of who we are!

 

https://youtu.be/eBqFZUcj8OU

 

TPED covers a huge range of professional and social events pertaining to the amusement industry! See below for more details on some highlights:

  • Park Trips and Backstage Tours
    TPED regularly plans trips to parks as a group, with cheap rates and all logistics taken care of. TPED has also regularly been given backstage tours and special opportunities at these parks, including tours of Copperhead Strike at Carowinds, Wild Eagle at Dollywood, Twisted Timbers at Kings Dominion, and more.

  • Industry Guest Speakers
    TPED has hosted several guest speakers from many companies in the industry, including Disney (Imagineers), Universal, Skyline Attractions, Proslide Technology, Dynamic Attractions, and many more including TPED alum who are currently working in the industry.

  • Design Competitions
    TPED participates in many of the industry’s largest design competitions for students, including the annual Ride Engineering Competition hosted by Iowa State University where teams design and construct a functioning model ride over a semester, the Toronto Met Thrill Design Invitational (formerly Ryerson) where students compete in design challenges and are judged by a panel from Universal Creative, and more.

  • Social and Educational Events
    TPED hosts nonformal, fun social and education events which allow members to hang out and socialize with other members of the club as well as learn more about the industry. In the past, TPED has gone bowling, hosted trivia nights, events discussing how your favorite rides work, and so much more!

  • IAAPA Expo, Orlando
